title: DATA ANALYST - ANALISTA BI
description:
¿Deseas asumir un nuevo desafío?
Nos encontramos en búsqueda de un/a DATA ANALYST para nuestra división de DERMOCOSMÉTICA en nuestras oficinas de Barcelona
Tu misión en nuestra compañía será:
Colaborar con el Business Intelligence Manager, asistiéndole con eficacia, discreción y siguiendo los procedimientos establecidos en la extracción de datos sell-in y sell-out, en la elaboración de estadísticas e informes, desarrollo de reporting y en el resto de las tareas inherentes a su función, aportando valor añadido a la toma de decisiones de la dirección general PFDC, así como los cálculos de grados de consecución de los objetivos de ventas de todos los colectivos PFDC.
¿Qué necesitas para tener éxito?
Formación: Diplomatura / licenciatura en informática, ingeniería o similar con amplios conocimientos informáticos.Experiencia: Experiencia mínima de 1 año en posición similarIdiomas: Inglés Competencias Informáticas: Paquete office, dominio de la herramienta BI Tableau y de la herramienta de preparación de datos Alteryx.
¿Quiénes somos?
El Grupo Pierre Fabre, de la Fundación Pierre Fabre, es una empresa mundial con un posicionamiento único: la alianza de la experiencia farmacéutica y dermocosmética.
💊 Un grupo farmacéutico con un fuerte posicionamiento: médico y natural🥈 El segundo laboratorio dermocosmético más grande del mundo🥈 El segundo grupo farmacéutico privado francés más grande🥇 Líder del mercado en Francia de productos vendidos sin receta en farmacias.
¿Quieres saber más? ¡Síguenos en LinkedIn para ver nuestras novedades!
¿Te interesa al reto? ¡Aplica a nuestra oferta!

title: Senior Data Analyst/Scientist
description:
At Domestika we are hiring a Senior Data Analyst/Scientist - Remote - Time Zone GMT, GMT +1 and GMT +2.
Would you like to join the team that keeps improving the learning experience and engagement in our creative Community?
At Domestika, we are creating an environment where data analysis is a driving force for our decisions and strategies. In our organization, our Analysts work closely with decision-makers to create and measure real impact.
Where will you land?You will join our newly created Product Data team and collaborate on adapting your workplace and toolset. As a Senior Data Analyst/Scientist, you will work with Data every day, finding ways to interpret it so that it makes sense for our users.
What do we expect from you:We are looking for people that can explain the insights and communicate them effectively. We believe in a Senior Analyst/Scientist as somebody that has good technical skills to work with SQL queries and Python notebooks.
Either during or after performing those technical tasks, the Senior Analyst/Scientist will expose its findings to second opinions and peer review and will humbly accept all the ideas that can drive to a better understanding and impact.
After this is done we want you to translate those results into insights and answers (even if there’s none) to whoever asked him, iterate on further questions, propose further research and improvements on the data we’re gathering, the processes we follow or anything you think it can help improve our efforts.
Who will you be working with:You’ll not be alone, there’s an amazing team of Data Engineers that have built a great data stack and will help you in finding, extracting and cleaning the data you need. Whenever you need to automate or move something outside of the data laboratory, they can help you.On the other side, you will drive impact by virtually sitting next to our business users and helping them to understand anything they need.
For your day-to-day life, a Lead Data Analyst will help you on connecting the dots: who to talk with, what are the top priorities, your duties as part of the Product Data team, and whatever it takes you to work at your best.
What can help you to reach those goals:We are particularly interested in profiles with proven experience in the following areas/topics:A/B testing (experimentation) and/or causal inference applicable to product management.E-learning environments and communities of practice/interest.E-commerce sites.
Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, to help them connect and learn from each other.
Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those who want to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers in the creative field. From this grew a community of over 5 million people who are curious and passionate about learning new skills.
Today, Domestika produces online courses. We share editorial content for and with the best creative people in the world. We run creative events where teachers, creative professionals, and students all have the chance to share experiences, ideas, and projects.
Responsibilities:To wrap up all mentioned above:
Conduct and communicate Data Analysis for product stakeholders (Product Owners, Directors).Help define performance measurements such as metrics, KPIs or OKRs.Define event tracking (telemetry) following guidelines and good practices.Monitor the key metrics to spot any anomaly that could be affecting our service.Help define, design, estimate and monitor A/B tests for your assigned product teams.Create charts and dashboards that synthesize.Share with your peers all the relevant learnings, tools and hard skills you’ve got.Keep up-to-date data documentation that can be used by your stakeholders.Establish and promote the Data Analysis peer-review process.Promote and expand whenever possible the data culture.Explain, train and empower the business stakeholders to make data-driven decisions.Efficiently communicate with stakeholders to deliver impactful insights.Co-own analytical tools such as Periscope, Amplitude, Google Analytics.Proactively improve team delivery.
Requirements:6+ years of experience as a Data Analyst preferably in a digital company, consumer apps.Track record of leading analytical projects.Ability to read and write complex SQL.Ability to write Python code in order to handle data analyses (pandas, numpy, matplotlib, seaborn, plotly, scikit-learn, XGBoost or similar), but the more the better.Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to effectively manage projects supporting multiple business partners.Preferably, a Math/Statistics/Physics/Comp SCI degree or equivalent.Based within the European time zone.English required at Full professional proficiency.
Would be a plus:Familiarity with Analytics and Business Intelligence platforms - Periscope, Amplitude, Mixpanel, Google Analytics, etc.Experience in defining tracking events and tagging for Analytics.Ability to work independently, take the initiative, and have a high level of ownership.
What do we offer?Working in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.A fun, creative, collaborative, and multicultural team.Domestika pro-account to have access to all of our courses for free.Possibility to work remotely.Private health insurance.A salary according to your experience and profile.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Global Operations' mission is to improve the health of Meta’s products and help people understand how to use them through both direct support interactions as well as scalable solutions. Those who join our teams are very passionate about solving people’s issues and are strong advocates for the Meta community. Scaled Operations, within Global Operations, manages the human expertise required for the integrity and experience of our community and business. The Scaled Operations Technology, Analytics, and Reporting (STAR) Team is a horizontal team that helps empower our business by driving scaled transformations through innovative technology solutions and data-driven insights. By using data and metrics, we are looking for talented individuals to provide an understanding of business performance, surface strategic problems, and generate actionable insights to help teams make better judgments in driving the balanced performance of our human content review operations. If you like helping people using data, this role is for you. You’ll have the opportunity to do exciting and highly visible work that directly impacts Meta’s operations.

Data Analyst Responsibilities:

Analyse data independently to deliver insights about operational performance and proactively drive improvementsInvestigate key problem areas by performing root cause analyses, corroborating quantitative and qualitative findingsEffectively plan and collaborate with a global team on data driven initiatives to solve complex operational problemsCollaborate with and support operations and data-focused teams to solve problems, develop solutions, and share insightsApply data expertise to successfully support cross-functional operational needsUnderstand strategic changes in business landscape and develop metrics that provide answers to the key questions

Minimum Qualifications:

BA/BS in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Math, Finance, or other technical disciplines, or relevant experience in a quantitative field5+ years of experience in data, reporting, analytical problem solvingHands on experience with SQLExperience in project managing data-centric projectsCommunication skills with experience explaining technical concepts to technical and business partnersSelf-starting, intellectually curious, and creative individual comfortable operating with a high degree of ambiguity

Preferred Qualifications:

Hands on experience building Interactive Visualizations such as Tableau, etc.Hands on experience in Programming Languages such as Python, R or any other programming languagesHands on experience building extract, transform, load (ETL) data pipelinesExperience and understanding of statistical analysis (experimentation logic and biases, hypothesis testing, probability, prevalence measurement, regressions)Ability to make impactful presentationsDemonstrated experience collaborating with multiple stakeholders across functions and time zonesExperience in a dynamic and fast-paced operational environment

title: Finance Data Analyst
description:
Back Market is the #1 marketplace for refurbished electronic devices in Europe and in the US, leading the way in a shift towards a circular economy, freeing the planet from electronic waste. We are proud to sabotage ‘new’ by connecting highly certified professionals to consumers who are looking for a more affordable, reliable and an ecological alternative to purchasing brand new products.

Back Market is undergoing meteoric growth and has raised over 884M€ already! We have the objective of reaching 1000 Back Makers (or Saboteurs) by the end of 2022!

We are thrilled to have an inclusive, fulfilling and caring work environment in all our offices (Paris, Bordeaux, Barcelona, Berlin, London, Prague, New-York and Tokyo). This is an opportunity for you to join a talented, humble and passionate team at the heart of innovation.

Be a part of the movement. Join the refurb revolution.

Joining the Finance Data & Analytics team, you will be at the heart of Finance team missions : support Back Market exceptional growth, working closely with all Finance teams - FP&A, payment and risk management.

YOUR MISSION (IF YOU ACCEPT IT): 🥇
Define new metrics & build dashboards to monitor financial performance Build data models to identify risk among clients and merchantsConduct in depth analysis of our checkout funnel & payment performance to improve our clients' experience and maximise conversion rateConduct ad hoc analysis to support strategic decision making Share your insight to top management (e-g : launching of a new payment methods, warranty extension ...) 

YOU ARE IN THE RIGHT PLACE IF: ⭐
You have 2 to 5 years of experience as a data analyst (or similar role)SQL has no secret for you, Python is a plus & you know how to use dataviz tools (Ideally Tableau)You have top-notch analytical skills to identify key business insights & share recommendations through impactful presentationsYou have a proven business sense.You thrive in a dynamic, challenging, fast-paced work environmentYou are fluent in EnglishIdeally, you have previous experience in the E-commerce business.

RECRUITMENT PROCESS: 📅
Phone call with Caroline , our Talent Acquisition Specialist.Case Study to complete at home.Interview with Christophe, our Head of Finance Data & AnalyticsInterview with Clément, our CFOInterview with Thibaud our CEO and co-founder

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US ? ✌🏼
 A meaningful job: through hard work, you will help avoid thousands of tons of electronic waste and fight against planned obsolescence. It counts! An attractive salary, equity, multiple benefits (meal tickets, health insurance, etc...), parental benefits, relocation package, internal events, etc… Be in an environment where you can make a difference: you will have the freedom to innovate and adopt new ideas! Grow your career with a flexible career path, Back Market can help you evolve! A booming scale-up: our environment is rapidly growing in Europe, the USA and in Asia! We embrace work life balance which includes flexible working hours and the opportunity to work from home. A lot of fun: you will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced, open-minded and friendly environment.

Back Market is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

title: Data scientist Intern
description:
About us
Softonic publishes Softonic.com, the leading global software and app discovery destination, offering the most complete selection of software and apps across hundreds of categories. The European company with one of the largest online audiences, and currently holds the 40th position worldwide with more than 100 million unique monthly users who generate more than 4 million daily downloads on Softonic.com.
About the positionWe are looking for a Data Scientist Intern to join our talented team in Barcelona for a duration of 3 to 6 months ( possibility to grow within the company and have a perm contract). In this role, you will have the opportunity to build and apply state-of-the-art machine learning models to real-world business problems that maximize company revenue. Academic and/or practical experience in data manipulation, model development, and fluency in Python and SQL are particularly relevant for this position. Experience in pricing models and reinforcement learning is also a plus.
Key responsibilities:
Immerse yourself in very large data sets and complex problems. Build and apply state-of-the-art machine learning models to real business problems that maximize company revenue. Visualize and interpret the results of analyses, create strategy recommendations, and present the results to the relevant stakeholders. Work in an agile and international environment, with a flat hierarchy and lots of space for your own ideas. Minimum experience and qualifications:
Experience manipulating data sets, and building and deploying advanced machine learning models. Fluent in Python’s main data science libraries (Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Matplotlib…) and SQL. Fluent written and spoken English. Intrinsic motivation and drive to actively bring additional value to our business activities. Willingness to learn, experiment, and work autonomously. Excellent communication and data presentation skills. Nice to have: Master’s or equivalent advanced degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, or related technical discipline. Academic or project-based experience in price optimization and/or reinforcement learning. Experience working with large datasets. Familiarity with Google BigQuery.
Why Softonic?Workplace & benefits:Dining RoomGaming room& TerracesBike & Car ParkingFresh Fruits, Coffee, Snacks & DrinksPizza & Beers Every ThursdayPrivate Health CareLanguage Classes (English & Spanish)Internal Training ProgramDiscounts At Gyms & RestaurantsFlexible Work Schedule ( home office and 2 days/week in the office)Day off at your birthday & other´s evenings offDiscover more....https://hello.softonic.com/why...

title: Business Data Scientist
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
description:
En Boehringer Ingelheim desarrollamos terapias y soluciones innovadoras para el cuidado de la salud de necesidades médicas no cubiertas, tanto para humanos como para animales. Como empresa familiar, nos centramos en el desarrollo a largo plazo. Creemos que, si tenemos personas talentosas y ambiciosas, apasionadas por la innovación, no hay límite para lo que podemos lograr. Después de todo, comenzamos con un equipo de 28 personas, y ahora somos más 50,000 alrededor del mundo, fomentando una cultura diversa, colaborativa e inclusiva. La posición: En Boehringer Ingelheim tendrás la oportunidad de desarrollar tu carrera y mejorar la salud del mundo. Si quieres dar tu siguiente paso profesional en un entorno innovador, internacional y multicultural, ¡Boehringer Ingelheim es para ti! Crece con el equipo como Business Data Scientist y forma parte de una compañía Top Employer global.
Funciones & Responsabilidades: Dentro del área de Business Operations, reportando directamente al Business Solutions Manager, el/la "Business Data Scientist" será responsable de la administración funcional de los sistemas de Reporting & Análisis, así como de la implementación de nuevas formas de análisis y desarrollo de modelos predictivos avanzados. Administrador Funcional de los sistemas de Reporting & Análisis asegurando la calidad del dato.Desarrollo de nuevas herramientas para monitorizar y analizar ventas y actividad.Contribuir a la identificación, evaluación, comparación e integración de nuevas fuentes de datos.Desarrollo de modelos avanzados basados en AI, Machine Learning, ..para realizar análisis de datos.Desarrollo de modelos avanzados predictivos.Trabajo cross-funcional con diferentes áreas de la compañía para implementar proyectos (HPBU/IT/Corporate) incluyendo la metodología agile en la gestión de proyectos. Perfil & Requisitos: Formación Universitaria. Preferiblemente en Ingeniería, Física, Matemáticas u otras disciplinas relacionadas.Alta capacidad analítica.Conocimiento de AI y machine learning.Conocimiento de plataformas de Business Intelligence: Tableau, PowerBI, Spotfire, Cognos.Tratamiento y procesado de datos: KNIME, SQL.Conocimiento de lenguaje de programación PythonOrientado/a al trabajo en equipo cross-funcional.Buen comunicador/a.Imprescindible alto nivel de inglés. #IamBoehringerIngelheim porque… Con nosotros, puedes crecer, colaborar, innovar y mejorar vidas. Te ofrecemos desafíos en un ambiente laboral global, respetuoso y familiar, donde las ideas impulsan nuestra mentalidad innovadora. Además, el aprendizaje flexible y el desarrollo continuo de nuestro equipo es clave, porque tu crecimiento es nuestro crecimiento. Estamos continuamente trabajando porque queremos diseñar para ti la mejor experiencia. Estos son algunos ejemplos de cómo te cuidaremos: • Horario flexible• Seguro de vida y accidente• Inversión en formación y desarrollo• Cuidado de la salud• Portal de ofertas para colaboradores• Smartworking Si has leído hasta aquí, ¿qué esperas para aplicar? ¡Queremos saber más de ti!

title: Data Scientist
description:
Kraz es una consultora analítica que forma parte del Grupo VIKO. El Grupo VIKO se dedica a prestar servicios de marketing digital desde 1999 y está formado por un equipo de más de 180 profesionales en España y México. Desde Kraz nos dedicamos a combinar datos, tecnología y ciencia para construir soluciones creativas a problemas de información complejos.
Y también...Ayudamos a las empresas a ser más competitivas a partir de la explotación inteligente de sus fuentes primarias de datos.Combinamos un alto nivel de expertise técnico con una profunda comprensión de las necesidades del cliente.Revelamos el valor oculto tras los datos disponibles en las organizaciones.
Si quieres formar parte del equipo, ¡sigue leyendo!
Estamos buscando a una persona que ocupe el rol de Data Scientist para ampliar nuestro equipo.
¿Buscas formar parte de un proyecto en expansión, participar en la definición de los procedimientos de trabajo del equipo de data, trabajar en proyectos retadores de diversos ámbitos funcionales (marketing, manufacturing, etc…) y de distintas industrias (fabricantes, distribuidores, etc…)? ¿Te apasiona la idea de participar en la construcción de la empresa? ¿Tienes muchas ganas de aprender y de rodearte de un entorno dinámico, donde se fomenta el respeto y la transparencia? ¿Disfrutas haciendo tu trabajo y crees en el trabajo en equipo?
Si has contestado “sí” a todas estas preguntas, ¡nos busques más! ¡Este es tu sitio!
¿Cómo será tu día a día?Los Data Scientists son el corazón de la actividad de Kraz. Alrededor de las DS se definen los proyectos a implementar y la metodología más adecuada en cada caso.
¿Qué buscamos en ti?Que tengas formación universitaria superior en Matemáticas, Estadística, Física, Ingeniería o similar.Que domines lenguajes de programación como R y/o PythonQue tengas conocimientos en bases de datos relacionales (SQL)Que conozcas herramientas de Visualización de datos (Shinny, Tableau, QlikView…)Que domines herramientas de control de versiones (Git)Que tengas experiencia trabajando con entornos Cloud (GCP, AWS, Azure, etc)Que tengas un nivel alto de inglésQue vengas con muchas ganas de aprender nuevas herramientas y tecnologías.
Además, valoraremos...Expertise en alguna de las siguientes áreas de foco: Reinforcement Learning, Evolutionary Algorithms, Computer Vision, NLP, distributed machine learning.Experiencia en MLOpsExperiencia en BBDD NoSQLY que compartas nuestros valores: Empower talent, Truly together, Good vibes, We love change y Own it & Make it happen!
¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?Incorporación a Kraz, empresa del grupo VIKO, con más de 180 personas enfocadas en proyectos de marketing digitalFormar parte de un equipo altamente especializado en un entorno joven, dinámico y flexible.Un proceso de selección transparenteSalario fijo + variable en función de objetivosBeneficios fiscales en restaurantes, transporte, seguro de salud, formación y guarderías.Ayuda económica para estudiar inglés: ¡nos hacemos cargo del 50% de tu cuota mensual!Cursos online de M4CAcademy sin coste23 días de vacaciones (+ 2: el 24 y el 31 de diciembre, ¡te los regalamos!)Horario flexibleJornada intensiva todos los viernes y los meses de julio y agostoHome office (asistencia a la oficina 2 días a la semana entre martes y jueves; aunque estarán abiertas toda la semana para poder ser utilizadas)
Si has llegado hasta aquí, eres la persona que buscamos... ¿dónde te habías escondido? ;-)

title: Data Scientist (DS2) - Ecommerce
description:
“We are on a mission to transform the future of grocery retail through sustained technology innovation.”

Ocado Technology is putting the world’s retailers online using the cloud, robotics, AI, and IoT. We develop the innovative software and hardware systems that power Ocado.com, the world’s largest online-only grocery retailer as well as the global ‘Ocado Smart Platform’. With everything from websites to fully autonomous warehouse that we design in-house, our employees need to be specialists in a wide range of technologies to help drive our business.

Data Scientist - Ecommerce | Barcelona 

Purpose Of The Position

Data Science is responsible for designing cutting-edge machine learning and optimisation techniques to convert data into important business insights and solutions.

We focus on machine learning and optimisation problems across Ocado’s ecommerce - from recommending products to customers, to search optimisation and intelligent substitutions. Our data is stored in Google BigQuery, we work primarily in Python for machine learning and use frameworks such as Spark and TensorFlow. We are looking for someone with experience in developing and optimising data science products as we seek to improve the personalisation capabilities and their performance for our OSP platform.

Role & Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist you will work closely with the team lead, management, other data scientists and software engineering teams to identify, scope, plan and manage projects, and effectively communicate complex technical issues and findings to a range of technical and non-technical internal audiences.

You will work on projects in all the areas touched by data science, dealing with complex problems and having a real impact on the operational performance of the company. You will be given autonomy in how you approach these problems and will be encouraged to research and seek out innovative solutions.

Communication is key; you will be in constant contact with business stakeholders and will need to work with developers both within the team and in other technology teams to ensure that your solutions are properly productionised and can be supported.

Essential Skills & Experiences Required
Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, or other quantitative sciences.Experience building productionised machine learning models at scale with a preference for MVP and iteration.Demonstrated computer programming ability including fluency in two or more of Python, Java (or equivalent), and SQL.Experience conducting research and analysis on large data sets and providing rigorous interpretations of the results.The ability to model complex problems mathematically and/or computationallyA solid understanding of key statistical concepts.
Desirable Competencies
Portfolio of past work (applications, analysis, visualisations, blog posts, presentations etc.)Successfully conducted research of significant scope – a Master degree or Ph.D. will be looked on favourably.Experience working on recommendation systems or search algorithms.Experience with Google Cloud Platform.Knowledge of common machine learning toolkits (e.g. scikit-learn).Knowledge of deep learning frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, Theano, Torch..).
Behavioral Competencies
Craftsmanship – demonstrates breadth and depth of knowledge and skill; upholds quality and continuous improvement; can adapt the ideas of others; displays high levels of initiative.Trust – demonstrates high levels of trust between individuals and teams; espouses respect, openness, honesty and knowledge sharing.Collaboration – works well with others and actively contributes towards team/department/division objectives to enable high performance of own and fellow teams; displays the generosity to help others succeed at own expense.Autonomy – accepts ownership of what they do; relishes empowerment to drive innovation; takes accountability and responsibility for their own actions.Learn Fast – ability to learn fast through experimentation; understands that failing is acceptable; recognises the importance of learning from failure quickly, without attributing blame.Leadership – proven ability to inspire, motivate and empower others; able to make tough decisions and handle difficult situations and face major challenges with positivity, confidence and pragmatism; adept communicator.
What We Can Offer You

Our employee benefits are designed for you, we care about people and we’ve ensured we have a wealth of benefits that focus on your well-being. We can offer technically stretching work, a competitive salary and;
Flexible working patterns and options for remote working (depending on your role/team)Wellbeing support through Apps such as Unmind and an Employee Assistance Programme25 days annual leave, rising to 27 days after 5 years service (plus optional holiday purchase)Pension scheme (various options available including employer contribution matching up to 7%)Private Medical Insurance22 weeks paid maternity leave and 6 weeks paid paternity leave (once relevant service requirements complete) Train Ticket loan (interest-free)Cycle to Work SchemeShare OptionsOpportunity to participate in Sharesave and Buy as You Earn share schemes15% discount on Ocado.com and free delivery for all employeesIncome Protection (can be up to 50% of salary for 3 years) and Life Assurance (3 x annual salary)
We also have regular divisional socials, sports clubs not to mention the Ocado Technology Academy for a packed schedule of courses, conferences and events. If you think you have what it takes to make a difference, please submit your application below.

We are thrilled to welcome applicants from across the world. Whilst we are able to offer visa sponsorship, please note that we are only able to cover the company-specific costs. For all employment offers made for UK roles, it is expected that you will be based in the UK in commutable distance, ready for your first day of work, so please keep this in mind. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask.

Due to the energising nature of Ocado's business, vacancy close dates, when stated, are indicative and may be subject to change so please apply as soon as possible to avoid disappointment. If you have applied and been rejected for this role in the last 6 months, or applied and been rejected for a role with a similar skill set, we will not re-evaluate you for this position. After 6 months, we will treat your application as a new one. All benefits information is subject to change and the terms of the individual arrangements.

Be bold, be unique, be brilliant, be you. We are looking for individuality and we value diversity above gender, sexual orientation, race, nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, disability or union participation. We are an equal opportunities employer and we are committed to treating all applicants and employees fairly and equally. 

We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a positive barrier-free recruitment process and supportive work environment. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application.

title: Data Research Analyst, Trilogy (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?

Are you looking for an entry-level role in the software industry that will give you the skills and exposure to move into any speciality later? We’re looking for curious individuals who love searching for meaningful answers.

In this role, you’ll be given a business problem and will scour the internet for possible solutions. The problems will come from every area of our business: operations, finance, hiring, engineering, and more - giving you broad exposure.

Not only will you gain knowledge, you’ll receive regular coaching and training from a team of global tech experts and operations professionals.

Jumpstart your career with us today!

What You Will Be Doing
Research a variety of high-priority topics that are critical to the businessEvaluate results against provided evaluation criteria
What You Won’t Be Doing
Researching the same topics repeatedlyWorking on loosely-scoped research with desired outputs not clearly definedGetting lost chasing tangentially-related solutions; our systems and processes will help you focus your research and optimize your time
Data Research Analyst Key Responsibilities

Provide high-quality research data to support company-wide business decisions

Basic Requirements
Ability to pay close attention to detailExcellent research and writing skills
About Trilogy

Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with Crossover

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

What to expect next:
You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us:
First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/reset-password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply. Crossover Job Code: LJ-4718-ES-Barcelon-DataResearchAn.001

title: Product Data Analyst
description:
As our new Marketing Data Analyst, you will collect, organize and interpret statistical information to make it useful for the business. You will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIESInterpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.Using advanced computerized models to extract the data needed.Removing corrupted data.Developing and implementing data analyses, data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality of the data.Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintaining databases.Performing further analysis to determine the meaning of the data.Performing final analysis to provide additional data screening.Preparing reports based on analysis and presenting to management.
Knowledge and skills:Mobile app analyticsExperience in at least one of the following 3 web/app/prod analytics (Firebase, Google Analytics, AppsFlyer)Knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc.), databases (SQL etc.), programming (XML, Javascrip).Ability to be hands on but also able to work on strategic projects.Assertive with a can-do attitude.High attention to detail.Numerical mindset and able to get insights out of data.Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc.).Methodological way of working and ability to cope with competing demands and prioritize tasks accordingly.Being eager to developer your skills and progress within the company structure is key.
Preferred Qualifications and Experience:Degree in Statistics or Mathematics or a related subject involving math’s, such as economics or data science.Fluent English + at least another language (Ideally Spanish or Portuguese) both spoken and written.At least 3 years of experience in Data Analyst Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities. Analytical and strategic mindset Proactive personality, can-do mentality The position will require interactions with various groups including marketing, business, product, IT technology and compliance.
Benefits:Attractive compensations, health benefit, kitchen with free coffee and fruit each Tuesday and Thursday.Team building activities and work in an international and passionate environment.

title: Junior Data Analyst
description:

title: Finance Data Analyst (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you’ll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives… all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo (glovoapp.com) is looking for a world-class Data Analyst to join the Finance team. Are you looking for a challenging experience in one of Barcelona’s fastest-growing Startups – helping build a product that will disrupt the on-demand market? If your answer is YES, we are looking forward to meeting you.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Take ownership of reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools or using the available ones Understand business needs and produce insightful analyses for internal teams to make the right decisions Assist the Finance Department in accessing data to make the right decisions and carry out operations Creating customized reporting tools (SQL queries, Python scripts, Google spreadsheets, etc) and maintaining the available ones Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date Compute financial KPIs Build robust relationships with key business stakeholders 
You Have
1-2 years of work experience providing internal teams with the necessary data to make the right decisions Proficient with SQL Amazon Redshift experience is highly desirable Proficiency in Python and or R Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview Previous experience in programming is desirable Proficiency in English is a must 
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!

Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing equity plan (if applicable) Top-notch private health insurance Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders! Discounted gym memberships Flexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time) Enhanced parental leave including nursery support! Online therapy and wellbeing benefit External learning budget 
What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learning Care: Uplift people and the planet Glownership: Act as proud owners High Bar: Focus on Top Performance 
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

title: Data Scientist
description:
Bing Experimentation Fundamentals Data Scientist

The Bing team is looking for a data scientist for Whole page Experimentation fundamentals team. The team is responsible for understanding how users engage with search engines and translate them into actionable metrics to guide the experimenters for successful A/B experimentation, validation and ship. 

Nearly half a billion users visit Bing.com worldwide monthly, and yet we have a large space to grow. At Bing, we celebrate our data driven culture- features only ship when they show a positive impact on metrics.  This role is a great opportunity to make solid impact on the org, develop signals that can be used in the product for ranking and on how users can be more productive with search. 

As a data scientist in this team, you will work on to understand, interpret org wide metrics that drive the direction of Bing initiatives. You will be responsible for analyzing 1000s of A/B experiments, be innovative in improving the sensitivity of our metrics to detect small changes faster and continue to build upon our data driven culture at Microsoft.

Responsibilities
Understand A/B online experiments, online user engagement and produce actionable, trustworthy conclusions. Build and track success metrics for Bing customer satisfaction and align with the key org metrics. Continuously improve measurement of the key metrics and update the metrics according to new instrumented signals for easy debugging and validation. Develop tools to help analyze the movement of the metrics to help feature teams to understand why their changes impact the metrics. 
Qualifications
Relevant year’s experience A/B experimentation, statistics, econometrics, and mathematics. Experience with relational databases and SQL-like query languages Hands on experience in design & problem-solving skills with one or more programming languages, such as Python, Java, C# or C++ Ability to work independently and strong communication and collaboration skills. 
 

Preferred Qualifications
Familiarity with search engines, dealing with online instrumentation is a plus. Experience with large datasets and interest in consumer online search behaviors Experience with building machine learning models on large scale data 
#Search# #WebXT# #nextplay //searchjobs

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Spain based position : in Barcelona or Remote !!

Who are we? 🚀

PayFit simplifies payroll management and HR processes for SMBs. PayFit is an automated SaaS solution to help business owners and HR professionals save time and money allowing them to refocus on what really matters: their employees.

Since 2015, we have set ourselves a mission to support the digital transformation of HR management through our ever growing range of product features and services. We have a strong presence in France and have been quickly growing in Germany, Spain and the UK. With 6,000 customers in 4 countries, we are one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in Europe.

Today, we are more than 650 employees at PayFit and we all share four core values:
 Care for each other Always stay humble Strive for excellence Live and work with passion
We are committed to a culture of inclusion and an environment that enables fulfilment in freedom & responsibility.

You want to join us? This video is better than a long description…

What will be your role?⭐
Work closely with the Head of Data and the CS Teams to identify problems.Implement solutions based on data and define key success metrics.Develop metrics, business logic and compelling dashboards to measure the impact of new initiatives.Shape data-informed business strategies.Communicate results and influence key business leaders.Proactively analyse internal and external data to suggest improvements.This job has been tailored for you if...🦄
You have 4+ years of experience in a similar role.You have a strong logic & business sense.You are autonomous, self-starter and detail-oriented.You are proactive, and have a problem-solving mindset.You have strong communication skills.You have strong analytical & data driven skills.You have 3+ years working experience with SQL and data visualisation tools.You are proficient in English.
We would be even more impressed if you have :
Experience with Looker.Experience with dbt.Familiarity with a scripting language (Preferred: Python).Experience with CS Analytics.What we offer❤️
An amazing work environment, designed for kindness and blossoming.An international and dynamic team with the opportunity to visit our different offices (Paris, Berlin, Barcelona and London).A Company Bonus that is paid to all PayFit employees when predefined MRR targets are achieved.25 days of vacations.Private insurance with Sanitas 100% covered by PayFit and extendable to partner and children (optional).Tickets restaurant: € 6 / day worked.Transport / Bicing Ticket (optional).Gym (Andjoy) (optional).Flexible remuneration: Nursery (Part kindergarten for baby) and training ticket.Language courses (English) 1.30h per week.Work from Anywhere policy: full flexibility to work wherever you prefer with some face-to-face moments to maintain our culture.
Hiring process ⚙️

1️⃣ Applicant initial validation: added value, key achievements, motivations, job match. (make sure your CV is in English).

2️⃣ Visio interview with Aida, our Head of Data.

3️⃣ Visio interviews & SQL test with another Data Analyst.

4️⃣ Visio interview with our main business partners: the Head of CS France.

5️⃣ Background check to verify your identity, diploma and past professional experience in the context of your ISO27001 certification.

title: Commercial Data Analyst
description:
26919

Some opportunities happen only once in a lifetime - like a job where you have the chance to change lives. At Alexion, people living with rare and devastating diseases are our Guiding Star. We are driven to continuously innovate and create meaningful value in all we do to help patients and families fully live their best lives. We value the uniqueness and diversity of our employees and recognize that nurturing the diverse perspectives and strengths of our people translates into innovative breakthroughs for patients.

Commercial Data Analyst

This Is What You Will Do

The Commercial Data Analyst role will be leading processes to drive Business Analytics, Systems, Data, Training & Special Projects within the local team and ensure active participation in and alignment to International/Global Commercial Operations initiatives and customer insights to the Spanish Marketing, Sales, Medical and Market Access teams. The position will support the technological transformation and alignment of digital processes across the local organization and interact regularly with the international Commercial Operations team.

You Will Be Responsible For
Oversee commercial platforms, tools and processes that drive Business intelligence & insights and coordinate requirements with the international departmentPartner with Marketing, Sales, Medical and Market Access in each business area with analysis and project management services to drive cross functional collaboration Deliver insights from analytics to inform strategy, challenge and proactively adapt business practice to support effectiveness in commercial activity, brand plans and business reviewsDrive implementation and integration of digital activities in alignment with commercial Build digital expertise across commercial and drive adoption of multichannel approachData integrity and reporting alignment among various internal groups and/or between internal and external sources. Ensure local adherence to global definitions.Concept, design and implement national and global dashboards with relevant KPIs to track business success and progress on local campaignsDesign and conduct regional training regarding reports and reporting toolsProvide ad-hoc value-adding analyzes and prepare regular reports highlighting market insights, trends and variances for commercial teams and senior management Gather and prepare analyzes based on information from internal and external sources to evaluate and demonstrate salesforce effectiveness and efficiency
You Will Need To Have
3+ years analytical and reporting experience; preferably in Healthcare or Life Sciences industryStrong problem-solving skillsAdvanced in Microsoft Excel, SAP (SD, BW and/or BI), SQL, PowerPoint and AccessPreferred experience with Salesforce.com (or other CRM) and QlikSense (or similar data visualization technology)Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneouslyVery good knowledge of English language Analytical skillsProblem solving focusStrategic thinkingGood presentations and communication skillsCustomer focus
We Would Prefer For You To Have
A Bachelor degree, preferably in Statistics, Economics, Industrial Engineering or Computer Science
Alexion is a global biopharmaceutical company focused on serving patients and families affected by rare diseases and devastating conditions through the discovery, development and commercialization of life-changing medicines. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Alexion has offices around the globe and serves patients in more than 50 countries. Further information about Alexion can be found at: www.alexion.com.

Alexion is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where every single person can belong because of their uniqueness. The Company will not make decisions about employment, training, compensation, promotion, and other terms and conditions of employment based on race, color, religion, creed or lack thereof, sex, sexual orientation, age, ancestry, national origin, ethnicity, citizenship status, marital status, parental status (including adoption or surrogacy), pregnancy (including childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), military status, protected veteran status, disability, medical condition, gender identity or expression, genetic information, mental illness or other characteristics protected by law. Alexion provides reasonable accommodations to meet the needs of candidates and employees. To begin an interactive dialogue with Alexion regarding an accommodation, please contact accommodations@Alexion.com. Alexion participates in E-Verify.

AstraZeneca completed its acquisition of Alexion, marking the creation of Alexion, AstraZeneca Rare Disease. If you're interested in career opportunities with AstraZeneca, click here.

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description:
Lingokids' mission is to help 100 million families around the world raise amazing children through playlearning™. To help us on this mission we’re looking for an exceptional Data Analyst. The role can be fully remote or based in our sunny Madrid office.
Our goal
We’re reinventing early childhood education through an online language learning service for kids. With fresh content - games, books, videos, interactive episodes, etc - every week, we are helping more than 9M families and their children around the world learn English in a fun and effective way.
Our dream is to have a positive impact on 100M families and we’re working hard to make it a reality. Our talented team of product designers, software engineers, and content producers tweak and improve our product daily while incorporating feedback from our customers.
Are you ready to Playwork™ with us?
As Data Analyst, You'll help us have a better understanding of each MKT channel. We are looking for a data-go-to person that is willing to join our Marketing Data Science team and channel managers to improve and expand campaign performance analysis. There are three main areas: Paid Media, User Acquisition and Organic channels.Our Data Science team consists of 11 people under the leadership of our Data Science Director, working to help the rest of the departments make data-driven decisions to bring Lingokids production to the next level.For this position, you’ll support our Paid Acquisition team. Working on traditional digital user acquisition, ATL channels (TV, magazines, newspaper, radio advertising, etc.) and Organic channels (PR, YT, Corp Web, Social Media, Partnerships, etc.) This is a fundamental role to us because, in order to continue scaling and offer the best service to the families that trust us, we need an autonomous fast-paced analytical individual who has a passion for going deep into data and for understanding our growth opportunities.
Are you our Data Analyst?
You will make your own cycle of data extraction and analysis, generating insights, data visualization and making recommendations. On one hand, requests for analyses for specific features, campaigns or experiments. On the other hand, you will also proactively do your own analytical work, investigating where you think there is opportunity and value to be added. ResponsibilitiesGenerate relevant and clear insights from data. Identify and clearly articulate recommendations drawn from data analyses.Design and analyze campaigns to statistically measure their impact in User Acquisition.Communicate your insights to technical and non-technical audiences and be able to guide non-technical stakeholders to transform their ideas/needs into the appropriate deliverables.Actively support Data Science with in-depth analyses previous to modelling, in order to understand our data better.Make clear, attainable, and consistent definitions for all things data: metrics, data schemas, KPIs, etc.Help setting achievable targets based on historical data and tendencies.Implement statistical modelling (anova, regression models, factor analysis, PCA, clustering etc.) to find relationships between variables or impact analysis to understand root causes of changes in the data/user pattern. Desired ExperienceThe ideal teammate for us would be someone with at least 3 years of experience in data analysis, ideally in a fast-paced startup environment.Amplitude and Looker for Data Analytics (your bread and butter)AWS Redshift for our data warehousing, dbt for ELTing and SQL for querying the data (your SQL needs to be very crisp and clean)Python/R for deep dive analysis. Not mandatory but analyses sometimes require data wrangling that goes beyond SQLNotion for documentation and GitHub for version controlPrevious experience in Digital marketing campaign analysis. English is a must. We are a multicultural team, and we are providing a service in English so, we don't care about certificates, but we expect you to be able to communicate fluently.You should feel equally comfortable communicating in long-form writing. We have become a fully remote company so, we believe that being articulate in both spoken and written long-form asynchronous communication is key to working efficiently together.Experience working closely with non-technical stakeholders to refine requirements and bring them to life is a must. Life at Lingokids🏡 Unlimited remote working: you can choose to work from home indefinitely or attend our Madrid headquarters whenever you feel like it. This position is open to anyone within +/- 2 hours of the CET timezone.⚖️ Flexible hours and work-life balance: we care about the results you bring to the team. 9 to 6 and constant commuting is not for us either.📈 Stock options: joining Lingokids means you can choose to own part of the company.🌍 Visa sponsorship: if you need a visa to work in the EU, Lingokids will assist you during the visa process, costs included.📚 Professional growth: up to €2.000 per year for conferences, books, and training.💬 Language lessons: language learning is what we’re all about! We’ll cover language classes for you to learn Spanish, English or Portuguese.🩺 Health care: we have optional health insurance as flexible retribution and 4 online therapy sessions for free to help your self-awareness and wellbeing.💳 Flexible compensation: you'll be able to include your monthly expenses in meals and transportations into your payroll.🍲 Meal allowances: every month, you will receive a 60€ voucher for you to spend on the restaurants and food delivery services you like the most.🖥 Home office setup: you'll have a 400€ voucher to set up your home office and a 35€ monthly allowance for remote expenses.🙌 Feedback culture: feedback is the breakfast of champions, and we take it seriously! We have a real-time and honest feedback culture, and a formal 360º assessment every 6 months.If you think you don't tick all the boxes, we'd still love to hear from you. Nobody checks every box, and we are looking for someone excited to join the team!

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description:
Our story, your future story
At Holded, we believe there is a different way to manage companies. An easier way. More effective. Better. It all started in 2016. Our founders, Javi Fondevila and Bernat Ripoll created Holded with the vision of reinventing the concept of ERP.
Our mission is to consolidate our position as the leading cloud ERP in Spain, creating a smart business management solution that covers all areas of business. Holded is an affordable, easy-to-use cloud-based software platform designed especially for small business management. It allows to manage every aspect of a business from a single place: invoicing, accounting, CRM, inventory, projects and human resources. Watch this two-minute video to discover everything Holded can do! -> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vKEqRWaG9ts
We know that big goals need a great team. That's why we're looking for passionate people who work everyday to be the best at what they do. Join our team of +100 employees and let's reinvent how we do business!
The RoleAs a Data Analyst you will work closely with marketing managers and growth operations teams to optimize performance marketing and user journeys, define, monitor and give visibility to business metrics and KPIs, and share useful insights that might influence channel strategies.
You will work closely with the data engineering team to ensure data availability/quality of new features and data sources, and build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between technology and business teams.
You will...Act as an Analytics owner for the Growth team; to ensure that all tactical and strategic objectives are supported by the timely and accurate delivery of reporting and performance measurement.Work in a cross-functional capacity to define success metrics, create approaches to track the data, quantify and evaluate the data, then develop a common language for all colleagues to understand these KPIsAnalyze multi-channel marketing data to evaluate the performance of marketing campaigns, and provide segmented analyses of the funnel from impressions to paying usersDevelop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improvedEnable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a simplified and actionable format
About youMinimum 3 years of professional experience in a data analytics, business intelligence or similar role, ideally working on business projectsProficient in data analysis, including defining KPI strategy and growth opportunities, time series analysis, data visualizationSolid understanding of performance marketing channels (Google Ads, Facebook, LinkedIn etc) and marketing attributionStrong understanding of how databases work, types of data, types of relations...Ability to liaise with data engineersExcellent SQL skillsGoogle Cloud Platform experience is highly valuedKnowledge of DBT and MongoDB is a great advantage
Extra awesomeSaaS experienceFluent in Spanish
What it's like to work with us:Permanent contractRemote friendlyFlexible working hoursShort work-day on FridaysFree catered lunchContinuous Training: annual budget for training for each employeeFully equipped kitchen with snacks, drinks, and fresh fruit.Top-notch work equipmentOffice in front of the sea with ping pong, pool table, PlayStation…Interesting projects and a great work environmentAn excellent opportunity to grow with the companyDiscounts on a gym membership
At Holded, we do things differently. There’s no corporate nonsense, and no old-fashioned hierarchy. Instead, we work in self-sufficient, autonomous teams. Think of them like start-ups within a start-up that learn from each other.
We didn’t start Holded to be another software company. We started Holded to be epic, and you can be part of it!

title: Product Data Analyst
description:
Hello 👋 future candidate,If you are asking "What kind of company is it"?We are a digital travel agency, full of young and dynamic people specialized in very local and thematic "short breaks".
📣 Our vision? Being the reference of unforgettable local short break experiences!We have partners around Europe: France, Benelux, Italy, and Spain.You can look 👀 us up, here: www.welcometothejungle.com/en/companies/weekendesk
Within a Data team between Barcelona and Paris, the goal of the position is to improve user experience onsite by analyzing behaviors and proposing optimizations.
You will work in collaboration with the Product team (PO, PM, UX designer) and other data team members (experienced data scientists and data analysts).
You will use the latest technologies in terms of Big Data (Big Query, Tableau), and your missions will consist of:Implementation and management of tagging plan and data layer, responsible for navigation data pipelines and quality.Track, monitor, and create KPIs and reports to measure satisfaction on our new website features (Google Analytics, SQL, Python).Create dashboards for the product team to empower decentralized data-driven decision-making (SQL, tableau).Follow-up and analysis of user journey until conversion.Alert role in the monitoring of key KPIs.

Required ProfileYou are recently graduated from a business or general engineering school/university or have one or two years of experienceGood skills in Google analyticsA first successful experience in web analysis is a plusYou are motivated to take intensive training in SQL and TableauYou have an analytical mind and a business-oriented vision.You’re a product acumen (understanding of product challenges, organization, etc)You like to evolve independently, take initiative, quickly gain skills and responsibilities.Fluent in English. French or Spanish is a plus
WED data team is looking for dynamic personalities, in search of challenges and new skills, who will quickly adapt to our new team and will inject energy into it to boost its development.

What you will enjoy 😎A competitive fixed salary.Ticket restaurant (5€/day worked).Private Health Insurance package.Monthly Teambuilding.Personal Discount of 20% on Weekendesk website.Languages training, to never stop learning!Free unlimited coffee!

title: Data Analyst
description:
My client are the world's fasted growing SaaS business and having completed a huge €160m Series D funding round are looking for a Data Analyst to join their team. Despite only being c5 years old they have grown to 400 people and have created an online travel agency for business travel that lets companies choose from the world's largest inventory of hotels and flights in the world.
You’ll join a team of 5 and work cross-functionally across their tech teams dealing with data from all aspects of their business (payments, bookings etc) providing them with visual data analysis to facilitate conversations and assist in data-driven decision making. They have a real passion for making data-driven decisions so you’ll have a real impact in the business!
You will be working with Looker (will look at other BI tools), SQL, R and Python.
In return, you will get the opportunity to join a business with a clear objective to IPO (stock options awarded as part of the package!) and a competitive base salary. A clear career progression path within a rapidly growing business that will likely be unrivalled in the local area.

title: Data Analyst - A/B testing
description:
Data Analyst - A/B Testing

eDreams ODIGEO is one of the world’s largest online travel companies and one of the largest European e-commerce businesses. Under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo – it offers the best deals in regular flights, low-cost airlines, hotels, cruises, car rental, dynamic packages, holiday packages and travel insurance to make travel easier, more accessible, and better value for the more than 18 million customers it serves across 43 markets. eDreams ODIGEO is listed in the Spanish Stock Market.

Our Experiments and Insights team is the centre of excellence for Online (AB) Experimentation and for providing best practices to generate insights and learning from and for the experiments. Our goal is to help different teams across the organization to succeed in their mission by providing insights generation and data analysis support in a healthy data-informed environment.

We are looking for a Data Analyst - A/B Testing who has experience working with analytics tools such as SQL (mostly for BigQuery usage) and visualization tools as DataStudio, and has a strong mathematical background to work with our Data Science team on new processes and methodologies being implemented or that can be put in practice.

In this role, you would be responsible for working with multi-disciplinary teams - Qualitative Researchers, Designers, Product Owners, Developers, and Pricing Managers - to blend different statistical and data analytics techniques to generate a holistic understanding of the users and markets. You will also be the link between the Experiments team and the inhouse Data Science team, to bring the AB capabilities our product teams work to the next level.

Main responsibilities (included but not limited to):
 Study and put in practice other ways to run and analyse experiments in a web environment by working closely with our internal Data Science team,  Analyse performance and identify behaviours in different A/B Test experiments and hypotheses,  Data validations for new dashboards, reports and data sets as well as ensuring accuracy for the current ones,  Data cleaning,  Gaps and discrepancies analysis,  Translate complex and potentially ambiguous information into a clear structure and actionable deliverables. Perform analysis on large data sets using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools with a strong focus on quality;  Build and maintain dashboards and/or reports to share performance information with senior management and C-level stakeholders;  Identify and analyze relevant customer data to drive business goals and validate hypothesis & designs; turn data into actionable insights;  Lead data-driven initiatives to improve company decision making and business knowledge;  Ensure that all eDreams ODIGEO websites are appropriately instrumented with events tracking to be able to answer different kinds of research/product questions;  Collaborate with User Researchers and designers to detect gaps in knowledge about our user; identify research opportunities to fill those gaps. 

Skills and Experience:
 Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline is a requirement (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, etc.),  Minimum of 4 years experience in a role with strong analytical component,  Knowledge of the math and statistical concepts behind A/B testing,  Strong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data,  R or Python programming skills will be highly valued,  Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with the Google toolset (spreadsheets, google docs, etc),  Knowledge of visualisation tools like DataStudio, Tableau, Looker or Qlikview,  A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys to have fun!  Business Proficiency in English 

Plus:
 Google Analytics knowledge (as well as Google Analytics API, googleAnalyticsR library for R, , etc.)  Previous experience in programming  Knowledge on data structure and data sets management in Google Cloud Platform 

What do we offer?
 Safe environment during COVID times: Onboarding and daily work can be done 100% remote.  A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.  Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.  Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills training, language lessons, external events and industry conferences.  Free subscription to O’Reilly Online Learning.  Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.  We also have for you a Ticket Restaurant benefit & unlimited beverages and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) because we like our eDOers happy and healthy!  A phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance.  New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.  Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements.  Fun at work: at eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand! 

… And the opportunity to work in a dynamic, dedicated, fun and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!

Come fly with us and join us now.

eDreams ODIGEO under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo –is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

title: Programmatic Data Analyst
description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world, competing with American-based Liftoff and Korean-based Moloco, both in the pre-IPO stage and averaging about $500M in yearly revenues.We compete in a highly advanced technology-driven industry where Data Science and cutting-edge cloud-based big data architectures make all the difference in the company’s growth. 
We are looking for ambitious engineers whose ultimate motivation is to learn the most advanced technologies used in the ad-tech industry by the likes of Google and Facebook and to help us become the biggest mobile programmatic advertising platform in the world.
Our mission is to continue to improve our ad-tech platform to help our clients achieve their programmatic advertising campaign goals, and we want to give our employees a job they’ll love, where they will be challenged to improve results through real-life engineering and data analysis and where everyone’s implication has an impact. 
We are looking for a Campaign Analyst with strong SQL and analytics experience to join our Ad Operations team. Working alongside our Programmatic Campaign Managers, the candidate should have a mix of business-oriented and analytical mindset, to understand the short and long term challenges the mobile advertising campaigns are facing, and use the tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them and create the most effective strategies and algorithms to help improve the Smadex platform!
 The role is based in Roger de Lluria 50, Barcelona.
Your tasks and responsibilities:Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behavior of millions of mobile users worldwide to address strategic and operational questionsObtain insights from our campaign portfolio, in order to make decisions that will directly impact our revenue-making optionsDevelop tools, algorithms, and processes to ensure data influences decisions at all levels of the companyManage and monitor programmatic User Acquisition campaigns' performance on a regular basis, striving to consistently refine tactics and produce exceptional results for our customers
Skills and requirements:1+ year of experience in a similar role is a mustExcellent command of Microsoft ExcelExcellent communication skills in English both written and spoken are mandatoryWorking knowledge of SQL and comfort working in large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluationPython/R experience is a plusKnowledge of digital programmatic buying is a great plusStrong analytical skills with the ability to analyze key metrics to optimize campaigns and meet client’s KPIs Ability to adapt and adjust to regular changes in priorities and focus based on campaigns' performanceProven ability to solve data-related problems using creative thinking Bachelor or Master's Degree in Engineering is preferredDesire to build the biggest company in the world
Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered. 
What is in it for you: Integrate a highly motivated and young teamGreat compensation packageTop location at the heart of Barcelona in a penthouse office with rooftop terrace, Barbeque, and fully stocked fridgeGreat work-life balance: work from home, flexible hoursLearning and training opportunitiesMeal vouchers - Tickets Restaurant monthly allowance Monthly gym allowance to use in up to 30 DIR gyms around the cityMonthly TGIF eventsRegular team-building eventsFun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 21 countriesExposure to leading global app publishers (Zynga, King, Rovio, EA, etc.) and media partners in the digital advertising industryAnd more!

title: Data Analyst - Supply & Demand Balance
description:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day. We currently deliver over +100M annual orders and operate in 22 countries, and in over +300 cities.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo is looking for a world-class Data & Operations Research Analyst to work in our Barcelona office. Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on? Do you want to evolve in one of the fastest growing startups of Barcelona, building a product that will change people's day-to-day lives and disrupt the on-demand market?

The Supply and Demand Balance team within the Logistics cluster is a product team responsible for ensuring the healthy marketplace at all times and operational conditions through different levers (availability of the restaurants, availability and incentives for couriers, etc) . The team leverages operations research techniques, optimization and machine learning models to build tools that support the health of the marketplace.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Work closely with product managers, engineering and data science teams to define, monitor, and provide visibility of product metrics and KPIs.Optimize and tune new product’s features to improve the performance and Glovo’s KPIs using mathematical optimization and simulation techniques.Create dashboards and reports to monitor key metrics and regularly communicate results to stakeholdersGenerate, prototype, and execute on ideas for product discovery to shape future projects and provide recommendations for actions.Design and lead A/B tests and/or Switchback tests, to evaluate new features of the product.Support the team on the rollouts of the product features.
You Have
Background studies in Engineering, Operations Research, Physics, Economics, Computer Science, or Mathematics (MSc is preferred)Ability to manipulate,analyze and visualize large amount of data, using analytical (such as: Python, R, SQL) and visualization toolsAbility to communicate and present complex ideas to stakeholders and get buy-in thanks to ability to understand business needs.Experience in mathematical optimization (metaheuristics, linear optimization, constraint programming, etc) would be very beneficial.Knowledge of A/B testing and/or Switchback testing is desirable, including design, interpretation of results and ability to draw actionable conclusionsAbility to juggle multiple strands of work and priorities on complex projects.Fluent spoken and written English
Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares planComprehensive Private Health InsuranceCobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and foodFree monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!Discounted Gym membershipsFlexible working environment
What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
GAS: Driven to deliver quality results quicklyGood Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learningCare: Uplift people and the planetGlownership: Act as proud ownersHigh Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

title: Data Analyst - PL/SQL
description:
¡Hola! 👋
Sabemos que 𝐛𝐮𝐬𝐜𝐚𝐬 𝐮𝐧 𝐜𝐚𝐦𝐛𝐢𝐨, sí, no lo niegues, estás explorando nuevos proyectos ofertas y empresas, algo te gustaría cambiar🤭. Nos gustaría que, en esta oferta de empleo pares, 𝐧𝐨 𝐡𝐚𝐠𝐚𝐬 𝐬𝐜𝐫𝐨𝐥𝐥 directamente a las responsabilidades, conocimientos, y todas esas cosas que buscamos de ti.
Porque primero queremos presentarnos…
Lo primero de todo 𝐬𝐨𝐦𝐨𝐬 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐬, lo segundo que 𝐬𝐨𝐦𝐨𝐬 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐬 𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐚𝐦𝐚𝐧 𝐥𝐚 𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠í𝐚 💙🦾, somos tekkies, nos gusta, aunque no tenga que ver con nuestro puesto de trabajo, esas novedades frikies que se comen nuestras horas mirando en youtube, en twich, en tik tok, gitlab o dónde sea.
Por las mañanas nos levantamos, nos tomamos un café☕, y no iniciamos el ordenador con palpitaciones, sino alegres 😁, con ganas de comenzar el día, de trabajar con las personas de tu equipo y todas aquellas con las que estamos en contacto día a día. Esa es nuestra primera promesa, 𝐜𝐨𝐧 𝐧𝐨𝐬𝐨𝐭𝐫𝐨𝐬 𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐛𝐚𝐣𝐚𝐫á𝐬 🅵🅴🅻🅸🆉. Se te pasarán las horas volando, haciendo lo que te apasiona hacer.
Si eres de los que dice: ¡ahorremos tiempo, soy el ingeniero que buscas en la creación de entornos Microsoft! ¡𝐍𝐨𝐬𝐨𝐭𝐫𝐨𝐬 𝐝𝐞𝐜𝐢𝐦𝐨𝐬 𝐖𝐨𝐰🤩!
