Pues es justo lo que necesitamos, pero empecemos por el principio… Sí, te estamos buscando para incorporarte a nuestra Comunidad de Cloud y participar en nuestros proyectos desde nuestros centros de desarrollo, o siempre que sea posible de forma Remota desde el calor de tu hogar o dónde prefieras.
¿𝐐𝐮é 𝐭𝐞 𝐠𝐮𝐬𝐭𝐚𝐫í𝐚 𝐬𝐚𝐛𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐞 𝐧𝐨𝐬𝐨𝐭𝐫𝐨𝐬 𝐩𝐚𝐫𝐚 𝐪𝐮𝐞𝐫𝐞𝐫 𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐫 𝐩𝐚𝐫𝐭𝐞 𝐝𝐞 𝐧𝐮𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐚 𝐟𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐚?
En primer lugar, somos Cloud Partner con 5 competencias. Además, trabajamos para 14 de las empresas del IBEX-35 y desarrollamos proyectos internos de innovación, pero ¡𝐢𝐧𝐧𝐨𝐯𝐚𝐝𝐨𝐫𝐞𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐝𝐚𝐝! 🤸♀️Además, te ofrecemos grandes posibilidades en plan de carrera, formación y certificación para crecer profesionalmente.
¿𝐐𝐮é 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐩𝐞𝐭𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐢𝐚𝐬 𝐦í𝐧𝐢𝐦𝐚𝐬 𝐞𝐬𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐚𝐦𝐨𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐭𝐢?
- Dominio de SQL - PL/SQL queries y jobs para diseñar y realizar pipelines ETL complejos- Conocimiento de algún lenguaje de programación (PYTHON, Java, .NET, etc)- Reporting- Bases de datos: MSSQL, MongoDB.-Nivel alto de inglés
Trabajarás en uno de nuestros principales clientes del sector farmacéutico. 
En atSistemas utilizamos la tecnología para estar cerca, nos profesionalizamos, investigamos, creamos y vendemos nuestras propias creaciones, nos certificamos, realizamos eventos, nos 𝐝𝐢𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐨𝐬 💃 y por supuesto, para ayudar a impulsar y hacer realidad los proyectos de nuestros clientes.
¿Qué más puedes hacer con nosotros?
• Si aún no te ves capaz de tener una conversación con la reina Isabel II puedes llegar hasta ese nivel con 𝐧𝐮𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐬 𝐜𝐥𝐚𝐬𝐞𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐠𝐥é𝐬. 💂• Sabemos que te gusta comer en restaurantes y que a veces no vas para no gastar tanto dinero. Con la 𝐫𝐞𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐛𝐮𝐜𝐢ó𝐧 𝐟𝐥𝐞𝐱𝐢𝐛𝐥𝐞 en tickets restaurante podrás ahorrarte unos eurillos. También en cheques guardería, tarjeta de transporte y seguro médico. 🍕🍼🚈💊• El ir a trabajar no es solo mirar correos y atender peticiones. ¿Te imaginas hacer un scape room virtual con tus compañeros o unirte a un club de ajedrez? Durante todo el año hacemos actividades de 𝐭𝐞𝐚𝐦 𝐛𝐮𝐢𝐥𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 para todos los gustos. 🎮♟• Si tienes un amigo del que no puedes despegarte, ¡haz que se una a la 𝐅𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐚𝐚𝐭!. Si crees que encaja en alguno de nuestros perfiles y se une a nosotros tendrás un premio 🤑 🤑• ¡Los eventos son lo nuestro! Tenemos dos grandes congresos además de webinars, formaciones internas hechas por técnicos de atSistemas o meetups.• Y si todo esto te parece poco, tenemos 𝐦𝐮𝐮𝐮𝐜𝐡𝐚𝐬 𝐬𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐚𝐬 que vamos realizando a lo largo del año. Puedes verlas aquí: https://www.atsistemas.com/es/unete/propuesta-valor• ¡Ah! Se nos olvidaba decirte que Los Reyes Magos también se pasan por atSistemas...
#FamiliaAt #Joinus @atsistemas

title: Data Analyst Banca
description:
TSD Consulting busca incorporar a su equipo de Barcelona a un/a Data Analyst (Banca)

¿Qué conocimientos / experiencia debo tener?

3 años de experiencia como Data Analyst, preferiblemente en el sector Banca.

Familiarizado con BBDD (SQL, Oracle, etc..) y herramientas de BI

Formación en ciencias, estadística, econometría, master en Data Analytics / Business Intelligence

Excelentes capacidades análiticas, debes ser capaz de trabajar tanto a nivel de detalle como de comprender la "big picture" del negocio.

Personalidad proactiva, orientada a la resolución de problemas

Muy buena capacidad de comunicación.

¿Qué conocimientos / experiencia no son indispensables pero nos gustaría que tuvieses?

Microstrategy

Nivel inglés medio

¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Salario Bruto Anual a partir de 36.000€.

Modelo de trabajo presencial en Sant Cugat del Vallés (Barcelona)

Plan de Formación

Contrato indefinido

Seguro Médico Privado y cuando volvamos a la normalidad otras opciones de retribución flexible como tickets restaurant, abono transporte, etc…

Y, sobre todo, un trato personalizado, no serás uno más entre miles. Ref.: 2022/011

title: Data Analyst
description:
Estamos seleccionando un/a Data Analyst para unirse a nuestro equipo del Departamento de Tecnología de la Información en nuestros HQ.
Tu misión será analizar los datos cualitativos y cuantitativos del proyecto CRM con el fin de obtener información clave para el desarrollo del proyecto. ¡Esta es tu oportunidad!
¿Qué esperamos de ti?Definir y ejecutar la selección de los segmentos de clientes así como hacer seguimiento de la cartera de clientes.Elaborar informes, así como estudios y previsiones.Analizar resultados, interpretar y participar en la toma de decisiones.Desarrollar modelos avanzados de analítica de datos.Optimizar procesos de datos para mejorar objetivos de negocio.Dar seguimiento a las solicitudes recibidas por parte de nuestros clientes en relación con el ejercicio de sus derechos como interesados.
¿Qué buscamos?Titulación Universitaria en Matemáticas o Ingeniería.Mínimo 3 años de experiencia en posición similar.Nivel de inglés avanzado.Aptitudes hacia la analítica de datos como técnicas estadísticas, segmentación y detección de tendencias.Experiencia previa en herramientas de gestión de datos: Excel, SPSS, SQL...Valorable experiencia previa en Cloud.Pensamos en una persona proactiva, organizada, con habilidades de comunicación, visión estratégica y con ganas de trabajar en equipo.
¿Qué ofrecemos?Te unirás a un gran equipo de personas en un ambiente de trabajo dinámico.Tendrás flexibilidad horaria de entrada y salida para conciliar tu vida laboral-familiar.Los viernes tarde serán libres para ti.Podrás optar al beneficio de Retribución flexible, con ventajas fiscales para servicios como comida, guardería, transporte, formación o seguro de salud.Si tienes hij@s, en TOUS tenemos Jardín de Infancia, para una mejor conciliación vida laboral-familiar.Amarás nuestro producto, por ello te ofrecemos un 30% en todos los productos TOUS.
Tenemos un fuerte compromiso con la igualdad de oportunidades y en las relaciones de trabajo basadas en los principios de respeto mutuo e igualdad.

title: Game Data Scientist
description:
Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps. With 6 billions downloads and over 300 million monthly active users, Voodoo is the #1 mobile publisher worldwide.

The company is one of the most impressive examples of hypergrowth in the ecosystem, backed by Goldman Sachs, Tencent, and GBL. Deciding to expand its portfolio of products further, Voodoo has more recently announced its investment in blockchain technology to bring blockchain games to mobile users. Voodoo is now a team of over 600 employees worldwide, we’re looking for talented individuals from across the globe to come and entertain the world with us.

What will be your main challenges?

You will be joining the new and growing Casual Games Business Unit at Voodoo. You will play a key role in the growth of this unit and in setting standard methodologies to support a growing number of studios and partners. You will work in an ambitious and fast-paced environment with stakeholders from multiple horizons: management, game design, marketing and tech.

You will be the link between our data organization and multiple teams working on games in development or live. You will assist them through the different stages of the game development cycle: implementation of events tracking, analyses of the performance of early prototypes, performance assessment of games to launch, optimization of live games and content. You will also need to adapt to a fast-moving environment and be pragmatic when it comes to defining priorities and choosing the most efficient solutions.

We expect you to match the high standards of rigor needed to carefully assess the potential of a game and identify areas of improvement to clearly communicate your results with the game teams. You will become an undisputed expert in game analytics, earning the trust of your collaborators through rigorous and efficient work.

What do we expect?
At least 2 years of analytical work experience in the gaming, tech or data-driven industry.Proficient with SQL and either R or Python, with a proven experience working with large and complex data sets. Good knowledge of statistical analysis and concepts used for industry-standard methods like AB testing or forecasting.Autonomous person with a strong analytical mind, problem-solving skills and strong attention to detail.Ability to understand a business problem, turn it into an analytics/statistics problem and solve it using adequate methods.Highly pragmatic mindset with the ability to quickly identify what needs to be focused on and what can be considered of lower priority.Proven track record working in close connection with product teams and clearly communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
What is your team about? 

The Casual Data Team is a centralized structure made up of industry veterans whose mission is to set up an efficient and rigorous analytical framework to support multiple studios and ambitious projects to drive the growth of Casual Games at Voodoo.

The data team plays a critical role in shaping the success of our games by identifying successful and underperforming patterns and communicating both results and recommendations to our stakeholders. We always seek to improve every piece of our complex analytical stack, from data collection to analytical methods and business impact.

We give all team members ownership of their projects while ensuring they have the right tools and support to grow both personally and professionally.

This role can be handled by candidates based in Barcelona, Paris, Berlin, and London.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Let’s Talk About You

Your profile 

You are a highly collaborative individual and enjoy solving problems that focus on adding business value. You have a sense of ownership and enjoy hands-on technical work. Our values resonate with yoursDegree educated in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or equivalent experience, with strong physics background or experience in physics-based Deep Learning preferably with Tensorflow or PytorchAbility to write clean, maintainable, and robust code in Python as well as working experience with CUDA and familiarity with at least some container, query, and database technologiesAnalysis of discrete or continuous, non-uniformly sampled time-series as well as knowledge in distributed computing and deep learning Preferable: familiarity with ML learning in the cloud, preferably with AWS SageMaker, as well as familiarity with the RAPIDs family specially cuMLFluency in English is essential (C2 Level), fluency in Spanish is strongly recommended (B2/C1 Level), knowledge of German and other languages is a plus

Your Responsibilities

Design and build digital twin models of Siemens-Energy assets components for anomaly and faults detectionsDefine failures root causes and produce risk analysis with explainable probabilistic modelsCombine data from various and diverse sources into global optimization modelsTake advantage of Siemens Energy cloud environment to scale your modelsContribute to cross-functional problem-solving sessions with your team and deliver presentations to colleagues and clients Your opportunities for personal growth

You will have the opportunity to work in a start-up like environment, with highly motivated team within a leading market company, and in an international environmentWhile we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, SQL, R, AWS Step Functions, AWS lambda and a lot of container technologies (Docker) with multiple runtimes for these (AWS SageMaker, EKS or AWS Batch). We are also using RStudio Teams as a centralized development environment to launch VScode, RStudio and JupyterLab sessionsYou will be part of an international team, working alongside Project Managers, Data Engineers, Machine Learning Engineers, Software Engineers and 3D DesignersDuring your first project you will also work closely with collaborators from two of the biggest companies in data services and deep learning techYou will directly contribute on the establishment of the energy systems of tomorrow

Let’s Talk About Us

"Let’s make tomorrow different today" is our genuine commitment at Siemens Energy to all customers and employees on the way to a sustainable future.

As Siemens Energy we are the only company with a leading portfolio along the entire energy value chain – in both conventional and renewable energy – we are uniquely able to help both public- and private-sector customers benefit from these developments.

Your role will be inside one of our DigiHubs and based in Barcelona.

#DigiHubBarcelona leads all Siemens Energy DigiHubs worldwide from the showcasing and customer experience perspective in Digitalization and Energy Transition. We work with consultative sales methodologies and enable our sales colleagues in selling Digital Transformation and Energy Transition related solutions from a holistic customer centric approach.

#DigiHubBarcelona is one of the main Data Hubs for Siemens Energy, become part of our dynamic digitization team as a Data Scientist and join us in the world of digitalization and decarnonization. A new dimension of the service of our machines awaits you - the dimension of data. For us, digitization means increasing the value for our customers by development of innovative business models as well as digital products.

MORE INSIGHTS

Be Energized. Be you.

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity we generate power. We run on inclusion and compassion. Our combined creative energy is fueled by at least 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society. All of society.

Jobs & Careers: https://www.siemens-energy.com/global/en/company/jobs.html

!

Organization: Enterprise Data & Advanced Analytics

Company: Siemens Energy S.A.

Experience Level: Experienced Professional

Job Type: Full-time

title: Data Scientist
description:
What are we looking for? 

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join the Data & Analytics team to use data to accelerate innovation and bring value across the business verticals. Your objective will be using available data to solve complex business problems across the organization. This person will provide analysis and develop AI solutions that help business with decision making.

The Data & Analytics team at Zurich is formed of Data Scientists that use data to accelerate innovation and bring value across the business verticals.

Your day to day will be the following:

 Building new models using advanced statistical knowledge and ML techniques to answer strategic business questions across the organization.  Conducting moderate to high complexity analyses under general direction.  Conducting ad-hoc analysis required by business team.  Identifying detailed data needs and structure to support model development.  Cleaning and organizing data for its analysis.  Manipulating and integrating data to highlight patterns, relationships, anomalies and trends.  Managing new data sources, deep analysis and insights, developing testing strategies.  Deployment and follow-up of the models in cloud (preferably in AWS).  Influencing key cross-functional business stakeholders by delivering analyses and recommendations. 

 What do we need? 

 Minimum BS/BA in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Physics, Artificial Intelligence or a related technical/data intensive field, a plus being holding a MSc  Proficiency in analytic tools in Python (nltk, pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, scipy) & SQL, Computer Vision (Image Segmentation, Image Classification - Tensorflow, Keras and PyTorch; OCR - eg. Google Cloud Vision, Tesseract), Pyspark programming would be considered a plus.  Experience 2-3 years in a data-intensive project, leading one or more analytics projects, including working with complex data sets from data processing to using advanced analytics techniques to build a model (classification, clustering, regression).  Experience in deploying models in AWS Cloud and using Amazon SageMaker Studio to cover the entire machine learning workflow would be considered a plus.  Proven team player with the ability to lead, guide and influence cross-functional teams.  Good written and verbal communication skills and problem-solving capabilities.  Proactive.  Strong drive for excellence.  Fluent in Spanish and English. 

 For being from Zurich 

At Zurich we want to take care of you and these are some of your benefits:

 Flexible compensation. Restaurant card. Home office voucher. Flexwork: 20 hours a week to work where and when you want. Pension plan - Life insurance. Bank and insurance offer. Discount in gyms. Zurich Wellness, sports activities. Zurich Sports Club, free registration for marathons and popular races. Free English classes.

About Us

Our nearly 55,000 employees in more than 215 countries and territories are the foundation of our success. They are the ones who enable companies and communities to confront a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You would give them confidence and peace of mind by protecting what they love the most. It is a great challenge, but you will have the support of a great international team that is ready to help you so that you can reach your full potential and thus fulfill our promises.  We have already started and we are changing the way of making insurance. For this we need talented people, the desire to learn and passion! Will you join us? 

 "Zurich, 14 consecutive years as Top Employer" 

Zurich Insurance has the policy to be an equal opportunity employer. We aim to attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to criteria such as race/ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

title: Data Analyst (P&T Operational Excellence)
description:
We are looking for an exceptional Data Analyst to join the Product & Tech Operational Excellence Team.

You will work in this team by providing data products which allow teams, managers and the entire P&T Organization to access the data easily to solve their analytical needs, and providing also high-level analyses and recommendations to help them make data-driven decisions. You will definitely make an analytical impact in Adevinta Spain.

These will be your main functions:

Lead a Data Analytics Project end-to-end: From detecting opportunities and understanding needs, data capture and transformation, visualization, analysis and analytical training.

Set, prioritize and coordinate implementation of data requirements and data-quality standards.

Understand business needs and produce insightful analyses for internal teams and leaders/managers to make the right decisions.

Creates the Data Pipelines to Extract, Load and Transform Data with batch and streaming jobs.

Design, implement and maintain dashboards and reporting to drive decision-making.

Guarantee definitions of dimensions and indicators across the company.

Assist colleagues in gaining access to the right data, train them and eliminate the barriers that exist in order to facilitate the analytical autonomy of the teams.

Provide accurate data, insights, analysis and forecasts for decision makers and stakeholders

Work with the technical team to translate business requirements into detailed technical design

Communicate results in a clear and concise manner, with an understanding of data visualization and the importance of drawing accurate conclusions from multiple data sources

 

 



Qualifications

Must:

Master’s degree in any relevant technical field such as statistics, experimental sciences (physics, chemistry, etc.), mathematics or economics.

Nice to have a 3 years experience in a similar position

Knowledge of Tableau.

Storytelling skills

Extensive experience with SQL (usage of Redshift and Azure)

Extensive experience with Python.

Experience working with data processing frameworks like Spark, Flink, Kafka Streams or Beam.

Proficiency in building well-tested code.

Querying tools: Hive, Athena, Presto, BigQuery...

Self-starter and detail-oriented . You can complete projects with minimal supervision

Excellent communication skills and ability to interact with multidisciplinary teams

Intermediate knowledge of Git

Experience with Agile methodologies

 

Nice to have:

Experience with streaming processing tools like Kafka / Kinesis, Structured Streaming, Akka Streams, Flink, Spark Streaming…

Experience with Docker and container orchestration tools like Kubernetes, ECS, Docker Swarm.

Notebooks: Jupyter, Zeppelin, Databricks.

Familiarity developing data pipelines with scheduling tools like: Airflow, Luigi, Cloud Componer, Argo.

NoSQL databases: Redshift, Cassandra, HBase.

Ideally expertise on digital analytics tools (Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Adobe Analytics, GTM, Tealium, etc.)

Fluent in English



Additional Information

At Adevinta Spain, we believe in the power of a fair and equitable benefits policy. And we do everything we can to make it so. Therefore, we pay special attention to all aspects that are key in your day-to-day life:

Ever since COVID-19 hit, we've all been working remotely following the health recommendations, but the offices are open and you can go in whenever you'd like with all the necessary health measures in place. Now, we are shaping our new post-COVID-19 working model. It will be based on a hybrid formula that will have a significant remote work component.

Every year we engage into benchmarking against the external market in order to create competitive compensation packages. Moreover, we do have plans that allow you to "flex your gross salary" in order to purchase benefits such as meal vouchers, commuters card, training and child care.

All Adevintans have in common the passion for innovation and technology. You can choose whether to have a Macbook or Dell XPS laptop and you can opt for an Iphone or a Samsung.

We subsidize your parking up to a maximum of 90€/ month.

Your well-being is our priority. We cover fully for your medical insurance and we allow family members to be added to the policy for a discounted price.

We have a doctor in our facilities and we do offer extra wellness initiatives such as Yoga at the office in Madrid and physiotherapy in Barcelona.

Do you like going to the gym? We sponsor 70% of the monthly fee of your chosen centre/ studio and we have agreements with both Andjoy and McFit for discounted membership prices. 

We enjoy 23 days of paid-time-off a year.

In Barcelona offices we offer free breakfast and beverages🥐 You can choose the daily menu freshly prepared in our canteen.

Last but not least, you have 5 extra days to attend conferences and we offer one entrance ticket per year

title: Business Data Analyst for Tax Engine
description:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

We are looking for a smart, passionate candidate to join our team. Tax Engine is part of the Global Tax Calculation Services team, a program comprised of analysts, tax professionals and software engineers that are responsible for providing end-to-end global indirect tax calculation solutions (sales and use taxes, value-added taxes, good and services taxes, and other consumption taxes) to Amazon and thousands of other merchants selling on Amazon marketplaces, as well as other e-commerce platforms.

The individual in this role will work within the Business Intelligence team providing support to analytical teams and tax engine business, through E2E BI solutions that will improve productivity and enhance efficiency in indirect tax calculations and processes. It will be directly involved in developing analytical data models in team’s owned business warehouse, generating new data metrics for tax engine operations, and delivering front-end reporting applications. In this role it will find a team-spirit environment and data-driven culture where autonomy and proactivity are celebrated and incentivized.

Key job responsibilities
 Developing and maintaining Data Warehouse analytical data models and processes Delivering analytical solutions through reporting applications (e.g. Tableau dashboards, Quicksight applications, automated reports) Applying governance and best practices for the back-end and front-end solutions in the Business Intelligence environment Developing and maintaining metrics and reporting for measuring processes efficiency Developing automated data quality processes Analyzing large data sets and presenting consolidated findings to senior management team, including an assessment of risks and opportunities.

Basic Qualifications
 4+ years of Business Intelligence experience (Datawarehousing, ETL processes, Data visualization) Strong SQL knowledge Experience in Dashboarding and reporting tools development (Tableau, Quicksight) Proficiency in English Strong analytical skills Experience interacting with global, cross-functional teams
Preferred Qualifications
 Ability to prioritize and meet deadlines while managing multiple stakeholder needs in a fast-paced environment Experienced in Python or any other programming language Working experience in any of the following areas: Robotics Process Automation (RPA), SharePoint development/migration projects, Machine Learning
Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.


Company - Amazon Spain Services, S.L.

Job ID: A1929151

title: Data Scientist - Eternal Games
description:
Craft

Job Description:

Do you want to be part of our exciting Eternal Games family? In Eternal Games, we run 5 amazing King games with a very clear picture in mind: making our games Eternal, challenging the standard assumed mobile games’ lifecycle. We have 3 million people playing our games every single day and the value we deliver is counted in millions of dollars. Are you ready to join us and to have a great impact?

Your role within our Kingdom

You will be working with varied stakeholders in a fun, dynamic and fast- paced environment. You’ll help us to further understand, model, predict, segment, retain and monetise our players and be part of a community of 100+ business intelligence & analytics experts.

Specifically, You’ll
Proactively develop new analyses, experiments and data- driven tools to better understand our players’ behaviour and the performance of our gamesProvide insights to support decision making for the portfolio of games in the StudioTranslate business needs to technical requirements and AB- tests, and work with development teams to ensure correct implementation, taking care to correctly track the right information to allow easy and precise analysis of the impactWork closely with other Data Scientists across the business to leverage insights from one game across multiple gamesCarefully check, debug, and problem solve issues to ensure you deliver accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools, even when confronted by subtle data complications. 
Skills to create thrills

There is plenty of scope at King for you to learn from your colleagues in the areas where you have less experience, and to share your own skills where you are stronger.

Specific factors that are helpful to excel in this role include:
Business Insight: The ability to understand the problems and issues our games and business wants to solve, and then defining the right data, analysis or interpretation to lead to the right recommendations and decisionsCommunication: Designing good ways of communicating, visualising or reporting your results/analysis so they are clear and unambiguousSQL: The ability to write complex SQL queries to analyse our databases with 300+ million players and work with relational database systems.Analytical coding: Using tools such as R, Python or Excel for analytical purposesStats: Understanding the basics of appropriate statistical or machine learning techniques.
Other experience that might be helpful, but is not required, includes:
 Work in the games industry or similarly customer- facing digital businesses Familiarity with massive data sets and tools to deal with them (BigQuery/AWS/Hadoop etc) Experience in behavioural psychology/economics and experimental design Experience in predictive analytics, segmentation, and related areas Software engineering skills in Java and other languages (beyond R and Python which we use most frequently) Skills with standard reporting tools such as Looker/QlikView/Tableau/etc.
About King

King is the game developer behind the world- famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top- grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King’s games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta.

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.

Making the World Playful

Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players - and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!

Applications needs to be in English.

Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Data Analyst
description:
OnFrontiers is tackling a problem shared by every institution, company, and team: knowledge is trapped; organizations can’t unlock it fast enough or capture and learn from it to improve over time. As a consequence, their growth and impact fall far short of potential. OnFrontiers exists to solve that problem. We make organizations smarter, on-demand.
We believe tomorrow’s most innovative organizations won't be composed of static org charts with rigid boundaries; they will be more amorphous, supported by a cloud of at-the-ready specialists, on-demand advisors, and a proprietary stable of experts. These organizations will use OnFrontiers tools and the power of networks to access, harness, and distribute expertise within and outside their organization. We’re building an entirely new technology category - a platform and set of applications that fundamentally change how organizations tap into their most valuable resource: knowledge.
Our team is motivated by the drive to fundamentally rethink how organizations operate. This isn’t an academic exercise - we convert our concepts into user-friendly, enterprise-grade tools, and ship those tools to market as quickly as possible. On the back of strong growth in 2020, and with COVID-19 significantly accelerating our trajectory, OnFrontiers is hiring across every function. In the coming months, we’ll be making significant enhancements and major expansions in functionality to our flagship product, and build an entirely new product suite, while dramatically expanding our customer base and expert community.
Now a growth stage start-up, we are looking for a contract Data Analyst, Marketplace who has significant experience in building multi-sided marketplaces to join our team. This is a role for someone who has a passion for marketplace platforms and mission-driven startups. Our Data Analyst, Marketplace will collaborate with our engineering team and product manager to support liquidity in our provider marketplace. This will include developing and executing strategies on data acquisition, supporting normalization and merchandising of development data, and providing analysis on a myriad of problems across the supply and demand sides of our marketplace. The ideal candidate will be self directed yet able to work in teams, have strong scripting skills, and an ability to design and implement holistic data science strategies that serve multiple stakeholders.
What you'll do:Lead hands on, detailed data research, analysis and acquisition (through scripting) of targeted data sets that support liquidity on the marketplace.Work with the Product Manager(s) to develop and document organizational data assets and definitions.Work with business stakeholders to identify improvements in efficiency and usage of their current data processes.Work on a globally distributed data team across timezones to make a large impact on OnFrontiers strategy.Be a lead liaison between the engineering team and business units to help ensure new efforts and changes think about data science impacts
Who you are:2+ years of experience in data science, at a marketplace or B2B SaaS company.Advanced analysis skills: Advanced SQL, experience with many different types of databases and pulling data from different sources.Programmatic QA and programming experience, python preferred.Strong data modeling skills.Demonstrated experience and passion for developing clear and easy to understand metrics and dashboards/visualizations for management meetings (e.g. Tableau, Power BI).Ability to explain translate business needs to technical execution and effectively communicate your analyses to groups of stakeholders.A strong communicator (both verbal and written) with great critical thinking skills, and attention to detail.Creative, positive, and helpful attitude; a team oriented, customer-centric working style.Adaptable and able to navigate a rapidly growing organization: not afraid to roll up your sleeves and tackle challenging problems.
Additional experience we would love: Experience architecting data warehouses or relational databasesExperience working with schema.orgGoogle Tag ManagerHigh-growth startups
BenefitsFully remote work cultureA fair and competitive salaryPaid time off
When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by OnFrontiers (“Controller”), which is located at 149 5th Ave, 9th Floor, New York, NY 10010 and can be contacted by emailing hello@onfrontiers.com. The individual responsible for data privacy at OnFrontiers is the Company’s legal counsel, Camille Linson, who can be contacted at clinson@onfrontiers.com. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Controller’s recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation) as necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the Controller, which are the solicitation, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment.
Your personal data will be shared with Greenhouse Software, Inc., a cloud services provider located in the United States of America and engaged by Controller to help manage its recruitment and hiring process on Controller’s behalf. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States, your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it through this site. Because the European Union Commission has determined that United States data privacy laws do not ensure an adequate level of protection for personal data collected from EU data subjects, the transfer will be subject to appropriate additional safeguards under the standard contractual clauses. You can obtain a copy of the standard contractual clauses by contacting us at clinson@onfrontiers.com
Your personal data will be retained by Controller as long as Controller determines it is necessary to evaluate your application for employment. Under the GDPR, you have the right to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified or erased, and to request that processing of your personal data be restricted. You also have to right to data portability. In addition, you may lodge a complaint with an EU supervisory authority.
There is more to working at OnFrontiers than your day-to-day responsibilities.Our culture is inquisitive. We’re open-minded, listen to one another, outside experts and real-world customer feedback to further our mission.We are a remote company. We trust our team members to define and tackle their chosen tasks and expect them to openly communicate the challenges they’re facing.We invest in our team by offering competitive base salaries and equity, medical, dental and vision benefits, and generous time off for eligible employees.We’re committed to your personal development. We fund mentorship from experts on the OnFrontiers platform and reimburse other job-related training expenses.We’re a team and if you’re hired, we have your back! We pride ourselves in doing our jobs well, caring about one another, caring about our customers and experts, and acting with integrity.
Do you believe organizations need to get smarter, faster?Are you excited by the challenge of making OnFrontiers the global standard for enterprise knowledge?Are you looking for a company where you will be challenged, respected, and valued?
If so, apply now to join our growing team!

title: DATA ANALYST
description:
Reportando al Country Manager analizarás la información comercial y te asegurarás de que todo funcione correctamente. Deberás garantizar que los proyectos sigan el rumbo optimo dentro del presupuesto asignado, y que el personal trabaje de manera eficiente y eficaz. Elaborarás la estructura y los contenidos de formación adaptados al objetivo establecido.
Funciones Principales:- Implementar y supervisar la aplicación de los procedimientos internos por los que se rige el departamento comercial y que reflejan la estrategia comercial:o Analizar el rendimiento comercial performances comercialeso Preparar los planes de accióno Hacer el seguimiento de los KPIo Medir la eficacia de los planes de acción- Facilitar la recogida y la difusión de información hacia otros departamentos del Grupo.- Comprobar y/o implementar procedimientos que permitan garantizar la exactitud de los análisis comerciales solicitados.- Sugerir mejoras para realizar análisis adicionales que puedan resultar útiles.- Participar en las previsiones de ventas, asegurarse de que las previsiones sean coherentes con el desempeño de los ejercicios anteriores y con los objetivos comerciales.- Elaborar los informes para la Dirección Comercial.- Apoyar a la Dirección Comercial en el diseño, la preparación y la implantación de los proyectos.- Llevar a cabo la vigilancia del mercado y de la competencia.- Realizar, comprobar y difundir de forma adecuada los documentos y presentaciones internos del departamento.- Preparar los soportes de formación. - Establecer la metodología de evaluación. 


¿QUÉ OFRECEMOS?
- La oportunidad de formar parte de una empresa líder en su sector en plena expansión, dinámica y con sólidos valores.- Contrato indefinido- Salario + Incentivos + Beneficios sociales (seguro médico, seguro de vida y ticket restaurant)- Excelente ambiente de trabajo con increíbles vistas 360º a la ciudad de Barcelona.- Amplias posibilidades de desarrollo profesional.

title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
description:
Job description:

We are looking for a new colleague in the Global Commercial Excellence department of ZF Aftermarket at our location in Barcelona.


Your tasks as Data Scientist (m/f/d):

 Prototyping of advanced analytics data products (models for business recommendations, segmentations, optimizations & statistical forecasts) across marketing, sales, pricing & logistics, and creation of relevant algorithms which can improve how the business operates  Business Understanding: acquire understanding of the business problem with the help of business analyst Data Understanding: lead the exploration of the data Modelling: create hypothesis of which models could fit the data, test the different hypothesis, find optimal parameters Results: share the prototype results and get feedback to have its model improved  

Your profile as Data Scientist (m/f/d):

 Strong Background in both Computing and Statistics (academical and/or by experience) Unsupervised and Supervised models including tree-based models and linear models in Python, R & Pyspark. Experience with (Deep) Neural Networks and Bayesian modelling is desirable. Databases (ex. Oracle, AWS S3). Big Data platforms (ex. Databricks, GCP, Cloudera) Knowledge of Visualization tools is highly desirable (ex. such as Tableau, PowerBi, Qlikview). Team player, ability to deal with uncertainty and ambiguity, business acumen, communication skills (mostly data storytelling)

title: Data Analyst (Online Marketing)
description:
Data Analyst (Online Marketing) 

eDreams ODIGEO is one of the world’s largest online travel companies and one of the largest European e-commerce businesses. Under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo – it offers the best deals in regular flights, low-cost airlines, hotels, cruises, car rental, dynamic packages, holiday packages and travel insurance to make travel easier, more accessible, and better value for the more than 18 million customers it serves across 44 markets. eDreams ODIGEO is listed in the Spanish Stock Market.

We are now looking for an Data Analyst to join our Marketing department in the SEO, Social and Content Marketing team in Barcelona, Spain. You’ll be expected to be fairly autonomous, working in a team that helps drive SEO growth, being committed to enabling the department to execute scalable and sophisticated approaches to online marketing, by leveraging data at scale.

Key Responsibilities:
 Translate complex datasets into clear insights and actionable propositions, presenting them in useful business formats;  Performing granular traffic and funnel behaviour analyses across multiple global markets to gain insight into keyword and landing page performance at scale;  Assist colleagues in gaining access to the right data and obtaining the right insights from it;  Develop tools and produce automatic dashboards / reporting solutions for the SEO team;  Monitor and analyze the evolution of KPIs, providing insights and recommendations;  Work on automation initiatives such as API scripting;  Identify and analyze competitor techniques, as well as benchmarking eDreams; ODIGEO’s websites portfolio performance against competitors through data. 

Experience, Skills & Qualifications:
 Degree in a quantitative discipline (Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, etc.);  2+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, preferably in digital marketing;  Advanced knowledge using SQL or other database languages;  Knowledge of R/Python programming languages;  Knowledge of data visualization tools and libraries (i.e. DataStudio, Shiny, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.);  A solid understanding of statistical techniques;  Strong analytical skills, fluency in data analysis and data storytelling;  Knowledge of API connections development, scription knowledge.  Knowledge of SEO tools or Digital Marketing tools is a nice to have.  Excellent organizational skills and problem solving capabilities with keen attention to details;  Excellent communication & collaboration skills, giving and receiving feedback;  Think creatively about approaching analytical questions;  Fluent in English. 

What do we offer?
 Safe environment during COVID times: Onboarding and daily work can be done 100% remote.  A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.  Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.  Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills training, language lessons, external events and industry conferences.  Free subscription to O'Reilly Online Learning.  Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.  We also have for you a Ticket Restaurant benefit & unlimited beverages and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) because we like our eDOers happy and healthy!  A phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance.  New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.  Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements.  Fun at work: at eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand! 

… And the opportunity to work in a dynamic, dedicated, fun and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!

Come fly with us and join us now.

eDreams ODIGEO under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo –is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

title: Game Data Scientist/Analyst - Barcelona Gaming Giant
description:
Game Data Scientist/Analyst (Barcelona):
Have you been looking for an exciting life-changing opportunity that is too good to miss? Are you keen to reap the rewards of your efforts with huge progression possibilities? If so, then please read on!
Our client is a worldwide mobile games leader that are in the top rankings of both iOS & Android, with games that are played by over 50 million fans all over the world. Their team of over 300 is full of keen gamers with a passion in this field. 
They are looking for creative and innovative Games Data Scientist/Analysts to join their vibrant Analytics team in Barcelona. You will work to understand their games behaviour and work with teams to continuously improve the product, drive retention and user conversion
This role offers the following benefits:
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you’re not already here). No sponsorship can be offered so you must have the right to work in the EU.Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).Spotify Premium for the first 6 months of your employment with us. Social events & parties to let off some steam. 
Required Experience:
Master’s degree in quantitative field3+ years’ experience applying analytics to answer business questions Strong exposure to A/B testing or A/B testing techniques Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python or R for data exploratory analysis Confidence in liaising with teams across the boards from pitching to stakeholders through to collaborating with the technical team
This truly is a unique, life-changing opportunity so if this sounds of interest and you are open to talking through more information, then please apply and if suitable, we will get back to you as soon as possible.

title: Data scientist
description:
Softonic publishes Softonic.com, the leading global software and app discovery destination, offering the most complete selection of software and apps across hundreds of categories. The European company with one of the largest online audiences, and currently holds 40th position worldwide with more than 100 million unique monthly users who generate more than 4 million daily downloads on Softonic.com.
About the positionSoftonic is looking for a Data Scientist to join our talented team in Barcelona. In this role you will have the opportunity to work on our state of the art data platform (implemented in GCP) and help us to contribute to keep improving our product.
REQUIREMENTSKey responsibilities
Develop, prototype and test machine learning algorithms that serve all Business Units in the company;Define metrics, data and the testing platform for the evaluation of the algorithms performanceHelp in the definition of new systems, KPIs and required infrastructure for delivering data products within the companyExtract and combine data from different sources: Databases, APIs, Files, … to be autonomous preparing datasets required for the modeling.Translate to “business friendly” language the insights generated from the analysis & models, and present them to all the levels of the organization
Minimum experience and qualifications
Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or Engineering.4+ Years of related experience as a Data Scientist or ML Engineer.A solid understanding of the appropriate statistical and machine learning methods to apply to each type of analysis.Advanced knowledge on SQL Language.Experience on Python.Strong analytical skills.Team playerExcellent written and verbal communication skillsWillingness to learn, experiment and to work autonomouslyNice to haveExperience using Google Cloud Platform;Knowledge of some of the important ML Libraries (TensorFlow, SciKit-Learn, Keras,Previous Experience on an Internet Company.
Why Softonic?Workplace & benefits:Dining RoomGaming room& TerracesBike & Car ParkingFresh Fruits, Coffee, Snacks & DrinksPizza & Beers Every ThursdayPrivate Health CareLanguage Classes (English & Spanish)Internal Training ProgramDiscounts At Gyms & RestaurantsFlexible Work Schedule ( home office and 2 days/week in the office)Day off at your birthday & other´s evenings offDiscover more....https://hello.softonic.com/why...

title: Reporting Data Analyst/Developer
description:
As Reporting data analyst/developer you will develop, tune, and support our computer health dashboards and related reports. Our dashboard system contains detailed data on computers, printers, network equipment, and other hardware. It is globally visible and is utilized by IT including the VP of IT and the Directors. The current system utilizes SQL, SSRS, SSIS, VB Script, PowerShell, and on prem SharePoint. You will be supporting the transition of this system to Power BI and will continue to use additional technologies including PowerShell, Rest API, and SQL.

Key Responsibilities
Collect and report data of PPG HW infrastructure and consult resultUse various system support tools and performance and monitoring toolsWork effectively with cross-function teams of IT professionals to help develop, implement, and troubleshoot systemsWork with minimal guidance and direction from project leaders to ensure the availability of critical systemsLead small to medium projects, plan, estimate, and monitor project timelineAssist in testing and implementing system software, prepare documentation
Qualifications
A degree in a computer-related field or equivalent experienceMin 3 years experience in systems software implementation and supportFluent in English both written and verballyWorking knowledge of SQL, PowerShell, PowerBI, SQL Server, SSIS, SSRSEffective project management and troubleshooting skillsCommunicative, flexible and adaptableKnowledge in the following technologies is considered a plus but not required: O365 reporting, SharePoint, VB.Net, Visual Studio and Azure DevOps
About Us

Here at PPG we make it happen, and we seek candidates of the highest integrity and professionalism who share our values, with the commitment and drive to strive today to do better than yesterday – everyday.

PPG: WE PROTECT AND BEAUTIFY THE WORLD™ 

Through leadership in innovation, sustainability and color, PPG helps customers in industrial, transportation, consumer products, and construction markets and aftermarkets to enhance more surfaces in more ways than does any other company. To learn more, visit www.ppg.com and follow @ PPG on Twitter.

The PPG Way

Every Single Day At PPG

We partner with customers to create mutual value. 

We are insightful, dedicated and proactive. We have intimate knowledge of the market and our customers. We focus on practical solutions that make a difference.

We are “One PPG” to the world. 

We are better and stronger together. We leverage our scale to reach new markets and introduce innovative technologies as we differentiate and disrupt our markets.

We trust our people every day, in every way. 

We enable and empower our people to make the right decisions. We are inclusive, transparent and respectful. Our feedback is clear and actionable.

We make it happen. 

We have a passion for winning. We achieve. We deliver with discipline and integrity. We bring our best energy to our work. We decide and act intelligently and quickly.

We run it like we own it. 

We respect one another by being responsible and accountable. We always act in the best interest of our company, customers, shareholders and our communities.

We do better today than yesterday – everyday. 

We continuously learn. We develop our people to grow our businesses.

PPG Way: (Click here to learn more about the PPG Way)

PPG vision: http://corporate.ppg.com/Our-Company/PPG-Vision.aspx

We are One PPG: http://one.ppg.com/

PPG provides equal opportunity to all candidates and employees. We offer an opportunity to grow and develop your career in an environment that provides a fulfilling workplace for employees, creates an environment for continuous learning, and embraces the ideas and diversity of others. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, pregnancy, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression. If you need assistance to complete your application due to a disability, please email recruiting@ppg.com.

PPG values your feedback on our recruiting process. We encourage you to visit Glassdoor.com and provide feedback on the process, so that we can do better today than yesterday.

Benefits will be discussed with you by your recruiter during the hiring process.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
En Cofidis queremos incorporar en nuestro equipo de fraude un Data Analyst. Si quieres unirte con nosotros y crecer juntos, ¡te estamos esperando!
Misión y responsabilidadesAnálisis de datos e interpretación y visualización de los mismos.Detección de patrones de comportamiento sospechosos/fraudulentos a través del análisis de datos.Proponer soluciones/medidas/KPIs para la detección temprana del fraude a partir de los análisis realizados, teniendo siempre en cuenta la actividad y la experiencia cliente.Monitoring de la actividad de fraude a través de los datos.Participar en proyectos de puesta en marcha de nuevas reglas, de nuevas herramientas de prevención del fraude o de nuevos productos/procesos.Interlocución con otras áreas y con el Grupo.
RequisitosLicenciatura/Grado en Economía, Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería o similares.Idiomas: Inglés o francés.Experiencia: Mínimo 3 años de experiencia en análisis estadístico de datos. Procedente de sector financiero o gran consumo.Valorable experiencia en departamentos de Fraude.
¿Qué te ofrecemos?Incorporarte a una multinacional del sector financiero en pleno proceso de Transformación.Formar parte de un equipo dinámico formando parte de proyectos transversales.Contrato indefinido.Un completo paquete de compensación que incluye: salario fijo, tickets restaurant y un paquete de beneficios sociales atractivo.

title: Data Analyst
description:
This position has responsibility for creating, maintaining, and issuing reports and analytics to measure and support business performance in key areas and agreed service levels.The ideal candidate will be required to develop analytical reports using tools such as MS power BI and Cornerstone On Demand.
This position requires: Very high level of accuracy, attention to detail, responsibility and reliability. A natural affinity to numbers and calculations would also be necessary.

What you will be doing:Design, develop and enhance reports & dashboards as required by the customer in Power BI with the use of DAXDevelop leading visualization solutions for our customersProvide good DAX, data modelling and basic Power Query Editor capabilityDeliver required project inputs according to time, quality and budget requirementsEnsure progress is accurately communicated and expectations of various stakeholders are managed effectively.Support business development activity by maintaining and developing demo sites for new customersEfficiently handle large sets of data and be able to confidently process them into required formatsActively participate in continuous development and innovation by contributing ideas for new feature and functionalitySupport definition of performance indicators and measures in accordance with customer Learning Systems.Support quality improvement initiatives as defined, measure performance against quality metrics and correlate training data with business performance.Support creation and data gathering for Governance presentations.Support with the creation of performance metrics reporting for programs and projects in term of:Accuracy and data integrityQuality, Correctness, Description and documentationData Analysis, Deduction and initiation of corrective actions from a performance perspective
What we are looking for:University level education or equivalent4 years of experience as Data analysisKnowledge in interaction management, process management, project management and rhetorical and presentation skillsExtensive knowledge and experience with reporting, statistical models and Data AnalyticsExtensive knowledge and experience with MS Office applications (esp. excellent MS-Excel skills)Advanced level of English languagePreferably advanced knowledge and experience with MS Excel Macros and VBA (Visual Basic for Applications)

About us: https://vtxco.com/vps/

title: Data Analyst - Product
description:
At FREE NOW we are at the most exciting point in our history - building a world-class product used daily by more than a million people. We are a part of one of the most dynamic spaces for innovation in the world today: shaping mobility. Our daily business is solving large-scale, highly complex problems – and we love it. As a new "family member" you will stretch, learn, grow, and have fun doing it in a creative, diverse and collaborative environment. Don’t join FREE NOW because of our perks or great office locations, join us if you can’t wait to disrupt the mobility industry with us!

Being a part of our growing Analytics team at FREE NOW you will work closely with our Product teams and be the data subject matter expert for your focus area. Your goal will be to enable and drive data first product decisions.

Location: You can join us either in one of our offices in Hamburg, Berlin or Barcelona or 100% remotely in one of the 11 countries where we have a legal entity**

Your role:
 Model and evaluate user behaviour in order to identify potential value of planned projects  Develop and evaluate A/B test experiments or other analyses to measure and report the performance of released features  Support of our data driven product development through analysis of transactional, in-app, and external data  Engage with internal stakeholders to gain an understanding of the problems that need to be solved and gather requirements for analysis tasks  Communicate results and recommendations to all levels of the company including senior management and prioritisation committees  Work closely with our software programmers and data engineers to create and capture data that is aligned with the business logic and allows modelling and analysis  Provide expertise and support stakeholders in generating new product feature ideas  Develop data tracking and collection concepts in order to ensure a high-quality analysis and evaluation  Build post-measure dashboards that will serve as a feature monitoring tool for diverse stakeholders  Be involved throughout the complete product lifecycle in order to guarantee a data-driven process 
Your profile:

You are a problem solver, detail-oriented and self-motivated who thrives in a fast-paced, highly dynamic environment, combining technical, product, business and leadership perspectives. Further key aspects of your profile are:
 Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering or other fields with a strong mathematical-statistical background  Very good knowledge of SQL and databases, experience in working with predictive models and strong knowledge of statistical programming tools (e.g. R, python)  Experiences in working with Data Visualisation tools (e.g.Tableau, Qlikview) and  Experience in working in a data driven analytics environment including an understanding of how to engage and influence decision makers  Exceptional analytical skills, lateral thinking and experience in solving highly challenging problems  Fluent in business English  legal entities: France, Spain, Germany, Austria, Portugal, Italy, England, Ireland, Poland, Romania & Greece
Diversity and inclusion:

At FREE NOW, we commit to being an equal opportunity employer. We consider qualified applicants regardless of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability or age. We celebrate diversity and have a clear vision: to be the place where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay and do their best work. Together with passionate, creative and collaborative colleagues, we are following our purpose of making mobility available for everyone.

Move like you

At FREE NOW we have colleagues from over 70 nations! We value open communication and welcome everyone as they are. We are all one team and follow the same goals – that’s why we share our insights and results to get on track together every month.

Your wellness and work-life balance matters to us. We offer trust-based and flexible working hours as well as the option to work from home. In the office, you can enjoy our free drinks and daily fresh fruit. Do you like to be active? Take part in our subsidised gym membership. Bigger plans? Take a sabbatical leave and get out there!

Let’s grow together! We believe in a transparent career growth  plan, quarterly development sessions with your team lead as well as regular 1:1s to help you thrive! For your own ideas, you’re welcome to set up initiatives and projects.

Need a lift?  We offer Udemy e-learning platform, subsidised language classes, internal peer-to-peer trainings and more to support your learning & development opportunities.

More Benefits? 👏 Monthly mobility budget for FREE NOW rides, quarterly team events, company-wide onboarding days at our HQ in Hamburg, relocation assistance for internationals, birthday-off, kudos and many more!

About FREE NOW:

FREE NOW is the Mobility Super App with the largest vehicle choice for consumers across Europe. More than 54 million users in 16 markets and in over 170 cities today are already moving freely from A to B by accessing the largest selection of mobility options available in one app. Through the unique integration of mobility brands and payment services, they can book their nearest taxi, private hire vehicle, car sharing or micro-mobility option such as eScooters, eMopeds, and eBikes within the app. FREE NOW aggregates numerous mobility brands with the ambition to make urban mobility more efficient and sustainable without adding new vehicles on the street. The German based company is backed by the BMW Group and Mercedes-Benz Mobility. In total, around 1,850 employees in more than 27 offices work for the services of FREE NOW, which is led by CEO Marc Berg.

title: Business Data Analyst (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you’ll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives… all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

We are looking for a passionate, hands-on and quick learner professional to join our Global Finance team at our Headquarters in Barcelona.

As a Business Data Analyst, you will work with result-driven and fast-paced teams, providing both business thinking and analytical skills.

This team is mainly focused on supporting and managing different stakeholders all over the world, to provide them required billing information on a daily basis.

If you are a passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on bird, jump on this train!

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Create and monitor the billing pipelines of all the Glovo countries Provide invoicing and billing insights to accounting and operations teams Be involved in Glovo launching phases, by creating new automated billing pipelines Build robust relationships with key business stakeholders Assist colleagues in gaining access to the right data Act as an internal consultant to translate business questions into insights Understand business needs and produce insightful analyses for internal teams to make the right decisions Mentor junior colleagues 
You Have
At least 2 years of work experience providing internal teams with the necessary data to make the right decisions Proficient with SQL Basic experience in Python Knowledge of visualisation tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview Proficiency in English is a must 
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!

Nice-to-haves
Working experience with Amazon Redshift Working experience with Git Working experience with Luigi Working experience with Jenkins 
Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing equity plan (if applicable) Top-notch private health insurance Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders! Discounted gym memberships Flexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time) Enhanced parental leave including nursery support! Online therapy and wellbeing benefit External learning budget 
What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learningCare: Uplift people and the planetGlownership: Act as proud ownersHigh Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

title: Data Analyst
description:
Desde SETESCA estamos buscando a un DATA ANALYST SR para incorporarse a una empresa multinacional del sector gran consumo, ubicada en l'Hospitalet de Llobregat.
Funciones:Comprender las necesidades y los objetivos de la empresa.Participar en el mantenimiento y el desarrollo de la Infraestructura.Construir sistemas para transformar los datos sin procesar en ideas de negocio procesables.Ayudar a mejorar los procesos de datos estables / línea de producción dentro de nuestro ETL.Dirigir y diseñar informes analíticos, cuadros de mando y visualización para su uso en toda la empresa.Manejar grandes solicitudes de datos y utilizar eficientemente los recursos de la nube para de datos.Procesar y analizar grandes conjuntos de datos para evaluarlos a diferentes niveles.Supervisar los análisis para detectar patrones inesperados y posibles comportamientos erróneos.Interactuar con colaboradores de diferentes departamentos de la organización.
Requisitos Minimos:Alto nivel de inglésLicenciatura en Empresariales, Ingeniería, Estadística, Informática, Matemáticas Informática, Matemáticas, Física o un campo relacionado.Experiencia en sistemas de datos, análisis de datos, herramientas y procesos.Experto en minería de datos, almacenamiento, procesamiento y elaboración de informes.Experiencia con una o más herramientas importantes de visualización de datos (PowerBI, Qlik)Experto en la construcción de ETLs/ pipelines de datos complejos (SQL)Experiencia con servicios en la nube en Azure, Google o AWSConocimientos de R, Python.Extraer informes de múltiples fuentes (por ejemplo, operaciones, TI, comentarios de los clientes) Experiencia en la industria es un plusAuto-impulsado para lograr resultados - tomando el liderazgo en las iniciativas con una actitud de poder hacerCapacidad excepcional para utilizar los datos y la información para "contar historias" de manera convincente de manera convincente para impulsar la estrategiaExcelente comunicación (verbal y escrita) y habilidades interpersonalesExperiencia en trabajar en un equipo ágilAtención al detallePensamiento crítico y analítico y resolución de problemas

title: Data Scientist
description:
Our opportunity 

At Zurich, one of our key areas of focus is preparing for the Future of Work. Changes in customer behaviours and needs, as well as the integration of new technologies are changing the workforce of the future. In order to be ready for the future of work we are proactively driving key transformation programs across the business.

Join us on our global Future of Work journey, working in a forward-thinking organizational design and analytics team, bringing data science and digitalization to life. Be part of shaping the organization of the future leveraging data to inform better decision making about people and teams. Act as a thought leader and partner to drive better decisions based on data.

 Your role 

 As an organizational data scientist your main responsibilities will involve: 

 Be the thought leader in the team when it comes to data science  Aggregation of large amounts of data, building statistical models and performing statistical analysis (e.g., segmentation, correlation, multiple regression, trend analysis, behavioral analysis, predictive modeling, etc.)  Perform organizational network analysis to support Org. Design initiatives  Analysis of all text data (survey comments, system data): cluster analysis, sentiment analysis, etc.  Presenting, explaining and discussing results of analysis and trends concisely and effectively  Supporting high-priority projects for executives and/or the leadership team  Providing thought leadership and capability building to the global HR community  Combining data science with technology to provide tailored insights at scale  Leading workforce planning and informing organizational effectiveness initiatives 

Your Skills And Experience

 As a organizational data scientist your skills and qualifications will ideally include: 

 General skills: 

 Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in Mathematics / Statistics, preferably with HR background  Knowledge of HR data and Workforce Analytics  Strong knowledge of statistical theory and calculations and analytic methods (e.g., correlation, multiple regression, moderator analysis, etc.)  Preferred skills: R, Python, Microsoft PowerBI, SQL (optional)  Good command of English (C1) 

 Data Modelling and Machine Learning: 

 Linear Modelling: Regression and Classification, Linear Mixed Models, Survival Analysis  Natural Language Processing: Text Classification, Cluster Analysis, Unsupervised/Supervised Topic Modelling, NER, Semantic Similarity Modelling  Recommendation Modelling: Collaborative / Content / Deep Learning Based Recommendations 

 Social Network Analysis: 

 Analysis of basic properties of a network (Density, Node centrality, Component analysis and etc.)  Node similarity, node classification, cluster / community analysis 

Additional Information

 As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes: 

 Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 100% - you choose  Flexible working hours  Wide range of internal and external trainings  Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on the needs  Ticket restaurant  Life Insurance  Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company  Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you  Special banking and insurance conditions  Exclusive Employees discounts 

Primary work location is Barcelona, Spain. Option to telework from any location within Spain territory is also feasible.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

 So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

 At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

title: Big Data Analyst
description:
Esta es tu oportunidad para unirte a un equipo diverso de personas apasionadas por el Big Data.

En buenas manos ¡las tuyas! las enormes cantidades de información que las empresas recopilan hoy pueden convertirse en un activo muy valioso manejadas estratégicamente. Ayudamos a nuestros clientes a ser más eficientes haciendo el mejor uso posible de los datos, aprovechados por los expertos para impulsar un nuevo motor de crecimiento de servicios de información.

Si te gusta aprender y disfrutas de una gran pasión por trabajar con nuevas tecnologías además de ayudar a los clientes a administrar los datos de manera efectiva para generar conocimiento y valor, este es tu sitio. Estamos buscando desarrolladores en Accenture, el lugar perfecto para continuar construyendo tu carrera. Nuestro equipo está creciendo por lo que siempre estamos atentos a nuevo talento como el tuyo. Las oportunidades dentro de las emocionantes iniciativas en el entorno digital que llevamos a cabo con nuestros clientes son ilimitadas, por tanto no te faltarán inspiración o desafíos.

Algunas de tus responsabilidades:

 Desarrollo de software usando tecnologías Big Data

 Formar parte de equipos multidisciplinares

 Participación en proyectos para grandes clientes

¿Te unes al Big Data | Accenture Technology team? ¡Aplica online!

#BigDataNinja

Requisitos:

 Titulación técnica: Informática u otras con experiencia equivalente (Telecomunicaciones, Matemáticas, Física, otras ingenierías, etc.)

 +2 años de experiencia real en producción con tecnologías Big Data (Spark, Hive, Kafka, Flink, etc.)

 Alguna/varias bases de datos NoSQL (MongoDB, HBase, ElasticSearch, Cassandra, etc.)

 Herramientas Agile (Jira, Jenkins, Bamboo, Git, Sonar, etc.)

Valorable:

 Experiencia en AWS o Azure

 Certificaciones en AWS, Azure o Big Data (Cloudera, Databricks, MongoDB, Kafka, etc.)

 Experiencia en proyectos para grandes clientes

Accenture ofrece igualdad de oportunidades y acepta solicitudes de todos los sectores de la sociedad y no discrimina por motivos de raza, religión o creencias, origen étnico o nacional, discapacidad, edad, ciudadanía, estado civil, orientación sexual o Identidad de género, o cualquier otra base según lo protegido por la ley vigente.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Applus+ es una de las compañías líderes mundiales en ensayo, inspección y certificación, con presencia en más de 70 países en los 5 continentes y un equipo de más de 20.000 personas. Hemos experimentado un gran desarrollo durante los últimos años, gracias a nuestro equipo humano que consideramos que son pieza clave y estratégica en el desarrollo de esta compañía. ¿Te gustaría ser parte del proyecto?
Para nuestra división Laboratories seleccionamos un/a Data Analyst con experiencia gestionando proyectos de Datawarehouse/Datalake Azure y Power BI. Estamos buscando un candidato apasionado por la tecnología y los datos, con capacidad de integrase en un entorno dinámico en plena expansión. Buscamos un background tecnológico con interés por el negocio, con autonomía y orientado a la consecución de objetivos.
 Responsabilidades:Gestión de Datawarehouse/Datalake de Azure Creación y optimización de informes en Power BI en base de los modelos de datos existentesDiseño e implementación de nuevos modelos de análisisParticipación en proyectos de digitalización de la división
Requisitos:Experiencia mínima de 2 años en proyectos de Datawarehouse y BI en funciones similaresExperiencia en bases de datos relacionales y lenguajes de consulta (SQL Server/ SQL)Dominio de Power BI, SQL, DAX, Power AutomateNivel de inglés: B2Persona proactiva, analítica y con buena capacidad de comunicaciónAutonomía

title: People Data Analyst
description:
eDreams ODIGEO is one of the world's largest online travel companies and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. Under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo – it serves more than 18 million customers per year across 46 markets. Listed on the Spanish Stock Market, eDreams ODIGEO works with over 665 airlines and has partnerships with 130. The brand offers the best deals in regular flights, low-cost airlines, hotels, cruises, car rental, dynamic packages, holiday packages and travel insurance to make travel easier, more accessible, and better value for consumers across the globe.

We are now looking for a People Data Analyst to join our Human Resources team based in Barcelona, Spain.
