The main responsibilities will be:
 Be a key player in defining and implementing our people analytics approach for the future, understand the key questions we should be asking ourselves and how to use data to answer these questions. Embed in the team over time key analytical skills.  Advocate for a data-driven approach, building processes to ensure data quality excellence and ability to advise on internal mobility decisions.  Assess company’s People information needs and plan for changes in HR systems or tools to meet these needs  Own the budget and reforecast process for the HR department  Create data models, and provide reports and analysis in consultation with internal clients to support the function through key HR processes such as budget planning, annual performance and compensation reviews, bonus payout process, recruitment.  Ensure timely and accurate reporting and analysis on People and compensation KPI’s, such as Headcount reporting and planning, attrition and turnover trend, employees demographics, personnel cost.  Perform specific analyses and data management around internal measurements and metrics to support monitoring specific HR programs and projects  Design and implement related compensation & benefits programs and policies including internal equity initiatives, gender pay gap calculations, and salary bands  Keep on top of external compensation benchmarks in Spain and other locations in line with our location strategy and growth  Work with several stakeholders within the People Function to ensure that all systems meet compensation needs and are updated according to compensation changes, in order to ensure compensation data and reports are up to date.  Support eDO in designing, developing and implementing ad hoc queries and reports, according to specific business needs  Support Chief People Officer in the preparation of documentation material for the Company’s Board of Directors 

Required skills and experience:
 2-4 years of experience as Compensation, HR, Finance data Analyst in a Multinational Company  Knowledge of budget process and HR controlling  A good eye for numbers and strong attention to detail  Advanced knowledge of MS Office, specifically of Excel and Powerpoint  Understanding of the main compensation processes and tools  Proven ability to be analytical and handle data effectively  Ability to juggle multiple tasks while still delivering high-quality results  Ability to function as an effective and respected partner to internal clients  Good communication skills, especially with internal clients and key vendors  Strong organisational and project administration skills  Drive to build a people analytics function and share your passion for analytics with the team  Knowledge of Cornerstone HR system is a plus  Strong English knowledge 

What do we offer?
 Safe environment during COVID times: Onboarding and daily work can be done 100% remote.  A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.  Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.  Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills trainings, language lessons, external events and industry conferences.  Free subscription to O'Reilly Online Learning.  Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.  We also have for you a Ticket Restaurant benefit & unlimited beverages and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) because we like our eDOers happy and healthy!  A phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance.  New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.  Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements. … And the opportunity to work in a dynamic, dedicated, fun and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!

title: Data Analyst, Marketplace
description:
OnFrontiers is tackling a problem shared by every institution, company, and team: knowledge is trapped; organizations can't unlock it fast enough or capture and learn from it to improve over time. As a consequence, their growth and impact fall far short of potential. OnFrontiers exists to solve that problem. We make organizations smarter, on-demand.

We believe tomorrow's most innovative organizations won't be composed of static org charts with rigid boundaries; they will be more amorphous, supported by a cloud of at-the-ready specialists, on-demand advisors, and a proprietary stable of experts. These organizations will use OnFrontiers tools and the power of networks to access, harness, and distribute expertise within and outside their organization. We're building an entirely new technology category - a platform and set of applications that fundamentally change how organizations tap into their most valuable resource: knowledge.

Our team is motivated by the drive to fundamentally rethink how organizations operate. This isn't an academic exercise - we convert our concepts into user-friendly, enterprise-grade tools, and ship those tools to market as quickly as possible. On the back of strong growth in 2020, and with COVID-19 significantly accelerating our trajectory, OnFrontiers is hiring across every function. In the coming months, we'll be making significant enhancements and major expansions in functionality to our flagship product, and build an entirely new product suite, while dramatically expanding our customer base and expert community.

Now a growth stage start-up, we are looking for a contract Data Analyst, Marketplace who has significant experience in building multi-sided marketplaces to join our team. This is a role for someone who has a passion for marketplace platforms and mission-driven startups. Our Data Analyst, Marketplace will collaborate with our engineering team and product manager to support liquidity in our provider marketplace. This will include developing and executing strategies on data acquisition, supporting normalization and merchandising of development data, and providing analysis on a myriad of problems across the supply and demand sides of our marketplace. The ideal candidate will be self directed yet able to work in teams, have strong scripting skills, and an ability to design and implement holistic data science strategies that serve multiple stakeholders.

What you'll do:
Lead hands on, detailed data research, analysis and acquisition (through scripting) of targeted data sets that support liquidity on the marketplace.Work with the Product Manager(s) to develop and document organizational data assets and definitions.Work with business stakeholders to identify improvements in efficiency and usage of their current data processes.Work on a globally distributed data team across timezones to make a large impact on OnFrontiers strategy.Be a lead liaison between the engineering team and business units to help ensure new efforts and changes think about data science impacts

Who you are:
2+ years of experience in data science, at a marketplace or B2B SaaS company.Advanced analysis skills: Advanced SQL, experience with many different types of databases and pulling data from different sources.Programmatic QA and programming experience, python preferred.Strong data modeling skills.Demonstrated experience and passion for developing clear and easy to understand metrics and dashboards/visualizations for management meetings (e.g. Tableau, Power BI).Ability to explain translate business needs to technical execution and effectively communicate your analyses to groups of stakeholders.A strong communicator (both verbal and written) with great critical thinking skills, and attention to detail.Creative, positive, and helpful attitude; a team oriented, customer-centric working style.Adaptable and able to navigate a rapidly growing organization: not afraid to roll up your sleeves and tackle challenging problems.

Additional experience we would love:
Experience architecting data warehouses or relational databasesExperience working with schema.orgGoogle Tag ManagerHigh-growth startups

When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by OnFrontiers ("Controller"), which is located at 149 5th Ave, 9th Floor, New York, NY 10010 and can be contacted by emailing hello@onfrontiers.com. The individual responsible for data privacy at OnFrontiers is the Company's legal counsel, Camille Linson, who can be contacted at clinson@onfrontiers.com. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Controller's recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation) as necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the Controller, which are the solicitation, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment.

Your personal data will be shared with Greenhouse Software, Inc., a cloud services provider located in the United States of America and engaged by Controller to help manage its recruitment and hiring process on Controller's behalf. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States, your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it through this site. Because the European Union Commission has determined that United States data privacy laws do not ensure an adequate level of protection for personal data collected from EU data subjects, the transfer will be subject to appropriate additional safeguards under the standard contractual clauses. You can obtain a copy of the standard contractual clauses by contacting us at clinson@onfrontiers.com

Your personal data will be retained by Controller as long as Controller determines it is necessary to evaluate your application for employment. Under the GDPR, you have the right to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified or erased, and to request that processing of your personal data be restricted. You also have to right to data portability. In addition, you may lodge a complaint with an EU supervisory authority.

There is more to working at OnFrontiers than your day-to-day responsibilities. 
Our culture is inquisitive. We're open-minded, listen to one another, outside experts and real-world customer feedback to further our mission. We are a remote company. We trust our team members to define and tackle their chosen tasks and expect them to openly communicate the challenges they're facing. We invest in our team by offering competitive base salaries and equity, medical, dental and vision benefits, and generous time off for eligible employees.We're committed to your personal development. We fund mentorship from experts on the OnFrontiers platform and reimburse other job-related training expenses. We're a team and if you're hired, we have your back! We pride ourselves in doing our jobs well, caring about one another, caring about our customers and experts, and acting with integrity. 

Do you believe organizations need to get smarter, faster?

Are you excited by the challenge of making OnFrontiers the global standard for enterprise knowledge?

Are you looking for a company where you will be challenged, respected, and valued?

If so, apply now to join our growing team!

title: Sr. Data Analyst
description:
We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our sunny Barcelona office as a Data Analyst. You will be working together with other data analysts and data scientists focused on creating a holistic understanding of user journeys, life cycle management, and user acquisition through online performance marketing and other media. As a Data Analyst, you will have a key role in defining, extracting, and actioning data from big and complex datasets. Thus, covering the full scope from data mining to reporting. In addition, you will also be responsible to evangelize the usage of data via dashboards and/or other means of visualizations to key stakeholders throughout the company.
Why this role?This role is intended to strengthen the existing growth team in Product Madness and to ensure we are using the right data for the right decisions. Your key responsibilities will be to:Work closely with other team members, data engineers, and business stakeholders to ensure the data we are consuming is clean, robust, and relevant.Work closely with other team members to ensure they have easy access to reliable and relevant data in their work optimizing channels and campaigns by delivering self-service data through dashboards.Perform on-demand quantitative analysis and reports to inform growth and/or operational strategy.Execute and evangelize actionable insights within the team to optimize growth marketing.Proactively work with our partners such as Apple, Google, Appsflyer, etc. to ensure we maintain our ability to derive insights from the data we are provided with.
To do this successfully we believe you are:Passionate about quantitative analysis and will have the ability to generate actionable business insights for the growth team, game teams, and Product Madness as a whole.Intuitive with regards to data interpretation, e.g. spotting anomalies without giving it a second thought.Having a good understanding of core statistical concepts and techniques.
Requirements2+ years work experience as a data analyst or data scientist in a similar fieldAdvanced knowledge of SQLExperience with visualization tools such as Looker/Tableau/etc.Strong in mathematics and quantitative analysis with a passion for numbers and dataFluent in English
Meriting skillsA masters degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, or a similar disciplineExperience with Python and/or RExperience with building and tweaking attribution modelsExperience with regression modeling and statistical analysisExperience with setting up and analyzing A/B-testsExperience from working with other F2P games, social casino titles, or RMG or general knowledge about the mobile games industry or similarly sophisticated customer-facing digital businesses.Interested in gaming and the mobile game industry
BenefitsAnnual Holidays:25 labor days per yearChristmas closure ( from the 24th December 2021 to the 4th of January 2022)BCN Bank HolidaysFlexible timetable:The flexibility of 1 hour at the start and end of the working dayBirthday Package:50€ Amazon voucherDay off in the month of the employee birthdayMonthly Food Allowance:40€ via Uber EatsWFH allowance:250€ (one-off)Health insurance:Up to 50€ per month maximum, expensed monthly.Gym Allowance:Up to 50€ per month maximum, expensed monthly.

title: Global Analytics, Data and Automation Scientist
description:
Alcon is the global leader in eye care, dedicated to helping people see brilliantly. With our 70-plus-year heritage, we are the largest eye care device company in the world – with complementary businesses in Surgical and Vision Care. Being a truly global company, we work in over 70 countries and serve patients in more than 140 countries. We have a long history of industry firsts, and each year we commit a substantial amount in Research and Development to meet customer needs and patient demands.

Join us now as our new Global Analytics, Data and Automation Scientist.

The main purpose of this role is to create data mining architectures/models, statistical reporting, and data analysis methodologies to identify trends in large data sets.

You will build and maintain business analytics that support the Global Commercial Excellence team in driving excellence in sales execution, marketing execution, automation, competency management, forecasting, sales re-porting and customer satisfaction in all regions across both Vision Care and Surgical franchises. Moreover, you will ensure maximum automation of data processing and reporting for all commercial activities internationally.

The Main Accountabilities Will Include
Creating and maintaining predictive models to help making decision and/or predict future trends or events.Creating and maintaining best-in-class ad-hoc reporting and analytics systems and capabilities.Creating and maintaining the databases used by the analytics.Collaborating with key stakeholders (e.g. Region Franchise leadership, Commercial Excellence, Marketing, IT and Finance) to ensure focus on the most value adding analytics to drive business growth.Driving and/ or supporting ad hoc analysis for core Commercial, Sales, Marketing and Training projects (e.g. Sales Incentive Plans, Launch Campaigns, Strategic Plan, Forecasting, etc).Supporting key processes such as incentive compensation automation, sales data loads into CRM, President’s Club reporting, etc, at least for Global Emerging markets.
To be considered in this role we are looking for an individual with:
Bachelors (Masters Preferred) in data or computer sciences, economics, or other related quantitative fieldStrong English communication capability as well as relevant local language skills to drive the team and drive change. Experience working in multiple countries with multiple languages and currencies is a plus2-3 years’ experience in building databases and SQL queries2-3 years’ experience in Python Scripting and R2 years’ experience in developing and managing analytics system (Tableau CRM - Einstein Analytics, Tableau, Spotfire, PowerBI, Qlik)1 years’ experience with data processing automation tools/ ETLs (Alteryx preferred)Strong quantitative aptitudeUnderstanding of Healthcare Market Environment is a plus
Why join Alcon?

We aspire to lead the world in innovating life-changing vision products because when people see brilliantly, they live brilliantly.

We are the world’s leading Eye Care products and Devices Company. You will join our 20,000 associates at Alcon, making a real difference to the lives of others. At Alcon, we create meaningful opportunities for associates to grow their careers. Learn more at www.alcon.com . .

title: Data Scientist
description:
eDreams ODIGEO is one of the world's largest online travel companies and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. Under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo – it serves more than 18 million customers per year across 46 markets. Listed on the Spanish Stock Market, eDreams ODIGEO works with over 665 airlines and has partnerships with 130. The brand offers the best deals in regular flights, low-cost airlines, hotels, cruises, car rental, dynamic packages, holiday packages and travel insurance to make travel easier, more accessible, and better value for consumers across the globe.

Our dynamic team of young, talented professionals from over 60 different nationalities is driven by one clear mission: making travel easier, more accessible, and create better value for our 18 million customers worldwide. Inside our Data Science team, we research and build cutting-edge solutions to be able to offer more and better combinations of tailored travel plans than any other site. We have dozens of machine learning models in production doing hundreds of thousands of predictions that optimize our processes, improve the content for our customers and help us adapt to changes in the market. The team is constantly analyzing the past to understand it, and predicting the future to guide business on making the decisions that drive the most value both for our customers and our business.

We set the path with data and intelligence. Shape with us the way people travel.

We are looking for a passionate, highly analytical Data Scientist to join our talented team in sunny and vibrant Barcelona. You will have the opportunity to either crunch massive datasets using the latest Big Data technologies or solve a quick problem with an already classic algorithm. We always promote using the best tool for each task. You will be a key player in the organization by designing and implementing advanced analytics and using machine learning to build AI-powered solutions for almost every area in the business like online fraud detection, recommendation engines, user experience personalization, optimizing the flight combinations we offer or the marketing campaigns we launch, and virtually every possible area subject to optimization in the business etc. Join us and help us reach our ambitious goal of becoming the global leader in online travel!

What you will do:
 Conduct predictive analytics to better understand how our customers interact with our products and help us anticipate their needs.  Collaborate with Product and Business teams in order to embed Machine Learning into our apps, services and products and create predictive models and generate insights from our data.  Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.  Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.  Effectively communicate results and insights with other stakeholders throughout the organization. 

About you:
 Degree in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or other quantitative fields).  2+ years of related experience as a Data Scientist, Machine Learning engineer or similar.  Previous experience in problem-solving, strong analytical and technical skills.  You have a solid understanding of appropriate statistical, data mining and machine learning methods for various analysis situations.  Strong experience coding in Python. Other programming languages like Scala, R, or Java are also valued.  Experience using frameworks like, Spark, Tensorflow and the already classic libraries like scikit-learn, pandas, etc.  Solid knowledge and use of SQL is important. Experience in Big Data technologies; such as distributed computing, NoSQL/graph databases or architectures based on kubernetes, airflow or kafka would be a plus.  You are committed to follow good practices and conventions, from code versioning to QA processes and monitorization.  Written and oral communication skills (in English). 

What do we offer?
 Safe environment during COVID times: Onboarding and daily work can be done 100% remote.  A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.  Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.  Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills training, language lessons, external events and industry conferences.  Free subscription to O'Reilly Online Learning.  Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.  We also have for you a Ticket Restaurant benefit & unlimited beverages and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) because we like our eDOers happy and healthy!  A phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance.  New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.  Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements.  Fun at work: at eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand! 

… And the opportunity to work in a dynamic, dedicated, fun and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!

Come fly with us and join us now.

eDreams ODIGEO under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo –is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

title: Product Data Analyst (f/m/d)
description:
About us:

We are Homelike, a young, dynamic and growing start-up and the largest furnished apartment platform in Europe. Homelike leverages cutting edge technology to provide a best-in-class booking experience for travelers seeking high-quality accommodation for 30 nights or more. With over 100,000+ high-quality apartments in 450+ cities, Homelike offers the largest portfolio of furnished apartments for travelers in Europe and the US.

We’ve raised over +$20M from leading VCs such as Spark Capital and Cherry Ventures. Our business has seen double digit growth in 2021 due to the increase of people looking to relocate and work remotely. We have offices in Barcelona, London, Paris and Cologne and were recently voted by Tech5 as one of the “hottest start-ups” in Germany!

As a Product Data Analyst (f/m/d) at Homelike you will be responsible for product KPIs, testing scenarios conclusions and understanding of our user journey end to end while being part of our cross functional tech & product team! Do you want to make a real impact and have an immediate effect on our business success? Then we are happy to get in touch with you!

Tasks
Support: The development of our user-facing homelike products through data analysis and drive strategy through identification of development opportunitiesMonitor: Design reports, monitor KPIs and provide executive summarize to product teams and stakeholders around our user behaviorAnalyse: Support product teams with data analysis, feature monitoring and product discovery topics around our user journeys Consult: On A/B testing strategies and drive data-related topics within the product teamCollaborate: With data engineers on data logging and infrastructure and with product owners on how to interpret results
Requirements

What you need to convince us:
You have 3+ years of work experience in a role-relevant field such as Data Analysis, Business Analysis or a related fieldYou have a bachelor’s degree in any relevant topic, preferably with a focus on numeric skillsYou are self-motivated, autonomous, enthusiastic, detail oriented, highly reliable with a high level of curiosity and initiativeYou have experience working with cross-functional teams in iterative product development cyclesYou have experience using A/B testing for product experimentationYou have experience handling large data sets and scripting with SQLYou have experience creating and maintaining dashboards with visualization software, such as Data Studio or similar toolingYou have great storytelling and communication skillsYou have excellent English communication skills
What would be a plus:
You have experience in Python and/or BigQuery and/or MongoDBYou have experience in online business, with focus on product analytics
Benefits

What you can expect from your Homelike journey:
Be Entrepreneurial: You can have a huge impact on our product and help disrupt a high growth 231bn mid-term rental market while bringing in your own ideasInternational Environment: You can expect a highly motivated, international Talent Team from 4 different offices and 30+ different nationalitiesGrowth & Responsibility: We support your personal development & reaching your career goals with various trainings and mentoring programFlexible Working: We give you the freedom to work from home as well as to have the possibility to work from one of our wonderful offices, balancing flexibility with human connectionWork from Anywhere: You are allowed to work up to 8 weeks per calendar year from anywhereCompany & Team Events: We offer a quarterly budget for regular team events and organize big company parties to have fun and catch up with your teammates outside work (COVID compliant) 30 Paid Vacation Days: You can enjoy 30 holidays each year for a great work-life-balanceSustainability Guild: We are committed to minimize the environmental impact wherever possible by raising awareness internally, exchanging and learning about sustainable practicesTech Team: We work in cross functional teams and continuously improve the team work by sharing our feedback. We own our code and make sure things are running smoothly in 2 weeks scrum cycles
Our tech stack:
BigQuery as data warehouseData Studio as data analytics toolsSalesForce as CRM toolPython as programming language for data transfer (ETL)MongoDB as product database
Sounds great? It is! So what are you waiting for?

Why are especially YOU a good fit for Homelike?

We are no fans of long cover letters, so please send us your answer to this question, your CV as well as your possible starting date & your salary expectations

title: DATA SCIENTIST
description:
Desde CaixaBank Tech nos encontramos en búsqueda un perfil Data Scientist para el área de ADVANCED ANALYTICS. 
¿Qué proyectos desarrollamos? Estamos embarcados en el camino hacia el Cloud que llevará el entorno de datos corporativo y el desarrollo de los casos de uso analíticos a nuevas plataformas y paradigmas. Con nosotros podrás realizar proyectos con las tecnologías más punteras en el ámbito de la Analítica Avanzada y del Dato en general. Realizamos proyectos variados que van desde el diseño e implementación de plataformas para el desarrollo e industrialización de modelos de Machine Learning e Inteligencia Artificial, hasta la implementación de dichos modelos para los diferentes casos de uso a los que damos solución para el resto de las empresas del grupo.
Funciones y responsabilidades 
Identificar y proponer soluciones basadas en analítica avanzada para la resolución de problemas de Negocio. Realizar experimentos a gran escala y construir modelos data-driven para responder preguntas de negocio. Analizar información, riesgos y oportunidades de manera autónoma sobre un ámbito concreto. Aplicar análisis de datos y técnicas de generación de modelos analíticos para la generación de valor añadido en el end-to-end del ciclo de vida del dato. 
Requisitos y competencias clave
Conocimientos avanzados de Machine Learning y modelos matemáticos (ej Regresión logística, Regresión Lineal, K-Means, Random Forest, etc.) Experiencia en programación orientada a ciencia de datos (R o Phython, nivel medio/alto) Conocimientos en story telling. Analizar, interpretar y presentar los resultados. Conocimientos en estructuras de almacenamientos de datos (json, avro, xml, etc.) Ciclo de Testing de software y modelos. Monitorización funcional de modelos. Inglés alto 
Propuesta de valor
Incorporación en plantilla con contrato indefinido en nomina de CaixaBank TechPodrías trabajar desde Madrid o BarcelonaPosibilidad de días de teleworking Horario intensivo los viernes y en verano (julio y agosto)Plan de carrera y crecimiento en empresa on top en EspañaRetribución flexible y compensaciones salariales Seguro medico y de vida. Banda salarial competitiva Plataforma de formación interna Planes de formación con posibilidad de certificación Formar parte del https://www.peoplexperiencehub.com/ Hub puntero en España

title: Data Scientist - Digital Finance Hub
description:
Job Description

2021 an exciting year for Novartis as we accelerate our growth in the digital space.

The Barcelona Digital Finance hub is startup within Novartis, which crafts finance business partnering solutions demonstrating innovation and talent. Artificial intelligence and predictive analytics are reshaping the function and this new team will be a differentiator, encouraging new ideas. To add even greater value for the business we need to have the right people with the right capacities in the right location. We need ground-breaking innovation, customer-orientation and focus on bringing the best services and solutions to the business – both globally and locally – to support Finance. We are looking for early talent with experience in consulting or business partnering who are eager to make a difference.

The hub offers a real opportunity to develop in a highly fast-paced, multicultural, technology-driven environment where collaboration and innovation are at the heart of who we are and what we do.

Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse team’s representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Minimum Requirements

Your key responsibilities:

Your responsibilities include, but not limited to:
 Translate business questions into analytical problems and build solutions using visualization techniques, machine and deep learning, and statistical modelling Search and develop new algorithms, methods, statistical models and business models, providing insight into structured and unstructured data. Quickly learn and pilots the use of tools, data sources and analytical techniques needed to answer a wide range of critical business questions and to improve status quo Identify research articles and reproduce/apply innovative methodology to Novartis business problems Provide understandable and meaningful business intelligence for key partners Bring understanding of one or more areas of data sciences and is able to demonstrate practical knowledge of techniques Help developing new quantitative methods with the aim of improving processes in various projects and developing new analysis opportunities by integrating existing and new data sources Support various projects, of limited scope. Proficient in English (spoken and written)


What you’ll bring to the role:
 Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics or in a quantitative field Academic experience in a multidisciplinary data & analytics environment or in research Experience in predictive modelling and large data analysis Experience in statistical/analytics tools such as R, Matlab, Python (Pandas) or big data technologies for machine learning Expertise in at least a visualization tools QlikView, Spotfire, Tableau for crafting insights. A track record of innovating through machine learning, data bases and statistical algorithms and their applications. Hands on experience with data mining, its concepts, techniques and implementation.


Desirable requirements:
 Knowledge of any other languages have an added advantage Candidates looking for an international career, open to relocate to different countries and with a global demeanour.


You’ll receive:

As a curious organization, we provide endless opportunities to learn and grow through remote, online and classroom learning services across a broad range of topics.

Company Pension Plan; Life and Accidental Insurance; Meals Allowance or Canteen in the office; Flexible working hours

Why consider Novartis?

799 million. That’s how many lives our products touched in 2019. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives?

We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.

Imagine what you could do at Novartis!

Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity and inclusion. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration, and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.

Join our Novartis Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to learn more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/netw

title: Principal Data & Applied Scientist
description:
Microsoft's mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more and we believe that artificial intelligence will play a critical role in accomplishing that mission. The Core Search and AI team is the leading applied machine learning team at Microsoft responsible for delivering the highest-quality search experience to over 500M+ monthly active users around the world in Microsoft’s search engine, Bing and other dependent search engines such as Yahoo, DuckDuckGo, and new startups like Neeva.

We have seen little innovation in search in the last decade and we are looking for people who want to build the next generation of search using advanced AI technologies at scale. We are responsible for the largest machine learning models at Microsoft by volume and take pride in being the first in the world to solve many practical AI at Scale challenges. Our work spans a very large scope of scenarios including delivering high quality search results from a massive document corpus, extractive and abstractive summarization to generate document snippets, personalization, machine reading comprehension, and document recommendations.

As a team, we leverage the diverse backgrounds and experiences of passionate engineers, scientists, and program managers to help us realize our goal of making the world smarter and more productive. We believe great products are built by inclusive teams of customer-obsessed individuals who trust each other and work together closely. We collaborate regularly across the company both to find the technology breakthroughs from groups like Microsoft Research to infusing AI into the rest of Microsoft products like Office and Azure.

Some Examples Of Our Work Include
Building the world’s most comprehensive spelling correction system through zero shot learning (covered by NextWeb, Venture Beat, and ZDNet)Using transformer networks for search (covered in Search Engine Land and in State of AI 2020 report)Deep learning based question answering and captions (covered in VentureBeat, Search Engine Land)Launching our technology as a cloud service on Azure (a summary of the technologies we used)Co-developing our large scale training library called DeepSpeed (covered in SiliconAngle, The Batch)Building and open sourcing blazing fast transformer network inferencing (covered in ZDNet and Forbes) including developing our own accelerated chips for inferencingOpen sourcing our vector search algorithm (covered by Ars Technica and TechCrunch)
If you are passionate about working on the latest and hottest areas that will help you develop skills in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, data science and high scale systems, this is the team you’re looking for!

#semanticsearch#

Responsibilities

We need a strong technical lead to direct a team of engineers and scientists in discovering and building the next wave of innovations in search.
Work closely with Program Management to deliver a roadmap towards solving the needs of our users by building the most relevant, freshest, and authoritative results while being strategically differentiated from our biggest competitors.Lead a team to define, design, and deliver product quality improvements from ideation stage to shipping to the customer.Focus on the whole team's productivity and strive to increase the impact of the team's work product.Define and build systems and strategies to ensure high quality, stable, performant code and state-of-the-art algorithms being shipped in production.Make independent decisions for the team and handle difficult tradeoffs.Translate strategy into plans that are clear and measurable, with progress shared out monthly to stakeholders.
Qualifications

Required Qualifications
Bachelors, Masters or advanced degree in Computer Science or related field (including Mathematics and Physics)Significant years of industry experience applying Machine Learning techniquesSignificant years of experience coding in Python, C++, C#, C or Java
Preferred Qualifications
MS or PhD computer science or related field.Experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorchExperience building large scale cloud-based solutions.Customer focused, strategic, drives for results, is self-motivated, and has a propensity for action.Fantastic problem solver: ability to solve problems that the world has not solved before.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Game Data Scientist
description:
Our client are a world-renowned social gaming developer and publisher, specialised in the mobile gaming industry. With an active 2+ million daily users, they are looking to expand their team members by recruiting another Game Data Scientist to join their Analytics team.
As Game Data Scientist you will work to understand our gamers’ behaviour, and work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion. You will do this by:Using predictive and quantitative analysis, statistics & programming to help predict how users will react to changes in the Games and turn this data into actionable insights.Making an impact in a fast-paced, agile environment, where you will be continuing to learn and develop yourself while collaborating closely with other game analysts and data scientists to lead projects on machine learning, behavioural segmentation and monetization.Visualising and presenting analyses and results to senior stakeholders and liaising between different departments to ensure our data is precisely specified, understood and consistent.
 Requirements:3+ years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value.A Masters degree in a quantitative field, including hard and social sciences.Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis.Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python and/or R for data exploratory analysis and has experience in creating dashboards and visualising findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau or Looker.Experienced with A/B Testing.Excellent written and oral communication skills, experience presenting to business stakeholders.Passion for games, or high interest in the mobile gaming industry.Curiosity about everything, ability to innovate & work both in a team and independently.
Nice-to-haves:Experience in a mobile B2C business.Experience designing and analysing randomized experiments.A fast learner, highly meticulous, a consummate professional. You bring value into any conversation you have.
Some additional Benefits:Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you’re not already there).25 days annual leave, not including public holidays.Free language lessons (English, Spanish & Catalan).An amazing training budget just for you and your internal mobility programme offers real growth opportunities!Plus many, many more....
Intrigued? We’d love to hear from you. Please click “apply” to level up and submit your application in English.

title: Sales Operations Data Analyst Intern
description:
Who We Are

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.

Criteo is looking for a Sales Operations Data Analyst Intern to join our EMEA Sales Operations Team. The ideal candidate will be highly data driven, process-oriented, as well as an exceptional team player.

The intern will report directly to the Sales Operations Manager EMEA to provide support in all Sales Operations functions across channels and Countries with main focus on evaluating sales and account management performance, improving efficiency through automation and best practices sharing and leading discussions on process improvements and strategy.

Key Responsibilites

Support quarterly planning, target setting and achievement tracking processes, ensuring data accuracy input in all processes.Support weekly and monthly business performance review, challenge the Teams and track progress on associated prioritiesSupport accurate data input and adoption of Sales Solutions (primarily Salesforce, Linkedin) and associated Sales Effectiveness Processes within the region.Ensure data integrity of Salesforce and other Sales Solutions.Support new business territory sizing and support new business strategy & action plan

Who We Are Looking For

You are Fluent in EnglishYou have previous experience in problem solving end to endAdvanced Analytical & Excel skillsIdeally, you have good technical skills or a keen interest: SQL, programming languages, ...You are interested in analysis and statisticsDemonstrated track record of cross-functional facilitation and partnering in a matrix organisationAbility to maintain positive relationships to accomplish organisational goals in a multicultural environmentExpertise in developing and implementing streamlined processesAbility to work autonomously with a keen attention to details and a high sense of prioritisation

Please note that this is a six months internship based in Barcelona, Spain.

#WTTJ

At Criteo, we are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed.

Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.

title: Data Analyst (sector salud)
description:
Buscamos un/a Data Analyst para una compañía referencia a nivel nacional en el sector salud. Su función principal será procesar y realizar un análisis estadístico de datos para poder sacar conclusiones y resolver problemas del negocio.
Funciones:- Recopilar los datos, analizarlos e identificar los necesarios para optimizar la gestión empresarial y/o estrategia de negocio.- Procesar los datos, extraer el valor y sacar conclusiones/hipótesis que servirán de base para las estrategias que se implementarán.- Generar informes y presentarlos antes los directivos de la empresa o los responsables del departamento correspondiente. - Poner en funcionamiento estrategias y soluciones.
Requisitos:- Formación imprescindible: Ciencias, Tecnología, Ingeniería y/o Matemáticas.- Formación valorable: máster o postgrados en Análisis de Datos. - Experiencia laboral mínima de 3 años.- Manejo de programas y bases de datos: Python, SQL o Cloud Computing, entre otros.- Capacidad de análisis y síntesis.- Orientado/a a resultados y resolución de problemas.- Habilidades comunicativas y proactivo/a.
Ofrecemos:- Contrato indefinido con periodo de prueba de 6 meses.- Salario según valía del candidato/a.- Mutua de salud
Si crees que cumples con los requerimientos de la posición y te gustaría conocer más detalles, no dudes en aplicar a la oferta con tu CV actualizado y nos pondremos en contacto contigo.

title: Data Quality & Statistics Analyst
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
description:
En Worldpanel by Kantar somos expertos globales en el comportamiento de los compradores, ofreciendo un seguimiento continuo, análisis avanzados y soluciones a medida para inspirar las decisiones exitosas de las organizaciones líderes en todo el mundo. Worldpanel convierte el comportamiento de compra en una ventaja competitiva en una amplia gama de mercados, como la tecnología, la moda, las telecomunicaciones y los bienes de consumo.
En Worldpanel by Kantar buscamos un perfil de Data Quality Analyst con la misión de realizar análisis de datos sobre los Paneles, cuyas funciones serán:FUNCIONESAnálisis de datos, tanto de manera pautada (Bases consolidadas) como ad-hoc, generación de recomendaciones y conclusiones.Resolución de incidencias / Consultas internas o de Servicio Cliente.Diseño y seguimiento de nuevos proyectos.Recopilar información de los procesos, analizar y emitir recomendaciones.Trabajar con el equipo para generar ideas y recomendaciones.Ser responsable de la rapidez, exactitud y calidad del delivery.Proponer soluciones o nuevas formas de trabajar que aumenten la eficacia / eficiencia / mejor servicio al cliente.CAPACIDADESExcel nivel avanzadoInglés nivel medio y español avanzado.Conocimiento de SQL y paquetes estadísticos (SAS. R…)Capacidad analítica.Facilidad de comunicación tanto interpersonal como en la comunicación de resultados a otros equipos.Actitud positiva y proactiva en la resolución de consultas e incidencias, así como al plantear soluciones de forma constructiva.
De L a J partida y V intensiva. Formato híbrido Oficina/Teletrabajo. Las oficinas están ubicadas en Sant Cugat del Vallès. Contrato temporal hasta jul'22 (prorrogable).

Join usAt Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.At Kantar, the diversity of our employees provides a richer environment for our employees and broader depth and breadth of thinking for our clients. Kantar is committed to inclusion and diversity; therefore, we welcome applications from all sections of society and do not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status or any other legally protected characteristics.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Hosco - making hospitality an exciting journey! 
Hosco is a Swiss company that was launched in October 2011, and since then has become one of the world's leading hospitality platforms. We provide a space in which the industry's top companies, leading hospitality schools, and best talent can explore new opportunities and thrive like never before. 
At Hosco, we love to dream big so that we can develop innovative and data-driven solutions that truly serve our users. Our talented team is crucial to our success, and that's why we constantly seek to build a more positive and close-knit team at every turn.
Do you share Hosco’s values? Read on to see exactly how you could help us by making hospitality an exciting journey!
About the Product & Tech team and your role 
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Product & Tech team.We are passionate about hospitality and solving hard problems to help talents and students in hospitality find their dream jobs. As a data Data Analyst you will be working closely to the Product and Growth team to measure impact and uncover new ways of growing user acquisition and engagement. 
Does this sound like you? 
You have a degree in data science, data analysis, computer science, economics, mathematics or a similar quantitative field.You are a data enthusiast always looking for new opportunities to turn data into actionable insights to support product and business goals.You have worked with product and/or growth marketing teams before and you are familiar with digital analytics key concepts and tools.Help define metrics to measure success and health of our product as well as the impact of our growth strategy.You have some experience with data crunching techniques and tools.You have a solid knowledge of SQL and a good grasp of Python.You have some experience with data visualization tools (Tableau a plus).You are familiar with key concepts of data modeling and data warehousing design.
Added bonus skills
Handson experience with ETL (ideally with Airflow)
The perks of working at Hosco
A dynamic team composed of 20+ nationalities. We’re from France, Spain, Colombia, Switzerland, UK, Argentina, Italy, USA… the list goes on!Team initiatives and eventsFlexible schedule from 08:00-19:00Flexible work from home policy
If you have the skills, experience, and passion to join Hosco, we would love to hear from you!

title: Data Analyst
description:
Grow and develop your career in our Hub located in Barcelona! DSH's mission is to drive online sales globally through the development of new applications, analysis of online and offline sales and the pursuit of new technologies for all Festo companies.
If you are looking for a change and you are motivated to work in a young, multicultural, agile and innovative environment this is the place for you!
Your job:Through data analysis identify areas of improvement, facilitate decision making to enhance offline and online sales strategies and achieve the growth targets set by the company globally.Process databases, unifying criteria and interpreting them.Elaborate and review reports (dashboards) of sales activity and results (online and offline).Identify target deviations, their causes and possible impact.Create descriptive and predictive models in relation to online and offline sales behaviour.Propose actions to improve online and offline sales conversion.
Requirements:University degree (Business Administration, engineering, mathematics, physics, statistics or similar).Master's/Postgraduate degree in statistics, data analysis.Languages: English (C1 level).Experience in data visualization programs (Power BI, SAC, Tableau).Programming languages: SQL, Python.Statistical programs: SAS, Matlab, RStudio.
You can expect the following with us:The good feeling working for a family-owned company with a safe and solid financial basis.Freedom to explore, innovate and realise your own ideas.Competitive compensation with attractive perks and other benefits.Mutual respect and appreciation—regardless of gender, nationality, disability, age, and identity.Lifelong learning with great conditions for individual further development.Flexible working hours for a good balance of work and private life.Highly modern working environment, infrastructure and communication technologies.Great family and health services for your well-being.
By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Festo Automation using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Festo Automation.
Festo Automation is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

title: (Junior) Data Scientist
description:
XING is the social network for business professionals with millions of members all over the world. Help us shape the future – for a better working life! 
You will be part of an international team of Data Scientists and Data Engineers that is responsible for turning data into services and products for XING's jobs market which is used by Millions of users. We work closely together in an agile setting and focus on improving our existing job recommender and job search and developing new data-driven services that benefit the users of XING's jobs market place. For example, we work on features that help job seekers to better understand who their future colleagues may be, models that help forecasting salaries, etc. As a (Junior) Data Scientist your job includes analysis, feature engineering and the development of machine learning models. And it does not stop there: you also bring your models to production and conduct A/B tests to understand to what extent your models helped people to find a job. 
Your Role as Data Scientist:Design and implement new algorithms and Machine learning models for search and recommender services Contribute to the development of services, batch processes and stream processing components (using programming languages such as Scala, Python or SQL and technologies like Spark, Kafka, etc.) to ship algorithms to our end usersProactively analyze data assets (e.g. tracking data, profiles, job ads, etc.) and experiment to enhance existing services and create new servicesDesign and implement components in a sustainable fashion (e.g. automating training of ML models; balance between complexity of models, computational costs, ease of use)Contribute to our Data Platform by developing reusable data sets, data processing components, utility functions, etc.
You're the right candidate if you come with...MSc or higher degree in Computer Science, Math or similar disciplinefirst Hands-on experience in analyzing large datasets (e.g. with Python, SQL or similar) and developing Machine learning modelsGood theoretical and practical knowledge about machine learning and problem domains related to information retrieval (e.g. recommender systems, search)Good programming skills (preferably in Scala or Python) Proficient English language skills (German is not required)
An inspiring environmentCheck our Twitter account! https://twitter.com/NewWork_esGood isn't enough? Tell us what we can change, we're willing to take risks.Flexible remote work from Spain.Varied tasks, uncomplicated interactions with your colleagues as well as many opportunities to bring in your own ideas.Training, conferences and many opportunities to learn, experiment and grow.Innovation weeks (Hackweeks)Restaurant tickets, coffee and snacks.Spanish / English/ Portuguese / German lessons.A mobile device of your choice (iPhone, iPad, Android…).A great, multicultural and diverse environment.A sunny office located in the centre of Barcelona, with a large terrace.Flexible Compensation Plan: Health insurance/ Transport/ Nursery TicketsExtended holidays 26+4+2Competitive salary and a Permanent contractA referral bonus for recommending talent to our companyBicycle park and package reception We're looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Senior Data Analyst - Product
description:
At FREE NOW we are at the most exciting point in our history - building a world-class product used daily by more than a million people. We are a part of one of the most dynamic spaces for innovation in the world today: shaping mobility. Our daily business is solving large-scale, highly complex problems – and we love it. As a new "family member" you will stretch, learn, grow, and have fun doing it in a creative, diverse and collaborative environment. Don’t join FREE NOW because of our perks or great office locations, join us if you can’t wait to disrupt the mobility industry with us!

Being a part of our growing Analytics team at FREE NOW you will work closely with our Product teams and be the data subject matter expert for your focus area. Your goal will be to enable and drive data first product decisions.

Location: You can join us either in one of our offices in Hamburg, Berlin or Barcelona or 100% remotely in one of the 11 countries where we have a legal entity**

Your role:
 Model and evaluate user behaviour in order to identify potential value of planned projects  Develop and evaluate A/B test experiments or other analyses to measure and report the performance of released features  Support of our data driven product development through analysis of transactional, in-app, and external data  Engage with internal stakeholders to gain an understanding of the problems that need to be solved and gather requirements for analysis tasks  Communicate results and recommendations to all levels of the company including senior management and prioritisation committees  Work closely with our software programmers and data engineers to create and capture data that is aligned with the business logic and allows modelling and analysis  Provide expertise and support stakeholders in generating new product feature ideas  Develop data tracking and collection concepts in order to ensure a high-quality analysis and evaluation  Build post-measure dashboards that will serve as a feature monitoring tool for diverse stakeholders  Be involved throughout the complete product lifecycle in order to guarantee a data-driven process 
Your profile:

You are a problem solver, detail-oriented and self-motivated who thrives in a fast-paced, highly dynamic environment, combining technical, product, business and leadership perspectives. Further key aspects of your profile are:
Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering or other fields with a strong mathematical-statistical backgroundVery good knowledge of SQL and databases, experience in working with predictive models and strong knowledge of statistical programming tools (e.g. R, python)Solid understanding and hands-on experience in analyzing and interpreting A/B test results, backed by statistical knowledgeExperiences in working with data visualisation tools (e.g.Tableau, Qlikview)Experience in working in a data-driven analytics environment including an understanding of how to engage and influence decision-makersExceptional analytical skills, lateral thinking and experience in solving highly challenging problemsFluent in business English  legal entities: France, Spain, Germany, Austria, Portugal, Italy, England, Ireland, Poland, Romania & Greece
Diversity and inclusion:

At FREE NOW, we commit to being an equal opportunity employer. We consider qualified applicants regardless of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability or age. We celebrate diversity and have a clear vision: to be the place where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay and do their best work. Together with passionate, creative and collaborative colleagues, we are following our purpose of making mobility available for everyone.

Move like you

At FREE NOW we have colleagues from over 70 nations! We value open communication and welcome everyone as they are. We are all one team and follow the same goals – that’s why we share our insights and results to get on track together every month.

Your wellness and work-life balance matters to us. We offer trust-based and flexible working hours as well as the option to work from home. In the office, you can enjoy our free drinks and daily fresh fruit. Do you like to be active? Take part in our subsidised gym membership. Bigger plans? Take a sabbatical leave and get out there!

Let’s grow together! We believe in a transparent career growth  plan, quarterly development sessions with your team lead as well as regular 1:1s to help you thrive! For your own ideas, you’re welcome to set up initiatives and projects.

Need a lift?  We offer Udemy e-learning platform, subsidised language classes, internal peer-to-peer trainings and more to support your learning & development opportunities.

More Benefits? 👏 Monthly mobility budget for FREE NOW rides, quarterly team events, company-wide onboarding days at our HQ in Hamburg, relocation assistance for internationals, birthday-off, kudos and many more!

About FREE NOW:

FREE NOW is the Mobility Super App with the largest vehicle choice for consumers across Europe. More than 54 million users in 16 markets and in over 170 cities today are already moving freely from A to B by accessing the largest selection of mobility options available in one app. Through the unique integration of mobility brands and payment services, they can book their nearest taxi, private hire vehicle, car sharing or micro-mobility option such as eScooters, eMopeds, and eBikes within the app. FREE NOW aggregates numerous mobility brands with the ambition to make urban mobility more efficient and sustainable without adding new vehicles on the street. The German based company is backed by the BMW Group and Mercedes-Benz Mobility. In total, around 1,850 employees in more than 27 offices work for the services of FREE NOW, which is led by CEO Marc Berg.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Let’s Talk About You

Your profile 

You are a highly collaborative individual and enjoy solving problems that focus on adding business value. You have a sense of ownership and enjoy hands-on technical work. Our values resonate with yoursDegree educated in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or equivalent experience, with strong physics backgroundAbility to write clean, maintainable, and robust code in Python Hands-on experience with ML libraries e.g Scikit-learn, XGBoost, keras and least one data query language / database technologyWorking expierence and deep understanding in methods for non-uniformly sampled time-series analysis, deep learning, computer vision or (non)linear optimization (at least two fields)Preferable: familiarity with ML cloud technologies, preferably with AWS SageMakerFluency in English is essential (C2 Level), knowledge of German and other languages is a plus

Your Responsibilities

Design and build digital twin models of Siemens-Energy assets components for anomaly and faults detectionsDefine failures root causes and produce risk analysis with explainable probabilistic modelsCombine data from various and diverse sources into global optimization modelsTake advantage of Siemens Energy cloud environment to scale your modelsContribute to cross-functional problem-solving sessions with your team and deliver presentations to colleagues and clients Your opportunities for personal growth

You will have the opportunity to work in a start-up like environment, with highly motivated team within a leading market company, and in an international environmentYou will be part of an international team, working alongside Project Managers, Data Engineers, Machine Learning Engineers, Software Engineers and 3D DesignersDuring your first project you will also work closely with collaborators from two of the biggest companies in data services and deep learning techYou will directly contribute on the establishment of the energy systems of tomorrow

Let’s Talk About Us

"Let’s make tomorrow different today" is our genuine commitment at Siemens Energy to all customers and employees on the way to a sustainable future.

As Siemens Energy we are the only company with a leading portfolio along the entire energy value chain – in both conventional and renewable energy – we are uniquely able to help both public- and private-sector customers benefit from these developments.

Your role will be inside one of our DigiHubs and based in Barcelona.

#DigiHubBarcelona leads all Siemens Energy DigiHubs worldwide from the showcasing and customer experience perspective in Digitalization and Energy Transition. We work with consultative sales methodologies and enable our sales colleagues in selling Digital Transformation and Energy Transition related solutions from a holistic customer centric approach.

#DigiHubBarcelona is one of the main Data Hubs for Siemens Energy, become part of our dynamic digitization team as a Data Scientist and join us in the world of digitalization and decarbonization. A new dimension of the service of our machines awaits you - the dimension of data. For us, digitization means increasing the value for our customers by development of innovative business models as well as digital products.

Check out this video to see what we do here!

MORE INSIGHTS

Be Energized. Be you.

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity we generate power. We run on inclusion and compassion. Our combined creative energy is fueled by at least 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society. All of society.

Company: Siemens Energy S.A.

Experience Level: Experienced Professional
