title: Data Scientist, Software Development-ESP
description:
Description

Data Scientist

(Cloud Software Development / Hybrid Work)

Join an experienced team with cutting-edge technology, a start-up mindset, multinational stability, and limitless possibilities for growth.

WHAT IS CLOUDBLUE?

CloudBlue, an Ingram Micro business, is the world’s largest cloud platform provider that orchestrates B2B ecosystems, by enabling management of traditional and digital products and subscriptions, quickly onboarding, integrating with partners, and scaling globally with a single platform.

CloudBlue is the result of $500 million in investments, and our entrepreneurial scope means we operate with the agility of a high-growth start-up, but with the confidence and backing of Ingram Micro.

At CloudBlue, you will join a diverse team, led by forward-thinkers, where everyone has a voice and works together; it’s a place where you can keep learning and growing, owning, and delivering the best solutions for large companies like AMX, Telefónica, Vodafone, TUM and many more.

WHY WORK AT CLOUDBLUE?
START-UP MINDSET WITH THE STABILITY AND SECURITY OF HAVING A MULTINATIONAL BACKING: You get the best of both worlds: the exciting challenges, flexibility, and agility of a start-up combined with strong financial stability, security, and career development.TOP CLASS, HIGHLY EXPERIENCED TEAMS: You will work with a team of smart people who write high-quality code, senior specialists who know the technology inside out, and team leaders who have extensive experience, several with more than 20 years in the software industry.PROFESSIONAL AND PERSONAL GROWTH WITHOUT LIMITS: There will be no limit to your growth, either as an individual contributor or as a leader.WE HAVE MICROSERVICES ARCHITECTURE AND CUTTING-EDGE TECHNOLOGY: We are a platform based on microservices architecture, and we use innovative technology, and for sure technology can always be improved, and we are open to this.ESSENTIAL PART OF GO-TO-MARKET FOR ALL FEATURES: At CloudBlue you will not only be implementing the features, but you will also be an essential part of maintaining and evolving them, doing things like testing (automated), supportability, and even customer care in some cases.CONSTANT COMMUNICATION AND COLLABORATION: At CloudBlue, everyone has a voice and a vote. We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts.WE ARE MULTICULTURAL AND LEARN FROM EACH OTHER: We are a dynamic multicultural organization from different countries, including Argentina, Colombia, Italy, Russia, and more, but we work as one.FLEXIBILITY & HYBRID WORK MODEL: You decide how to organize your work and manage your time. We provide a hybrid work model consisting of 2 days from the office and 3 days at home.
WHAT TECHNOLOGIES, TASKS AND METHODOLOGIES WILL YOU WORK WITH?
You will be required to help with our visualization projects using PowerBI.We expect you to have strong technical skills in no-SQL solutions, ETL, Python, R, TensorFlow, Keras and Spark.Knowledge of MLOps Experience in Kubeflow will be a plus.
WHAT WILL MAKE YOU SUCCESSFUL IN THIS ROLE?
We are looking for an expert with a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science/Engineering or Mathematics and more than 2 years of related work experience with data.Good knowledge of statistics, algebra, Machine Learning, and Data Mining Techniques.Goal-oriented with high standards for quality, performance, and exceptional attention to detail.Ability to exhibit flexibility, initiative and innovation when dealing autonomously with ambiguous and fast-paced situations.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.It would be a plus if you have a Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or other quantitative fields, or Basic understanding of Cloud platforms.
WHAT WILL YOUR MISSION BE?
Design and develop a variety of complex statistical and machine learning techniques.Provide appropriate recommendations for action and changes to improve model performance. Help with the interpretation of results – for both causal inferences and predictive effectiveness.Design and implement pipelines to cleanse and integrate data in an efficient and reusable manner.Help create the vision for future analytical studies that use advanced analytics technologies. 
Other Benefits Of Working At Cloudblue
Ticket Restaurant meal allowance.Private health insurance.The office is at the Diagonal 00 building in the Fòrum area. A brand-new office with spacious areas for working, meeting or relaxing, tons of sunlight, a cafeteria, and a kitchen, plus table tennis, arcade games and PlayStation.New and complete set up for you: laptop, 2 screens, ergonomic chair, and everything you need to make your workspace as comfortable as possible.Drinks, large kitchen, fruit, CSR, and team building activities, and parties in summer and Christmas.Yearly salary review based on performance.Bonus: When goals are reached, you will be rewarded through our annual global bonus scheme, based on your professional level. Career growth: You will find national and international opportunities to grow within the company, both at Ingram Micro and CloudBlue.

title: Data Scientist in Planning & Fullfillment - Applied Intelligence Team
description:
About Accenture

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners, and communities.

The company has been operating in Greater China for over 30 years. Today, it has more than 17,000 people servicing clients across the region with offices in the cities including Beijing, Shanghai, Dalian, Chengdu, Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Hong Kong and Taipei. As a trusted Partner of Choice for digital transformation, Accenture is bringing more innovation to the business and technology ecosystems and helping Chinese enterprises and the government to embrace digitization and enhance global competitiveness to succeed in the new era.

For more information about Accenture, please visit its corporate homepage www.accenture.com and its Greater China homepage www.accenture.cn .

Supply Chain & Operations

Supply Chain Management professional’s help clients develop strategies and operating models that integrate planning, procurement, manufacturing, and fulfillment functions within an organization, as well as connect suppliers and customers across the extended supply chain. The key areas of focus/consideration for the Supply Chain and Operations practice in Fulfillment and Logistics areas are:

Design and implement efficient and effective supply chain networks that support client business strategies 

Balancing the tradeoffs of customer service levels, inventory deployment, network options, transportation, and distribution costs 

Help companies implement processes, applications, and enablement strategies to support the transaction flow from customer inquiry through to financial settlement, order to cash process 

Key Responsibilities

Work independently in client facing situations as well as part of larger project teams in the design, development and implementation of new and improved business processes and enabling technology in Fulfillment and Logistics related projects 

Supervising business diagnosis in Fulfillment and logistics activities 

Management of daily operative communication with the client 

Deliver expertise for the implementation and continuous improvement of Logistics strategy, organization, network, processes, operations, and technology. Typical Fulfillment and Logistics projects include: 

Strategy: Supply Chain strategy, Logistics and Supply Chain assessment, fulfillment model, customer service policy 

Organization: functional (re)structure, role sort, job description, job competency 

Network: supply network node design, inventory policy 

Process: standard operation procedures, KPI setup, benchmarking

Operation: transportation planning, route planning, warehouse layout design, equipment, and automations, 3PL service evaluation, logistics trainings 

Technology: ERP, TMS, WMS, OMS and BMS system implementation and business process management

Deliver cost saving initiatives including productivity and utilization of logistics resources and facilities covering transportation, warehouse, and customer delivery to meet project deliverables 

Setup and evaluate logistics performance measurement KPIs and benchmarking process. Periodical interviews with the client for measurements/KPIs presentation 

Leverage best practices and existing operation standards to create client-specific business solutions for Logistics and Supply Chain improvements 

Conceptualize, design, and build re-usable components around the Logistics practices to help accelerate the development of Capability Network. 

Act as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for making client proposals and setting up project objectives for the prospective projects 

Ability to meet travel requirements, up to 100% 

Technical skills:

Bachelor in mathematics, statistics, physics, Industrial or other Engineering is required

6+ years of experience developing or running advanced analytics capabilities, preferably with consulting experience

Demonstrate strong understanding of business, technology and process implications as related to supply chain planning

solving skills, with expertise in quantitative/qualitative process analysis techniques, process metrics and performance measurement

Exhibit effective oral and written communication, leadership, project management, and teamwork skills with an ability to interact effectively with different levels of management. Should be diplomatic, flexible, and have a good team approach.

Experience in a similar role, managing a data science teams and projects. Preferably in supply chain space

Excellent spoken and written communication skills (English).

Demonstrable experience at productizing models; from inception to deployment.

Professional Skill Requirements

Having supply chain strategy and operation consulting experienced is preferred.

Advanced algorithm modeling skills: Python, R

Deep theoretical and applied knowledge in one or more of the following areas: forecast modelling, inventory optimization, network optimization, supply simulation or digital twin modelling

Cloud architectures know how: Azure, AWS, GCP

Working knowledge of agile development, including DevOps and DataOps concepts.

Experience with Azure Data Factory, Databricks, etc…is a plus.

Experience with Statistical/Machine Learning techniques is a plus.

Familiarity with business solutions tools (such as o9, BlueYonder, etc…).

Skills in business diagnostics, value assessment and opportunity identification, and application design of Supply chain

We offer a competitive salary, an extensive benefits package which includes extra vacations days per year, medical and life insurance, learning opportunities and much more!

title: Data Analyst, Strategy Analytics
description:
Are you a curious and passionate data analyst interested in impacting business decisions with data-driven insights and recommendations? Do you enjoy working with large data sets and applying analytics skills to answer business questions? Scopely's Barcelona office is searching for a Data & BI Analyst with strong SQL and analytics experience to join our Portfolio Strategy Analytics team. You should be a rare breed of business-savvy and analytics powerhouse capable of digging into terabytes of player, revenue, marketing and game data to understand user behavior, player experience and game health across our portfolio. What You Will Do:Analyze large, complex data sets representing the behavior of millions of online and mobile game players to address strategic and operational business questions.Turning data into actionable insights that can support and drive impactful business decisions.Provide insights about the health of our portfolio, both within and across genres, in order to drive business decisions across all key functions.Contribute to the development of jaw-dropping dashboards to more effectively surface the group’s findings.Develop frameworks, KPIs, models and tools to help game teams improve and optimize LTV and loyalty,Develop cross-portfolio analysis and reporting products, providing strategic alignment across the company and ensuring data influences decisions at all levels. What You Will Need:Intellectual curiosity, analytical rigor, hard-working, the ability to innovate & work independently and a good business intuition are musts!2 or more years of experience as a Data Analyst preferable at a top-tier institution or firm in an analysis, scientific, research or consulting role.Strong presentation and Storytelling skills; ability to communicate complex results throughout an organization.Critical thinking and problem-solving capabilities.Working knowledge of SQL and comfort working in large data sets – exposure with Bigquery is a plus.Working Knowledge of visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, or Qlikview.Python/R experience is a plus.Advanced knowledge of ExcelB.S. (graduate degree a plus) from a top institution in a quantitative or scientific field (Math/Stats, Economics, CS, Engineering, Physics, Psychology or similar).Prior experience working in the gaming industry is a plus but not requiredA love or strong desire to work with mobile games

Life @ Scopely BCNCompetitive compensation package, including base + bonusPrivate health insurance 100% covered for you and private life insuranceFree catered lunches daily + Fully Stocked Kitchen with unlimited snacks and drinksFlex RetributionSmall team environment with opportunity for growth and ownership
At Scopely, we want individuals to bring their unique experiences to the table. Who you are, where you come from, what you look like, and the kinds of people (and games) you love create a unique perspective that can enrich our games and our culture. With more voices like yours, our company can flourish. About us:Scopely is a leading mobile games company home to many top-grossing, award-winning franchises including Star Trek™ Fleet Command, Looney Tunes™ World of Mayhem, WWE Champions 2019, The Walking Dead: Road To Survival™, YAHTZEE® With Buddies and Wheel of Fortune®: Free Play, among others. Scopely creates rewarding, immersive games that empower a directed-by-consumer experience. Founded in 2011, Scopely is fueled by a world-class team and a proprietary technology platform that personalizes gameplay at scale across one of the most diversified portfolios in the west. Recognized in Fast Company’s ‘World’s Most Innovative Companies’ and #2 on Deloitte’s ‘Technology Fast 500’ as one of the fastest-growing companies in North America, Scopely has achieved more than $1 billion in lifetime revenue by creating game experiences that are an important part of people’s lives. With global operations in Los Angeles, Barcelona and Dublin (DIGIT Games Studios), and additional studios in seven countries across four continents, Scopely has raised more than $250 million in financing from global entertainment and technology investors.  Scopely is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, family or parental status, gender identity, veteran, or disability status, or other protected status.  Candidate information will be treated in accordance with our candidate privacy notice which can be found here: https://scopely.com/scopely-candidate-privacy-notice/

title: Data Scientist
description:

Their core solution is an award-winning institutional risk aggregation and reporting application which provides an independent appraisal of investment risk compliance and financial risk exposures.

title: Data Scientist
description:
As Data Scientist you will have following key accountabilities: Design, develop and implement solutions based on data science, stats and machine learning models throughout the full life cycle (ideation, design, implementation, productization and maintenance) Create and improve methods and tools, contribute to communities of practice in the area of Data Science Communicate regularly with non-data scientists in Tech, Operations, Commercial, Product to understand the domain and the requirements, as well as explain data science principles, concepts, algorithms, and approaches Make data your best friends, understand their strengths and leverage them - be aware of their weaknesses and tackle them in your solutions Screen the market for potential new / innovative Data Science approaches Foster knowledge exchange within the company and present GfK’s Data Sciences expertise at conferences and workshops 
Now you know what a Data Scientist does. What skills, qualifications & experience do you need for this job? You can think creatively in addressing analytical objectives You have expert statistical / machine learning modeling skills (e.g. statistical tests, classification, predictive modelling, handling of missing data, sampling, weighting) You are skilled regarding performance optimization and scalability (e.g. parallelization and code optimization) You have experience with an analytical programming language (Python, R) and the respective ecosystem You have solid skills regarding database handling as SQL Knowledge of the constantly evolving Data Science ecosystem and its frameworks (e.g. Spark MLlib, TensorFlow, MLflow) is a plus Knowledge of cloud computing environments and tooling (especially AWS) is a plus Advanced software development skills (unit testing, CI/CD, Git) is a plus Your English is fluent in a business environment, fluent Spanish is a plus You typically have a master’s degree or PhD that reflects strong modeling and statistics skills You typically have 3+ years of work experience Admittedly, this is a long list and we do not expect you to be able to tick off every single point on it. Learning on the job and formal trainings will help you to close potential knowledge gaps and quickly bring you up to speed. 
We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions. Can there be a better place to take center stage in the digital revolution? We are excited to getting to know you!

title: Digital Marketing Data Analyst/Data Scientist
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
description:
Job Specification

E-commerce is both growing rapidly and redefining the way we shop and buy. In the online space, the Search Engine Results Page (SERP) is the new digital shelf and this role will play a critical role in identifying the insights that will help to optimize our presence on that shelf.

This role will be within the Global Search Strategy & Analytics Team which is part of the Search Center of Excellence (COE). The successful candidate will play a strategic role in elevating our analytics and data science capabilities around the digital customer journey and both paid and organic Search execution.

Primary Function

We are looking for someone who is curious, energetic, teamwork-oriented and has a willingness to elevate the performance of the team as a whole through an exceptional ability to turn data into insights. The Marketing Data Analyst will help to develop and maintain dashboards, perform ad-hoc reporting based on business need, provide actionable insights based on data, and provide strategic support to the Global Search Strategy Team and regional Search Delivery Teams. This position serves as an expert in digital marketing data sources, analysis and modeling. The ideal candidate will be able to manage multiple data sources and identify process improvements in how the data is tracked and reported.

Core Responsibilities

Marketing Data Analytics
Develop and implement data solutions and statistical models to improve the speed and effectiveness of business decisionsGather business requirements, design data structures, and develop code if needed to manage and report data using a diverse set of toolsCollect, cleanse, analyze and provide data for digital marketing effortsUse data narratives and KPI’s to identify insights, trends, and business opportunities and effectively present these to stakeholdersInterpret data and create ongoing and ad hoc report to interpret data and create ongoing and ad hoc reportsIdentify data and process improvement opportunities by monitoring existing metrics, analyzing data and partnering with internal teams as neededDevelops data sets to enable self-service data analysis within the broader marketing organizationPlan and implement marketing attribution models within a multi-channel advertising environment using data from Google, Amazon, and other marketing automation software
Job Requirements

Critical requirements
Bachelors in Data Science, Statistics, Analytics, Marketing (or similar field),A minimum of 5 years experience working with data and a minimum of 2 years working with digital marketing dataGoogle Analytics Certification or equivalent knowledgeBasic knowledge of search engine advertising tools (Google, Bing, Yahoo) and bid management systems (Adwords, DoubleClick, Search Ads 360, Google Analytics, Tag Manager etc.)Proficiency with Search Engine reporting tools (DoubleClick, Google Analytics, SEMRush, etc.)Knowledge of Amazon-related tools including Vendor Central, Downstream, KenshooAdvanced Excel/Data base capabilitiesStrong proficiency with PowerpointSelf-directed with a passion to continue to learn and grow, embracing the continuous improvement approach (define-measure-analyze-improve-control)Very strong teamwork orientationAbility to work with virtual, global teams across multiple time zonesStrong project and budget management skillsExcellent written/oral communicationsStrong analytical, influencing, and interpersonal skillsAbility to interface effectively with multiple levels of management and functional disciplinesFluency in English (please submit resume/CV in English)Willingness to work as part of an onsite team at an HP location at least 2 days per week (after COVID) Existing authorization to work in an approved country without sponsorship from HP. Approved countries include: US, Spain, and Mexico.
Desired But Not Required Knowledge Or Capabilities
Create and maintain data dashboards with visual software such as PowerBI using data from marketing platforms such as Google Analytics, Search Ads 360, Brightedge and other marketing data platforms.Google Adwords and or Shopping Certification preferredAmazon Marketing Services (Sponsored Products, Headline search, Product display)Multi-lingual capability a big plus (Spanish, German, French, Japanese)
Why HP? 

At HP, we believe in the power of ideas. We use ideas to put technology to work for everyone. And we believe that ideas thrive best in a culture of teamwork. That is why everyone - at every level in every function, is encouraged to have original ideas, to express them and to share them. We trust anything can be achieved if you really believe in it, and we will invest in your ideas to change lives and the way people work. This vision is what sets us apart as a company. At HP we work across borders, and without limits. Global virtual teams share resources and pool their big ideas to solve business issues and meet personal goals. Everyone is valued for the unique skills, experiences and perspective they bring. That’s how we work at HP. And this is how ideas and people grow.

Below Are Some Key Benefits Offered To US Employees

Not only is HP making great products and staffed with outstanding people, but HP offers other valuable benefits.
 15 vacation days per year (prorated the first year), 10 paid holidays and 2 floating holidays (US employees) HP 401K with company match (US) Employee Stock Purchase Program Company-paid life insurance Company-paid disability leave Parental leave Employee discounts on HP products
Where legally permitted, an offer of employment is conditional upon you providing proof that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (as defined by the CDC) as of your first day of employment.

The updated language that can be used for reqs with a primary or secondary job posting location of Colorado.  It must be used shown exactly as it’s shown below (addition in red font) since that is what has been approved by Legal:

HP Offers a Comprehensive Benefits Package, Including

Dental insurance

Disability insurance

Employee assistance program

Flexible schedule

Flexible spending account

Health insurance

Life insurance

In accordance with Colorado statute, the estimated range of compensation for this job in that location, at the time of this posting, is 74,600.00 - 108,200.00 USD Annual. This position may be eligible for incentive pay, for openings where this is applicable.

About HP

You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion - it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

title: CRM-Data Analyst
description: En Imagin ( by Grupo CaixaBank) somos una comunidad abierta, un espacio para la libertad financiera, la sostenibilidad, la solidaridad, la cultura, el conocimiento y el entretenimiento. title: Data & Applied Scientist II - WebXT
description:
The newly formed WebXT organization encompasses Bing, Edge Browser and Microsoft Content services used by nearly a billion users across the Globe. Data is staple to how we run the business in WebXT and there’s immense thirst from engineering, data science, business development and partners across Microsoft to have their data insight questions answered in a fast, accurate and easily digestible fashion. If you seek the opportunity to make direct business impact in major AI driven products in Microsoft, come and join the Bing Metrics and Insights team as a Data Scientist to drive user and engagement growth strategies with data.

We combine our data science expertise with business and engineering knowledge to provide insights to build better products for our customers.

So if you want to work on key growth initiatives for Bing and drive future growth, if analyzing petabytes of data to generate insights excites you and if you want to build great products and make business impact using statistical analysis, machine learning, experiments, data mining, data visualization, and more, then this role is for you!

As Bing is evolving and getting integrated across multiple Microsoft owned products like Windows, Edge, Office, Teams etc., there is a critical need for identifying actionable insights to drive product growth by analyzing cross product data across all Microsoft owned products.

We are looking for a strong data scientist who is hands-on, self-driven and able to work in a fast-paced and constantly evolving environment with direct product focus. This role also requires solid technical, leadership and communication skills. You will extract actionable insights from petabytes of data through data analysis and tell a story through data visualization that will drive enhancement and development of Bing.

Responsibilities
Hands on analysis on large volumes of telemetry data using various algorithms and tools including your ownDrive data driven ideation for Bing user and volume growth initiativesDrive impact analysis for features critical to agile course correction and business investmentsDefine and track key org level success metrics for impact and drive reliable process to track contribution from individual feature initiatives across the product lifecycle against set goalsArticulate insights, storyboard with data and visualization to communicate and influence leadership and other key decision makersHelp build data platform for the Bing org to support their metrics and analytical needs
Qualifications

Required Qualifications:
 Bachelor's or master’s degree in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, Statistics, or another quant-focused fieldRelevant years of professional experience working in Data Science and analyticsRelevant years of experience with metric design, exploratory data analysis, predictive analytics, machine learning for data mining, clustering, A/B testing and other areas of data science and statisticsRelevant years of experience working with large data sets or doing large scale quantitative analysisProficiency in SQL scripting requiredProficiency in using one or more programming or scripting language like Python, R, C# to work with data requiredStrong communication skills to articulate insights to senior management and feature teams to drive actions
Preferred Qualifications
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Kibana etc.,Familiarity with search engines and online servicesA willingness to learn, share, and improve
#WebXT #nextplay #data #datascience #analysis #datamodel #machinelearning

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

title: Global Analytics, Data and Automation Scientist
description:
Alcon is the global leader in eye care, dedicated to helping people see brilliantly. With our 70-plus-year heritage, we are the largest eye care device company in the world – with complementary businesses in Surgical and Vision Care. Being a truly global company, we work in over 70 countries and serve patients in more than 140 countries. We have a long history of industry firsts, and each year we commit a substantial amount in Research and Development to meet customer needs and patient demands.

Join us now as our new Global Analytics, Data and Automation Scientist.

The main purpose of this role is to create data mining architectures/models, statistical reporting, and data analysis methodologies to identify trends in large data sets.

You will build and maintain business analytics that support the Global Commercial Excellence team in driving excellence in sales execution, marketing execution, automation, competency management, forecasting, sales re-porting and customer satisfaction in all regions across both Vision Care and Surgical franchises. Moreover, you will ensure maximum automation of data processing and reporting for all commercial activities internationally.

The Main Accountabilities Will Include
Creating and maintaining predictive models to help making decision and/or predict future trends or events.Creating and maintaining best-in-class ad-hoc reporting and analytics systems and capabilities.Creating and maintaining the databases used by the analytics.Collaborating with key stakeholders (e.g. Region Franchise leadership, Commercial Excellence, Marketing, IT and Finance) to ensure focus on the most value adding analytics to drive business growth.Driving and/ or supporting ad hoc analysis for core Commercial, Sales, Marketing and Training projects (e.g. Sales Incentive Plans, Launch Campaigns, Strategic Plan, Forecasting, etc).Supporting key processes such as incentive compensation automation, sales data loads into CRM, President’s Club reporting, etc, at least for Global Emerging markets.
To be considered in this role we are looking for an individual with:
Bachelors (Masters Preferred) in data or computer sciences, economics, or other related quantitative fieldStrong English communication capability as well as relevant local language skills to drive the team and drive change. Experience working in multiple countries with multiple languages and currencies is a plus2-3 years’ experience in building databases and SQL queries2-3 years’ experience in Python Scripting and R2 years’ experience in developing and managing analytics system (Tableau CRM - Einstein Analytics, Tableau, Spotfire, PowerBI, Qlik)1 years’ experience with data processing automation tools/ ETLs (Alteryx preferred)Strong quantitative aptitudeUnderstanding of Healthcare Market Environment is a plus
Why join Alcon?

We aspire to lead the world in innovating life-changing vision products because when people see brilliantly, they live brilliantly.

We are the world’s leading Eye Care products and Devices Company. You will join our 20,000 associates at Alcon, making a real difference to the lives of others. At Alcon, we create meaningful opportunities for associates to grow their careers. Learn more at www.alcon.com . .

title: Data & Analytics Specialist
description:
What We’re Looking For

We are looking for a Data & Analytics Specialist providing leadership on ideation, analysis, delivery and improvement of data solutions considering as main objective to drive business results and sales with data-based insights. 

This position is located in our Barcelona (Viladecans) HQ.

What You’ll Do
Lead Data & Analytics strategy across the company working closely with different business stakeholders specifically Ecommerce and Sales teams.High performing and scalable delivery of insights through the usage of analytical solutions.Identify opportunities based in data insights to optimize e-commerce performance.Ability to optimize and propose improvements that help achieve better results in the different digital campaigns based in data insights.Development and execution of reports and dashboards to support internal and external stakeholders needs.Collaborate with external partners specialized in Digital Marketing, Analytics and Technology.Incorporate best Practices.
What You’ll Need To Succeed
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field is preferred.At least 3 years of experience in the implementation of Data Analytics initiatives or in a similar role.Experience as Analytics Consulting role within E-commerce turning data into actionable insights will be a plus.Proven track record of driving revenue growth and optimizing digital marketing initiatives through data analytics.Experience with segmentation & targeting (CRM), acquisition and retention, pricing and conversion, reporting & analytics.Great knowledge & passion of data analysis applied in the business strategy.Must Have a Problem-Solving Attitude, being Data & Results driven and having excellent project management skills such as Organization, Communication and Collaboration.Strong influencing, facilitating working with stakeholders at all levels and across departments.Ability to quickly adapt to changes in timelines and sequences.Experience using Microsoft Power BI or other Business Intelligence platform.Languages: Fluent level of English & Spanish
What We Can Offer You

Sustainable Business - People Commitment – Learning & Development – Career Possibilities

Who We Are

Unilever is a leading global Fast-Moving Consumer Goods company, with over 400 brands that are sold in over 190 countries. At Unilever, we share one simple purpose: to make sustainable living commonplace. Through our household brands, like Lipton, Knorr, Dove, Hellman’s and AXE, we are creating a bright future for our customers, our business, and our planet – and you can be part of it.

WANT TO KNOW MORE? 

Follow us on LinkedIn for the latest updates!

Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.

title: Senior Product Data Analyst (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

We are a product centred company and all of our teams rely heavily on data to drive product development. By experimenting with features in different markets, testing hypotheses and UI/UX changes through A/B testing and tracking success metrics continuously, the Product Analytics team is strategic for the development cycle of our apps in Glovo.

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Product team you will be responsible for using data to uncover usage and behavioral patterns and provide actionable insights that guide product development teams. We are looking for a product savvy analytics professional with the same passion that we have for using data as the main driver of product innovation and business growth.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Work closely with product managers and development teams to define, monitor and give visibility of product metrics and KPIs. Design and analyze product experiments (A/B tests, multivariate test, etc) that will directly impact the backlog. Translate product questions and hypothesis into analysis and actionable insights. Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and dashboards. Align with engineering teams to ensure data availability/quality of new features and data sources. Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology and the business. 
You Have
4-6 years of working experience with data analysis/business intelligenceExperience in managing complex projects or programsGood understanding of software development and agile methodologies. Excellent SQL skills Redshift experience is highly valued. Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown. Knowledgeable and preferably experienced in designing and analysing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc) Knowledge of visualisation tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview. Ability to juggle multiple strands of work and priorities on complex projects. Ability to communicate and present complex ideas to stakeholders and get buy-in thanks to ability to understand business needs. Ability to build relationships with key stakeholders across the teams. Excellent spoken and written English. 
Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan Comprehensive Private Health Insurance Spanish lessons Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!) Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months! Discounted Gym memberships Flexible working environment 
What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
GAS: Driven to deliver quality results quicklyGood Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learningCare: Uplift people and the planetGlownership: Act as proud ownersHigh Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we’re currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://glovoapp.com/ | Twitter: @Glovo_ES | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/glovoappES/ | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/glovo-app/

title: CT02 - Digital DATA Analyst
description:
BUSCAMOS PARA IMPORTANTE PROYECTO DE CLIENTE, DIGITAL DATA ANALYST con ENTRE 2 y 5 años de experiencia y SIGUIENTE PERFIL PROFESIONAL:

Descripción:
Definir la estrategia de recopilación de datos identificando los KBRs y estableciendo los objetivos y KPIs de seguimiento.Definir e implementar el modelo de datos teniendo en cuenta las fuentes de datos internas y externas y los canales de tráfico online y offline.Convertir los datos en dashboards informativos para una gestión Data Driven. Generación de informes automatizados para distintas áreas. Controlar y determinar las campañas online para su rentabilidad.Colaboración en los requerimientos de evolutivos y proyectos web en la etapa de experiencia de usuario y usabilidad.Definir y normalizar el etiquetado de todo el ecosistema web para un mejor análisis mediante Google Tag Manager y Data Layers.Gestión de compra y renovación de los dominios web del grupo.Automatizar y analizar atributos de productos como el precio en plataformas eCommerce y Amazon.
Conocimientos requeridos IMPRESCINDIBLES:
Se valorará muy positivamente la experiencia en una posición similar en ecommerce Conocimiento de Google Analytics, Tag Manager y conocimiento de Marketing Digita
Conocimientos deseados:

Se valorará el conocimiento en Sales force, Hub y Power BI

Perfil deseado:

Capacidad de comunicación, análisis y proactividad

title: Data Scientist AI
description:
Desde CaixaBank Tech nos encontramos en búsqueda un perfil Data Scientist con conocimiento avanzado de Python, Machine Learning, modelos matemáticos y estadísticos.  ¿Qué proyectos desarrollamos? Desarrollamos soluciones basadas en inteligencia artificial (IA) para impulsar la adopción de la IA en el grupo CaixaBank. Para ello, definimos la estrategia de IA en el grupo CaixaBank, ofrecemos servicios y aplicaciones escalables y robustas en IA, centralizamos y divulgamos el conocimiento y buenas prácticas en IA, y exploramos nuevas tecnologías y tendencias manteniéndonos a la vanguardia del estado del arte.El Centro de Excelencia de Inteligencia Artificial es un equipo multidisciplinar que conceptualiza y desarrolla proyectos con una visión user centric entre los que destacan las aplicaciones cognitivas (nueva generación de asistentes virtuales), soluciones basadas en tecnologías de voz y análisis de texto, recomendadores, clasificadores de lenguaje natural o gestión documental.Las responsabilidades que asumirás en la posición son: Desarrollo de modelos de machine learning/deep learning para dar respuesta a los diferentes problemas que se planteen.Transformar los datos en información relevante, obteniendo ‘insights’ y transfiriendo este conocimiento a las áreas de negocio, proponiendo soluciones cuando se requiera.Desarrollo de prototipado ágil, para demostrar la viabilidad de la solución/modelo propuesta.Implementar soluciones de ingeniería inversa para entender el problema del cliente y resolver sus retos de negocio identificando oportunidades de machine learning.Definición, implantación y seguimiento de indicadores.Diseñar las actividades necesarias para completar proyectos de manera exitosa fomentando el uso de metodologías Agile.Analizar información, riesgos y oportunidades de manera autónoma sobre un ámbito.Aplicar las últimas tecnologías de mercado y estado del arte en las soluciones propuestas.Aplicar análisis de datos y técnicas de diseño, modelado y QA en base a un entendimiento detallado de los procesos de negocio, para establecer, modificar o mantener una estructura de datos y sus componentes.Documentar trabajo técnico, utilizando estándares, métodos y herramientas adecuados.

Requisitos y competencias clave: Título universitario en Informática, Ingeniería, Matemáticas o Físicas. Se valorará tener un doctorado.Conocimiento avanzado de machine learning y modelos matemáticos y estadísticos como autoencoders, Transformers, RNNs, análisis de series temporales, Gradient Boosting, Multi-armed Bandits, etc.Experiencia de mínimo 3 años en programación orientada a ciencia de datos: Python con conocimientos de paquetes como TensorFlow, Pytorch, Sklearn, Scipy, Keras, etc.Experiencia en la visualización y exploración de datos con herramientas como Seaborn, Matplotlib y se valorará experiencia en librerías de javascript para la visualización interactiva como 3D.jsConocimientos de metodologías de desarrollo de modelos (MLOps, DataOps, etc.).Conocimientos de transformación y limpieza de datos (ETL., data wrangling).Conocimiento en entorno Cloud (IaaS, PaaS, CaaS, SaaS).Experiencia práctica en el uso de técnicas, metodologías para el control de versiones y A/B Testing.Experiencia en implementación de proyectos de machine learning en industria con grandes volúmenes de datos.Capacidad para valorar y seleccionar los procedimientos y enfoques de trabajo adecuados para superar los retos técnicos.Versatilidad y visión transversal de proyectos IA.Habilidad gestionando expectativas de equipos técnicos y de clientes.Comunicación e influencia.Capacidad de trabajo en equipoAlta motivación para afrontar retos y diseñar aplicaciones innovadoras y transformadoras.Capacidad para desempeñar sus funciones con autonomía, gestionando tiempos e imprevistos.Necesario nivel alto de inglés (escrito y conversacional)

title: Data Scientist (Andorra)
description:
At Gauss & Neumann, we are looking for PhDs, MSc and BS mathematics, physics and engineering to work with us in our office in Andorra. We do Search Engine Marketing (SEM) worldwide and work for international clients. We love and breath technology and everyone at the company has a tech background.We believe that advertising on search engines (SEM) should provide perfect answers to the users. Gauss & Neumann creates data structures and technologies that help our clients deliver a perfect response to queries and provide value to search engine customers like Google or Bing.  What we look for:Professionals with a PhD, MSc or bachelor degree in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or other engineering disciplines. We search for natural problem solvers with initiative that push the needle always a bit further and have the self-discipline to get things done. We look for people that have fun at work and create a great atmosphere with their teammates. We value personal attitude at the very top.  Responsibilities:Design SEM keyword structures for international clientsCreate predictive algorithms for bidding in real timeCreate scripts for optimizing keyword structuresCreate technologies that disrupt the SEM industryData research and visualizationManage campaign daily operations with large clients mainly in the United States. 
What you need to haveBachelor, MSc or PhD level degree in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science or Software Engineering or similar engineering degree.Programming skills ( Python, SQL, PHP, R…). Statistics knowledge
Other skills we valueEnglish fluency (written and verbal)Project management experienceNatural ability to deal with ratios and numbersBeing up to date with programming librariesWillingness to learn and go beyond what's necessary. 
Contract DetailsContract: Full timeSalary: based upon value and experience providedPrivate insurance
LocationOur new office is right in the heart of the capital of Andorra, in the main shopping area in the center, with stunning views of the mountains and in a natural environment.Ideal for those who love outdoors and work surrounded by nature.

description:
Job Requisition ID #

22WD57718

People Team @ Autodesk
Do you take pride in your excellent organizational skills? Do you enjoy questioning and finding solutions? Position Overview
Strong technical and research skills for the creation of reports, global dashboards, and analytics that will be used organization wideStrong collaboration with HR stakeholders to assess and understand program needs and develop sustainable and scalable tools and solutions to meet those needsServe as an active partner to identify and communicate recommendations for people programs including employee attraction and selection, performance, growth, engagement, compensation, diversity and inclusion, and retention
Responsibilities
Work to understand the information held in our people management systems with a goal of maintaining data quality, improving the tools capabilities and the extraction & sharing of relevant informationSupport the strategic direction of the employee relations team, by building reporting and analytics processes and continually evolving the tools and capabilities required to facilitate thisPlay a pivotal role in designing, executing and measuring the effectiveness of employee programs, which will include identifying and solving issuesDeliver analyses and insights to stakeholders in clear business terms and identify results that drive action. Collaborate to ensure reports and dashboards meet current and ongoing needsEmpower HR team with improved tools and training to easily deliver HR programs, and to easily draw business relevant insights from our people dataIdentify trends and patterns through data and develop recommendations to support business objectivesDevelop sustainable and scalable tools and processes to ensure accuracy of master data and train HR on tools and processes to ensure ongoing data integrityIdentify solutions that will raise the bar for all things people-related
Minimum Qualifications
Strong MS Excel, data management and presentation tools skillsAbility to influence stakeholders to drive change and improvements across the businessA strong eye for detail with a focus on quality is essentialExperienced working within a fast-paced environmentQuestioning mind with the ability to challenge the status quo and to conduct research and interpret/present useful insightQuestioning mind with the ability to challenge the status quo and to conduct research and interpret/present useful insightStrong focus on program managementAble to offer ideas to the businessAble to provide detailed analysis for key business projectsAttention to detail, drive and flexibility to deliver great customer serviceExcellent written and oral communication skills to liaise with multiple stakeholders at various levelsExperience working with tools such as PowerBI and Smartsheet is desirable but not essential

Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic.
