title: Senior Product Data Analyst
description:
About Bling
BLING is the first cash-on-demand mobile app. We are experiencing an impressive growth, with more than one million users now. Need a ride? Uber. Need food? Glovo. Need money? BLING.
We are disruptive and unique. We enjoy creating our own rules, bending the way our users relate with their finances and our brand reflects that. BLING is popular, human and modern.
⚡️ We aren't scared to be different, we aim for it.
📍Our offices are based in Paris and Barcelona.
The role
You will be our eyes and ears to keep improving our product and making happier users based on behavioural patterns and actionable insights.We look for a data wizard that can leverage passion and knowledge to push product innovation and growth!
This position will report to the Head of Product in the Barcelona office and work closely with all the teams at Bling!
Your main missions will be : 
Leverage your Data superpowers with us!A/B Product testing: definition of hypotheses, calculation of the necessary sample, analysis of main metrics and making proposals based on the results.Collaboration to define AB Testing best practices and creation of frameworks.Ensure the integrity and quality of our data stackDefine tagging and own the taxonomy in Apps and Web.Main KPIs forecastingCreation of dashboards to monitor AB Tests, track metrics, and provide tools to the different business areas.Analysis of the operation of the site with proposals for improvement.
Requirements
Like us, you’ll be deeply committed to delivering positive outcomes for customers and passionate about shaping the future of Bling.3-5 years of working experience with data analysis/business intelligenceGood understanding of software development and agile methodologies.Excellent SQL skillsSolid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, Jupyter notebooks, and such.Experienced in designing and analysing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)Knowledge of visualisation tools like Tableau, MetaBase, ...Ability to prioritise multiple tasks based on business needs.Ability to communicate and present ideas to stakeholders that facilitate making better decisions based on data.
What we offer you
Full-time permanent contract and competitive salaryBased in our offices in BarcelonaRemote friendly and flexible working hoursEmployee benefits package : Healthcare insurance (100%), language classes (100%), meal vouchersOthers : coffee, snacks, fresh fruit and weekly cross-team lunches at the office
Last but not least - the perks of being a Blinger!
Become part of our family of fun, passionate and multicultural Blingers - +110 team members, with already 25+ nationalities represented!Cool office environment in Paris or Barcelona, with outside areas, ping pong, team events, and so on - you get the vibeBecome part of the next consumer fintech unicorn!

title: IT Auditor & Data Analyst
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
description:
Do you want to join an international team working to improve the future of healthcare? Do you want to improve the lives of millions of people? Grifols is a global healthcare company which, since its foundation in Barcelona in 1909, has been working to improve the health and well-being of people all over the world. Our four divisions - Bioscience, Diagnostic, Hospital and Bio Supplies - develop, produce and market innovative medicines, solutions and services in more than 100 countries and regions.

Who We Are

Help us lead one of the world’s largest pharmaceutical companies.

The Grifols Corporate Internal Audit department provides the Audit Committee and the business units, independent assurance and consulting services that are focused to improve the quality and effectiveness of the governance, risk management and internal controls of the organization.

Reporting to the Chief of Internal Audit and Enterprise Risk Management, the Data Analyst will be responsible for conducting global audit projects across all areas of the three different Grifols’ main Business’ Divisions: Bioscience, Diagnostic and Hospital.

What Your Responsibilities Will Be
 You will participate in the project planning, making suggestions and proposals, and contributing in the establishment of realistic deadlines.  You will assess processes, information and data based on business risks.  You will collect and understand data by collaborating with different stakeholders.  You will design and execute tests to analyze processes and data, verify results and report conclusions.  You will locate and define new process improvement opportunities focusing in improving business efficiency and in the mitigation of business risks.  You will identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets and provide ongoing reports.  You will review the quality of data and assess that the information is aligned with the applicable policies and procedures as well as other external regulations.  You will assess the security of information systems that support data. 

Who You Are
 You have a Bachelor’s degree in business economics, mathematics, statistics, computer science, information technology, or equivalent.  You provide 1-2 years of experience as data analyst or performing IT risk and/or IT audit functions.  You have a High level of English and Spanish.  You have experience in understanding, processing and analyzing processes, systems and data. Knowledge on SAP and/or other ERP systems will be positively valued.  You have experience in using data analytics tools (e.g. ACL, IDEA, SAS, Excel, Access, SQL, etc.…).  You have experience with business intelligence tools (e.g. QlikView, QlikSense, Tableau, etc.…).  You have knowledge of frameworks and experience in the analysis of cybersecurity environments.  You are responsible and methodic, with analytical capabilities, willingness to learn and dynamic.  You have a travel availability up to 30% both domestically and internationally. 

What We Offer

It is a brilliant opportunity for you, Grifols is fully aware that its employees are one of its major assets. We are committed to maintaining an atmosphere that encourages all our employees to develop their professional careers in an excellent working environment.

Information about Grifols is available at www.grifols.com . If you are interested in joining our company and you have what it takes for such an exciting position, then don’t hesitate to apply!

We look forward to receiving your application!

Grifols is an equal opportunity employer.

Contract of Employment: Permanent position

Benefits Package

Flexibility for U Program

Location: SPAIN : España : Sant Cugat del Valles : SC1 

Learn more about Grifols

title: Data scientist | Softonic
description:
About our client: Softonic publishes Softonic.com, the leading global software and app discovery destination, offering the most complete selection of software and apps across hundreds of categories. The European company with one of the largest online audiences, and currently holds 40th position worldwide with more than 100 million unique monthly users who generate more than 4 million daily downloads on Softonic.com.
About the position Softonic is looking for a Data Scientist to join our talented team in Barcelona. In this role you will have the opportunity to work on our state of the art data platform (implemented in GCP) and help us to contribute to keep improving our product.
REQUIREMENTSKey responsibilities
Develop, prototype and test machine learning algorithms that serve all Business Units in the company;Define metrics, data and the testing platform for the evaluation of the algorithms performanceHelp in the definition of new systems, KPIs and required infrastructure for delivering data products within the companyExtract and combine data from different sources: Databases, APIs, Files, … to be autonomous preparing datasets required for the modeling.Translate to “business friendly” language the insights generated from the analysis & models, and present them to all the levels of the organization
Minimum experience and qualifications
Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or Engineering.4+ Years of related experience as a Data Scientist or ML Engineer.A solid understanding of the appropriate statistical and machine learning methods to apply to each type of analysis.Advanced knowledge on SQL Language.Experience on Python.Strong analytical skills.Team playerExcellent written and verbal communication skillsWillingness to learn, experiment and to work autonomously
Nice to have
Experience using Google Cloud Platform;Knowledge of some of the important ML Libraries (TensorFlow, SciKit-Learn, Keras,Previous Experience on an Internet Company.
Why Softonic?
Workplace & benefits:Dining RoomGaming room& TerracesBike & Car ParkingFresh Fruits, Coffee, Snacks & DrinksPizza & Beers Every ThursdayPrivate Health CareLanguage Classes (English & Spanish)Internal Training ProgramDiscounts At Gyms & RestaurantsFlexible Work Schedule ( home office and 2 days/week in the office)Day off at your birthday & other´s evenings off

title: Data Scientist in Sourcing & Procurement - Applied Intelligence team
description:
We are looking for passionate, curious, and driven team players who are ready to ignite ideas, push boundaries and drive innovation. At Accenture you’ll work on innovative projects and develop your career, collaborating with the best teams in the world.

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services at scale in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations.

Part of Accenture Strategy and Consulting, the Barcelona Center of Excellence (see it in action in this video!) has been at the forefront in helping clients from around the globe under the umbrella of intelligent operations for the last 15 years. With a team of over 100 consultants, data scientists and engineers, and leveraging Artificial Intelligence, Analytics, Machine Learning, Simulation & Optimization, among others, we develop cutting-edge assets and solutions to reduce costs and improve supply chain processes.

Zooming into the Sourcing & Procurement Analytics Team, we develop & implement intelligent algorithms solving procurement challenges to help global leading companies maximize value and move towards automation. As part of this group you will grow your skills and capabilities around both, Data Science and Procurement functional knowledge, areas in continuous growth and huge demand for talent in todays’ global economy.

Manager/Consultant Procurement Analytics Role

As part of the Procurement Analytics team, you will have to:

Understand and describe issues and challenges around any Sourcing & Procurement processes.

Interact with business leads to define implementation strategies, business requirements and solution design related to procurement processes.

Outline project tasks and best approach from the client’s problem statement.

Develops simple and easy to understand frameworks and formats to present information & ideas.

Help develop Procurement Analytics offerings and software solutions demonstrations.

Designing Procurement Analytics algorithms and software solutions.

As a data scientist, you also will have to:

Do the extraction, wrangling and enrichment of data from one or multiple sources.

Manipulate data sets, including variables definition, calculations and summarizations.

Develop predictive models and generate data-driven insights to solve industrial challenges.

Develop, train and validate data models, and results visualization through dynamic dashboards.

Develop and maintain analytical models.

Work effectively with offshore development team and provide guidance to ensure quality.

Additionally, you will have to:

Mentor and train junior developers and modelers.

Support Management team on client proposals and other sales activities.

Resolves problems quickly and effectively using creativity and innovation.

Adopt methods and tools that improve personal and team productivity.

Skills you will need:


Engineer / mathematics / physics / economics / science master’s degree or equivalent.

3 to 6 years of relevant experience proving Data Science skills:

process data visualization, statistics/statistical testing, machine learning, data mining, and database structure and management.

Statistical analysis/programming (in tools like R, SAS, PYTHON, SCADA, Spark, MATLAB, Tensor Flow, Torch, Caffe, Excel, CNTK).

Knowledge in visualization tools (like Shiny, Spotfire, Qlikview, Tableau, PowerBI).

Knowledge of full life cycle development methodologies.

3 to 6 years of relevant experience proving Procurement area skills:

Procure-to-Pay Process, Supplier Relationship Mgnt., Contract Mgnt. or Spend Mgnt.

Interaction with business leads to define requirements and solution design related to procurement processes.

Experience with Ariba or Coupa P2P solutions, or equivalent platforms are a plus.

Passion in statistical analysis.

Critical thinking and attention to detail.

Interest in consulting career.

Excel advanced level.

What’s in it for you:

Join the Data Analytics Group for a challenging and rewarding career where the variety of opportunities and projects allows you to develop your potential and grow professionally every day. The only place where you can learn from our unrivaled experience, working alongside over 100 data scientists and Data Engineers, 20% of which are PhD’s in the areas of Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or Statistics.

We offer a competitive salary, an extensive benefits package which includes extra vacations days per year, medical and life insurance, learning opportunities and much more!

Make your move – Apply now!

#BarcelonaInnovationCenter

title: Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
description:
Are you a curious and passionate analyst interested in impacting business decisions with data-driven insights and recommendations? Do you enjoy working with large data sets and applying analytics skills to answer business questions?Scopely's Barcelona office is searching for a Data Analyst with strong SQL and analytics experience to join our Marketing Analytics team to help scale our growing business. You should be a rare breed of business-savvy and analytics powerhouse capable of digging into terabytes of data to drive advanced analysis that helps the company evaluate its marketing and user acquisition investments and monitor ongoing performance to unlock business opportunities.

What You Will Do:
Analyze large, complex data sets representing the behaviour of millions of online and mobile game players to address strategic and operational business questions supporting our Marketing Leadership org.Surface valuable insights to ensure that the capital allocation strategy for our largest area of investment results in the highest and best outcome for the businessDevelop frameworks, models, tools, and processes to ensure data influences decisions at all levelsContribute to the development of jaw-dropping dashboards to more effectively surface the group’s findingsCollaborate with broader analytics teams and functions (BI, Data Viz, Strategic Analytics, Data Science) to develop analytics products.

What You Will Need:
Intellectual curiosity, analytical rigor, hard-working and a good business intuition are a must!2 years of experience as a Data Analyst preferable at a top-tier institution or firm. Previous experience in marketing analytics or user acquisition strongly preferred (Familiarity with CPI, ROAS, ARPU, Retention and LTV is a plus)Critical thinking and problem-solving capabilitiesAdvanced skills in using analytics tools and languages used to manipulate and export data in large data sets (SQL) and to analyze/automate (Python preferred / R). Exposure to Google Cloud Platform and BigQuery is a plus.Working Knowledge of visualization tools: Looker (Preferred), Qlikview, Tableau or PowerBI.Strong presentation skills; ability to communicate complex results throughout an organizationB.S. (Masters degree a plus) from a top institution in a quantitative or scientific field (Math/Stats, Economics, CS, Engineering, Physics, Psychology or similar)A love or strong desire to work with mobile / games


About us:Scopely is a leading mobile games company home to many top-grossing, award-winning franchises including Star Trek™ Fleet Command, Looney Tunes™ World of Mayhem, WWE Champions 2019, The Walking Dead: Road To Survival™, YAHTZEE® With Buddies and Wheel of Fortune®: Free Play, among others. Scopely creates rewarding, immersive games that empower a directed-by-consumer experience. Founded in 2011, Scopely is fueled by a world-class team and a proprietary technology platform that personalizes gameplay at scale across one of the most diversified portfolios in the west. Recognized in Fast Company’s ‘World’s Most Innovative Companies’ and #2 on Deloitte’s ‘Technology Fast 500’ as one of the fastest-growing companies in North America, Scopely has achieved more than $1 billion in lifetime revenue by creating game experiences that are an important part of people’s lives. With global operations in Los Angeles, Barcelona and Dublin (DIGIT Games Studios), and additional studios in seven countries across four continents, Scopely has raised more than $250 million in financing from global entertainment and technology investors.

Scopely is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, family or parental status, gender identity, veteran, or disability status, or other protected status.Candidate information will be treated in accordance with our candidate privacy notice which can be found here: https://scopely.com/scopely-candidate-privacy-notice/

title: Operations Data Engineer
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
description:
Would you like to be part of an EdTech project with a social impact? Innovamat needs people like you!  
About our project 🚀Innovamat is an educational project that revolutionizes the learning of Mathematics. We transform the classroom to excite, motivate and stimulate boys and girls, promoting meaningful learning. To achieve this, we offer schools quality resources, manipulative material, teacher training, a self-adaptive and self-correcting gamified platform and personalized advice. In other words, we work to make Math accessible and exciting, providing our students with the tools they need to confront the world around us with a critical mind. 
Company Situation 🏢Innovamat is a didactic proposal with:More than 1200 schools working with us in Spain. Some schools at Chile and Ecuador.A gamified platform that allows individualized learning so each student can keep up with it.More than 5000 resources that help improve maths learning.A network of experts who train and advise teachers on the didactics of mathematics.Many opportunities to have a direct impact on our educational system. 
Your mission at Innovamat 🎯You will be part of our Operations team, and you will play a key role in helping to optimize all revenue/finance processes. 
Day-to-day life at Innovamat 🏁Collaborating with Sales, Meeting Generation and Customer Success to enhance revenue department effectiveness and productivity through process optimization and new software evaluation, testing and implementation.Give solutions about all the requeriments of Finance team. Spreading Innovamat around the world by designing repeatable and scalable processes. Ensuring Revenue/Finance data quality: Implementing regular data governance and hygiene/quality processes. Proactively monitoring and maintaining high levels of quality, accuracy, and process consistency, and identifying opportunities for improvement.Proactively identifying gaps and errors in data and reporting, and working towards improving these areas. 
Who are you 🔍Engineering degree or similar.An analytical mindset, work autonomy and good communication skills.Passion for our proposal.Knowledge of spreadsheets and SQL or willingness to learn.Knowledge of ERP or willingess to learn. Ability to multitask.Quick learner, great problem solver and self-motivated team player.An eager beaver willing to be in a challenging environment.And above all... desire to change the world and have fun!  
What can you expect from us 🤗Full-time with flexible schedules.A personal and professional development and growth plan in a young, enthusiastic and dynamic environment.Team building days and the Innovamat Retreat at least a couple of times a year.A Trust & Thrust culture:Honest and respectful communication.The importance of teamwork.The feeling of belonging based on trust and responsibility.The intensity, rhythm and self-demand at work.And all the coffee, water, milk and tea, separately or mixed, that you can drink 😉 
… And if that isn’t enough, you will have the opportunity to transform the education sector and see how more and more girls and boys rediscover and become passionate about Mathematics 🙌

title: Product Data Analyst (Full remote within Spain)
description:
Life is too short to work for a boring company, so why don’t you join us? We are looking for a Product Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. This position works in concert with the Project Manager on determining product usability, requirements and prioritization. Your main mission will be to define and execute analyses of our users and companies with the objective of identifying trends, opportunities, and problems to improve the product.

The ideal candidate will have interest in the eCommerce world, possess good communication and great analytical skills. Overall, the individual will be an active part of an organization focused on innovative business architecture design, operational execution, and channel integration.

Does that sound like you?

But first, let’s break the ice!

Who We Are & What We Do

At Leadtech, we work hard... and play harder! Our mission is to bring forward new business ideas and empower employees to achieve their goals in the online business world.

Since 2009, we have been fostering innovative and creative techniques across many industries, making us pioneers in online project management.

Leadtech is dedicated to constant improvement and inspiring new ideas daily for the world we live in and the future to come.

If you have a creative and innovative mind, Leadtech is looking for you!

Does this still look like your cup of tea? There’s more

Key Responsibilities

You’re our perfect candidate if you:
Perform analysis to understand user behaviour and proactively propose solutions based on the findings of this research.Monitoring on a daily basis KPI’s and understanding the product performance.Exploring data to find actionable insights and make product recommendations through funnels, cohort analyses, long-term trends, user segmentation, regression models, and more.Be a steward of data quality, ensuring that metrics and KPIs are consistently reported across the catalogue of dashboards and data products.Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualisation tools and dashboards.Support the process of AB testing by choosing the right metrics to optimise, set up the tracking, analyse the results and provide recommendationAlign with engineering teams to ensure data availability/quality of new features and data sources.

Requirements

Your expertise in a nutshell:
Graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or related fieldsAt least 2 years of experience as a Data AnalystExperience with defining high-level KPIsExceptional analytical skills and data-driven mindset.Experience running A/B tests (or exposure to A/B testing concepts)Excellent communicator.Excellent data presentation and visualisation skills.You are passionate about technology and used to working with IT Teams.Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.Problem solver and results-driven, with a can-do attitude.Ability to work independently and interface with all levels of management negotiating and influencing to build consensus.Advanced level in English and Spanish (written and spoken), ideally with experience in international environmentsGoogle Sheets/Excel proficiency

Interested? Keep on reading!

Benefits

Some of the perks of working with us:
Competitive salaryFull-time, permanent contractPrivate health insurance25 days of holiday + your birthday offFlexible vacation time (no blackout days)Flextime (7 - 09.30h / 15:30 - 18.30h)Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!)35-hour week for the full month of August (free afternoons!)Flexibility to work from homeOther benefits paid from the gross salary (ticket restaurant, nursery tickets)Team-building activitiesMonthly afterworkFree coffee and snacksFree fresh fruitPermanent internal training + annual budget for external trainingGames room (Nintendo, table tennis, futbolín)Terrace at the officeAn innovative approach to all internal processes and businessesWork with the latest technologies + career progress opportunities

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer:

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Hiring process
First step: 30-minute phone interview to get to know youSecond step: Skill assessment testThird step: Online interview with HR and your future manager to talk about the position and how we approach work

Sounds good? Apply now!

We’re looking forward to meeting you.

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you. If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona’s Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you’ll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you’ll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be processed in order to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by writing to our address (Avenida del Maresme, 44-46 08918 Badalona) or to the email address protecciondedatos@ Leadtech.com, attaching to your request a document that can validate your identity.

title: Senior Data Analyst (Mobile)
description:
NOTICE: ONLINE RECRUITMENT PROCESSLOCATION: KRAKÓW OR REMOTELY FROM POLAND  
The Mobile Team in Brainly is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to cooperate closely with the Senior Manager Product - Mobile on strategic analytical problems. Your recommendations will influence the shape of the individualised engagement experience in-app. You will also be a partner in the process of decision making regarding our monetisation strategy. To help you deliver, you will become an integral member of our data-driven and user-oriented data analysts team, ready to support and share knowledge whenever needed.

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?Make an impact on a product used on a global scale – Brainly is used by 350+ million users monthly in 35 countriesTransform the world of online education by developing related products for students, parents, and teachers around the globe - your impact on our product is immediate!Work with the newest technology stack (Google Analytics 360, Google Optimize, Tableau, AWS, Google Cloud Platform) and with scrum values which will bring you maximal productivity and joy of workCooperate with our Analytics Center of Excellence on your professional development - having a well defined career path, building your professional development plan, having access to various learning resources, live trainings and growth opportunitiesBe part of our Brainly Data Analytics Community that enables you to learn from and share knowledge with all Data Analysts across BrainlyParticipate in Data Analytics Bootcamp - structured onboarding experience that gives you the opportunity to learn about our key metrics, data structures, tools and to meet other data analystsPlethora of learning opportunities provided by our Learning and Development department - possibility to participate in training about communication, leadership, presentation skills, design thinking and more!

WHAT WILL YOU DO?Working closely with Senior Product Manager - Mobile on strategic analytical projectsSupporting Product managers in their decisions about product developmentCreating analytical frameworks for different aspects of User Engagement and Monetization in-appDefining KPIs and measurement plansWorking as a domain expert for mobile apps analytics - working on business and technical definitions of KPIs connected to mobile appsGuiding other Data Analysts in their professional growth as well as day to day work

WHAT WILL YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN THIS ROLE?
ExperienceRequired4+ years of experience in a data/product analyst position, preferably in the mobile areaExperience with statistical analysisExperience with supporting senior (business) stakeholders in the data-driven decision-making process (defining KPIs, delivering insights, providing recommendations)PreferredExperience in using BigQuery for raw Google Analytics data processing and analysisExperimentation/AB testing
Skills and systemsRequiredWorking knowledge of SQLExcellent knowledge of Google Analytics (UA/GA4)Excellent data presentation and visualisation skillsGoogle Sheets/Excel proficiencyTableau or other data visualisation toolExcellent communication and organisational skillsStrong collaborative skillsFluent English (in speaking and writing)PreferredKnowledge of Python/RExperience in Firebase

ADDITIONAL DETAILSSome of our benefits:Flexible working hours and the possibility to work remotelyPersonal development budget 800$ per year + unlimited time off policy for participation in conferences and workshops and access to an online learning platform with courses from Udemy, Harvard Manage Mentor and many othersFull medical insurance (including partner and children)Gym & wellness card (including access to gyms, sports classes)Access to the Mental Health Helpline - providing virtual support of external psychologists, psychotherapists, and coachesPossibility to join one of our Employee Resource Groups and initiatives (Inclusion Council, Ladies at Brainly, Brainly Cares)If needed, additional budget for work remote work accessories

By sending us your application, you agree that Brainly sp. z o.o. with its seats in Krakow, will process your data contained in the form below and in the documents you attach in to participate in recruitment. In connection with this, you have the right to withdraw your consents, the right to access to your data, the right to obtain their copy, rectify them, erase, limit their usage and also data portability right and object to their use by Brainly, as well as to lodge a complaint with the President of the UODO. If you have any questions regarding the use of information about you and exercising your rights related to this use, please contact our DPO - privacy@brainly.com.

title: Data Scientist
description:
DESCRIPTION
As a Data Scientist, you will be able to witness the beginnings of building a data-driven culture and implementing predictive models into our products at MENU, as well as get the opportunity to take a leading role in making it happen.
The Data Scientist is responsible for providing insights to the product team to help them understand our business, product and customers better. The insights provided by the Data Scientist will help the team take better and more informed decisions that result in improved business outcomes for our customers and us.Additionally, the Data Scientist is responsible for taking the lead to implement machine learning models into our products to power features such as personalized recommendations, engagement optimization and predictive reports.
We are just starting to take a data-driven approach to build a commerce platform that allows restaurants to create a better experience for their guests and grow their business, and are looking for someone that is willing to pull their sleeves up and get their hands dirty to lay the groundwork for a new and growing expertise within the organization.

Type of contract: Permanent
The key functions of the Data Scientist include:
Collaborate with your product team to understand business problems and areas of insights that would be valuable to product developmentPerform exploratory data analysis to deliver insights to your teamContinuously monitor KPIs and metrics as product changes are implemented to determine successDesign and execute product experimentsDevelop machine learning technology strategy and implementation planDesign and implement data pipelines and infrastructureWork with designers, developers, QA engineers and product managers to integrate your models into customer-facing productsGrow the Data Science expertise within the organization, including recruiting, defining standards and developing best practices
REQUIREMENTS:
Minimum 5 years of experience in a data analysis roleMinimum 3 years of experience developing production machine learning and predictive analytics modelsPrevious experience working in an agile and cross-functional product teamStrong SQL skills and experienceExperience with business intelligence tools (Tableau, Power BI, Mode or similar) and data warehousesExperience with Python and Python-based data science and machine learning librariesExperience building large-scale modelsStrong written and verbal communication skills to interact with a wide audience: customers, development, product management and senior management teamsDemonstrated ability to successfully manage multiple projects under limited Willingness to do what it takes to ensure the team accomplishes its goalsCritical thinker with strong analytical and problem-solving skills and “can-do” attitudeAttention to detailAbility to dive deep into technical details, while maintaining an understanding of the big pictureStrong English language skills
Nice to Have
Experience deploying ML models on AWSExperience with deep learning frameworks and modelsExperience working for a B2B SaaS company
OUR OFFER:
Opportunity to participate in creating a global industry-changing productGreat international team and informal start-up atmosphereStrong company culture and team spiritOpportunity to learn and improve technical and soft skillsPossibilities for career development as the company grows25 vacation daysCompetitive salaryEquity incentivesHome office
We thank all applicants for their interest, however only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Data Engineer Trainee
description:
Our opportunity 

We are looking for an Intern to join the CBD-Intel team! This is an exciting opportunity as we offer:

 Interesting and challenging tasks in a friendly environment  Significant learning experiences: a hands-on introduction to real world data processes working directly with senior management  Opportunities to work on real world data gathering and processing techniques 

 Your role 

 As a Data Engineer Trainee,  you will assist CBD-Intel management and analysts in with: 

 Data collection, cleaning, and pre-processing  Building and running scraping operations  You will be doing data analysis for different clients  Use programming languages like Scala or python.  Participate in cloud-based projects (Azure & AWS)  Updating databases and serving data requests to the analytics team  Evaluating the quality and identifying the areas of improvement  You will learn about product development methodologies, like data ops and agile, but also about product discovery and delivery 

Your Skills And Experience

 As a Data Engineer Trainee your skills and qualifications will ideally include: 

 Studying a degree/master's degree related to science, statistics, computing or technical subjects in Spanish University  Knowledge of programming language, Python or similar  Fluent in English: B2  Open mind to join a team and work within an international context  Duration of the internship as long as the university allows  Flexible work 

Additional Information

Primary work location is Barcelona Poblenou, with opportunity to work remotely.  Internship Agreement with actual Spanish University/School is mandatory.  You can apply with your English CV by clicking on the button “Apply online”

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.
