title: Operations Data Engineer
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
description:
Would you like to be part of an EdTech project with a social impact? Innovamat needs people like you!

About Our Project 🚀

Innovamat is an educational project that revolutionizes the learning of Mathematics. We transform the classroom to excite, motivate and stimulate boys and girls, promoting meaningful learning. To achieve this, we offer schools quality resources, manipulative material, teacher training, a self-adaptive and self-correcting gamified platform and personalized advice.

In other words, we work to make Math accessible and exciting, providing our students with the tools they need to confront the world around us with a critical mind.

Company Situation 🏢

Innovamat Is a Didactic Proposal With
More than 1200 schools working with us in Spain. Some schools at Chile and Ecuador.A gamified platform that allows individualized learning so each student can keep up with it.More than 5000 resources that help improve maths learning.A network of experts who train and advise teachers on the didactics of mathematics.Many opportunities to have a direct impact on our educational system.
Your mission at Innovamat 🎯

You will be part of our Operations team, and you will play a key role in helping to optimize all revenue/finance processes.

Day-to-day life at Innovamat 🏁
Collaborating with Sales, Meeting Generation and Customer Success to enhance revenue department effectiveness and productivity through process optimization and new software evaluation, testing and implementation.Give solutions about all the requeriments of Finance team. Spreading Innovamat around the world by designing repeatable and scalable processes. Ensuring Revenue/Finance data quality: Implementing regular data governance and hygiene/quality processes. Proactively monitoring and maintaining high levels of quality, accuracy, and process consistency, and identifying opportunities for improvement.Proactively identifying gaps and errors in data and reporting, and working towards improving these areas.
Who are you 🔍
Engineering degree or similar.An analytical mindset, work autonomy and good communication skills.Passion for our proposal.Knowledge of spreadsheets and SQL or willingness to learn.Knowledge of ERP or willingess to learn. Ability to multitask.Quick learner, great problem solver and self-motivated team player.An eager beaver willing to be in a challenging environment.
And above all... desire to change the world and have fun!

What can you expect from us 🤗
Full-time with flexible schedules.A personal and professional development and growth plan in a young, enthusiastic and dynamic environment.Team building days and the Innovamat Retreat at least a couple of times a year.A Trust & Thrust culture:Honest and respectful communication.The importance of teamwork.The feeling of belonging based on trust and responsibility.The intensity, rhythm and self-demand at work.And all the coffee, water, milk and tea, separately or mixed, that you can drink 😉
… And if that isn’t enough, you will have the opportunity to transform the education sector and see how more and more girls and boys rediscover and become passionate about Mathematics 🙌

title: Data Engineer
description:
Who We Are

Bitpanda is on a mission to reinvent the world of finance and bring investing closer to everyone, everywhere. Today’s financial ecosystem is complex, exclusive and expensive, and we’re here to change this as the #1 investment platform in Europe and beyond. Our platform is rooted in the belief that investing should be safe, easy and accessible to all. With Bitpanda, everyone has the freedom and flexibility to invest in what they believe in - commission-free stocks, cryptocurrencies or even precious metals - starting from as little as $1.

Our story started in 2014 with our founders, Eric Demuth, Paul Klanschek and Christian Trummer. Since then, we’ve grown to a powerful and diverse team of 700+ people who represent more than 50 nationalities. Headquartered in Vienna, we’re proud to be Austria’s first unicorn and one of the fastest-growing fintechs in Europe. Our innovative technology serves over 3 million users and operates across multiple hub locations. Our products are built by fast-moving, talented, “roll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen” kind of people. If you’re someone who thinks big, moves fast and wants to make an impact right from day one, then get ready to join our industry-changing team. Let’s go!

Your mission

Do you want to develop data pipelines and do innovative work on the data processing frameworks and architectures with the ability to scale intelligently? Then join the Bitpanda Data Platform Engineering team!

What you’ll do
 Opportunity to build and define the data initiatives for the company  Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a variety of data sources using AWS technologies  Implement data pipelines and data integration solutions with Python and Java languages  Ensure accuracy and timeliness of data is maintained in the data layer  Clean and wrangle data into a usable state that are ready to be used by our Product and Engineering teams  Debug, troubleshoot, and improve cloud-based applications  Work on improvements to current data architecture 

 Who you are
 3+ years of related work experience  Experience working in projects with data integration and data gathering methodologies and APIs  Demonstrated ability to understand requirements and deliver accurate results according to scope  Experience with AWS services and Service-Oriented Architecture  Experienced in at least one of the following languages: Python, Java, Scala  Understanding of ETL/ELT infrastructures and Cloud architectures  Experience working with a variety of APIs (e.g., REST API or SOAP API)  Experience with event driven Architectures and tools such as Kafka  Knowledge of version control systems such as GIT  Demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor, team oriented, energetic, collaborative, diplomatic, and flexible style  Intellectually curious and continuously striving to learn 

What’s In It For You
 Top-notch “tech pack” (a.k.a.: the latest and greatest hardware) that you need to help Bitpanda move the needle, right from day one. The best part? You can choose between PC or Mac. And yes, noise-cancelling headphones are included!  An attractive individual stock option plan* in a high growth company, and a competitive salary *our stock option plan is available to all permanent employees Exclusive premiums when trading on Bitpanda  Occasional company-wide and team events - both in-person and virtually!  Learning & development opportunities  A brand new, optimised-for-hybrid-working, HQ office located in Vienna’s fintech hub (in the second district) as well as local office location hotspots in Berlin, London, Madrid, Barcelona and Milan (to name just a few!)  Bitpanda sustainable merch to keep you swagged out and living the Bitpanda brand  A global Bitpanda team of fast-moving, talented, “roll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen” kind of people who are united (across cultures and time zones) by our unique way of working. *These benefits do not apply for our internships.

And, above all, the opportunity to learn & grow as part of Bitpanda’s incredible journey to become Europe’s #1 investment platform.

Bitpanda is committed to fostering a fair and equal environment based on trust and mutual respect. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace is paramount to our success and we are committed to building a team that represents a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.

title: Senior Data Analyst / Data Scientist : Courses
description:
At Domestika we are hiring a Senior Data Analyst/Scientist to work closely with the Programming (Courses) team!

Domestika is the fastest-growing creative community where the best creative experts share their knowledge and skills through professionally produced online courses. It all started as an online forum and a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other. Today, the online community is home to over 6 million people from around the world who are curious and passionate about learning new creative skills.

Team
Data:
The data team partners with all parts of the business to aid decision-making and define measurement frameworks across Domestika. This position is part of Growth Analytics, reporting to the Director of Growth Analytics. You will also work closely with others in the data group such as Product Analytics & Data Engineering.
Programming:
The Programming team is responsible for setting and optimizing the strategy of our course development in Domestika.

Projects

All Analysts in Domestika have their feet in two worlds. On the one hand they must be technical leaders who have the skills to extract, analyze, and visualize data. On the other hand they are partners for their functional teams to measure, support and challenge decision making and strategy.

For this position, some of the specific projects and areas for exploration will include:
 Which topics have a good market opportunity to develop courses? Once we launch a course, how can we measure its quality for our users? Can we predict and measure the incremental revenue of a course? With segmentation & personalization, how can we find the best course for each user?
Requirements
High level of SQL. You are comfortable navigating raw data and creating aggregate tables. You are comfortable doing this autonomously, but asking for help on occasion from your peers is more than ok. Basic select queries are something you can do with your eyes closed once you are comfortable with the data. You have used window functions to do more complex analyses, but if not, are happy to learn.Visualization of analysis, reporting, & models. You have used one or more of the popular visualization tools, like Tableau, Looker, or others. In any case, you are able & motivated to pick up new tools, and understand what makes a useful visualization. You have no issue creating quick charts in Excel / Google Sheets to share quick analysis, but at the same time understand the consultation process that comes with building longer-lasting dashboards. You much prefer to build something that people will use for a long time, than something that will only be used for a specific analysis.Measurement & Testing Analysis. You understand well the principles of measurement, statistics, and typical user behavior related to pricing & marketing. With all of these, you are equipped to consult on how best to measure the effect of changes, or strategies, and in turn how to improve them. AB testing digital products, in general, is something you have some experience with, but you are also aware of measurement frameworks that don’t necessarily involve formal testing, like attribution, causal impact, or regression.Curiosity & Creativity. Data at Domestika is not a service function. We are creative partners who solve problems and consult on all areas of the business. You should be ready to challenge, to analyze, to improve, to optimize, and to recommend. At the same time, you are humble, collaborative, and driven ultimately by the motivation to make Domestika an amazing experience for our users, and an amazing place to work for your friends and colleagues.Ownership & Product / Project Management. Seniority at Domestika is not about years of experience, it is about autonomy and impact. In this position, you will need to demonstrate ownership and leadership in your area. This means identifying opportunities, scoping and defining projects, prioritizing them, and ultimately managing and being responsible for their success.
Bonus Skills
You have experience in for content / curation-driven platforms, learning & technology platforms, or digital-first consumer industries like mobile apps, gaming.You are fascinated by human behavior, with some expertise in fields like behavioral psychology, microeconomics, or neuroscience.More advanced skills using R/Python for machine learning & programming, working with APIs, or data modeling & engineering experience.
What do we offer?
Working in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.A fun, creative, collaborative, and multicultural team.Domestika pro-account to have access to all of our courses for free.Possibility to work remotely.Private health insurance.A salary according to your experience and profile.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Company Overview
Headquartered in Barcelona (Spain) Rakuten TV is the leading Video On-Demand platform in Europe providing users an all-in-one content universe just on a click. The company is continuously growing and expanding the scope of its services.
Rakuten TV is available today in 42 countries and is part of Rakuten Group, one of the world’s leading internet services companies. Rakuten is also known for its partnerships with FC Barcelona, the NBA, the Golden State Warriors and Davis Cup.

ROLE: Data Engineer
Rakuten TV is looking for a highly analytical Data Engineer to join our Business Intelligence team, in Barcelona. You will also be working with teams from around the Globe, in Barcelona, Paris and Tokyo.
Responsibilities  · Design and Development of data pipelines to ingest, normalize and clean data.· Development and monitoring of daily ETL process to assure data integrity and timely delivery.· Effectively communicate results and insights with other stakeholders throughout the organization through regular KPI reporting and analysis
Requirements and Experience
· 3-5 years of related experience as a Data Engineer.· Strong knowledge of SQL and Python.· Experience with ETL using Pentaho, Talend, Matillon or any other workflow tools.· Experience in Cloud based platforms such as Snowflake, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud.· Experience working with version control (GIT).· Experience working with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlikview, Power BI is a plus.
Some good reasons to apply
Opportunity to work for a leading company and a global technology conglomerate.Promotion possibilities in a fast growth environment.Great work environment, 2 blocks away from Barcelona beach.Culturally diverse and inclusive environment, with people from approx. 30 different nationalities.Private Medical Insurance, extra money for meal card/commuting card and other benefits.Free Language Classes on-site and interesting trainings and sponsorships.

title: Data Engineer
description:

Nuestro objetivo es cambiar el mundo con la tecnología y el dato, ¿Te unes?

title: Data Engineer
description:
MoonPay builds payments infrastructure for cryptocurrencies. Our on- and off-ramp suite of products provides a seamless experience for converting between fiat and crypto using all major payment methods in over 160 countries. Our mission is to make cryptocurrencies accessible to over a billion people by 2030! 🚀

We are trusted by 250+ leading wallets, websites, and applications. Some of the biggest crypto brands in the world, including Bitcoin.com, Dapper Labs, OpenSea, Argent, ZenGo, Trust Wallet and Spot, rely on our technology. Through these partnerships alone, our products are used by over 5 million users worldwide. 🌎

One of the great things about working at MoonPay is that we are remote first. Our global team spans 25+ countries, and we pride ourselves on having a connected and inclusive culture that empowers people to do their best work. We give our team autonomy to move fast, innovate and take responsibility. Join us in our mission to build a better financial world!

We are very proud of our values and expect all those who join us to help us proactively drive and improve our culture, aligned to these values.
B - Be HumbleL - Lead with EmpathyO - Own ItC - Communicate ClearlyK - Kaizen 

The team ❤️

Our newly formed data team is here to build up and serve a best in class data platform to the whole company. This is a greenfield project so you will be able to play your part in key decisions and our strategy from the outset.

Tech Stack 💻

GCP, AWS, BigQuery, Postgres, Python, Airflow, DBT, Looker

What You’ll Do 👀

Working closely with the rest of the data team and the wider company you will be part of a team ensuring the constant availability of clean, usable data and data services. As a key member of the data team you would be expected to come with good experience and knowledge from previous data roles. With the support of more senior members of the data engineering team you would be expected to further develop your skills and knowledge, while at the same time helping to mentor more junior members of the team. While we are not expecting you to come in with full architecture plans your ideas will be listened to from day one.

You should apply if ✅
Fluent in python, including tests and at least some of the data libraries.Experience in writing tests, both code and data with a strong desire to champion those standards.Experience with a number of differing data storage solutions, SQL and NoSQL databases, data warehouses, data lakes etc.Cloud experience (ideally GCP but transferable skills from other cloud providers is also fine).Fluent is SQL (exact flavour doesn’t really matter), with experience in using window functions and the more advanced features. Experience with Airflow or similar orchestration toolFamiliarity with shell scripting languages (eg bash)Understanding of Docker & kubernetesGood understanding of data warehouse structuringFull grasp of gitAbility to work under pressure, we’re a fast paced startup, you’ll be working on many different things day to day.Good communication skills in English.

Nice to have:
Experience/familiarity with other languagesExperience with streaming technologies, eg KafkaExperience with DBT, Spark, Beam Experience in designing data systems from scratchExperience with TerraformFamiliarity with production quality ML and/or AI model developmentExperience working in startupsExperience within crypto and/or fintech

Research has shown that women are less likely than men to apply for this role if they do not have solid experience in 100% of these areas. Please know that this list is indicative and that we would still love to hear from you even if you feel you only are a 75% match. Skills can be learnt, diversity cannot.

We promote a diverse and inclusive culture at MoonPay.

Logistics 🛠

Unfortunately, we are unable to offer visas of any kind at this time!

Our interview process takes place on Google Hangouts and tends to consist of the following stages:
Initial screen (30-45 minutes)Remote take-home task Final interview (2 hours)

Please let us know if you require any accommodations for the interview process, and we’ll do our best to provide assistance.

Benefits 💰
Stock options 📈Unlimited holidays 🏝Home office equipment allowance of $600 USD (or local equivalent) 🪑Working in a disruptive and fast-growing industry where the possibilities are endless 🚀Fully remote: your life, your way of working 🌎Freedom, autonomy and responsibility 💪Annual company retreat 🧘♀️

title: Product Data Developer
description:
Our opportunity 

Zurich is looking for a full-time a product data developer to join our growing product development team in Barcelona. Our team’s mission is to ideate, prototype and develop innovative data products for both internal as well as external customers.

The most important characteristic of our team is that we operate with a startup mentality. We are open minded and embrace new ideas and technologies. You will work as part of a cross-functional team to build new products for an international customer base.

At Zurich we are proud to be one of the world’s leading insurance groups, and one of the few to operate on a global basis. Our mission is to help our customers understand and protect themselves from risk.

Do you enjoy developing new products? Join us!

 Your role 

 As a  Product Data Developer  your main responsibilities will involve 

 Being responsible for the transformation of (raw) data into useful formats for analysis and decision-support  Understanding and aligning with the Architecture team on data architectures for ingestion, processing, and surfacing data for large-scale (enterprise) data intensive applications  Implementing data solutions including interfaces and making the data available for reporting/visualization functionalities  Feed management of input and output data for analysis and reporting  Interacting with clients, product managers, product owners, designers, business analysts and developers to envision, model and provide initial datasets  Proposing, maintaining, designing, and developing databases and information systems according to business requirements and in compliance with the standards.  Watching market trends in data engineering and bringing opportunities of significant impact to the business (e.g. architecture, languages, technology...) 

Your Skills And Experience

 As a Product Data Developer your skills and qualifications will ideally include: 

 4+ years of experience extracting and manipulating data to drive projects  B.A. or B.S. degree with a quantitative focus in Economics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Math, Statistics, Operations Research, or equivalent training  Proficiency in querying and manipulating complex raw datasets for analysis using SQL  Experience modelling data in SQL Server databases, having participated in projects involving data marts, datawarehouses and data lakes.  Experience defining data architectures for ingestion, processing, and surfacing data for enterprise products. with one+ of these tools: SSIS, Informatica, Azure Data Factory, AWS data pipelines.  Experience with reporting and data visualization tools (with preference for Power BI)  Advanced degree with a quantitative focus (Economics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Math, Statistics or other relevant disciplines)  The motivation to learn and constantly improve processes and tools  The people skills required to work with platform engineers, data architects, designers, developers, product owners and business stakeholders  Fluency in English (spoken and written)  You’re proud of your work and always strive for quality 

 Nice to have: 

 Insurance, finance, or consulting experience  Knowledge of other data analytics tools/languages (Databricks, Python, R, etc.)  Experience in defining end-to-end product solutions at the operational level  Experience working with non-technical business level customers to understand data requirements  The hunger for transforming the (raw) data into useful formats for analysis and decision-support 

Additional Information

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:

 Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 100% - you choose  Flexible working hours  Wide range of internal and external trainings  Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on the needs  Ticket restaurant  Life Insurance  Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company  Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you  Special banking and insurance conditions  Exclusive Employees discounts 

Primary work location is Barcelona, Poblenou. Please apply with your CV in English by clicking on the button “Apply online”.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

 Diversity & Inclusion 

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

title: Desarrollador Big Data en remoto
description:
Hay dos palabras que nos definen: talento y tecnología, porque en Indizen by Scalian no entendemos una sin la otra. Nosotros ofrecemos soluciones sencillas e innovadoras a problemas complejos, que tienen un impacto positivo y sostenible en las organizaciones y en la sociedad. El objetivo del proyecto es redefinir el proceso de cálculo, análisis y reporte de Capital Económico, manteniendo la diversificación en todos los niveles y cubriendo los requerimientos regulatorios, locales y corporativos.

Contamos con acceso a plataformas externas de contenido en modalidad premium, así como plataformas internas con contenido abierto para que lo disfrutes cuando tú quieras y a tu ritmo.📝 Contrato indefinido🕐 Jornada completa con horario flexible para facilitar la conciliación entre vida familiar y profesional.✔️ Retribución flexible (seguro médico, cheque restaurante, cheque guardería, transporte público...)🌏 Como parte del grupo Scalian, abrimos nuestras fronteras y crecemos internacionalmente.♻️ En el grupo apostamos por iniciativas sostenibles.✅ Apostamos por el bienestar del empleado mediante al acceso a una extensa red de gimnasios y otras instalaciones con un descuento y otros beneficios.¿Quieres saber más?Si hemos despertado tu curiosidad, inscríbete o envía tu CV a n.casanovas@indizen.com con el asunto "Desarrollador/a Big Data".Ref. (2364)

title: Big Data Engineer (Spark/Scala)
description:
Si eres un apasionado de los Datos y estás buscando nuevos retos profesionales ¡esto te puede interesar!
Nuestra Comunidad Tecnológica experta en Big Data/BI no para de crecer y necesitamos incorporar un equipo de INGENIEROS BIG DATA que estén listos para un nuevo desafío. Será necesaria amplia experiencia en SPARK y SCALA.
¿Qué esperamos de ti?
Será fundamental experiencia con herramientas de procesamiento de datos batch y en streaming (SPARK y SCALA)
VALORABLE: Apache Kafka (o Apache Flink), y el uso de esta solución en flujos de ETL.
Experiencia con grandes entornos de almacén de datos y procesos/programación ETL.
Sólidas habilidades analíticas y de resolución de problemas.
Experiencia con SQL/noSQL relacionadas con el trabajo con datos estructurados y no estructurados.
Experiencia de trabajo con diseño y programación orientada a objetos (la programación funcional es un plus) y herramientas de desarrollo como GIT.
Valoraremos experiencia con AWS, Azure o cualquier otra plataforma en la nube.
Comprensión de las mejores prácticas de desarrollo de software
Valoraremos un buen nivel de inglés pala alguna posición ya que ciertos squads son internacionales
¿Cómo será tu día a día?
Garantizar la trazabilidad de los datos desde los orígenes hasta las estructuras de datos decisionales y analíticas.
Colaborar con nuestro equipo de Ingenieros de Datos, con el fin de construir sobre soluciones de integración de datos (ETL) altamente escalables utilizando plataformas de computación en la nube de clase mundial que combinan una gran variedad de fuentes de datos.
Colaborar con el equipo de la Plataforma de Datos para garantizar el uso correcto de nuestra infraestructura de datos, conjuntos de datos y herramientas disponibles.
Establecer y coordinar estándares de calidad de datos para cubrir las necesidades de las partes interesadas.
Definición de arquitecturas Big Data tanto en batch como en streaming.

¿Qué más podemos hacer por tí? 
22 días de vacaciones, 2 días de libre disposición + 24 y 31 de Diciembre (cierre de empresa)
Trabajamos en entornos agile, flexible, con máxima conciliación y teletrabajo y equipos horizontales de trabajo con una cultura de colaboración, compromiso e innovación. Si aún no te ves capaz de tener una conversación con la reina Isabel II puedes llegar hasta ese nivel con 𝐧𝐮𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐬 𝐜𝐥𝐚𝐬𝐞𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐠𝐥é𝐬. 💂 
Sabemos que te gusta comer en restaurantes y que a veces no vas para no gastar tanto dinero. Con la 𝐫𝐞𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐛𝐮𝐜𝐢ó𝐧 𝐟𝐥𝐞𝐱𝐢𝐛𝐥𝐞 en tickets restaurante podrás ahorrarte unos eurillos. También en cheques guardería, tarjeta de transporte y seguro médico. 🍕🍼🚈💊 
El ir a trabajar no es solo mirar correos y atender peticiones. ¿Te imaginas hacer un scape room virtual con tus compañeros o unirte a un club de ajedrez? Durante todo el año hacemos actividades de 𝐭𝐞𝐚𝐦 𝐛𝐮𝐢𝐥𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 para todos los gustos. 🎮♟ 
Si tienes un amigo del que no puedes despegarte, ¡haz que se una a la 𝐅𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐚𝐚𝐭!. Si crees que encaja en alguno de nuestros perfiles y se une a nosotros tendrás un premio 🤑 🤑 
¡Los eventos son lo nuestro! Tenemos dos grandes congresos además de webinars, formaciones internas hechas por técnicos de atSistemas o meetups. 
Y si todo esto te parece poco, tenemos 𝐦𝐮𝐮𝐮𝐜𝐡𝐚𝐬 𝐬𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐚𝐬 que vamos realizando a lo largo del año. Puedes verlas aquí: https://www.atsistemas.com/es/unete/propuesta-valor 
¡Ah! Se nos olvidaba decirte que Los Reyes Magos también se pasan por atSistemas...

title: Data Analytics Engineer
description:
DescriptionWallbox is a global company, dedicated to changing the way the world uses energy. We do this by creating smart charging systems that combine innovative technology with outstanding design and manage the communication between vehicle, grid, building, and charger.
Founded in 2015, with headquarters in Barcelona and selling already in over 80+ countries, our mission is to facilitate the adoption of electric vehicles today to make more sustainable use of energy tomorrow. Our talent has no borders - we welcome over 700 Wallboxers from over 45 nationalities in Europe, Asia, and the Americas!
We’re now the first Spanish unicorn listed on the NYSE ($WBX) and have been recently named amongst LinkedIn’s top 3 Spanish startups.
In day-to-day life, you will see our core values shining through our Wallboxers. The passion and dedication towards our mission will hit you the moment you walk through our doors - and there’s no feeling like it.
Our journey is not plain sailing - it requires proactive, flexible and top performing individuals who are committed to the world of sustainable mobility. But one thing is for sure - it's going to be a fun ride!
The question is: are you ready to change the world with us?
About the role:We are growing our Data and Analytics team and are looking for an analytics engineer to help us maintain and evolve the new Wallbox Data platform.If you love data and SQL, want to work with a modern data stack (using technologies like Fivetran, Airflow, dbt, Snowflake, Tableau, Hightouch and GitLab CI), want to use ELT instead of ETL, believe the data team should adopt version control, data testing and data documentation processes or want to solve problems for the various areas of the company and make their lives easier, this is your opportunity!
As a Analytics Engineer you will act as the bridge between data engineers and data analysts and you will:Ingest data from many third-party APIs using 3rd party platforms (like Fivetran) or internal solutionsBe proficient with SQL: you know how to write SQL which is easy to understand, simple to troubleshoot and that is highly performant.Create and own the data models in our analytics environment comprised of Snowflake, Tableau and data build tool (dbt)Automate data pipelines using tools like Apache Airflow.Apply, help define, and champion data warehouse governance: organize and maintain a data lake/warehouse so that it does not become a data swamp, do data quality, testing, documentation.Apply software engineering best practices like version control, continuous integration and peer reviews.Coach analysts and data scientists on software engineering best practicesCollaborate in the growth of a data-driven culture in the companyCollaborate with other teams across the company by building reports and dashboards with useful analysis and data insightsManaging our BI tool, Tableau, including ensuring smooth running day-to-day Tableau performance, best practices and user maintenance.Work closely with data analysts and backend engineers to understand business requirements and provide data ready for analysis.
Must have:3+ years of experience working as part of a data team; preferably as an analytics engineer - or as a data engineer.Hands-on and strong working knowledge of SQL and Data Modelling (tools and techniques)Be comfortable with one or more common data-related programming languages (Python - preferrably, Java, Scala, or similar).Working experience with Amazon Web Services/Google Cloud PlatformExperience with task orchestration tools (ex.Airflow, Luigi)Experience working with a modern data warehouse (Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, or similar).Have been involved in importing and transforming data from many third-party APIs or DBs (both 3rd party solutions and internal tools)Be familiar with software development best practices and their applications to analytics (version control, testing, CI/CD, automation).Experience working with different kind of stakeholdersEnglish is a must
Nice to have:Experience with data modeling in DBT (or similar)Experience with data modeling techniques like KimballExperience with GitLab CI or Github actionsExperience with data quality frameworks
Soft skills:You are able to work-out effective solutions under uncertain or ambiguous circumstancesYou’re always willing to learn something new and embrace a healthy debate.Quality in mind. You can easily detect whether a data result is good or bad in terms of quality and you understand that building good code with strong testing is key to growth and sustainabilityStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsYou have experience designing and implementing features in collaboration with product owners, reporting analysts/data analysts, and business partners within an Agile / Scrum methodology.
BenefitsRemote friendlyHalf-day Fridays!First class private health insurance after your first month at WallboxOnline group training sessions twice a week & other out of office activitiesUse one of our EVs for a weekend and/or a week (car sharing) and test our products in your home (beta testing) to become a valuable source of feedbackFree online language classes (Spanish & English) twice a weekFlexible compensation valid for restaurants & food delivery apps, transportation, childcare, and learning & development.Hundreds of discounts in different brands & services with our Wallbox Circle benefits platformCar discounts & special advantages if you choose an EV!Smartpoint for all your online orders & services at our officesFree coffee & soft drinks to fuel those tough Monday morningsVariety of breakfast and lunch dishes, everyday, at a discounted price at our canteenLearn and grow in a company of over 45 nationalities and counting!No suits! Unless it's Carnival or Halloween
Please submit your CV in English*At Wallbox, we’re committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We strive to be a more equal opportunity workplace.

title: Data Engineer , DE II, Maintenance Automation Platform
description:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Amazon is looking for a Data Engineer to develop, build and scale data modeling solutions powering one of the world’s largest Reliability, Maintenance Engineering enterprises. As a member of the Automation Engineering team, this highly motivated candidate supports the business in all data engineering aspects of the traditional automation pyramid, and will provide consumers information on all aspects of the status of control systems within Amazon’s EU Fulfillment Network. At a basic level, these systems link our low-level automation systems with the cloud and we work at the cutting edge of automation technologies, from device level to the enterprise level. The more complex systems are leveraging Machine Learning and Big Data to drive predictive actions, preventing downtime or defects in the material handling equipment and improving the Overall Equipment Efficiency of the installations.

This is a fantastic opportunity to work with some of the best engineers in the industry and help support and shape the direction of automation and machine learning systems within one of the world’s largest fulfillment networks.
 You are knowledgeable in a variety of strategies for ingesting, modelling, processing, and persisting data. You are able to use one or more query languages (e.g. SQL, HiveQL, SPARQL), schema definition languages (e.g. DDL, SDL, XSD, RDF), and scripting languages (e.g. Perl, Python, KornShell, Scala) to build a data solution. You understand distributed system concepts from a data storage and compute perspective. You understand the differences between data persistence solutions (e.g. HDFS vs RDBMS), data integration techniques (e.g. ETL vs federation), database optimization (e.g. partitioning, distribution, indexing), and join algorithms (e.g. hash vs nested loop). You write secure, stable, testable, maintainable code with minimal defects. You are able to create physical data models and optimize data pipelines for simple datasets. You do not put the company at risk (e.g. proper access control, data integrity, auditability, etc.). You get your data models, pipeline designs, and code reviewed. You test your code thoroughly. You classify, store, and handle data in accordance with Amazon policies You work effectively with customers (e.g., Business Analysts, Data Scientists, etc.) and other internal partners to identify opportunities/problems. Able to prioritize in complex, fast-paced environment.

Basic Qualifications
 Computer Science or equivalent degree. Knowledgeable in a variety of strategies for ingesting, modelling, processing, and persisting data. Proficiency in a scripting language (e.g. Perl, Python, KornShell, Scala). Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases. Understands one or more schema definition languages (e.g. DDL, SDL, XSD, RDF) Can articulate differences between datatypes (e.g., JSON/NoSQL, relational) Is able to create a physical data model Able to dive deeply into technical details (e.g., key dependencies, design choices, operability, etc.) and drive a constructive technical discussion. Familiar with the implications of different implementation decisions (e.g. distribution, normalization). Understands distributed systems concepts, primarily as it pertains to data storage and compute
Preferred Qualifications
 Knowledge of IoT networks and technologies Knowledge of Business Intelligence tools (Power BI, QuickSight) Understands how to leverage AWS services for data ingestion/modelling/storage
About Our Rewards

We’ll expect you to go the extra mile, but we’ll also make sure you’re well rewarded. As well as a competitive salary, stock units and site performance-related pay potential, we offer a whole host of other benefits, including an employee discount.

Additionally, you will find yourself in a stimulating environment where you can develop processes as well as yourself as an individual by working with some of the best and brightest minds in the industry. Our rapidly growing organisation also offers many opportunities for building a diverse and rewarding career.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.


Company - Amazon Spain Services, S.L.

Job ID: A1974880

title: Data Engineer
description:
We are looking for a data engineer to join our IT infrastructure team, based in Barcelona.

Sagaci Research is the leading independent market research for the African markets.
We strive to be a business challenger of traditional methodologies, using technology from data collection to business use.

Our Engineering team is composed of a small group of specialists developers under the guidance of a very experienced multi technology leader.

We run a large infrastructure in data collection across over 30 countries, with over 200.000 members generating data from surveys and app events. Our android app has over 1M downloads and 4plus star rating on PlayStore.

The role of the data engineer will be to improve our core database systems and implement all tools related to data access.

Key responsibilities
Design and implement changes to the database model.
Create tools for users to access the data: APIs for external data access and other services and systems.



To apply, we expect candidates to have the following capabilities:
Strong SQL knowledge. Oracle PL/SQL is highly valued but not required.
Experience in designing database models.
Experience in developing REST APIs
Knowledge of Python and the Pandas library.
Strong analytical skills: ability to analyse complex problems, to ask relevant questions and to challenge own output,…
Resourcefulness: the ability to deal with new situations or difficulties, to come up with creative ideas, to suggest new ways of working…
Entrepreneurial and energetic spirit: willingness to contribute to the structuring of the leading pan-African market research firm
Excellent command of English
A desire to work in a highly international environment

The position is based in Barcelona, Spain.
We are currently working on a hybrid working model with full flexibility to work remotely.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Our client is an international pharmaceutical company, leader in the Spanish dermatology market.As a leading company in European dermocosmetics, they are now present across the globe, working hand-in-hand with scientific communities and dermatologists to provide a range of advanced skin solutions suited to your skin's every need.
Honesty, commitment, adaptability, flexibility, and companionship are some of the terms that represent them.

Programming in Python.Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload managementSkills: teamwork, initiative, detail orientation, analytical thinking, flexibility.
They offer:Permanent contract.Flexible working hours.Half-day Fridays.Ticket restaurant.Medical insurance and life insurance.Annual Budget for training.Team building activities.Salary range: 45k€ - 55k€

title: DATA Engineer (full remote)
description:
At the SEAT:CODE we are constantly looking for talented people willing to join our projects. Our start-up environment is very open-minded, we love to test and implement new ideas. If you think you are ready to enjoy your work and be part of our big family, we invite you to keep reading what we think it could be a good fit for our current needs. We are looking for a full-time DATA Engineer. You will work on a day-to-day basis in squads with talented designers, product owners & software developers to build a scalable and solid product.
The Data Engineer role:
These extravagant competencies are particularly distinctive:Above average team ability.Above-average learning readiness. To rethink the team's feedback to reflect within the framework of the Balanced Team Approach (Janice Fraser).High degree of self-interest.High analytical competence.Your experience: 
Ph.D. in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Engineering, Statistics, or other technical fields.3+ years' experience in data science/quantitative analysis.Passionate about Big Data and its potential for the IoT / Smart Cities: user profiling, self-learning, pattern matching, fault prediction, and preventive and predictive maintenance, etc.Understanding of statical analysis. Excellent data mining skills.Expertise in predictive analytics, artificial intelligence, machine learning: supervised learning, clustering, and time series analysis.Experience working with multiple data-sets.Has an eye for data visualization and can demonstrate creativity.Excellent problem-solving skills and proven technical leadership.Programming experience in Python and/or with Java/Kotlin/R is a plus.Experience with large scale data analysis frameworks (e.g. Spark, Hadoop/MapReduce).Experience with all AWS Data related services (Athena, S3, Glue, API GW, kinesis, etc..).Ability to extract business metrics/questions from data sets.Ability to turn vague concepts and asks into well-documented and effective business metrics and insights.Excellent written and verbal communication skills including the ability to identify and communicate data-driven insights in a clear and effective manner.Bonus: experience in relevant vertical industries: consumer electronics, automotive, industrial, health. Fluent in English and/or Spanish. About the Team: 
Our technical Team loves to deliver really well-crafted solutions at a decent speed. We love tech so we really give great attention to technology (Technology as the first-class Citizen). We know that small, empowered, self-motivated teams can do big things.We like to measure everything so we are always improving, for that we use the best tools on the market such as Datadog. Finally, we promote a culture of no blame, trust, and learning, and we support the mantra “if it hurts to do it more often” so good CI and CD are really key for us.What we offer:
Full Remote work from all over Spain2.000€ per year in social benefits to choose from (Restaurant, Kindergarten, Health Insurance, etc.)Clean servicesWifi (paquete movistar: netflix, disney plus)Holaluz contract (for an advantageous plan for the light).2.000€ per year in trainingDaily Snacks: We try to promote healthy living habits. You will find in our canteen many nuts, fresh fruit, salads,...Flexible working hours: We understand the importance of work-life balance.Short FridaysBest gear for your needsNice located officesWeekly Yoga Classes. NamastèFree language coursesEnglish as the official speaking language.
REQUISITOS MÍNIMOS:
What kind of person do we like to work with:
We're creating the automotive future and we know that we will only succeed if it's built with people from around the world, with gender diversity and with many different backgrounds.People who like high quality software development, who appreciate simplicity, are used to good practices (TDD, DDD, KISS, ...) and to the culture of craftsmanship.At SEAT:CODE, we breathe start-up, so being flexible must be in our DNA.Team Players, transparent, communicative people to whom we can give feedback.Our Teams have a lot of freedom to take decisions, so we need people to trust. People with high responsibility.In addition, we like humble people (no Rockstars please), nice and with a sense of humor (the bar is quite high right now).

title: Ingeniero de datos (Data Factory y Databricks)
description:
Si eres un apasionado de los Datos y estás buscando nuevos retos profesionales, tenemos los proyectos que estás buscando.
Nuestra Comunidad Tecnológica experta en Big Data/BI no para de crecer y necesitamos incorporar un equipo de INGENIEROS DE DATOS y/o CONSULTORES BI que estén listos para un nuevo desafío. Es necesaria experiencia trabajando con PowerBI y AZURE (Databricks y Data Factory).
Se podrá teletrabajar 100% en remoto.
¿Qué esperamos de ti?
Será fundamental experiencia como mínimo 2-3 años con Power BI y DAX. Así como Power BI Desktop, Power Query y Power Pivot sería lo ideal.
Experiencia en desarrollo ETL en Azure: Data Factory y Databricks
Amplios conocimientos matemáticos y estadísticos serán fundamentales.
Conocimientos de modelado de datos.
Valorable programación en Python y PySpark.
¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?
Diseñar e implementar procesos ETL.
Satisfacer las necesidades del negocio mediante el desarrollo de modelos de datos específicos en la gold label que incluyan KPIs enriquecidos y vistas de agregación particulares. Estos modelos se explotarán con cuadros de mando e informes fáciles de usar.
Construir un modelo de entidad de datos que pueda soportar cualquier descubrimiento analítico que una datos de parques y fuentes corporativas
Integrar los sistemas operativos de las herramientas corporativas en la nueva plataforma de datos Azure.

Y además, que más te ofrecemos?
22 días de vacaciones, 2 días de libre disposición + 24 y 31 de Diciembre (cierre de empresa)
Trabajamos en entornos agile, flexible, con máxima conciliación y teletrabajo y equipos horizontales de trabajo con una cultura de colaboración, compromiso e innovación.
Si aún no te ves capaz de tener una conversación con la reina Isabel II puedes llegar hasta ese nivel con 𝐧𝐮𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐬 𝐜𝐥𝐚𝐬𝐞𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐠𝐥é𝐬. 💂
Sabemos que te gusta comer en restaurantes y que a veces no vas para no gastar tanto dinero. Con la 𝐫𝐞𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐛𝐮𝐜𝐢ó𝐧 𝐟𝐥𝐞𝐱𝐢𝐛𝐥𝐞 en tickets restaurante podrás ahorrarte unos eurillos. También en cheques guardería, tarjeta de transporte y seguro médico. 🍕🍼🚈💊
El ir a trabajar no es solo mirar correos y atender peticiones. ¿Te imaginas hacer un scape room virtual con tus compañeros o unirte a un club de ajedrez? Durante todo el año hacemos actividades de 𝐭𝐞𝐚𝐦 𝐛𝐮𝐢𝐥𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 para todos los gustos. 🎮♟
Si tienes un amigo del que no puedes despegarte, ¡haz que se una a la 𝐅𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐚𝐚𝐭!. Si crees que encaja en alguno de nuestros perfiles y se une a nosotros tendrás un premio 🤑 🤑
¡Los eventos son lo nuestro! Tenemos dos grandes congresos además de webinars, formaciones internas hechas por técnicos de atSistemas o meetups.
Y si todo esto te parece poco, tenemos 𝐦𝐮𝐮𝐮𝐜𝐡𝐚𝐬 𝐬𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐚𝐬 que vamos realizando a lo largo del año. Puedes verlas aquí: https://www.atsistemas.com/es/unete/propuesta-valor
¡Ah! Se nos olvidaba decirte que Los Reyes Magos también se pasan por atSistemas...

title: Desarrollador Big Data
description:
¿Te gustaría trabajar con grandes clientes y formar parte de proyectos innovadores?
Desde VIEWNEXT buscamos gente como tú: innovadora, con talento y con ganas de mejorar cada día en nuestro entorno.

Un/a desarrollador/a BIG DATA con 2-3 años de experiencia. Deberá poseer conocimientos y experiencia en Spark/Scala.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Who we are:

Chartboost is the leading in-app monetization and programmatic advertising platform. We reach a global audience of over 700 million monthly active users and process over 90 billion monthly advertising auctions. The Chartboost SDK is one the most widely integrated mobile ad SDKs and through the Chartboost Exchange, Ad Network, DSP and other services, we empower mobile app developers to build businesses, while connecting advertisers to highly engaged audiences.

Chartboost is hiring accomplished Data Engineers to join our team, helping us build and maintain a data platform that supports diverse uses — including data analysis, exploration, aggregation, and external & internal APIs — delivering significant value to our game developers, advertisers and internal clients.

In this role you are expected to be comfortable working to high standards as a professional data engineer, dealing with huge amounts of business-critical data (hundreds of TBs), and to contribute across a full spectrum of responsibilities from architecture to ops.

Our stack currently utilizes Spark, Kafka, Airflow, Scala, Python, MySQL, Druid, Spinnaker, and Kubernetes. We run the pipeline on GCP where we are running on Dataproc, Dataflow, BigQuery and Big Table. You will have the opportunity to join us in exploring new technologies and use them to design, deploy and operate highly performant systems.

As part of the Data Team you will be a key player in our small, nimble, internationally-distributed team and drive significant impact all across the company's data technology and business.

Impact you will make:
Develop high-quality reliable data pipelines that convert data streams into valuable informationDesign, implement and deploy both real time and batch data processing pipelines for internal and external customersDevelop tools to monitor, debug, analyze and operate our data infrastructureDesign and implement data technologies that can scale for hundreds of millions of usersCollaborate with our product and business teams to deliver valuable new features and functions

Who you are:
2+ years of professional experience in data engineering environments2+ years of experience with SQL and programming in any of Python/Java/Scala or similar HLLExperience with data pipelines processing larger than 10TB of data is a plusExperience working in cloud environments, ideally with GCP or AWSStrong experience in improving performance of queries and data jobs and scaling the system for exponential growth in data volumes and trafficExpert debugging skills and enthusiasm for automation to deliver high-quality reliable systemsComfortable with modern development tools such as Git and Confluence and working in a distributed agile team environment with both high autonomy and regular collaborationBS in Computer Science or related technical discipline or equivalent experience

Perks:
Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) - you will have a stake in the future success of Chartboost and ZyngaCompetitive salary with bonuses based on performanceCompany sponsored daily lunch, healthy snacks, and coffee in our cool office in the centre of Barcelona - near subway and train stationsFlexible schedule based on core hours and the possibility of working from home dependent on teamEnglish/Spanish lessons and/or other investments in your professional developmentPrivate health insuranceGym membership Transportation reimbursement23 days of paid time off per year15 paid holidays per yearTeam building eventsThe opportunity to help continue to build a company with the founding team

More about us:

We are proud of the product we've built and appreciate the impact it has on other people's businesses and lives. We want to be surrounded by people who are always finding opportunities to try something new and grow. We love data and anything that helps drive intelligent decisions and always design with the user in mind. Sounds like a fit? Join us, and be part of the team that will change the future of mobile gaming!

We are an equal opportunity employer — we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and make our hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Data Engineer
description:
As Data Engineer you will have following key accountabilities: 
Develop, test and deploy big data applications. Ensure that all development work in data pipelines follow best practices for ensuring validity, efficiency and maintainability. Collaborate in a distributed, cross-functional agile team to reached shared goals. Take ownership of technical implementations and architecture together with your team and in alignment with communities of practices. Communicate with data producers to align on data exchange formats and interfaces. Communicate with data consumers and other stakeholders in order to help them fulfill their needs to drive the business. Provide suggestions to business in the Media Measurement context on how existing and new data sources can be utilized to enhance our existing product portfolio. Recommend different ways to constantly improve data reliability and quality. 
Main technologies you will be using with us: Python AWS Spark (Java, Scala, PySpark) Airflow GitLab Atlassian suite 
Now that we've introduced you to the position as Data Engineer, what skills, qualifications and experience should you have? You have a Bachelor's degree in computer science, software/computer engineering, or applied mathematics. You are curious about finding new and unusual ways of how to solve data management issues. You already have experience with at least one cloud provider (GC, AWS, Azure). You have solid hands-on experience with Python. You have experience with Java or Scala. You know how to develop data-intensive applications using Spark. You are comfortable writing SQL queries to wrangle data from relational databases. You know how to orchestrate data pipelines with Airflow or any other similar data scheduling and orchestration tool. You have experience with CI/CD and ideally also with IaC using Terraform. You are following best practices in software engineering, like pair programming, testing, clean code and agile software development frameworks. You are able to give and take open, constructive feedback. 
We Offer a permanent position with a competitive salary, and flexible working conditions a good work life balance, 30 days of vacation, and parent-friendly regulations. We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions
Can there be a better place to take center stage in the digital revolution? We are excited to getting to know you!

title: Data Engineer
description:
Role Description:Development of ETL processes and data pipelines to ingest and clean data.Design, development, and operation of scalable cloud solutions for processing and handling large quantities of data.Engagement with Data Scientists and Analysts to validate new analytics solutions.Supporting Data Scientists and Analysts with technical demonstrations, training, expertise.Coordination and alignment of requirements with Festo IT in terms of best practices, security, and data governance
Requirements:Degree in information technology, maths, physics or statistics.Experience in setting up data pipelines on AWS (SageMaker, Athena, EC2, S3, RDS. Redshift). IaC management (Terraform, CloudFormation) will be a plus.Experience programming with SQL, Python and GIT.BI skills are a plus (Spotfire, Tableau, Power BI). Ability to work in a team and good communication skills.Independent and structured way of working and holistic thinking.Good written and spoken English skills round off your profile.
By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Festo Automation using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Festo Automation.
Festo Automation is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

title: Analista de Datos con Power BI
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
description:
Descrépción del trabajo:

¿Qué estamos buscando?

 

Actualmente buscamos un/a Analista de Datos con Power BI  que quiera unirse a GFT. Buscamos una persona entusiasta y dinámica, dispuesta a crecer en un entorno multicultural, motivador y desafiante.

 

Tus principales responsabilidades serán:

 

Para la creación de informes y modelos financieros, colaborarás y darás soporte en las funciones de : 

 Creación de informes en Power BI en base de los modelos de datos existentes y mediante consultas SQL Diseño e implementación de nuevos modelos de análisis en data warehouse y en la capa analítica en SQL Server Analysis Services (Tabular/DAX). Análisis y especificación de los requisitos técnicos de las bases de datos de la compañía para construir el reporting en Power BI. Realizar comprobaciones de viabilidad técnica.  

Requisitos mínimos:

 

 Dominio de Power BI, SQL, DAX, Power Automate. Conocimientos avanzados de modelado de datos y tratamiento de datos para obtener un rendimiento óptimo de las visualizaciones. Conocimientos de diseño funcional de dashboards. Estudios en ingeniería informática, telecomunicaciones o afines. Valorable estudios económicos con especialización en Business Intelligence. Nivel de inglés: B2 Capacidad de planificación de trabajo individual y en equipo. Persona responsable, metódica y proactiva. Orientación al área económica. Incorporación inmediata  

Requisitos deseados:

 

 

 Experiencia en proyectos de Business Intelligence utilizando la suite de productos de Microsoft. Máster o postgrado en finanzas Nivel Advanced o Superior en Inglés. Valorable conocimientos de alemán. Conocimientos en SAP los sistemas de información y control.
  

Competencias personales:

 

  Iniciativa, flexibilidad, proactividad y responsabilidad  Habilidades analíticas y de comunicación Capacidad de organización Trabajo en equipo

title: Data Engineer (Cliente Final)
description:
¿Eres un/a apasionado/a de Data Engineer y disfrutas en proyectos donde mande la creatividad? ¿Quieres desarrollarte como profesional de la mano de una empresa multinacional donde realmente se reconoce tu trabajo y esfuerzo?

 

¡Esto te va a interesar!

 

En Consultia IT tenemos actualmente una oportunidad para incorporar a un/a Data Engineer para trabajar por contratación directa en cliente final en Barcelona en un entorno internacional, con el objetivo principal de mantener y mejorar la operatividad de los activos o componentes del equipo de datos en el nivel correcto para garantizar que las estrategia del equipo de datos se puedan cumplir, los clientes reciban el servicio y nivel adecuado de calidad.

 

¿Cómo es trabajar en Consultia IT?

 

Buen ambiente de trabajo: la gente con la que te vas a encontrar es muy maja, están motivados y tienen muchas ganas de aprender todos juntos y de compartir aprendizajes. Además tienen mucho conocimiento, por lo que podrás seguir aprendiendo aunque tengas mucha experiencia.



No serás solo un número: desde el primer día, tanto los socios y directivos como los demás empleados de ConsultiaIT tendrás una relación muy cercana y de confianza en la que la comunicación es clave, por lo que podrás plantear cualquier cuestión que te preocupe sin ningún problema, ¡si tú estas bien, nosotros también!



Contratación indefinida desde el primer día: En ConsultiaIT creemos en las relaciones a largo plazo, queremos personas que se queden con nosotros mucho tiempo, por lo que este proyecto será solo el primero de muchos con nosotros!



Aprendizaje continuo: Podrás aprender cosas nuevas, entornos nuevos, nuevas formas de hacer, nuevas tecnologías… ya que siempre tenemos proyectos diferentes (cliente, internacional, proyectos multidisciplinares, asistencia técnica…) en los que puedes participar.



Desarrollo profesional: Podrás participar en diferentes proyectos, con diferentes tecnologías y desempeñando diferentes roles, lo cual te permitirá adaptarte mucho mejor y no estancarte!



Reconocimiento: Se te valorará a título personal, y cada año se realizará una evaluación del desempeño que, si es positiva, se verá recompensado en el salario. En Consultia, siempre se ha valorado el trabajo de cada uno y siempre en positivo.

¿Qué te hará triunfar en este puesto?




Especialista en desarrollo de TI con especialización en Big Data de 2 años de experiencia en el entorno de producción de Big Data (build & run), con experiencia probada en proyectos de análisis / ingeniería de datos, idealmente en organizaciones importantes y multiculturales con datos a gran escala.
Experiencia de Big Data en el entorno de la Cloud (ADLS, Databricks, ADF, Azure DevOps, etc.).
Experiencia como Data Scientist.
Conocer muy bien los "spark processes".
Conocer con fluidez varios lenguajes de desarrollo.
Conocer bien el proceso de desarrollo de software (git, ci / cd, etc.).
Tener conocimientos sobre los sistemas de BI (Spotfire, AAS, Power BI).
Inglés Alto.
 


Además valoraremos mucho(Deseable):
Experiencia en el sector asegurador.
Conocimientos de BI.
Francés (o tener intererés en querer aprenderlo).
 

¿Cuál será tu misión?

 


Contribuir a la definición de la hoja de ruta de datos, en coordinación con otros equipos / clientes.
Interactuar con científicos de datos, analistas y empresas para definir la estrategia de abastecimiento de datos con respecto al caso de uso.
Gestionar interacciones con proveedores de datos u otros ingenieros de datos de otros equipos de datos para proyectos de lago de datos y tareas de BAU.
Apoyar a otros becarios de datos: demostraciones técnicas, UAT, formación, experiencia.
Participar en las decisiones estratégicas de los componentes de datos de destino con otros miembros de la familia de datos así como el desarrollo y automatización de flujos de ingestión, curación de datos y capas de acceso.
Definición de soluciones y participar en el desarrollo e implementación de aplicaciones siguiendo estándares y pautas centrales.
Contribuir a la mejora de los estándares y los procesos de obtención de datos para la familia de datos.
Diseñar, desarrollar, probar, promover e industrializar flujos de ingestión de datos, datamarts, core jar de componentes de datos de destino.
Implementar herramientas y monitoreo de un extremo a otro para garantizar una alta disponibilidad del procesamiento de datos de producción, la calidad y confiabilidad de los datos.
Mantenimiento de tratamientos de datos en el data Lake.
Realizar BAU e informar periódicamente sobre esta actividad.
Resolver problemas y problemas, poyar a otros expertos en datos técnicos de su equipo de datos (analistas de datos, etc.) o usuarios finales de datos en el uso del lago de datos, aplicaciones o activos de la plataforma actual.
 

Próximos pasos.

 

Si has llegado hasta aquí, primero tenemos que darte las gracias por tu interés!

Los siguientes pasos en el proceso de selección serán:

 

Evaluaremos tu perfil y haremos una primera criba así como el primer contacto para entender cuáles son tus expectativas laborales y tus motivaciones. 

Cerraremos una entrevista con el equipo de Recruiting y el Account Manager y responsable de la oficina de Barcelona, con el objetivo de darte una visión completa de quienes somos, del proyecto y del cliente. 

Si ambas partes hacemos ¡match! y estamos de acuerdo, el siguiente paso será enviarle tu perfil al cliente esperando que le encante tu perfil y que nos llamen pronto para coordinar la siguiente entrevista con ellos! 

SIEMPRE os daremos feedback después de las entrevistas, sea cual sea el resultado, lo más rápido que nos sea posible. 

 

Si te ha gustado lo que has leído y quieres formar parte de la familia de Consultia IT… 

¡APUNTATE YA!

title: Data Engineer with Machine Learning
description:
Our opportunity 

You will join the Data Engineering Team, part of Enterprise Data Analytics & Architecture (EDAA) within Group Operations (GO). The Data Engineering team consists of engineers who are passionate about the solutions that we build and the impact that we have in transforming and enabling Zurich as a data-driven organization. Our team is responsible for delivering cutting edge solutions, services and environments to internal customers; Business Units and Group Functions alike, giving you the opportunity to have a global impact.

In the role of Data engineer with ML, you will join a dynamic and agile team providing services, including designing, developing, industrializing and maintaining systems in support of data science and advanced analytics processes. The main objective will be the industrialization of the solutions provided by the Data Scientist team, making them scalable, robust, optimized and following the group standards.

 Your role 

 As a Big Data Engineer with AI/Machine Learning in our Data Science and Data Engineer team   your main responsibilities will involve 

 Industrialize AI / Machine Learning products with a MLOps mentality  Develop data processing pipelines using Spark framework with Scala/Python in a Cloud environment (Azure, AWS,...)  Be self-driven: work under uncertainty in terms of requirements and unperfect data  Communicate with all type of audiences in English  Love learning and programming in Scala and/or Python  Have experience in Spark  Are Fluent in English  Are Looking for working with Agile methodologies & DataOps  Are ready to become part of our diverse team, helping customers and supporting data scientists in their daily activities  Other pluses that you might bring (Nice to have not mandatory):  University level education, e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or Master’s degree (PhD or equivalent) in a relevant technical field such as computer science, statistics, machine learning or mathematics  Experience in Cloud Environments  Experience in MLOps  Insurance knowledge 

Your Skills And Experience

 As a Big Data Engineer with Machine Learning your skills and qualifications will ideally include: 

 University level education, e.g. Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Engineering Discipline  Desired: PhD or Master’s degree (or equivalent) in a relevant technical field such as computer science, statistics, machine learning or mathematics.  5 years relevant industry experience as an applied Data Engineer, or Machine Learning Engineer in an advanced analytics / data science environment  Preferred: Insurance knowledge and experience.  Extensive experience applying advanced analytics / machine learning to design, develop, implement and deploy data-driven products  Proven track record of programming skills:  Required: Python, SQL, Scala, Spark (R is a plus)  Experience with Agile methodologies & DevOps  Experience working in cloud environments, Docker and Kubernetes are a plus, especially in Azure  Experience in MLOps practices and tools such as AzureML, Sagemaker, MLFlow, Kubeflow or Tensorflow Serving is a plus  Ability to work effectively in a global organization, even when under time pressure  Fluent in English (spoken and written) 

Additional Information

 As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes: 

 Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 100% - you choose  Flexible working hours  Wide range of internal and external trainings  Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on the needs  Ticket restaurant  Life Insurance  Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company  Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you  Special banking and insurance conditions  Exclusive Employees discounts 

 Primary work location is Barcelona, Poblenou  . Please apply with your CV in English.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

title: GIS DATA ENGINEER
description:
We are hiring a GIS DATA ENGINEER
Biome Makers is an AgTech company specialized in microbial analysis of soils for the agriculture industry. We leverage proprietary DNA Sequencing technologies and Intelligent Computing to monitor microbial networks of soils to accelerate the worldwide transition to regenerative agriculture.
We are looking for an experienced and motivated engineer to join the Data Science team. This role reports directly to the Remote Sensing Specialist, and will work closely with the CEO and key business leadership at the company for product advancement decisions and strategic growth.
Location: Spain (remote job)
Duties & Responsibilities:GIS database design, development, documentation, and curation.Database deployment and maintenance in Amazon Web Service.Implementation of data models and data endpoints.Database optimization and security.Development, documentation, and deployment of GIS data capture and processing pipelines.Development of a GIS database frontend.Identification of ready-to-use data sources.Supporting the activity of the data science team. Job competencies & Personal attributes:3-5 years of experience in similar roleDegree in computer science, biology, environmental science, or related.Master’s degree in Geographic Information Systems or equivalent professional experience.Experience working with Unix/Linux systems.Experience with SQL, PostgreSQL, and PostGIS.Experience with GRASS GIS and Quantum GIS.Deep understanding of raster and vectorial formats and format translation with GDAL and OGR.Ability to fully document your work.Experience working in multidisciplinary teams.English fluency to document, communicate and present your work. We Have:An international leading team working to improve the health of our planet from the soil up! With a fun and energetic working environment, our multi-skilled, dedicated team is composed of industry experts, top scientists, and talented engineers who love spreading expertise and creativity with a desire for self-improvement. Our cultural DNA is based on these five values:Inspire one another,Innovate in all we do,Leave a mark on the world,Find the possible in the impossible,Be direct and transparent.
We provide competitive salaries and some of the best perks in the industry, including:Flexible work environment.Time when you need it, generous vacation policy.Encouragement to get out of the office and into the field to see first-hand how our products are being used.We take part in and offer workshops, conferences, meet-up groups, and tech-talks to encourage participation and growth in both community involvement and career development.
This is the chance to boost your career and develop your skills in one of the fast-growing companies in AgTech. We need brains, ambition, and passion to continue helping farmers everywhere to keep their soils productive.
As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Biome Makers is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or veteran status.
We would love to hear from you!
Send your LinkedIn URL and resume to jobs@biomemakers.com
We Are:Biome Makers is an AgTech startup developing Smart Microbiome-based tools to measure Soil Health to support the Future of Agriculture. We have developed a proprietary technology based in DNA Sequencing and Intelligent Computing to profile and understand the impact of microbes pursuing more sustainable and productive agriculture.
Today over 900 customers globally are farming more responsibly thanks to Biome Makers. We keep growing. We are VC-backed. We are 65 international team members spread between West Sacramento (CA, USA) and (Spain).
Biome Makers has been widely recognized as a biotech startup leading the revolution of AgMicrobiome. Biome Makers has been recognized overseas by the most prestigious innovation and AgTech institutions such as AgFunder, Terra Accelerator, Plug and Play, Illumina, Bayer Crop Science, and FoodBytes!
We're really just getting started. Make something exciting, come join us and make a difference!

title: Data Engineer
description:
Mundimoto is a profitable start-up that buys, repairs, and sells motorbikes, it has moved from selling 50 motorbikes to 600 in one year, and we're projecting a 10x growth during 2022. We're looking for a Data Engineer who can collaborate with a team with end to end ownership to analyze the company's process and build modern services that can scale and automate operations from acquisition, factory, repair shop, and sales. The engineering team is growing from 5 to 30 engineers in the next six months, and we project to be 70 by the end of the year. We move fast, have 22M in investment, and the engineering team is critical for the company's enormous growth.
What you’ll do:Using automated and programmatic tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources.Reorganizing data in a readable format.Performing analysis to assess quality and meaning of data.Using statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets that could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction.Assigning numerical value to essential business functions so that business performance can be assessed and compared over periods of time.Analyzing trends that impact both the organization and the industry.Preparing reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.Working with programmers, engineers, and management heads to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies.Preparing final analysis reports for the stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to take important decisions based on various facts and trends.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data.Knowledge of programming languages like SQL and Python.Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.Experience in handling reporting packages like Business Objects, programming (ETL frameworks), databases.Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages.Exposition to data processing platforms like Hadoop and Apache Spark.Knowledge of data visualization software like Tableau, Qlik, QuickSight, Looker…Problem-solving skills.Accuracy and attention to detail.Adept at queries, writing reports, and making presentations.Team-working skills.Verbal and Written communication skills.Proven working experience in data analysis.
 Minimum Qualifications:A background in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Management, or Economics.Exposition to development, most of our data transformation pipelines will be programmatic. Python is a must.
Some of our benefits:
👨👨👦180 collab / Tech Team: +30🏡 Full Remote Friendly⏰ Flexible working hours (WFH)💃 Talented, young and happy team where all ideas count🤑 Payflow get paid whenever you want☕️ 🍫Fully equipped kitchen with fresh fruits and snacks, water and coffee📅 30 holidays per year🚨 Other benefits: kindergarten check 👶, food check 🥘, transport check🚍.🏆 Team Building events📚 English lessons💰 Personal Learning budget (500€)
Do you think you are a good fit? Get in touch with us, we are looking forward to hearing from you! send your CV to Fran@mundimoto.com
