title: Data Engineer
description:
POSITION TITLEData EngineerReporting to Head of Data Engineering

Scope & contextWe are involved in a great transformation journey of our systems and processes and data is considered as a key enabler of this transformation in the Group. You will work in a very passionate and growing data team within the Product & Technology department. We develop a data-driven culture and handle all the dimensions of the data area within the Group: strategy, governance, modern data architecture mixing open source and top trend data solutions, BI, Big Data, IoT and data science.
MAJOR AREAS OF ACCOUNTABILITY
Design and implement data pipelines to ingest heterogeneous data into the datalake / datawarehouse in different scenarios (batch, streaming, …), managing large and complex data sets.Ensure data accuracy and correctness on the implemented pipelinesCreate custom software components and analytics applications.In coordination and collaboration with the data insights team, in charge of the front-end and delivering data products, develop data preparation in order to be used for different purposes and use cases: reporting, machine learning, data sharing, … and identify opportunities for data acquisitionIn coordination and collaboration with the data governance team, explore ways to enhance data quality and reliability.Integrate up-and-coming data management and software engineering technologies into existing data structures.Use agile software development processes to iteratively make improvements to our back end systemsEnsure that all systems meet the business/company requirements as well as industry practices.

INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL RELATIONSHIPSInternal : All Business Services, Product Lines, Architecture, Security, Data Insights & Governance, IT Ops, QAExternal : IT Partners, External consultants
PERSONAL PROFILE OF POSITION HOLDERPrevious experience Proven experience in data engineering or software engineering around data solutions in modern data architectures

Education level / certificatesBachelor or Engineering's degree level or higher

LanguagesWritten and verbal proficiency in English (mandatory)Other languages practice is appreciated (French, Spanish etc.)
Technical skillsStrong Python and SQL knowledge Strong knowledge in data integration / ETLs and orchestration toolsExperience with relational SQL and NoSQL databasesExperience in cloud data platforms (GCP, AWS, Snowflake)Experience in continuous integration development techniques
WISHEDGood knowledge in other programming languages, like Java / Kotlin.Knowledge in frameworks to develop streaming pipelines: Kafka, Apache Beam, Spark, …Knowledge in Terraform/Helm/K8s/DockerKnowledge on BI and visualization tools
Personal characteristics

Team player with a positive attitude and ability to collaborate effectively.Strong willed and self-motivated.Analytical mindset, process focused and structured.Proactive and self starting.

title: Data Engineer (Data Platform Team) - Freelance
description:
The vente-privee group has consolidated its various European brands, together made up of 6000 employees, under one unified conglomerate: Veepee. This coalescence marks a new chapter in its European history.

With Privalia, vente-exclusive, Designer & Friends, Zlotewyprzedaze, Eboutic and vente-privee, Veepee achieved a 3.7 billion Euro turnover as of 2018. Present in 14 countries now, Veepee is taking a leading role in the European digital commerce landscape.

Our 6000 employees have chosen a job at Veepee to spice up their daily lives! Our teams implement new technologies to fuel our strategies, offering our customers the best possible experience.

Are you eager to learn? Veepee offers you a variety of trades to develop your career, enabling you to renew your skills constantly. Tech, logistics, sales, marketing, sales production: join us on an exciting, digital-centered journey.

We are looking for a Data Engineer freelancer (within the Data Platform Team) at vpTech, which is fully cloud-native and distributed between Paris, Barcelona and Brussels.

Your mission will be to support the whole organisation in scaling our data warehouse by building microservices, data transformation pipelines and tooling around it.

Responsabilities :
Develop and deploy high-load API’s on Kubernetes with strong SLA requirements and high business valueIdentify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability etc.Build ingestion pipelines to our Google BigQuery based data warehouseKeep improving your technical knowledge and expertise by attending conferences, contributing to open-source projects (Apache Beam, Apache Airflow), organising and attending meetups.

Your Profile :
At least 3 to 5 years experience in software engineering, preferably in the data fieldStrong knowledge of Java & PythonFamiliarity with Protobuf & gRPCExperience with data processing technologies like Apache Beam, Kafka, etc.Used to work in a cloud environment, preferably GCPFamiliarity with the concepts of a microservice architecture and infrastructure as codePrior experience with deploying containers on a platform like Kubernetes and its ecosystem (Istio, Grafana, Prometheus, etc) is a big plusProficiency with GitKnowledge of database technologies/concepts: relational (MS-SQL, PostgreSQL, ...) and non-relational (Bigtable/HBase, ElasticSearch, …)A strong team-player, willing to share knowledge with other team members and help out where neededYou have strong verbal and written English language skills.

What we offer :
A dynamic and creative working environment Fun and open international teamsState of the art technologies and toolsParticipation in Veepee meetups and events Remote friendly opportunities.

Belonging to Veepee, is one of the biggest tech communities in Europe with more than 800 IT collaborators.

From Warsaw to Barcelona, through Lyon, Nantes, Tel Aviv, Brussels, Nice, Amsterdam, and Paris, all our projects are developed in a functional environment with a wide skills variety where you’ll be sure to find your place, no matter the technology you want to work with.

If you love to try things why don’t you jump on this new adventure?

Need more info > https://careers.veepee.com/en/careers/

title: Data Engineer
description:
Purpose Of The Role

We are currently looking for a Data Engineer to support the delivery of multiple data projects for our diverse client base. This role will involve hands-on data engineering with appropriate testing. The Data Engineer is a key part of the development team and will work with Senior Data Engineers and Project Managers, Clients Services to ensure that projects are accurately scoped and delivered.

Key Responsibilities

Supporting the project delivery process by providing timely updates to Project Managers and Account Managers on the progress of all projects under your supervision

Ensuring the delivery of all projects to the time estimates given

Hands on development by developing and maintaining ETL\ELT processes

Responsibility for BAU work commitments

Be the first point of escalation for supporting BAU projects.

Strategic Planning & Decision Making

Collaborating and deploying innovative technology solution

Responsibility for ensuring own projects are running to time and escalates where there are potential issues

Working with the senior technology team to ensure that the right technology is being used with the right resource allocated to the project

Relationships

Establishing and maintaining crucial relationships with day-to-day clients including marketing and technology departments through email, telephone and face-to-face meetings and briefings

Reporting to Senior Data Engineer providing updates about work in progress and escalating any delivery issues

Engaging with colleagues from other departments as appropriate to deliver projects

Attending weekly client meetings for projects as and when required

Key Experience, Skills And Knowledge

2+ years demonstrable commercial experience developing a number of high-value projects in data provision

Skilled in data development, with experience in SQL Server and or AWS using Redshift

Exposure to reporting capability in SQL Server

SSRS, SSAS and SSIS experience

Exposure to cloud based technologies such as AWS or Microsoft Azure

High standards of professionalism with strong (and clear) written and verbal communication skills

Experience of using data warehouses

Has worked in a technology environment

Experience developing marketing databases

We are an equal opportunities employer and as such, will make any reasonable adjustments to accommodate the needs of all candidates. If you have any such needs or requirements in the context of your interview, please notify us so that we can make the appropriate arrangements.

22 días de vacaciones, 2 días de libre disposición + 24 y 31 de Diciembre (cierre de empresa)
Trabajamos en entornos agile, flexible, con máxima conciliación y teletrabajo y equipos horizontales de trabajo con una cultura de colaboración, compromiso e innovación.
Si aún no te ves capaz de tener una conversación con la reina Isabel II puedes llegar hasta ese nivel con 𝐧𝐮𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐬 𝐜𝐥𝐚𝐬𝐞𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐠𝐥é𝐬. 💂
Sabemos que te gusta comer en restaurantes y que a veces no vas para no gastar tanto dinero. Con la 𝐫𝐞𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐛𝐮𝐜𝐢ó𝐧 𝐟𝐥𝐞𝐱𝐢𝐛𝐥𝐞 en tickets restaurante podrás ahorrarte unos eurillos. También en cheques guardería, tarjeta de transporte y seguro médico. 🍕🍼🚈💊
El ir a trabajar no es solo mirar correos y atender peticiones. ¿Te imaginas hacer un scape room virtual con tus compañeros o unirte a un club de ajedrez? Durante todo el año hacemos actividades de 𝐭𝐞𝐚𝐦 𝐛𝐮𝐢𝐥𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 para todos los gustos. 🎮♟
Si tienes un amigo del que no puedes despegarte, ¡haz que se una a la 𝐅𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐚𝐚𝐭!. Si crees que encaja en alguno de nuestros perfiles y se une a nosotros tendrás un premio 🤑 🤑
¡Los eventos son lo nuestro! Tenemos dos grandes congresos además de webinars, formaciones internas hechas por técnicos de atSistemas o meetups.
Y si todo esto te parece poco, tenemos 𝐦𝐮𝐮𝐮𝐜𝐡𝐚𝐬 𝐬𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐚𝐬 que vamos realizando a lo largo del año. Puedes verlas aquí: https://www.atsistemas.com/es/unete/propuesta-valor
¡Ah! Se nos olvidaba decirte que Los Reyes Magos también se pasan por atSistemas...

title: Data Engineer
description:
Éste es el reto:
Buscamos una persona con sólidos conocimientos sobre arquitectura, implementación y transformación y gobierno de datos, con al menos 2 años de experiencia en desarrollo de software.
Nuestro equipo de de Data Science and Engineering se encarga de entender las necesidades de nuestros clientes, pertenecientes a todo tipo de sectores (Banca, Real Estate, Retail, etc..) y ofrecerles la mejor solución basada en ingeniería y ciencia de datos. Para ello, el departamento cuenta con especialistas en ambos campos.
Trabajamos en entorno cloud (GCP, AWS, Azure) y usamos las herramientas adecuadas para cada problema en concreto.
Entre otras cosas, esto es lo que harás:
En tu día a día:
Propondrás soluciones a nivel de arquitectura, detallando las diferentes piezas de la solución de infraestructura y conexiones entre ellas.Implementarás esas mismas soluciones (ETL, creación de API Rest, etc...).Realizarás testing y validación de código.Te comunicarás de manera continua con científicos de datos y analistas de negocio.Transmitirás a nuestros clientes el trabajo que realizamos.
Para llevar a cabo estas tareas necesitarás conocer:
Principalmente python, pero valoramos también java o scala.Spark.Bases de datos (Relacional, NoSql).Entornos Big Data (Hadoop).Docker.Integración continua (herramientas tipo jenkins, git flow, etc).Metodologías ágiles.Entornos cloud.Muy valorable conocimientos sobre ciencia de datos.Se valorará poseer conocimientos en herramientas de analítica digital.
Además, cuando lleves un tiempo aquí esperamos que seas capaz de: Colaborar de forma independiente y activa con los diferentes departamentos implicados en el end-to-end de los proyectos.Exponer tu trabajo a diferentes tipos de interlocutores, no sólo técnicos.Entregar código testeado de alta calidad.

La experiencia en The Cocktail:
En TCK somos una empresa multidisciplinar que trabajamos en proyectos punteros para empresas muy reputadas del mercado. Cada día es un reto, podrás aprender y disfrutar mejorando nuestra práctica. Además:
Modelo de trabajo basado en la autorresponsabilidad y la autogestión con horario flexible y opciones de teletrabajo.Puedes trabajar 100% en remoto, 100% en la oficina o con un sistema híbrido ¡depende de ti! Nuestras oficinas están ubicadas en Madrid y en Oviedo, y siempre serás bienvenido/a en cualquiera de ellas.Tu desarrollo profesional e individual es importante para nosotros. No creemos en el “café para todos” y montamos un plan individual de crecimiento para ti, que revisamos periódicamente.Somos intensos, no extensos, así que te damos 27 merecidos días de vacaciones al año y, por si no son suficientes, puedes disfrutar de hasta 5 días más de extra time.¿Eres de Windows o de Mac?… da igual, te daremos un equipo de trabajo a tu medida para que uses el sistema operativo que más te guste.No tenemos dress code. Ven como quieras a trabajar.Seguro médico privado con cobertura completa.Posibilidad de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte o cheque guardería).Precios especiales en viajes, tecnología, gimnasios… una infinidad de servicios y productos que te serán muy útiles en tu día a día.Ser parte de una compañía con alma: tenemos iniciativas de apoyo a la maternidad (una sala de lactancia en la oficina y programas para mamás y papás), la sostenibilidad (políticas zero waste), la igualdad de género y diversidad (iniciativas de visibilización e inclusión del colectivo LGTB+, colaboraciones para disminuir la desigualdad social...).
Próximos pasos:Si has llegado hasta aquí es porque hemos conseguido llamar tu atención ;)Apúntate a la oferta y el equipo de People echará un vistazo a tu CV. Si coincide con lo que buscamos, recibirás una llamada para conocernos mejor, que podamos contarte más sobre The Cocktail y sobre el rol.
Nuestros procesos de selección suelen tener alrededor de dos o tres entrevistas, y es posible que en algún momento queramos verte en acción y te propongamos un reto técnico. Al final del proceso charlaremos acerca de las condiciones salariales del puesto, una vez te conozcamos bien y sepamos cuánto puedes aportar.
Si necesitas un tip para el proceso: simplemente queremos que seas tú.
¿Te vienes?

title: Data Engineer
description:
¿Eres un apasionad@ de la programación y del procesamiento de datos? ¿Te gusta el procesamiento en streaming? ¿Eres inquiet@ y siempre buscas mejorar?En idealista estamos buscando un ingenier@ de datos para nuestro equipo de tecnología.Si te gusta estar rodead@ de buen@s compañer@s, trabajar con buen rollo y en un ambiente colaborativo ¡sigue leyendo! Seguro que idealista te va a gustar ;)
¿Qué harás?• Trabajar junto a tus compañer@s del equipo haciendo crecer la infraestructura de datos• Desarrollar con Apache Flink y Scala, entre otras tecnologías, procesos en streaming para proveer de datos al resto de equipos• Trabajar codo con codo con el equipo de plataforma y el resto de equipos de desarrollo para desplegar componentes asegurando su escalabilidad, alta disponibilidad y correcta monitorización
¿Qué te ofrecemos?Ahí va:• Podrás ver el impacto directo de tu trabajo en una de las webs de referencia tanto en España, como en Italia y Portugal. Para los que no lo hayáis vivido ya: no sabéis el cosquilleo que da en la tripa la primera vez que ves algo que has hecho en una plataforma que utilizan millones de personas.• Oficinas en el centro de Madrid y distribuídas en entornos de trabajo colaborativos por si te apetece ir algún día a la ofi.• Somos Remote Friendly :)• Vas a aprender. Lo decimos en serio. La plataforma va evolucionando constantemente, y de ahí sacamos mogollón de charlas internas, posts, talleres… que hacen que el conocimiento fluya.• Además… patrocinamos eventos, acudimos a ellos y hacemos meetups en la oficina. ¡Es tan importante aprender como enseñar a tus compis!• Además de tu salario, podrás acogerte a un plan de retribución flexible (tarjeta de transporte, cheques gourmet, seguro médico…) del que te podrás beneficiar desde el primer día• Clases de Inglés, italiano y portugués• Fruta fresca y café siempre disponible en la cocina.• ¡También tenemos fisio, servicio de piscología, clases de yoga en la oficina… porque para nosotros lo más importante es cuidar de nuestros idealistas!• Además de trabajar, nos gusta pasarlo bien, por eso que si te unes a nuestras familia, cada mes celebrarás algo…Halloween, San Valentín, Navidad,…¡Te lo vas a pasar muy bien!• Relocation en tus primeros días en Madrid, sabemos que cambiar de casa no es una tarea sencilla
¿Qué esperamos de ti? Sobre todo que te apasione el mundo de los datos, pero además no estaría mal si:
• Tienes experiencia en el procesamiento de datos, y nos puedes hablar de ello.• Has trabajado con herramientas como Flink, Spark, Storm, Beam, Kstream...• Te has peleado alguna vez con temas de infraestructura.• No subes nada si no tiene test. Sí, todos nuestros procesos de datos como no, tienen test :P• Si no tienes ninguna experiencia en procesamiento de datos, pero eres un backend experimentado con una base sólida en “best practices”, arquitectura hexagonal, servicios, y quieres un cambio, también queremos conocerte• Nosotr@s trabajamos en equipo. El equipo son tus compañer@s; pero también lo es la gente de producto así como la gente de negocio, etc.• Te gusta este mundillo. Y te encanta saber que vas a tener que estar aprendiendo durante toda tu vida laboral. Además, eres lo suficientemente humilde como para aceptar las enseñanzas de tus compañeros, y lo suficientemente generoso como para compartir con ellos tu conocimiento :)• Tienes curiosidad e iniciativa. Al final, este trabajo va de los problemas que somos capaces de resolver y de cómo logramos hacerlo. Así que se espera de ti que seas capaz de analizar, preguntar, pedir ayuda (y ofrecerla), y saber plantear soluciones a los mismos.
¿Qué otras cosas son un plus?• Tienes conocimiento y has trabajado con eventos• Conoces y has usado bases de datos columnares• Conoces y has usado Kafka.• Te manejas bien con la programación funcional• Has participado en algún proyecto de datos desde 0
Estamos deseando conocerte y que nos conozcas.¿Aceptas el reto?

title: Data Engineer
description:
Quotacom is proudly partnered with an industry leading Digital & Data Transformation Consultancy, with a firm focus across multi-cloud, Data, A.I and Advanced Analytics topics.
Our client is currently engaged within driving digital changes by leveraging state of the art technologies within Data and A.I products at scale, inspiring cutting-edge developments within Data strategies to the markets.
You will be joining a team of high-performing data engineering professionals who are developing Cloud-based efforts in transforming businesses across multiple industries.Working within the Data & Analytics teams, you will participate in the development of data applications on cloud architectures, delivering digital transformation to industries.
This opportunity will present professional exposure in cutting-edge, innovative, and technologically complex projects for clients from different sectors, acquiring knowledge in the most advanced technologies.
Key Skills & Experience:Dedicated professional experience in cloud based technologies like AWS platform (EMR, Glue, S3, Redshift etc) or Azure platform (Datalake, Datawarehouse, Blob Storage etc…)Profound experience within software development in data projectsDemonstrated background within complex projectsAn understanding within conceptualisation, design and implementation of data architecturesClear previous experience and knowledge in Java, Python, Scala or Spark, DatabricksAdvanced knowledge of Databases (relational, NoSql, ...)Knowledge of continuous integration and DevOps (Jenkins, GitLab, ..) and IaC (Terraform)
At Quotacom, we take the security and privacy of your personal data seriously; any data we hold will be in accordance with data protection legislation. Full details of our privacy notice can be found at www.quotacom.com/privacy-notice

title: Data Engineer
description:
¡Hola! Somos Indizen-Scalian Group , una empresa internacional especializada en soluciones para empresas que buscan realizar su transformación digital implementando proyectos de Big Data, Cloud, Cyberseguridad o Inteligencia Artificial . Nacimos en 2001 y desde entonces nos hemos desarrollado en el sector bancario, salud, transporte, retail…En Indizen llevamos largos años de recorrido, desde el 2019 formamos parte de la multinacional francesa Scalian Group , presente en diferentes países de Europa, especializada en estrategia, transformación, sistemas y desempeño de operaciones. Juntos hemos logrado nuevos proyectos y sectores a nivel internacional donde se combinan nuestros conocimientos y talentos.Nuestros equipos están orgullosos de trabajar en este sector sabiendo que nuestro trabajo contribuye a mejorar la vida de las personas, y que cada día aportamos un poco más en hacer del mundo un lugar mejor (entre todos). Sentimos pasión y curiosidad por lo que hacemos. ¿Y a ti que te apasiona?Actualmente somos más de 400 indizer@s y seguimos creciendo… ¿te interesaría unirte a nuestro equipo? ¿Qué buscamos?Estamos buscando incorporar al mejor Data Enginner para participar en un proyecto puntero de un banco internacional.Serás parte de un equipo innovador, puntero tecnológicamente, para participar en los nuevos desarrollos de diferentes unidades de negocio.El objetivo del proyecto es desarrollar nuevas métricas y realizar las ingestas necesarias para los desarrollosRequisitos mínimos:Experiencia como desarrollador PythonExperiencia con PySparkValorable experiencia en entornos de conda y pycharmGit altoSQL alto.Conocer hadoop/yarn en la distribución de cloudera. 
¿Qué ofrecemos?Contrato indefinidoFormación continua y planes de desarrollo profesionalRetribución flexible (seguro médico, cheque restaurante, cheque guardería, transporte público...)Horario de trabajo flexibleCultura corporativa internacionalDescuento en gimnasios (Andjoy) 
¿Quieres saber más? Si hemos despertado tu curiosidad, inscríbete o envía tu CV a n.casanovas@indizen.com con el asunto "Data Engineer".

title: Data Engineer
description:
Company Description

Gameloft Barcelona, the studio behind the mobile gaming hits Despicable Me Minion Rush and Asphalt 9 Legends is looking for a Data Engineer to join the team.

About Gameloft

Leader in the development and publishing of mobile games, Gameloft® has established itself as one of the top innovators in its field since 2000. Gameloft creates games for all digital platforms, two of which are featured in the “Top 10 Games by All-Time Worldwide Downloads” from App Annie. Gameloft operates its own established franchises such as Asphalt®, Order & Chaos, Modern Combat and Dungeon Hunter and also partners with major rights holders including Universal, Illumination Entertainment, Disney®, Marvel®, Hasbro®, Fox Digital Entertainment, Mattel® and Ferrari®. Gameloft distributes its games in over 100 countries and employs 4,600 people worldwide. Every month, 114 million unique users can be reached by advertisers in Gameloft games with Gameloft Advertising Solutions, a leading B2B offering dedicated to brands and agencies. Gameloft is a Vivendi company.

All trademarks referenced above are owned by their respective trademark owners.

About Gameloft Advertising Solutions

With a monthly audience of more than 113 million unique players and an inventory of 2.4 billion impressions, Gameloft Advertising Solutions offers advertisers a unique level of visibility and engagement. To date, Gameloft Advertising Solutions has delivered more than 3000 campaigns for prestigious brands such as Air France, Coca-Cola®, Ford, FOX™, Kellogg’s®, McDonalds, ©Netflix, Procter & Gamble, Samsung and Unilever, in over 40 countries around the world (North America, Latin America, Middle East, Africa, Europe, Asia, etc.).

All trademarks referenced above are owned by their respective trademark owners.

Job Description

Gameloft Barcelona is searching for a skilled and self-motivated Data Engineer to join our central analytics engineering team. This role will collaborate very closely with data analysts, data scientists, peer data engineers and analytical engineers to continuously improving analytics solutions for the whole company.

Responsibilities
Design data models in best practicesMaster ELT/ETL data stackCreate, maintain and optimize our internal ELT/ETL processes and data pipelinesGive support to other data practitioners
Requirements

Qualifications
+3 years of proven track record as a Data Engineer, BI Engineer or Analytical EngineerOutstanding knowledge of SQL, mastering DML and DDL best practicesProficiency in Data modellingKnowledge in ETL processes and toolsFamiliar with one of the programming language Python, Java or JavaScriptGood communication, you are both a team player and a self-contributorInterest for the gaming industry
Bonus points
Experience with Snowflake, dbt and Looker
Additional Information

Why Join the World of Gameloft?
Because you want to be part of an exceptional experience within a company that is constantly growing!Because you want to work with talented people who are industry pioneers!Because you want to be part of an international environment with daily contact with other countries & cultures!Or, just because you’re looking for a great place to work! 
Benefits
Permanent contract, full-time job with excellent Social Benefits.25 vacation days per yearPrivate medical health insuranceFlexible compensation with Ticket Restaurant CardFree language coursesFree coffee and fruit every morning!Free afternoon on your birthday!Merit based salary progression system and a competitive initial salary package.Career-development opportunities.Excellent local working conditions (quality of offices, geographical location of office in the centre of Barcelona).... and Thursday afterwork beers! 
We can’t wait to find our next great talent! 

Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted and your CV will be saved in our files for a period of 6 months.

Want to know more? Please visit our Website www.gameloft.com

If the offer interests you, Join the Game!

______________________________________________________________________

Additional Survey

Thanks for agreeing to take part in this survey and your interest in our Company.

As part of our Recruitment process, we would like to know more about your interests when applying in Gameloft.

The survey may take you less than 5 minutes to complete, and is totally anonymous. Your honest answers will have no impact on whether you will get the job or not.

They will only be used to support our continuous efforts to match our Employer brand with our candidate’s expectations.

https//www.surveymonkey.com/r/PVFDD2P

Many thanks for your help!

Kind regards

title: Data Engineer
description:
¿A QUIÉN BUSCAMOS?En Sngular nos encontramos en búsqueda de perfiles de Data Engineer con al menos 3 años de experiencia.
¿QUÉ RESPONSABILIDADES TENDRÁS?Integrarte en equipos multidisciplinares y con diferentes perfiles técnicosAdopción de las mejores prácticas en salud del código, pruebas y mantenibilidad del códigoDespliegue de modelos predictivos, creación de pipelines, transformación de datosEstar dispuesto a incorporar nuevas herramientas o marcos, para mejorar el día a día del equipoImplicación en proyectos ágiles desde el primer momento
¿QUÉ REQUISITOS TÉCNICOS BUSCAMOS?Al menos 3 años de experiencia trabajando como Data EngineerExperiencia trabajando con GCPImprescindible experiencia trabajando con PythonExperiencia trabajando con PySpark
¿QUÉ HABILIDADES/SOFT SKILLS NOS GUSTARÍA QUE TUVIERAS?ProactividadCapacidad de trabajar en equipoTrabajo en equipos agileMuchas ganas de aprender
¿POR QUÉ ELEGIR SNGULAR?Lo primero porque trabajarás con los mejores profesionales del sector y con tecnologías punteras. Y además te ofrecemos:Acceso a formación continua: presupuesto individual para formación, obtención de certificaciones, asistencia a eventos, acceso ilimitado a Udemy, clases de inglés.Asistencia ilimitada a eventos y meetups organizados en nuestro Hub (también on line).Plan de carrera y seguimiento 1 to 1.Flexibilidad horaria, full remote, posibilidad de trabajar desde nuestros Hubs.Jornada intensiva en julio y agosto.22 días de vacaciones + día de cumpleaños + 24 y 31 de diciembre.2 días libres para la asistencia a eventos técnicos.Wellbeing pack: Ayuda para la mejora del bienestar.Salario competitivo, adaptado a las capacidades y experiencias de las personas.Retribución flexible.And last, but not least: ¡porque somos muy sngulares! Tenemos Tutti Fruties todos los viernes (ya te diremos en qué consisten), fiestas, espacios donde podrás expresarte, proponer cambios y ser partícipe de ellos (lo que nos gusta llamar #challengeyourcompany). Y también: competiciones de baloncesto, padel, escalada, juegos de mesa, clases de baile, team buildings, etc. Y no sólo lo decimos desde People & Culture, sino que puedes preguntar al resto de sngulares o hacerte una idea viendo esto: https://bit.ly/33eoobW
En Sngular entendemos la diversidad y promovemos la inclusión, por ello, mantenemos un compromiso claro con el establecimiento y desarrollo de políticas que integren la igualdad de trato y oportunidades entre todas las personas, sin importar su género, sexo, orientación sexual, procedencia, situación familiar, raza, color, edad, religión o cultura.
Si al leer esta oferta sabes que estamos hablando de ti, no dudes en enviarnos tu perfil, ya que estamos deseando conocerte en persona. Y si crees que conoces a alguna persona que cumpla estos requisitos, no dudes en decirle que nos escriba.
¡Te esperamos!

title: Data Engineer
description:
Fast-scaling SaaS Start-up

Hybrid or 100% remote work from Europe or similar time-zone possible

Offices in Malaga, Prague, Bratislava

Unlimited Paid Time off

Full-time / Contract
Salary is negotiable based on your location and experience.
We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer who will help us change the way we look at and utilise our data. You will be part of a brand new Data Team (comprising of Data Analysts, Data Engineers and Data Scientists).

You'll be able to work with a modern cloud tech stack, Airbyte for data connectors, AWS Athena for queries, S3 and Redshift (or Snowflake) on the backend, thinking of using DBT and working with various data sources as HubSpot, ChartMogul, MongoDB, MariaDB, ElasticSearch, Zendesk, Intercom, Amplitude, and many others.

What You'll Work On
 Design and drive execution of our data pipeline and tooling to deliver scalable and reliable data consumption  Work on data delivery from different data sources to our data lake/warehouse  Focus on data cleaning and optimization of our ETL / ELT pipelines within the platform to deliver the most important data sets  Document our data and processes  Champion a culture of data-driven decision making within the product organization and educate power users across the organization  Cooperate closely with data analysts to provide smooth data pipelines  Work with users across the organization to establish data hygiene best practices  Partner with Data users, Analysts and other teams to understand current and future data needs  Identify, document and promote data engineering best practice 
What We Are Looking For
 2+ years experience as Data Engineer ideally in the SaaS industry  You have experience with ELT/ ETL data pipelines  You have proven skills with Python or R programming languages  You have extensive experience with SQL  You have practical experience with designing data models  You have good written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work closely with analytical and business partners 
You’ll Get Bonus Points For
 experience with Keboola, Snowflake, dbt or other ETL tools  familiarity with Data APIs  experience with AWS S3, Redshift, Athena  experience with any other programming language 
Why You’ll Love It Here
 Unlimited paid time off  You’ll be part of a great team building a world-class product  A family atmosphere and a small team where everyone can stand out  An opportunity to grow and achieve great things  Both remote and office (Bratislava/Prague/Malaga) work are possible  Flexible working hours  Your own MacBook  Quarterly bonus depending on the performance of the company  Referral bonus up to 3000 eur  Team buildings and workshops  Communications coach  Birthday book of your choice  Company merchandise  We try to give back to the community by sharing our expertise whenever we can – Take a look at our blog for more info  External Referral Program – Recommend a developer to klaudia.nemcicka@cloudtalk.io and get a new Macbook (2000 eur value) after 3 months probation period 
We’re thrilled to announce that we have raised $7.3M in Series A funding ! This Series A round is led by henQ VC (Mews, Sendcloud) and joined by Point Nine Capital (Zendesk, Revolut) adding to our $1.6M Seed investment from Presto Ventures in 2019.

About CloudTalk

CloudTalk ☁️ is a modern, user-friendly cloud telephony solution that has disrupted the $50 billion stagnant telephony market. Our easy integrability and advanced features save our clients an average of 2-3 minutes on every phone call! Our solution is loved by customer support and sales teams the world over. We can, of course, back this bold claim with data – check out our reviews and accolades on Capterra , Pipedrive Marketplace , G2.

We believe in connecting the world not only through technology but also through people. CloudTalk’s 180+ employees represent over 22 nationalities and work remotely from Europe, Asia and South America. Our clients span industries like SaaS, e-commerce, tech and finance. Some of our biggest partners are Fujitsu, Mercedes, Oyo and the Ministry of Health of the Slovak Republic.

Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Your application was submitted successfully.

By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

title: Data Engineer
description:
¡Bienvenidos a la revolución tecnológica más humana!
Este es el reto: 🔔Buscamos a profesionales con experiencia en programación y/o arquitectura Big Data.🔔
En tu día a día, entre otras cosas:Accederás a diferentes proyectos de gran calado como profesional Big Data en tareas de desarrollo y/o arquitectura en proyectos (On Premise y/o ⭐️Cloud⭐️).Trabajarás en entornos ágiles y multidisciplinares.Tendrás acceso a la plataforma Udemy y certificaciones Data&Analytics. 🔝 🔝 🔝
¿Qué esperamos por tu parte?A partir de 2 años de experiencia realizando labores de desarrollador/a y/o arquitecto/a:Habiendo trabajado con marcos generales como: HDFS, Spark, Hive, Flume, Kafka, SparkStreaming, HBase...Marcos particulares ligados a diferentes distribuciones: Apache Open, HortonWorks, Cloudera...
También valoramos:Experiencia en entornos Cloud ☁️: AWS, Azure, GCP...Valorable Máster Big Data.
¿Qué te ofrecemos?Incorporarte a una compañía 🔝 Employer 🏆con más de 45.000 profesionales y con acceso a proyectos retadores para clientes líderes en sus sectores de actividad con presencia internacional. ✈️ 🌏🚀Plan de carrera innovador y formación continua en distintos ámbitos adaptada a tus necesidades para ayudar al desarrollo orientado al crecimiento y desarrollo profesionalConciliación entre la vida personal y profesional, con opción de flexibilidad horaria y posibilidad de acogerte a nuestros ❤️ programas de teletrabajo. ❤️Retribución competitiva y acceso a planes de retribución flexible. ✅✅✅Programa de bienestar con acceso a una red de gimnasios por un precio especial, servicio de telemedicina en línea gratuita, y otras ventajas como aplicaciones para hacer tu declaración de la renta más fácil. 🍉🍇🍏⚽️ 🏀 🎾Teletrabajo (pudiendo ofrecer hasta una modalidad del 100%).
Nuestro compromiso es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.

title: Data Engineer (Scala)
description:
Work as an Data Engineer (Scala)|International SaaS company from Silicon Valley with offices in Barcelona

About Our Client

Our client is a USA company focused on the development of a brand new SaaS product.

title: Data Engineer
description:
We are a group of people working in IT&Product teams in Warsaw and Barcelona building a product known as ZnanyLekarz in Poland and as Doctoralia in Spain, and MioDottore in Italy.

Want to learn more about Docplanner Tech? Find out: here. We’re looking for a Data Engineer to join our Tech team in Poland, Spain or Italy.The recruitment and onboarding process is online and #fully_remote is available.

The challenge is as enormous as the scale and style of the whole DocPlanner undertaking - we are the world's leading marketplace for doctors and patients, enabling booking and management of doctor's offices (SaaS model). We are a leader in 13 countries, creating a tool for over 100k active doctors. What is more, 80 mln unique patients are visiting our website each month. Last month, 7.5 mln medical visits were booked on our website. We have seven offices around the world and our team consists of over 2000 people.

Three words that describe this role:

Passion - Our most important value is "do what you love”. We're looking for people passionate about engineering, but also learning every day. Passion is making people stay with us for long - our turnover in the Tech team is under 10%!

Autonomy - We have both company and product goals but how you achieve them is your call. Moreover, your ideas and projects are more than welcome.

Entrepreneurship - Teams function like startups, which makes you and your whole team entrepreneurs.

What will you do with us?
You will enable the company to always be on top of business performance by supplying accessible and reliable data. You will work on the edge of IT, Data and Product departments working closely with analysts from Product & BI teams as well as with developers and SREs. You will be focused on the development and maintenance of the data environment (data warehouse, data lake, planned ML services). 

Requirements

What experience and skills do you need to do a great job in this position?
A few years of professional experience connected with data engineering, data warehousing or software development. Experience with Python & SQL with good coding practices. Hands-on experience with data pipelines (ie. Airflow, Luigi, dbt, NiFi).You are using cloud technologies, such as AWS. You have a sound technical background related to extracting, importing and exporting of data (ETL). You have strong analytical skills. You are familiar with Docker and Kubernetes. You can analyze, synthesise and formalize your work and present your work clearly. You are positive, resourceful, organized and proactive.You are rigorous and your deliverables are perfect.You can communicate in English (both spoken and written).

You’re a great fit for this role if you:
Are familiar with various big data and DevOps stuff (Hudi, Spark, Kafka, RabbitMQ, Helm, Terraform).Operationalized ML models (ie. in Docker, Kubernetes).Have experience in CI/CD for the data environment.Based data development on tests.

Benefits

You will get in return:
Competitive salary adequate to your experience and skills (36.000 € - 82.000 € gross yearly) Private healthcare plan.23 free paid days.Additional paid holiday on your birthday/ work-anniversary to celebrate with your loved ones or to have a self-care day! Share options plan after 6 months working with us.Relocation package (from a different city or country).Free English / Spanish classes.Flexible working hours (plot twist: this is true).Access to hundreds of gyms in Barcelona for a symbolic fee in partnership with andjoy.Summer everyday schedule of July and August.Remote / hybrid / onsite work - you decide.Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh which includes: Restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten and training tax savings. 

Important: Our recruitment team is international, representing various nationalities. Therefore, please be sure to send your CV in English.

Psst. Do you know that our Candidate Experience score is over 8.5 out of 10? We do our best to keep the quality of our recruitment processes high!

Want to see how life at Docplanner Tech is and what to expect? Take a look at our pages to get a better idea:

Facebook | Docplanner Tech page | Medium | Glassdoor | Linkedin | Twitter

You can also join our community by signing up for our Newsletter.

title: Data Engineer (Azure, Databricks)
description:
¡BUSCAMOS AVENTUREROS!
Nuestra historia comenzó hace 26 años y a lo largo de todo este tiempo, con mucho esfuerzo y pasión por lo que hacemos, hemos llegado a ser una empresa muy consolidada en el sector de la tecnología. Actualmente somos Partner homologados de SiteCore en España, tenemos 14 Competencias Gold y 2 Especializaciones Avanzadas de Microsoft y somos Partners certificados de Databricks. Ya somos muchos y ¡seguimos creciendo!
Te ofrecemos un ambiente único:✔Retribución variable.✔Programa de beneficios sociales, conciliación...✔Formación continua y capacitación profesional.✔Planes de Carrera y de desarrollo profesional.✔Eventos y acciones de voluntariado.✔Y …¡Alfombra roja! Para que puedas sumar con Webinars, ponencias, artículos…
¿Cómo serán tus futuros compañeros?📌Un equipo dinámico, cohesionado y siempre dispuesto.📌Grandes profesionales con un objetivo común: pasión por la excelencia y la tecnología.📌Compañeros valientes, resilientes y llenos de creatividad.📌Una tribu comprometida con la diversidad y la Ley Integral para la Igualdad de Trato y la No discriminación, nos da igual tu género, tu raza, discapacidad o clase… ¡Aquí hay hueco para todos!📌Personas que, como tú, trabajan en equipo y siempre dan lo mejor de sí mismas. QUEREMOS AMPLIAR NUESTRO EQUIPO CON UN DATA ENGINEER ENTORNOS CLOUD AZURE
¿Cuáles serían las funciones? 
Creación modelo de datos, y construcción de Datawarehouse.Transformaciones que optimizan su almacenamiento y consulta permitiendo elaborar sobre ellos modelos de analítica avanzadaNormalización de los datos que permite integrar los datos recibidos de distintas fuentes.Responsabilizarse de los procesos de homogeneización y calidad del dato. Gestionar la calidad del dato, generando mecanismos de control.Dejar preparado un dataset válido para Data Scientists y AnalistasResolver problemas de escalabilidad y rendimientoDesarrollar prototipos y pruebas de concepto los entornos corporativos.Monitorización de los procesos para la detección temprana de errores.Buena interlocución con Usuarios de Negocio
¿Que conocimientos consideramos que son necesarios para esta posición?Conocimientos de Python -Conocimiento de entorno Azure (Data Lake, Event Hub, Synapse, SQL DDBB)Conocimiento de SQL y BBDD -Azure Datafactory, Azure Databricks y Pyspark

Está claro que es una lista larga:) en todo caso si crees que es una posición que te interesa puedes contactar conmigo también en esta dirección de correo mperez@kabel.es
Para nosotros lo más importante y valioso son las personas, porque nos hacen ser mejores cada día y por ello nos esforzamos en su desarrollo, bienestar y satisfacción a través de una serie de beneficios que enriquecen tanto en lo personal como lo profesional. En Kabel trabajamos por construir un lugar en el que las personas quieran ser, estar y llegar a ser. Así que si te apetece disfrutar de una gran experiencia…¡este es tu sitio! Kabel, en compromiso y coherencia con la Ley Integral para la Igualdad de Trato y la No discriminación, hace constar que los términos empleados en la presente comunicación (independientemente del género derivado de su propiedad lingüística) consideran a todas las personas interesadas/destinatarias sin ejercer ningún tipo de discriminación por razón de sexo, raza, discapacidad o clase.

title: Big Data Engineer
description:
¡Seguimos buscando talento…y nos encantaría que te unieras a nuestra familia!UST se preocupa por la seguridad de sus empleados y, ahora más que nunca dada la nueva situación, hemos reforzado nuestras operaciones. UST ofrece teletrabajo a los empleados y también otras modalidades de conciliación con las que podrás acumular suficiente tiempo para equilibrar tu vida personal y laboral.
En UST fomentamos la diversidad y la inclusión social. Para ello, contamos con procesos de selección basados en competencias, habilidades y experiencias de los participantes, los cuales no discriminen por raza, género, discapacidad, edad, religión, orientación sexual o nacionalidad.Nuestra compañía cuenta con una Política de Igualdad de Oportunidades de empleo para todas nuestras candidaturas, así como para personal interno y externo.
Para que nos conozcas algo mejor, UST es una multinacional norteamericana certificada como TopEmployer con más de 25.000 empleados a nivel global y con presencia en los cinco continentes. Somos líderes en servicios de tecnología digital y proporcionamos soluciones tecnológicas de gran alcance a grandes compañías a través de proyectos end-to-end, consultoría y soluciones propias.

¿Qué buscamos?Estamos buscando incorporar un Big Data Engineer para dar servicio a uno de nuestros principales clientes líder en el sector telco.

Funciones:- Participará en el desarrollo y mantenimiento de procesos de extracción, transformación y carga (ETL) sobre datos provenientes de las distintas OBs del cliente. - Análisis y diseño de los procesos ETL en base a los requerimientos funcionales, teniendo en cuenta también los no funcionales como el rendimiento o la escalabilidad.- Desarrollo y pruebas unitarias.- Participación en revisiones de código.- Automatización de procesos y soporte a IT en el despliegue y mantenimiento.


Requisitos Mínimos:- Ingeniero Informático o similar.- Experiencia en Big Data, particularmente como data engineer.- Experiencia con las tecnologías Spark, YARN, Hadoop, Hive.- Experiencia con BB.DD. relacionales, particularmente MySQL.- El lenguaje de programación es Scala y se valorarán conocimientos de programación funcional (en casos excepcionales, se valorará experiencia con PySpark).- Experiencia con Linux y shell scripting, se valorarán conocimientos de Ansible.- Familiarizado con entornos cloud, particularmente Google Cloud Platform (en su defecto, se valorarán conocimientos de AWS o Azure).- Familiarizado con el WoW de CDCO (Agile, GitHub, JIRA/Redmine, Continuous Integration).- Nivel de inglés intermedio (B2).

Requisitos Deseados:- Mínimo 2 años de experiencia como desarrollador. • Mínimo 1 año de experiencia trabajando en proyectos de Big Data.- Valorable poseer Certificado de discapacidad.

Ubicación de trabajo:Las Tablas. MadridSe permite teletrabajo 100%


Horario:L-J 9:00 a 18:00, y el V de 8:00 a 15:00En verano (julio y agosto) es de 8:00 a 15:00


¿Qué te ofrecemos?Acceso gratuito a varias plataformas de formación para que tengas acceso a un amplio catálogo multidisciplinar.Estabilidad y carrera profesional dentro de la Compañía donde podrás participar dando cobertura a varios proyectos.Entorno internacional y contacto directo con compañeros referentes en las tecnologías core de la compañía, con los que podrás compartir conocimientos.Tenemos implantado un plan de compensación de referencias internas del que podrás beneficiarte al referenciar profesionales que se incorporen a la compañía.
Y además…23 días laborables de vacaciones.Te damos vacaciones los días de Nochebuena y Nochevieja.Salario competitivo y beneficios sociales (seguro médico, conectividad en casa, seguro de vida y seguro de accidentes).Programa de Retribución Flexible para que puedas adaptar tu retribución según tus intereses (tarjeta comida, cheques guardería, tarjeta transporte, clases de inglés online con profesores nativos, seguro médico para tu familia…).Programa Devengo (recibe tu salario prorrateado, en el momento del mes que necesites)Posibilidad de elección de percibir tu salario en 12 o 14 pagas.Medidas de conciliación (horario flexible, teletrabajo, jornada intensiva en verano según proyecto)Plataforma UST Club de descuentos en numerosos servicios (restauración, ocio, informática, ropa...)Tarifa plana con los gimnasios que tú elijas, cerca de tu domicilio o de las oficinas.
Si quieres conocer más, no dudes en inscribirte y nos pondremos en contacto contigo para ampliarte información de la posición, ¡te estamos esperando!

title: Data Engineer
description:
Opportunity Description

Our client is looking for a Data Engineer to join our digital data team in the data

architecture operation and governance team to build and operationalize data

pipelines necessary for the enterprise data and analytics and insights initiatives,

following industry standard practices and tools. The bulk of the work would be in

building, managing, and optimizing data pipelines and then moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers like business/data analysts, data scientists or any persona that needs curated data for data and analytics use cases across the enterprise. In addition, guarantee compliance with data governance and data security requirements while creating, improving, and

operationalizing these integrated and reusable data pipelines.

The data engineer will be the key interface in operationalizing data and analytics on behalf of the business unit(s) and organizational outcomes.

Tech Skills
Knowledge of AWS.Knowledge of Azure or GCP is a plusOrchestration: AirflowProject management & support: JIRA projects & service desk, Confluence, TeamsExpert in ELT and ETL such as Informatica IICS, Databricks, Delta, Glue, ...Expert in Relational database technologies and concepts:Perform SQL queriesCreate database modelsMaintain and improve queries performanceSnowflake is a plusWorking knowledge of Python and familiar with other scripting languagesGood knowledge of cloud computing 

Soft Skills
Pragmatic and capable of solving complex issues Ability to understand business needsGood communicationPush innovative solutionsService-oriented, flexible & team playerSelf-motivated, take initiativeAttention to detail & technical intuition

Experience
At least 5 years experiences in a data team as Data EngineerExperience in a healthcare industry is a strong plus

Preferred Qualifications
BS or MS in Computer Science

Requirements

Responsibilities
Must work with business team to understand requirements, and translate them into technical needsGather and organize large and complex data assets, perform relevant analysis Ensure the quality of the data in coordination with Data Analysts and Data Scientists (peer validation)Propose and implement relevant data models for each business casesOptimize data models and workflowsCommunicate results and findings in a structured wayPartner with Product Owner and Data Analysts to prioritize the pipeline implementation planPartner with Data Analysts and Data scientists to design pipelines relevant for business requirementsLeverage existing or create new “standard pipelines” within to bring value through business use casesEnsure best practices in data manipulation are enforced end-to-endActively contribute to Data governance community

title: Data Engineer (Remote)
description:
About ConsenSys

ConsenSys is the leading Ethereum software company. We enable developers, enterprises, and people worldwide to build next-generation applications, launch modern financial infrastructure, and access the decentralized web. Our product suite, composed of Infura, Quorum, Codefi, MetaMask, and Diligence, serves millions of users, supports billions of blockchain-based queries for our clients, and has handled billions of dollars in digital assets. Ethereum is the largest programmable blockchain in the world, leading in business adoption, developer community, and DeFi activity. On this trusted, open source foundation, we are building the digital economy of tomorrow. To explore our products and solutions, visit http://consensys.net/.

About ConsenSys Quorum

ConsenSys Quorum is an open source protocol layer that provides developers with the flexibility and reliability needed to make their blockchain applications successful. ConsenSys Quorum comprises a suite of configurable components and APIs, enabling you to customize your use case and production environment. Confidently join the hundreds of enterprises already running reliable, production applications on Quorum.

About The Role

As a Software Engineer at ConsenSys you will: build core blockchain and enterprise technologies; optimize blockchain data structures, write crypto algorithms and protocol specifications; Design, develop and implement blockchain protocol packages for Ethereum; Craft and maintain interfaces for API and Storage teams; Use formal methods to test the correctness of Ethereum Protocols.

Required Skills
Deep understanding of OOD/OOP distributed systems; designing and developing large scale, high availability software preferably in JavaExperience analyzing data structures and algorithms and issues related to scale, security and availabilityExperience working with language and compiler design or crypto engineeringExperience with and/or interest in some of the following areas:Distributed SystemsDatabase and Large-scale Storage SystemsBig Data Processing SystemsOperating SystemsPerformance Analysis and OptimizationCryptographyBlockchainsEthereumComfortable operating in an Agile environment Collaborative by nature; willing to give and receive feedbackOpen to learningUnderstanding we are a globally distributed, remote-first team; Comfortable with handling uncertainty and ambiguity

Don't check all of the boxes? Don't sweat it. We’re passionate about building a diverse team of humans and as such, if you think you've got what it takes for our chaotic-but-fun, remote-friendly, start-up environment—apply anyway. While we have a pretty good idea of what we need, we're ready for you to challenge our thinking on who needs to be in this role.

Why join ConsenSys? 

Here are some of the perks of being part of a unique organization like ConsenSys
One of the most recognized tech companies in the blockchain ecosystem globally. A work experience at ConsenSys is a tremendous reference for your future career. ConsenSys alumni have moved on to become tech entrepreneurs, CEOs, and team leads at tech companies.The forefront of a revolution. We fundamentally believe blockchain is a next generation of technology that can lay the foundation for a more just and equitable society. You can be a part of building the digital economy of tomorrow and radically transforming our society for the better.A dynamic startup environment with deep roots. We are one of the earliest blockchain companies and a leader in the space. You’ll join a network of entrepreneurs and technologists that reaches the edge of our ecosystem. Deep technical challenges. Blockchain technology is just over 10 years old. Ethereum itself is still a toddler. There is much to be done before these platforms can scale to the order of millions or billions of users. We are building the tools, infrastructure and applications l that are pushing the technology forward.Continuous learning and improvements. You’ll be constantly exposed to new concepts, ideas and frameworks from your peers and as you work on different projects — challenging you to stay at the top of your game.

ConsenSys is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. We are committed to ensuring that our technology is made available and accessible to everyone. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

ConsenSys is aware of fraudulent recruitment practices and we encourage all applicants to review our best practices to protect yourself which can be found here.

title: Data Engineer - Education - BARCELONA, ES
description:
We are looking for aData Engineer to join one of our clients – a life-changing project in Barcelona dedicated to the improvement education accessibility in the whole world.

Requirements
Experience in data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL development.Solid understanding in SQL, MySQL, Postgres, or similar.Knowledge in architect data pipelines and data validation.Planning and organizational skills.Strong experience using Python.Knowledge in AWS (RDS, S3, EMR, RDS).Knowledge in Big Data (Hive, Spark, Hadoop).Excellent at consuming and cleansing data from third-party APIs and external sources.Understandings in Web data analysis environments and end-to-end Mobile (Google Analytics).We value previous experience in the startups field; as some knowledge in Redshift, Metabase, Tableau, Qlikview, etc.You are collaborative, respectful, talented, and bold. We are looking for a person with initiative, a lot of energy, and sense of humor.Available to work in Spain – have the necessary permit and visa requirements prior to application.
Benefits

Sounds like you and want to get more information?

description:

title: Big Data Engineer (REMOTE)
description:
Remote|Career Progression

International Company

Complete technical solutions to solve concrete business challenges in the areas of Business Intelligence and self-service analytics.Collect functional and non-functional requirements, consider technical environments, business constraints and enterprise organizations.Support our clients in executing their Big Data strategies by designing and building operational data platforms: ETL pipelines, data anonymization pipelines, data lakes, near real-time streaming data hubs, web services, training and scoring machine learning models.Collaborate, closely with partners, strategy consultants and data scientists, in finding innovative approaches to business issues, in a flat and agile organization where personal initiative is highly valued.Support the organization to scout the possible approaches, evaluating pros & cons, and estimating times and efforts required.Share data engineering knowledge by giving technical trainings to youngest team members.Guide and mentor team members.

title: Data Engineer for a Fortune 500 - work in Berlin, Madrid, Prague (Azure/ Python/ Spark)
description:
Reporting to: Data & API Delivery Manager

Duration: Full-time, Permanent Hire

Reporting to: Head of Software Development

Industry: Business services and consulting

Location: Available on-site in Berlin, Lyon, Madrid, Prague or Sofia

About The Company

Our client is looking for a Data Engineer at a group level, to join an international engineering team working on global projects. A Fortune Global 500 company and a leader in its field, with more than 34,000 employees in 60 countries.

This role helps drive the core business of the company and provides services to internal stakeholders.

You will become part of a Global IT community whose mission is; to optimise IT processes, consolidate data centres, and standardise systems that result in innovative, flexible, and scalable technology solutions for our colleagues, candidates, and clients.

Is this role for you?

We offer the best of both worlds; the excitement of working in a new team, developing new data services the company needs, along with the stability, support and security of a large company.

Do you have at least 4 years of experience in the implementation of data and analytics projects in Azure, with proven experience with Azure Databricks? Do you also have hands-on experience in Python, R, PowerShell, SQL and Spark? Would you like to help build the data transformation required to support the Data & AI Team of Data Scientists?

As a Data Engineer, you will develop and operate data pipelines and integrations to ease everyday workflow. You will also participate in analytics and machine learning model design and implementation, together with the analysts and data scientists.

Your Responsibilities
 You will work closely in an international team with data scientists, business analysts, and product owners to gather requirements and then design, implement and operate any build required to clean, transform data as per the required design. You will understand business use-cases and implement services around business intelligence and data analytics. You will be able to create reusable pipelines for data integration, data cleaning, data transformation, etc. You will deal with a large volume of structured and unstructured data, including JSON, XML and corresponding analysis tools. You will work with Azure technology stack including, Azure Databricks, Azure ML, Azure Container Service, ADLS Gen2, Azure Synapse, Azure Functions, PowerApps
You will need these skills and experience to be successful:
 At least 4 years of experience in the implementation of data and analytics projects in Azure Proven experience with Azure Databricks Hands-on experience in Python, R, PowerShell, SQL Hands-on experience in Spark (Python or Scala)
Language: English fluency at a management level required

Sounds interesting? Please send us your CV or LinkedIn profile outlining a track record of your achievements. In case of any questions, please contact info@fullstacktalents.com

We are looking forward to hearing from you!

By replying to this job offer, you agree with processing your personal information and confirm that you have had the opportunity to learn about our handling of your personal data.
 Guaranteed reply to all applicants!

Desired Skills and Experience
            Python, Data Analysis, Data Mining, azure, spark

title: Data Engineer - (remote)
description:
At Swapcard, we build communities by empowering meaningful connections and know it all begins with a strong community of our own. We believe that diverse collaboration brings us closer to embracing change and propels us to form the ideas of tomorrow in an ever-evolving world.

Powered by artificial intelligence, Swapcard is the only end-to-end community platform for virtual and hybrid events. Behind this vision, stands a passionate, curious, and down-to-earth team. We believe an environment of trust, autonomy, and support is integral to our success. As a result of putting people first, career evolution and rapid growth have become regular commodities.

With 42 nationalities amongst a team of more than 200 innovative minds, we enjoy an open-minded environment where opinions and ideas are encouraged and exchanged freely in order to create a product and company we can all be proud of. We’ve also learned that the more moments we share, the more comfortable, communicative, and confident we are when working together. That’s when the real magic occurs.

And the best part? Swapcard offers full remote opportunities, which means you’ll be able to bring your best self to the table no matter where in the world you are located! We fully support and empower an international environment, where all cultures, mindsets and backgrounds are equally welcome and appreciated.

Our Values

📚 Curiosity: Rapid growth and evolution are the results of our endless quest for new knowledge and understanding. We’re interested in our peers and their concerns. Anything novel or innovative excites us.

👽 Open-mindedness: Feedback and ideas can be exchanged freely, without being taken personally. We welcome Swapcardians of all sorts and learn from each other’s personal and professional experiences.

✊🏾 Humanity: Empathy encourages a kind and down to earth environment where we all feel comfortable and free to be human. We never have to wear a mask or hide who we are.

🎯 Resilience: We have a desire to win and don’t take no for an answer. We prefer the term “experiment” over “failure”. We are solution-oriented and find innovative approaches to succeed.

🏋🏽♀️ Ambition: Nothing is impossible. We're always striving to get better, seize opportunities, and reach the top. We are encouraged to dream big and believe in ourselves.Requirements
2+ years hands-on experience deploying code in production.Professional experience using Python for data processing.Knowledge of and experience with data-related Python packages.Demonstrably deep understanding of SQL and analytical data warehouses (Redshift)Hands-on experience implementing ETL.Hands-on experience with data pipeline tools (Airflow, Argo Workflow).Experience with Salesforce, Zendesk, Jira... as data sources and consuming data from SaaS application APIs.Catch bugs and style issues in code reviews.

Responsibilities
Maintain our data warehouse with timely and quality data.Build and maintain data pipelines from internal databases and SaaS applications.Create and maintain architecture and systems documentation.Implement the DataOps philosophy in everything you do.Collaborate with Data Analysts to drive efficiencies for their work.Collaborate with other functions to ensure data needs are addressed.Passion for developing high quality and robust code that scales and performs well.Highly motivated, goal driven, can-do approach.Innovative, entrepreneurial, team player, ability to multi-task.

Reasons to join us
 International team with 42 nationalities (more on the way!) 🌍 Remote-first policy with offices in Paris, USA, UAE, CA, UK, & IN 🇫🇷 🇺🇸 🇦🇪 🇨🇦 🇬🇧 🇮🇳 🇸🇬 Fast-growing startup with many opportunities for growth 🌱 Open-minded culture that appreciates differences 👽 Feedback driven, supportive & curious team with DIY mindset 🤔 🛠 Family leave and remote work to ensure you have time for what matters most ❤️ 🏡 Team that seizes every opportunity to celebrate success 🕺🏼💃 Personal learning budget for professional growth, budget for books and eLearning courses in our LMS 360Learning. 📚 Work-from-home budget to help you feel comfortable 😌 Generous paid time off program to ensure your happiness 🎁 Team vacations to celebrate our achievements ✈️

title: Data Warehouse Engineer (f/m/d)
description:
wefox is Europe’s leading InsurTech that is reinventing insurance at scale, with a record-breaking Series C funding round of $650 million in 2021, making it the largest funding round of any InsurTech to date.
wefox is revolutionising insurance by empowering the customer and delivering personalised experiences, driven by data. Our vision is to enable people to be safe. By providing our customers 360 degree advice through our network of advisors, we optimise each individual's risk coverage through innovative prevention, assistance and insurance products

The Role
Your work comprises the full spectrum of data management, including data modelling, data integration, as well as aggregating data for analytical consumption and reportingProactively improve processes, monitoring, optimizing and troubleshooting our Data solutions (running PostgreSQL/Redshift and Airflow).You will be in direct contact with stakeholders and analysts from business departments, understanding their business requirements and translating them into technical solutionsDevelop a data model that allows accurate and consistent reporting and self-service analysis.You work on advancing data quality and ensure consistency
What You Bring
3+ years of experience as a DWH developerProfound experience with data warehouse modelsStrong T-SQL / SQL skills, with proven ability to code effectively preferably PythonPracticed and proficient in ETL/ELT procedures, data migration, integration, or data quality conceptsSolid experience with RDBMS like Postgres plus strong NoSQL and unstructured datastore skillsYou have worked with the AWS data stack in the past (e.g: S3, Redshift, Lambda, Athena etc.)Team player, highly motivated, able to work independently with extreme user-orientation
What We Offer

Now, we’ve gotten to the fun part, the part where you get to brag about your company, those perks your friends are so jealous of!

Here Are Some Of Them
Flexible working hours including some days remote option26 working days of vacation + 24th and 31st December.Seniority days: one day of extra holiday per employment year starting from the 2nd anniversary in the company (up to 30 days total holidays).Discounted fitness membershipsA stack of the latest technologies and working gadgetsFree coffee, fruit and snacks, because we need fuel!Grants for training and coaching
If you love a less-formal work environment, flexible paid time off, a great compensation package and benefits offering - and most of all, being the authentic you, get in touch, we want to meet you!

To all the misunderstood geniuses, rebels and mavericks looking to change the world for the better. Come work with us!

We are an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

title: Support Data Engineer
description:
¿Te apasiona la tecnología y te gustaría formar parte de una empresa referente en el sector energético?  En Grupo DISA buscamos a una persona que se incorpore a nuestro equipo de Transformación Digital, repartido entre nuestras sedes de Tenerife, Gran Canaria y Madrid.  Este departamento se encarga de explotar los diferentes datos de la compañía con el objetivo de generar valor en los negocios del Grupo. Utilizando estrategias data-driven para generar modelos que permitan mejorar u optimizar los procesos y servicios actuales, así como buscar nuevos modelos de negocio.
¿Cuáles serían tus principales responsabilidades?- Resolución de peticiones de mejora y evolutivos en los diferentes proyectos relacionados con la plataforma de datos de la compañía.- Monitorizar, diagnosticar posibles incidencias y optimizar el rendimiento de todos los procesos de ingeniería de datos.- Subsanación de diferentes incidencias en los proyectos en producción. Requisitos:- Titulación en Informática, Física, Ingeniería, Matemáticas o similar, o FP en Informática.- Idiomas: inglés, nivel medio.- 1 año de experiencia con SQL o tecnologías similares.- 1 año de experiencia en programación orientada a objetos (Python, Java, C#...).- Experiencia en gestión de repositorios de código con Git. Se valora:- Experiencia en componentes cloud, preferiblemente Azure (Databricks, ADF, blob storage…)- Experiencia en CI/CD- Experiencia en Azure DevOps- Conocimientos en materia de protección de datos ¿Qué ofrecemos?-Incorporación inmediata.-Contrato indefinido.-Formación continua y desarrollo profesional.-Incorporación en las Políticas de sistema de teletrabajo, flexibilidad horaria y medidas de conciliación.  En nuestro departamento valoramos la motivación, la capacidad de trabajo en equipo, saber focalizarse en conseguir resultados, la proactividad y las ganas de mantenerse formado para estar siempre al día en las nuevas tecnologías.
Si crees que puedes ser un/a buen/a candidato/a para esta oferta y no cumples con alguno de los requisitos, anímate igualmente a participar añadiendo a tu CV tu carta de motivación y presentación para que podamos valorar adecuadamente tu candidatura. Las personas que concurran a los procesos de selección y evaluación serán valoradas en base a los requisitos del puesto de trabajo con objetividad, transparencia y respetando el principio de igualdad de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres.

title: Data Engineer
description:
We are TravelPerk: a scaling unicorn valued at $1.3billion that has raised over $400m since our creation in 2015.

Backed by world-class investors with portfolios including AirBnb, Stripe, Slack, Trello, Gusto, Twitter, Farfetch and Deliveroo, our team is made up of A-players from across the travel and technology industries.Over the past few years, we’ve been named the fastest-growing SaaS startup in the world by SaaS1000 and featured as one of the hottest startups to watch by both Forbes and Wired.

We’re revolutionising the B2B corporate travel market—worth over $1.3 trillion— to connect people in real life in an enjoyable and sustainable way.TravelPerk are innovators.

During the last year we have welcomed and acquired the likes of Click Travel, NexTravel and Albatross to the team. From TravelCare, to FlexiPerk and of course GreenPerk we are shaping the future of the industry. Our team continues to emerge stronger and stronger as we adjust to the new normal—and that’s where you come in!

If you’re ready to take off with us, keep reading!

We are looking for a Data Engineer to help improve in the 3 main pillars of Data Operations: Data Governance, Tracking & Data Integration. This Role’s mission will be:
Ensure we are able to keep all data in our DWH updated and accessible for the analysis.Partner with the Data analysts to support the requirements of the company in terms of analytics, reliability and efficiencyDevelop and maintain data pipelines to extract data from different sources and integrate it in the DWH following data modelling best practices 
What You Will Do
Take charge of the required data processing while ensuring a sustainable and organic growth of the data model and the infrastructureKeep our data infrastructure up to date and working like a clockWork with stakeholders across multiple departments to convert their requirements into tracking specifications and coordinate tracking implementationIntegrate and model datasets from different sourcesSupport our Data Analysts & BI Developers to build awesome dashboardsSupport Product and Analytics teams at defining the best approaches for data modelling, mining and productionUse data to investigate and help resolve issues in our product or processesProactively suggest improvements to data reliability, efficiency and qualityChampion a healthy data culture throughout the organisation
What You Need
University degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar3+ years of relevant experience as a Data Engineer, Business Intelligence, Big-Data Engineer or similar role working with large-scale data systemsExcellent communication skills, both written and spoken, in EnglishYou are a Master in SQL, optimising queries for performance, scalability, and ease of maintenanceYou feel comfortable querying different type of databases (ie PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, Redshift) and knowledge of AWS technologiesYou’re an ace at data modelling, accustomed to designing and implementing complex architectures with a constant eye on their future evolution, while taking into account the needs of multiple usersYou have experience integrating data from multiple sources including DBs, product tracking, and APIs. You get excited by seeing your jobs run like clockworkYou have instinct for automationYou have the desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction, and with highly engaged individuals
Bonus points for…
Experience with AWS Redshift or other distributed systems (Hadoop, Vertica, Exasol, etc.). Basic DBA skillsExperience in web analytics and web tracking and event based analytics toolsExperience with workflow managers (Airflow, Luigi, etc.)Experience in dbt.Experience with pythonExperience in queue and streaming systems (SNS, Kafka, Firehose…)Experience with AWS infrastructure and Terraform
What do we offer?
Competitive compensation including equity in the companyGenerous vacation days so you can rest and rechargeHealth perks such as private healthcare or gym allowance depending on your location"Flexible compensation plan" to help you diversify and increase the net salaryFlexibility to work from home most of the time with core hoursUnforgettable TravelPerk events including to travel to one of our hubsUdemy for Business account to continue your developmentA mental health support tool for your wellbeingExponential growth opportunities
Flexible Work Policy
You will need to be based in one of our hub countries, some positions are only open in specific locationsWe will require you to travel to the office hub in your country once or twice per week depending on your positionIn addition, every quarter you will be required to travel to an office hub location for up to 5 days to meet with your whole teamWe have flexible working hours to fit around your lifeTeam members that want to go to the office more are welcome to!
For certain positions we can help with relocation from anywhere in the world, please let us know in your applications and we will assess whether this is possible. English is the official language at the office. Please submit your resume in English if you choose to apply.

At TravelPerk we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We don’t just accept differences—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. As an equal opportunity employer, we stay true to our mission by ensuring that our place can be anyone’s place regardless of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability or age.
