title: People Systems & Data Specialist
description:
Job Summary We’re seeking an exceptional individual to join Cazoo as a People Systems & Data Specialist, on our journey to create the UK and Europe’s best car buying experience.
The People Team plays a key role at Cazoo, growing and retaining our employees, supporting our managers and ensuring a world class employee experience.
As the People Systems & Data Specialist, you will play a pivotal role within the People Team, helping to create a world class People System & Data infrastructure.
What You’ll Be DoingAct as the SME for our core HRIS (HiBob) and ATS (Greenhouse) platformsWork closely with the People Systems and Data Manager to help implement a People system infrastructure that enhances the experience for Cazoo Employees and ManagersContinuously monitor all People systems, discovering ways to make enhancements. Performing and supporting any new configuration and testing of new functionality within the systemsPartner with our Global People team to ensure our systems support our People processesDevelop and maintain training materials (e.g. videos and guides) related to structured processes and system configurationAdhere to strong governance around all Data held within our People Systems to ensure the highest level of data integrity and accuracySupport our employees in the daily use of HiBob and Greenhouse and ensure adherence to legal and company standardsConduct system training with Employees and ManagersMonitor and Maintain accuracy of all Data within our HR SystemsAssist with reports and data extraction when needed
What You NeedPrevious experience working in a People/HR MI analyst capacity, working in a fast-paced environment where continuous improvement was at the core of the activities performedExperience working with and configuring HR systemsAdvanced level of excel - Pivot tables, vlookups, complex formulaDetail-oriented, problem-solver who is able to employ critical thinking and time management skills and can work effectively both independently and in teamsSolutions focused with an innovative and pragmatic approach to problem solvingComfortable with ambiguity and ability to work autonomously with minimal directionAbility to manage stakeholders from various areas and multiple processes at the same timeStrong analytical, communication and organisational skillsTeam player and strong team contributorAlways keen to learn!
DesirableExperience using GSuiteExperience of HiBob Core HR and Greenhouse RecruitmentStrong understanding of Absence / Time and Attendance

title: Data Engineer - 100% remote for a Fortune 500 co (Azure/ Python/ Spark)
description:
Reporting to: Data & API Delivery Manager

Duration: Full-time, Permanent Hire

Reporting to: Head of Software Development

Industry: Business services and consulting

Location: 100% remote - America working time zone

About The Company

Our client, a Global Fortune 500 company, is looking for a Data Engineer, to join an international engineering team working on global projects. They are a leader in their field, with more than 34,000 employees in 60 countries. This role helps drive the core business of the company and provides services to internal stakeholders worldwide.

You will become part of a new Global Data Team whose mission is; to optimise IT processes, consolidate data centres, and standardise systems that result in innovative, flexible, and scalable technology solutions for our colleagues, candidates, and clients.

Is this role for you?

We offer the best of both worlds; the excitement of working in a new team, developing new data services the company needs, along with the stability, support and security of a large company.

Do you have at least 4 years of experience in the implementation of data and analytics projects in Azure, with proven experience with Azure Databricks? Do you also have hands-on experience in Python, R, PowerShell, SQL and Spark? Would you like to help build the data transformation required to support the Data & AI Team of Data Scientists locally and participate in a global strategy?

As a Data Engineer, you will develop and operate data pipelines and integrations to ease everyday workflow. You will also participate in analytics and machine learning model design and implementation, together with the analysts and data scientists.

Your Responsibilities
 You will work closely in an international team with data scientists, business analysts, and product owners to gather requirements and then design, implement and operate any build required to clean, transform data as per the required design. You will understand business use-cases and implement services around business intelligence and data analytics. You will be able to create reusable pipelines for data integration, data cleaning, data transformation, etc. You will deal with a large volume of structured and unstructured data, including JSON, XML and corresponding analysis tools. You will work with Azure technology stack including, Azure Databricks, Azure ML, Azure Container Service, ADLS Gen2, Azure Synapse, Azure Functions, PowerApps
You will need these skills and experience to be successful:
 At least 4 years of experience in the implementation of data and analytics projects in Azure Proven experience with Azure Databricks Hands-on experience in Python, R, PowerShell, SQL Hands-on experience in Spark (Python or Scala)
Language: English fluency at a management level required

Sounds interesting? Please send us your CV or LinkedIn profile outlining a track record of your achievements. In case of any questions, please contact info@fullstacktalents.com

We are looking forward to hearing from you!

By replying to this job offer, you agree with processing your personal information and confirm that you have had the opportunity to learn about our handling of your personal data.
 Guaranteed reply to all applicants!

Desired Skills and Experience
            azure, azure databricks, Azure Datalake

title: Data Modelling and Engineering Lead
description:
Our opportunity 

We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled solution architect to join our Enterprise Data Architecture and Analytics (EDAA) organization. You will work on Business Intelligence and Analytics projects for various Business Units and Group Functions. In this role you will be accountable for the overall Solution Design, ensuring the scalable and reliable IT Architecture.

 Your role 

As a  Data Modelling and Engineering Lead  your main responsibilities will involve

 Managing a team of Data Modelers and Solution Designers covering the span of Data Analytics & Business Intelligence tools including Design and Implementation  With a highly motivated team you are capable to translate the company incl. Group Technology & Operations strategy into real data driven solutions, from design thinking, to proof of concepts / prototypes to final product as productive solutions  Driving the requirements engineering as part of the project proposal phase to provide the best solution for the business need leveraging a combination of the various Data Analytics technology stacks.  Advocate for Data Analytics & Business Intelligence Solutions and Concepts  Overseeing the projects resources managing the allocation of Data Modelling resources and working closely with multiple internal clients  Collaboration with Enterprise Architecture, Platform Management, Service Management, Data Delivery and Purchasing  Develops design standards and guidelines.  Applies advance data modelling practice using Data Vault.  Integrates data analytics with DevOps practices for an agile deployment.  Implements end-to-end BI solutions with little supervision.  Ensures alignment with Enterprise Architects and Data Architects, as well as the broader Group Operations community.  Supervises the technical dimension of the implementation by performing validation and approvals of work done by delivery teams.  Develops concepts for compliance to IT standards through system-driven quality controls (e.g. naming conventions).  Is able to work on globally running initiatives, engaging with different Business stakeholders and IT colleagues in different cultures, capturing the requirements and producing the results that work according to standards and best practices.  Contribute to define a stack of technologies to support the definition of corporate ready end to end solutions that could be industrialized using EDAA capabilities. Focus on integrating the diverse layers that conform vertical solutions (ETL, data modelling, analytics, visualization), adopting latest approved market trends (cloud, edge computing, IoT, Artificial Intelligence).  Support the creation and continuation of user communities for Data Analytics and propose re-usable assets (experience exchange, training) to improve the group dynamics.  Advise and support the translation of the business demand in data driven solutions that our lean execution-focused team develop rapidly.  Performs requirements engineering ahead of project initiation by identifying appropriate solution architecture and evaluating reusability opportunities of existing shared platforms across analytics, design, architecture and build areas  Lead the design authority (IT Solution Architecture) for the projects based on Microsoft BI technologies (e.g. MS SQL, SSIS, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL, Power BI), and ensures adherence to standards in all work streams across the globe. 

Your Skills And Experience

 As a  Data Modelling and Engineering Lead  your skills and qualifications will ideally include: 

Qualifications & required experience:

 Education profile with technology or business background and with a university degree is highly desired.  Minimum 10 years of work experience in technical positions, including min. 3 years as an Application Architect in BI space.  Proven industry experience in Insurance or Finance is a big plus. 

Soft Skills :

 Good knowledge of Business Intelligence landscapes with complex architecture, covering backend and frontend components.  Strong communication and presentation skills.  Able to work well across different teams and cultural backgrounds  Able to perform requirements engineering and take accountability for the results  A track record of making complex business decisions with authority, even in times of ambiguity, considering the potential long-term risks and implications  Proponent for innovation, best practices, sound design with data & information optimization in mind, strong development habits, and efficient team/project structures.  Capable of articulating complex designs, code and applications for large scale projects to a simple to understand non-technical client-facing standard. 

Technical Skills:

 Highly skilled in different integration solutions and architectures.  Solid experience in advanced data modelling techniques such as Data Vault.  Proven deep experience with Microsoft BI technologies:
 SQL Server Database: Performance optimization, automation, etc.  ETL with SSIS and Azure Data Factory  DevOps with Visual Studio and Azure DevOps 
 Experience with cloud solutions (IAAS, PAAS), and hybrid landscapes with on-premises and Cloud-based components.  Desired certifications and trainings:
 Microsoft Certified: Azure Fundamentals  AWS: Certified Cloud Practitioner  Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer Associate  AWS: Certified Data Analytics , Certified Solutions Architect 

Additional Information

 As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes: 

 Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 100% - you choose  Flexible working hours  Wide range of internal and external trainings  Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on the needs  Ticket restaurant  Life Insurance  Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company  Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you  Special banking and insurance conditions  Exclusive Employees discounts 

Primary work location is Barcelona, Poblenou. Please apply with your CV in English.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

title: Junior Big Data Developer (Tech Support) - Google Cloud Platform
description:
WHAT WE LOOK FOR
We are looking for a talented Cloud Data Engineer with a deep understanding of Python/Java to join our young and international team based in Barcelona. 
As part of our team you will be responsible for providing outstanding technical support for Google Cloud Platform big data products (such as BigQuery, Dataflow, Pub/Sub, Dataproc, Composer...) to worldwide clients.

100% fluent in English (minimum C1) European citizenship or work permit in SpainBachelor’s degree in computer science, software/computer engineering, applied mathematics, physics, statistics, or applicable work experience.Experience with Linux/UNIXUnderstanding of basic web technologies (e.g. TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP, etc.).In-depth programming skills in Python or JavaExperience with relational SQL and NoSQL databasesUnderstanding of streaming data architectures and technologies for real-time data processing

Data warehousing and ETL ToolsExperience with big data tools (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, HBase, etc.)Experience in Machine LearningExperience with code repositoriesExperience with cloud providers (Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure)
WHAT YOU WILL GET
Currently working from homeYou will become a Google Cloud expertPermanent contractFull time position (39 hours / week) Salary package: 30.040€ gross/year (25.000 as base salary + 3.000 as bonus + 1.540 ticket restaurant + private health insurance valued approximately 500€)Salary review after one yearTwo months of paid trainingContinuous training and certification within Google productsTicket restaurant 23 days of vacation and day off on your birthdayFree fresh fruit and coffeePing pong, arcade machine, pool table and punching bagTeamwork in a multicultural environment, social activities and personal developmentRelocation package

title: AI/ML - Data Curation Engineer (Swedish), Siri Languages and Technologies
description:
Summary
 
Come and join the the team in Barcelona that teaches Siri how to understand and speak new languages. We are an extremely diverse and passionate group, dedicated to making Siri the best worldwide digital assistant. We are looking for a highly motivated annotation projects lead, with a high sensibility for foreign languages and cultures, to help us drive the quality of our Siri deliverables.


Key Qualifications
 
Native speaker fluency and cultural awareness of Swedish

Knowledge of text processing, scripting (e.g python)and automation

Highly organized with attention to detail and a commitment to quality.

Awareness of ML, NLP, TTS, or speech recognition technologies

Outstanding communication skills.

Project management skills, with cross-functional experience and ability to understand and prioritize tasks and issues.

Technical engineering, data science or machine learning background.


Description
 
The Global Siri team brings innovative solutions to complex engineering challenges, with focus on improving the end to end engineering and quality of Siri's experiences for our international users. From Speech Recognition to Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, Big Data consumption, all the way to Speech Synthesis. Be ready to develop robust scalable systems for Siri's international languages, in partnership with a wide range of colleagues.


As a Data Curation Lead in Global Siri, you will drive and supervise several of the data curation efforts that fuel the pieces in Siri’s technology pipeline. This will include defining data curation specifications for your language, reviewing and ensuring data quality, reporting accuracy metrics, and documenting conventions and processes. You will also lead failure analysis exercises aimed at improving the quality of the end-to-end experience for Siri users in your market. This will include delivering hands-on data analysis tasks across the product’s stack, and triaging technical issues.


We are looking for demonstrated ability to be creative, take ownership of a project, and a knack for solving problems that stump most accuracy improvement projects. If you have a desire to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams with design, product, data science, and research partners we'd love to hear from you!


Education & Experience
 
B.A. or B.S. degree preferred, or experience in related fields


Additional Requirements
 
Apple’s most important resource, our soul, is our people. Apple benefits help further the well-being of our employees and their families in meaningful ways. No matter where you work at Apple, you can take advantage of our health and wellness resources and time-away programs. We’re proud to provide stock grants to employees at all levels of the company, and we also give employees the option to buy Apple stock at a discount — both offer everyone at Apple the chance to share in the company’s success. You’ll discover many more benefits of working at Apple, such as programs that match your charitable contributions, reimburse you for continuing your education and give you special employee pricing on Apple products. 


Apple benefits programs vary by country and are subject to eligibility requirements.


Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Apple is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Apple is a drug-free workplace.

title: Big Data Engineer - Cloudera Technologies
description:
ClearPeaks is a leading BI, Big Data, Data Science & Analytics consulting firm, established in year 2000 and operating in global customers across the EU, USA, and Middle East.Due to our constant growth and expansion both regionally and technologically, we are looking for talented and motivated people to join our team. If you would like to work with modern, data-focused technologies, in growth industry segments and technically innovative projects, this could be the right position for you – accelerating your growth, expanding your knowledge, and building all essential customer project experience.
As a Big Data Engineer, you will be responsible for installing, configuring, migrating or upgrading highly secured Big Data (Cloudera) clusters as well as use them to build data engineering and data warehousing solutions for our clients world-wide. At ClearPeaks, there are endless opportunities to get involved in different projects bringing innovative ideas while being part of leading-edge teams who are always innovating and evolving in the Data Management field.

Responsibilities
Technology expertise of solutioning in Cloudera or Hortonworks: HDFS, Hive/Impala, Spark, Oozie, NiFi, Kafka, Ranger, Flink, etc.Demonstrated ability in solutioning covering data ingestion, data cleansing, ETL and data mart/warehouse creationSQL knowledgeExperience in installation, configuration, and upgrade/migration of Cloudera platforms: CDH, HDP, CDP (private cloud and/or public cloud)Versed in Linux sysadmin & Unix shell scripting with good understanding of security and networking conceptsExperience in configuring highly secure Cloudera platforms: Kerberos, LDAP/AD integration, in-motion encryption (SSL), at-rest encryption and authorization mechanisms (POSIX, Ranger, Sentry)Expertise in Airflow, Talend or Informatica is an advantageExpertise in Python, Java and/or Scala programming Languages is an advantageExpertise in Docker, Kubernetes and Micro-Service based architecture is an advantageExpertise in DevOps/CICD (ex: Gitlab, Azure DevOps) is an advantageExpertise in infrastructure as code tools (ex: Terraform / AWS CloudFormation) is an advantage
Requirements
A degree in Computer Science or Telecommunication Engineering, Informatics, Statistics or related degree.Technical background.Versed in admin skills.Admin certification desiredCloudera certification desiredAnalytical, problem solving and creative.Excellent communication and presentation skills.Fluent English both written and spoken.Proactive, team player, committed and constant willingness to improve.Excited about international business experience.


Our offer to you!
Work with leading edge technologies that will enable you to accelerate your career development.Enjoy an excellent work environment where people love what they do.Be part of an international and ambitious team whilst having fun.Attractive salary and flexible compensation

title: Data Engineer
description:
We're looking for a talented Data Engineer who works closely with our high tech team for assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional/non-functional business requirements.
Key Responsibilities:Develop and support data models and data/ML pipelines, using MLOps principles with robust monitoringSupport data architecture using different solutions: batch, streaming and structured and unstructured DatabasesSupport security and compliance in data pipelines: Identity, encryption, privacy and legal complianceEnsure standards are met so that solutions deployed have technical integrity and stability.
Basic Qualifications:2+ years of experience in Data Engineering, BI Engineer or related field with experience manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large datasetsExperience building end-to-end IT data solutions with focus on integration and MLOps principlesExperience working with cloud services (AWS, Azure or GCS) with a strong understanding of cloud databases (Redshift/BigQuery/Athenea), storage (e.g. S3) etc.Proficiency with SQL skills for Postgres and BigQuery to perform common types of ETL.Experience with Python for data processingExperience integrating machine learning libraries/frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Dask into automated pipelines
Preferred Qualifications:Knowledge of software engineering best practices across the development lifecycle, including agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source management, build processes, testing, and operationsStrong analytical skills, 2+ years’ experience with Python(e.g. pyspark) and an interest in Machine LearningAbility to effectively interact with managers, employees and vendorsSystem level understanding - Data structures, algorithms, distributed storage & computeExperience with containerization and related technologies (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes)Experience working with data streaming: e.g: Google DataFlow, AWS Kinesis, Apache Flink and compute engines (EMR/DataProc)Google Cloud Professional Data Engineer certification
What we’re offering:
💻 Latest technologies⚖ Flexible working hours: work-life balance🚀Challenging projects and environment📍 Remote/On-Site/Hybrid work 🌏 Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people😜 Startup climate👀 Benefits: English classes, medical insurance, restaurant tickets

title: Big Data engineer
description:
Hay dos palabras que nos definen: talento y tecnología, porque en Indizen by Scalian no entendemos una sin la otra. Nosotros ofrecemos soluciones sencillas e innovadoras a problemas complejos, que tienen un impacto positivo y sostenible en las organizaciones y en la sociedad. Pero para conseguirlo, necesitamos del talento, por eso, buscamos.

Role Number: 200316057

title: Data Engineer (Full Remote)
description:
StubHub International (SHI) is a marketplace that provides fans a safe, transparent, and trusted environment to buy and sell tickets for sport and music events all over the world. It allows fans with tickets they can no longer use to recoup part of the money they’ve spent and fans that didn’t have the chance to buy tickets when the on-sale, to access them at any time.
 Our goal: To be the most trusted ticketing marketplace that connects fans and inspires them to enjoy life through live events, providing them a safe environment to buy and sell tickets through fair practices and transparency, while giving them the best choice and value. Backed by award-winning customer care, StubHub’s FanProtect™ Guarantee means every ticket is guaranteed valid or customers receive a replacement ticket of equal or better value, or their money back. At StubHub International, we are: We are a team on a mission: We are a diverse and inclusive team that is here to disrupt and challenge the status quo. We think in a bold, creative, and different way and we take calculated risk.We put fans first: We understand that a vibrant marketplace needs to earn and keep the trust of our buyers and sellers. It always starts and ends with the fans; it is our top priority and consistently top of mind.We deliver: We feel empowered to make decisions, we take action, and we move fast. We overcome obstacles, find solutions, and take pride in taking full ownership and accountability.We do the right thing: We operate with a high level of integrity; no matter what is right for the fans, stakeholders, and colleagues. We enjoy the journey: We believe in hard work and in the importance of what we are accomplishing. We are hungry, we are passionate, and we simply love what we do. The Opportunity: We are currently looking for a skilled Data Engineer to join our team in Spain. Responsibilities: Develops and maintains scalable data pipelines and builds out new API integrations to support continuing increases in data volume and complexity.Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL, no-SQL, and GCP-based technologies (BigQuery, Spanner, Bigtable).Collaborates with analytics and business teams to improve data models that feed business intelligence tools, increasing data accessibility and fostering data-driven decision making across the organization.Cover your code with tests.Works closely with all business units and engineering teams to develop strategy for long term data platform architecture.Follow Agile values and principles. We break product development work into small increments so we can add value sooner.   Requirements: Python programming language (extra kudos for R, Java, or Scala).StrongSQL knowledge (extra kudos for BigQuery and Spanner).No-SQL experience is a plus (Bigtable).Experience withKafka.Experience withTableau, with some understanding of Tableau administration.Airflow experience is a plus.Experience with schema design and dimensional data modeling.Experience designing, building, and maintaining data processing systems.Academic background in Computer Science or STEM fields is OK but not exclusive.You write clean and maintainable code.You feel comfortable working with Git (or any other distributed version control system).You have strong verbal and writtenEnglish communication skills.Excellent interpersonal skills. Willing to improve and learn every day. What we offer: Competitive salary.Permanent contract.Flexible working day. We build relationships based on trust.Good work environment is very important for us.Benefits: Life insurance, private medical insurance (you and your direct family), pension plan, meal tickets, public transport pass, nursery tickets, time off and others. Are you interested in joining an ambitious and close-knit team dedicated to solving meaningful customer problems? Your work will have a significant impact on the business, and help spread the joy of concerts, theater, and sports around the world.  We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel StubHub International is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work.

title: Cloud & Data engineer - 100% remote
description:
We are still looking for the very Top Talent…and we would be delighted if you were to join our family!
UST cares about employee’s safety and now, more than ever given the new situation, we have reinforced our operations. UST offers `100% WFH or remotely´ for our employees and, new measures of work-life balance within you could accrue enough time for a healthy and integrated professional and personal life.
UST promotes diversity and social inclusion. With this mindset, our selection processes are based on soft skill, tech ability and work experience evaluation of the participants, which do not discriminate by ethnicity, gender, disability, age, religion, sexual orientation, or nationality. Our company has an Equal Employment Opportunity Policy for all our applications, as well as for internal and external staff.
More in details, UST is a multinational company based in North America, certified as a Top Employer company with over 26.000 employees all over the world and with a presence on all 5 continents. We are leaders on digital technology services, and we provide large-scale technologic solutions to big companies through E2E projects, consulting services and our own solutions.
What are we looking for?
We are looking for a cloud engineer to be the point of contact for the product teams regarding CI/CD and DevOps automation. Design and implement standards to orchestrate build, upgrade and tear down of the environment using Kubernetes. You will work closely with the solution architect, software engineers and product managers to meet their environment configuration and service automation needs.

Main tasks and accountabilities will be:  Cloud/devops engineer with sklill like SQL | Oracle | MS SQL | MySQL | Postgress | big data | Azure ML.Proven experience in Cloud optimized and native architectures under Microsoft Azure technology stack: managed services, serverless, PaaS for containerized microservices.Experience with Azure DevOps services, on-premises using Azure DevOps Server or TFS.Experience with Terraform/Ansible all as code.Experience with Docker/Kubernetes technologies.Knowledge on DevSecOps flow: SAST/DAST.Experience implementing and managing CI/CD solutions.Experience working with Agile principles and best practices.A degree in computer science, or similar professional certifications.Fluent English and excellent communication skillsUsed to work in multinational projects
What can we offer?
Free access to several training platforms with a wide multidisciplinary catalogue.Professional stability and career plans in our Center of Excellence where you could participate on the latest projects inside the company.International environment and close contact with colleagues specialised in the core technologies of the company, with whom you will share your knowledge.Many of international projects, with the most exciting and innovated technologies.UST also, compensates referrals from which you could benefit when you refer professionals.
And also…
UST also offers 23 days of Annual Leave plus the 24th and 31st of December as discretionary days!Competitive salary and benefits (Heath Care Plan, Internet Connectivity, Life and Accident Insurances).`Retribución Flexible´ Program: you will benefit from a flexible salary package that allows to optimise your income (Meals, Kinder Garden, Transport, English lessons, Heath Care Plan…)`Devengo´ Program (choose to prorate your salary, any moment you need!)The option to pick between 12 or 14 payments along the year.Real Work Life Balance measures (flexibility, WFH or remote work policy, compacted hours during summertime…)UST Club Platform discounts (numerous well-known brands in hospitality, retail, free time...)Gym Access discounts (choose the nearest to your home or office!)
If you would like to know more, don’t hesitate to apply and we’ll get in touch to fill you in detail.
We are waiting for you!

title: AI/ML - Data Curation Engineer (Finnish), Siri Language and Technologies
description:
Summary
 
Come and join the the team in Barcelona that teaches Siri how to understand and speak new languages. We are an extremely diverse and passionate group, dedicated to making Siri the best worldwide digital assistant. 


We are looking for a highly motivated annotation projects lead, with a high sensibility for foreign languages and cultures, to help us drive the quality of our Siri deliverables.


Key Qualifications
 
Native speaker fluency and cultural awareness of Finnish

Knowledge of text processing, scripting (e.g python)and automation

Highly organized with attention to detail and a commitment to quality.

Awareness of ML, NLP, TTS, or speech recognition technologies

Outstanding communication skills.

Project management skills, with cross-functional experience and ability to understand and prioritize tasks and issues.

Technical engineering, data science or machine learning background.


Description
 
The Global Siri team brings innovative solutions to complex engineering challenges, with focus on improving the end to end engineering and quality of Siri's experiences for our international users. From Speech Recognition to Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, Big Data consumption, all the way to Speech Synthesis. Be ready to develop robust scalable systems for Siri's international languages, in partnership with a wide range of colleagues.


As a Data Curation Lead in Global Siri, you will drive and supervise several of the data curation efforts that fuel the pieces in Siri’s technology pipeline. This will include defining data curation specifications for your language, reviewing and ensuring data quality, reporting accuracy metrics, and documenting conventions and processes. You will also lead failure analysis exercises aimed at improving the quality of the end-to-end experience for Siri users in your market. This will include delivering hands-on data analysis tasks across the product’s stack, and triaging technical issues.


We are looking for demonstrated ability to be creative, take ownership of a project, and a knack for solving problems that stump most accuracy improvement projects. If you have a desire to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams with design, product, data science, and research partners we'd love to hear from you!


Education & Experience
 
B.A. or B.S. degree preferred, or experience in related fields


Additional Requirements
 
Apple’s most important resource, our soul, is our people. Apple benefits help further the well-being of our employees and their families in meaningful ways. No matter where you work at Apple, you can take advantage of our health and wellness resources and time-away programs. We’re proud to provide stock grants to employees at all levels of the company, and we also give employees the option to buy Apple stock at a discount — both offer everyone at Apple the chance to share in the company’s success. You’ll discover many more benefits of working at Apple, such as programs that match your charitable contributions, reimburse you for continuing your education and give you special employee pricing on Apple products. 


Apple benefits programs vary by country and are subject to eligibility requirements.


Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Apple is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Apple is a drug-free workplace.

title: Google Cloud Data Engineer

title: Sr Analyst, Enterprise Customer Data Steward
description:
Auto req ID: 263660BR

Job Description

Locations: Europe - Barcelona, Krakow, Moscow, Warsaw

PepsiCo Data Governance Program Overview:

PepsiCo is establishing a Data Governance program that will be the custodian of the processes, policies, rules and standards by which the Company will define its most critical data.

Enabling this program will:
Define ownership and accountability of our critical data assets to ensure they are effectively managed and maintain integrity throughoutPepsiCo’s systems
Leverage data as a strategic enterprise asset enabling data-based decision analyticsImprove productivity and efficiency of daily business operations

Position Overview: 

The domain Data Steward role is responsible for working within the global data governance team and with their local businesses to maintain alignment to the Enterprise Data Governance's (EDG) processes, rules and standards set to ensure data is fit for purpose.

This will be achieved through the EDG Data Steward operating as the single point of contact for those creating and consuming data within their respected data domain(s). Additionally, they will be driving the team to interact directly with key domain and project stakeholders, the EDG Lead, Governance Council, other data stewards across the organization and relevant SMEs throughout the organization as necessary. This position collaborates / advises with PepsiCo's Governance Council, of which they are accountable for the success of PepsiCo’s EDG program.

Primary Accountabilities:
Promote data accuracy and adherence to PepsiCo defined global governance practices, as well as driving acceptance of PepsiCo's enterprise data standards and policies across the various business segments. Maintain and advise relevant stakeholders on data governance-related matters in specific domain (Customer, Material, Vendor, Finance, Consumer) with a focus on the business use of the dataProvide recommendations and supporting documentation for new or proposed data standards, business rules and policy (in conjunction with the Governance Council as appropriate). Advice on various projects and initiatives to ensure that any data related changes and dependencies are identified, communicated and managed to ensure adherence with the Enterprise Data Governance established standards. Represent market specific needs in Sector data councils and above, ensuring locals user needs are heard/met/addressed; Voice opinions around why proposals will or will not work for the market you represent and provide alternative solutionsCoordinate across the Sector (with fellow Market Data Stewards and the EDG Steward; strategic initiatives, Digital Use Cases and the federated data network) in order to maintain consistency of PepsiCo's critical enterprise, digital, operational and analytical data.Accountable for ensuring that data-centric activities are aligned with the EDG program and leverage applicable data standards, governance processes, and overall best practices.

Data Governance Business Standards:
Ensures alignment of the data governance processes and standards with applicable enterprise, business segment, and local data support models.Champions the single set of Enterprise-level data standards & repository of key elements pertaining to their in-scope data domain (e.g Customer, Material, Vendor, Finance, Consumer) and promoting their use throughout the PepsiCo organization. Owns one or multiple domain perspectives in defining and continually evolving the roadmap for enterprise data governance based upon strategic business objectives, existing capabilities/programs, cultural considerations and a general understanding of emerging technologies and governance models/techniques.Advise on various projects and initiatives to ensure that any data related changes and dependencies are identified, communicated and managed to ensure adherence with the Enterprise Data Governance established standards.

Data Domain Coordination and Collaboration:
Responsible for helping identify the need for sector-level data standards (and above) based on strategic business objectives and the evolution of enterprise-level capabilities and analytical requirements.Collaborates across the organization to ensure consistent and effective execution of data governance and management principles across PepsiCo's enterprise and analytical systems and data domains. Accountable for driving organizational acceptance of EDG established data standards, policies, and definitions and process standards for critical / related enterprise data. Promotes and champions PepsiCo's Enterprise Data Governance Capability and data management program across the organization.

Qualifications/Requirements

Qualifications:

4+ years of experience working in Data Governance or Data Management experience within a global CPG (Consumer Packaged Good) company; Strong data management background who understands data, how to ingest data, proper data use / consumption, data quality, and stewardship
4+ years of experience working with data in the specific domain (ie: Customer, Material, Vendor, Finance, Consumer), associated processes, involved systems and data usageAbility to partner with both business and technical subject matter experts to ensure standardization of operational information and execution of enterprise-wide data governance policies and procedures are defined and implemented.

Relocation Eligible: Not Applicable

Job Type: Regular

title: Solutions Engineer - Data Security
description:
Relaxed Work Environment, Dedicated Team, & Growing Company

Solutions Engineer

The Solutions Engineer, “Pre-sales Consultant”, or “Sales Engineer”, is a technical role that is part of the sales team. It is an exciting opportunity for experienced professionals with both strong technical, collaboration and presentation skills willing to participate in a key role in sales activities and business development.

A solutions engineer is a product and market expert for one or several product lines of HelpSystems portfolio. You will work with leading companies worldwide providing guidance during the sales process by identifying customers technical and business requirements and demonstrating product capabilities prior to designing a solution proposal that is the best for the customer. You will also participate in marketing activities such as webinars, tradeshows, and content generation.

As a Solutions Engineer for Data Security, you’ll be managing pre-sales activities for different solutions from the portfolio, your focus will be Data Classification solutions (Titus and Boldon James), DRM (Vera) and will also have the chance to learn other data security solutions from Helpsystems portfolio including, Clearswift, GoAnywhere MFT, Agari and others. This position will require to travel occasionally, you may expect to be traveling 10-50% of the time.

Responsibilities

Sales Activities :
 Be a team with sales representatives, and work together on any activities with prospective customers  Conduct “pain discovery” processes to understand the customer needs and articulate a solution that best addresses that need.  Develop, present, and deliver high-impact demonstrations  Be the owner on customer’s evaluation process of the offered products and solutions, by executing trials and proof of concepts.  Detect technical and functional objections from the prospective customer during the sales process, be creative finding solutions, and work together with the appropriate team for remediation.  Build and defend proposals to customers, articulating the benefits of our company as the best solution that addresses that need to all levels, including “C” level executives.  Estimate professional services effort and build a project plan, when needed, to guarantee a successful deployment on customer.  Understand the competition and be, with your participation, a differentiator during the sales process.  Know the company portfolio to generate and detect cross-selling opportunities. 
Partnership Activities
 Work together in partners activities like visits, demos, proposals, events, and others.  Help on partner recruiting process, participate in calls with potential partners.  Participate in partner enablement activities like tech training and functional enablement.  Deliver technical presentations and responds to technical questions during sales calls. 
Industry Events
 Represent the Company at Trade Shows, User Group events, Conferences, and Virtual events.  Provide presentations at events where applicable. 
Product / Technical Marketing
 Participate in online webinars on specific topics.  Assist in the outbound launch of new products and releases activities.  Serve as the market expert on products, from how customers use them, to how the competition positions against them, to how the field sells and services them 
Job Requirements
 Degree in a technical field, ideally Computer Science or IT is preferred.  Strong experience in IT, technical presales, technical consultancy, IT security projects, development, or technical support activities.  Excellent oral presentation skills, public relations skills, and the ability to educate and train in a technical environment. 
What Sets You Apart
 Experience with security infrastructures including DLP, CASB, Email Gateways, Document Management, and DRM/Encryption solutions.  Security, technical or other certifications like CISSP are considered an advantage  Experience with Microsoft infrastructure products including Microsoft Office, Outlook, Exchange and SharePoint, Google G Suite  Very good English is mandatory, an additional European language is a plus. 
HelpSystems is passionate about making life easier for modern organizations and improving the lives of our customers. As a seven-time Star Tribune Top Workplace we are dedicated to making our employees happy by offering great benefits, fun company culture, and transparency from our leadership team. When working at HelpSystems you will have the opportunity for an upbeat office environment with A LOT of perks, such as professional development, equity program, employee recognition programs, and more!

Check out our website to learn more about HelpSystems and apply by visiting our Careers page . We encourage you to check out our Glassdoor page as well.

As an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran or disability status.

Role Number: 200316048

title: HQ - Treasury Data Analyst (Remote, EMEA)
description:
About usJobandtalent connects good people with endless opportunities. We created a revolutionary staffing platform that seamlessly matches workers with growing companies. Jobandtalent is the world’s largest and most successful job platform, with the highest NPS in the industry and having placed over 100,000 jobseekers so far. 
At the heart of our on-demand job platform is the data-driven job matching technology, which tears down the barriers to job searching and hiring. Jobandtalent radically simplifies hiring processes so that workers are supplied a steady flow of job opportunities. International companies like DHL, FedEx, eBay, P&G, IKEA, Gorillas, and Just Eat have put their growth into the trusted hands of our people. 
Jobandtalent is currently valued at $2.4 billion and is backed by leading investors including SoftBank, Kinnevik, Atomico and BlackRock. With a growth rate of 130% and $1 billion in revenue last year, Jobandtalent is the 10th fastest growing startup in Europe 2021.
Who we areWork, work, work. At Jobandtalent, we don’t get tired of hearing all about it. That’s because we are set out on a mission to increase the employability of millions and want to put people square back at the center of employment - a mission we believe is pretty cool to be a part of. 
Headquartered in sunny Madrid, Spain, but home to the world, we are a remote-first company operating in 9+ markets across Europe and the Americas - with ambitious plans for further expansion. We need a passionate team to revolutionize the employment market with us. If you want to help us work on the future of work, keep scrolling; your next adventure awaits!
About the positionAs a Treasury Analyst, you will be part of the HQ Finance team and participate in the cash management team.
Key ResponsibilitiesSupport Treasury department on the preparation, analysis and follow-up of global credit dataMonitoring of the data generated from other Finance teams and helping different stakeholders to build dashboards, data visualizations, and KPI reportsPreparation of forecast analysis based on the data to measure impact in cash managementParticipate in different projects within the Finance department in collaboration with different Company areasGood critical thinking skills and attention to detail
Candidate RequirementsDegree in Finance, Economics, BA, Engineering or similarHigh level of Excel SQL and working with large data sets (Python skills are a bonus)High level of English (C1)
Nice to haveExperience in Tech/High Growth companiesPrevious experience in a similar taskMaster in Finance or MBA
What We OfferChance to make an impact in one of the fastest-growing start-up companies in Europe, currently expanding aggressively into the US marketDevelop your career working in a super exciting environment, with an international and multidisciplinary teamAttractive compensation and benefits packagePossibility of working remotely
Not looking for free fruit? Good, we offer much more:
Purpose: Make an impact in one of the fastest-growing scale-up companies in Europe and develop your career while working alongside an international, diverse and multidisciplinary team. Our exhilarating working environment gives you a seat at the table that's transforming the employment market
Pay: With financial recognition ingrained into our company philosophy, we offer our employees highly competitive salaries. Your performance and salary are reviewed every 12 months. With our ESOP (Employee Stock Option Plan) you can benefit from our skyrocket growth. 
Place: Being headquartered in Madrid but at home in the world, we let you work wherever you please and thrive. Even though an average 7,5 hours of Spanish sunshine a day seems pretty ideal, we are a remote-first company. We provide all the technical equipment you need to do your job, and hold regular team camps across Europe where you can meet your colleagues IRL
Play: We offer complimentary learning and development opportunities, such as an annual personal learning budget of 1,000€, as well as language classes for English, Spanish, German, Italian and French. It’s like an open bar, but better
Pace: Stagnation is boring. We believe every year gives us 52 opportunities to try something new and challenge yourself. With Jobandtalent you will be growing with us, at rocket speed 
Prop Up: We won’t leave you standing in the rain. That’s why we help you put your mind at ease and offer free emotional and psychological guidance with Therapy Chat because, well, we care about mental health. We also support European Visa Sponsorships

title: Data Platform Engineer - Looker Developer
description:
Are you an expert Looker developer with a passion for data, looking for a new challenge helping us build a state of the art Looker environment? Then albelli is looking for you!
Join us at albelli. We’re front runners in the photo product industry, blazing a trail across the globe with six different brands – albelli, monalbumphoto, bonusprint, fotoknudsen, onskefoto and resnap. We inspire people to relive and share life's moments by creating personalized photo products and believe in providing quality, affordability, and great customer service.We’re proud of what we do and the way we do it, attracting talent from all over the world. At the last count our offices were home to 40 different nationalities. As one of the fastest growing ecommerce companies in the Netherlands, we’re constantly striving to push boundaries and drive our business further forward. Would you like to be part of this international, ambitious, and fun team? Come join us and let’s create memorable moments together.
What you will be doing  We are building out our data platform team in Amsterdam, migrating our ETL/ELT stack from Redshift to Snowflake as cloud datasource. The frontend is Looker.
You will be responsible for maintaining, administering and upgrading the Looker environment.You will maintain and design the Models and the Views and supporting the analists that will be creating most of the dashboards.You will help us build a comprehensive Looker dictionary, so the entire enterprise will work of the same concepts and definitions.You will also be instrumental in the optimization of the Snowflake-Looker interface, helping us fully leveraging the Snowflake architecture and keeping cost under control.
Who are we looking for?
3+ years of experience in a similar roleExperience building, developing and administering Looker environments.3+ years SQLAgile mindset and/or experience.Nice to have:Experience with Snowflake and/or RedshiftExperience with and knowledge of AWS cloud services: AWS, EC2, S3.Experience building and optimising Data Warehouses, ETL/ELT processes and data sets.Programming PythonUsing and Programming the Dataviruality ETL/ELT tool.
We offer 
A fast-growing e-commerce environmentAn international company hosting over 40 nationalitiesCompetitive compensation and lots of benefits (such as a discounted gym membership)Budget for personal growth and development, including external training, courses, and conferencesA healthy work-life balance and a hybrid work set up (both home and at the office)Everything you need for a proper work from home setupAn informal, fun, proactive, and inclusive culture with a social atmosphere (Friday drinks, parties, sports, etc.) to be resumed properly post COVID-19!A central location in one of Europe’s most vibrant cities, Barcelona!
We are working in a hybrid environment and this role is based in our Barcelona office, situated in a WeWork by Plaça de les Glòries Catalanes, a hub for technology and innovation. Within walking distance of public transport, the beach and shopping centers, the office has great facilities (coffee, tea, showers, bike parking, social events and more) with a modern working atmosphere. There are approx. 10 people in the office, who work across all areas of the business, with a focus on analytics, marketing, and technology.

COVID-19 updateFor the safety of our employees and following the measures implemented due to COVID-19, we currently work differently. Our offices are closed while our production facilities are operating with proper safety and health measures. Our Recruiting process is currently entirely remote via phone and video calls. Our new hires will have a remote onboarding since the well-being of our employees is our number one priority.

description:

This team will be responsible for developing pipelines, extracting information from the different internal systems, and creating visualizations to help the business users make decisions. You will be working in an Agile environment together with a team of experts, using the latest technologies.

title: Big Data Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about Big Data and Cloud Services? Are you looking for innovative and tech-addicted data lovers like yourself? Do you want to create real value? - Good News – the Ultra Tendency family is growing, and we are looking for powerful new members keen on solving the most complex problems of global corporations together with us. Join our cross-functional and diverse teams in Germany, Spain, Latvia, and Russia.
Who are we? – We are Ultra Tendency: The international boutique technology company dedicated to Big Data, Streaming, IoT, Microservices, and Cloud Computing. We are based on the principle of creating innovative, highly scalable, and sustainable data-driven solutions based on cutting-edge open-source technologies and the portfolios of Azure, AWS, and GCP. We do not only leverage tech; we build it by contributing source code to more than 15 open-source projects. We operate 8 company branches in 5 countries supporting global corporations of any industry and public institution. Our mission is to enable organizations and institutions to harness the power of their data to drive the digital transformation of products and processes.
Your Role: Professional Big Data DeveloperIf you love writing high-quality code, Docker is your daily business, or you know SPARK like the back of your hand we have just the right challenges for you! In your Role as Big Data Developer, you will design and optimize data processing algorithms. Together with a very talented cross-functional team, you bring in prior experiences, best practices, and a collaborative attitude to steer Software projects.
YOUR MISSIONMake Big Data useful (build program code, test and deploy to various environments, design and optimize data processing algorithms for our customers)Support your development team with feature implementation and automate testing of data-driven applicationsMake a difference by bringing in new ideas to improve the quality or development methodology of the development team
YOU WILL ENJOY THIS ROLE IF YOU HAVEAt least 2 years of experience with data ingestion, analysis, integration, and design of Big Data applications using Apache open-source technologies, such as Spark, Kafka, Impala, HBase, etc.Strong experience in developing software using Java or a comparable language.Solid computer science fundamentals (algorithms, data structures and programming skills in distributed systems)Verbal and written skills in English (a MUST), other (e.g., German, Russian, Spanish) an advantage
BE ABLE TOShow the qualities that enable high performance like being curious about learning and thinking agileAct objective oriented - deliver on what brings the greatest value to the organizationWork enterprising - chart a course that understands customer needs and creates a competitive advantageEmpower others– build up the team and uplift growthDemonstrate reliability- be disciplined and conscientious in your tasks
YOU CAN LOOK FORWARD TOWork in an English-speaking, international, and pluralistic company that feels like one global big familyBoost your own career together with some of the greatest minds in our industry (Apache Committers, PMC members, MVPs, etc.)Create real impact and make a difference while developing unique systems and applications for our numerous renowned customers in Germany and EuropeProfessional development opportunities and an unrivaled lifelong learning philosophy that will max out your potential (guaranteed!)Unlimited access to UdemyWell-structured personal development path executed by Ultra Tendency AcademyOpen feedback culture that generates distinct value from connecting people through networks rather than through hierarchiesContribute your ideas and turn them into value through a high level of personal responsibilityGreat pay and compensationsFlexible work through home office and flex timeEmployee referral programRegular (virtual) teambuilding eventsUltra Summer: Company-wide workcation event in a beautiful location

title: BI Data Engineer (Temp)
description:
About us:
Softonic publishes Softonic.com, the leading global software and app discovery destination, offering the most complete selection of software and apps across hundreds of categories. The European company with one of the largest online audiences, and currently holds 40th position worldwide with more than 100 million unique monthly users who generate more than 4 million daily downloads on Softonic.com.
About the positionSoftonic is looking for a data engineer to join our talented team in Barcelona. In this role you will have the opportunity to work with our Google’s Cloud Platform Data Lake and help us to manage all the data ingestion of the data and move it to the next level ingesting new real-time sources. 
 REQUIREMENTSKey responsibilities
 Manage the current data ingestion process on GCP (Python - Airflow - BigQuery - and App Engine).Design & Implement the integration of additional data sources.Work with our Data Scientist & Data Analysts in order to implement and productionize ML models.Good written and verbal communication skills

title: Cloud & Data engineer - 100% remotely
description:
We are still looking for the very Top Talent…and we would be delighted if you were to join our family!
UST cares about employee’s safety and now, more than ever given the new situation, we have reinforced our operations. UST offers `100% WFH or remotely´ for our employees and, new measures of work-life balance within you could accrue enough time for a healthy and integrated professional and personal life.
UST promotes diversity and social inclusion. With this mindset, our selection processes are based on soft skill, tech ability and work experience evaluation of the participants, which do not discriminate by ethnicity, gender, disability, age, religion, sexual orientation, or nationality. Our company has an Equal Employment Opportunity Policy for all our applications, as well as for internal and external staff.
More in details, UST is a multinational company based in North America, certified as a Top Employer company with over 28.000 employees all over the world and with a presence on all 5 continents. We are leaders on digital technology services, and we provide large-scale technologic solutions to big companies through E2E projects, consulting services and our own solutions.
What are we looking for?
We are looking for a Cloud Engineer to be the point of contact for the product teams regarding CI/CD and DevOps automation. Design and implement standards to orchestrate build, upgrade and tear down of the environment using Kubernetes. You will work closely with the solution architect, software engineers and product managers to meet their environment configuration and service automation needs.
Main tasks and accountabilities will be: Cloud/devops engineer with sklill like SQL | Oracle | MS SQL | MySQL | Postgress | big data | Azure ML.Proven experience in Cloud optimized and native architectures under Microsoft Azure technology stack: managed services, serverless, PaaS for containerized microservices.Experience with Azure DevOps services, on-premises using Azure DevOps Server or TFS.Experience with Terraform/Ansible all as code.Experience with Docker/Kubernetes technologies.Knowledge on DevSecOps flow: SAST/DAST.Experience implementing and managing CI/CD solutions.Experience working with Agile principles and best practices.A degree in computer science, or similar professional certifications.Fluent English and excellent communication skillsUsed to work in multinational projects

What can we offer?
Free access to several training platforms with a wide multidisciplinary catalogue.Professional stability and career plans in our Center of Excellence where you could participate on the latest projects inside the company.International environment and close contact with colleagues specialised in the core technologies of the company, with whom you will share your knowledge.Many of international projects, with the most exciting and innovated technologies.UST also, compensates referrals from which you could benefit when you refer professionals.
And also…
UST also offers 23 days of Annual Leave plus the 24th and 31st of December as discretionary days!Competitive salary and benefits (Heath Care Plan, Internet Connectivity, Life and Accident Insurances).`Retribución Flexible´ Program: you will benefit from a flexible salary package that allows to optimise your income (Meals, Kinder Garden, Transport, English lessons, Heath Care Plan…)`Devengo´ Program (choose to prorate your salary, any moment you need!)The option to pick between 12 or 14 payments along the year.Real Work Life Balance measures (flexibility, WFH or remote work policy, compacted hours during summertime…)UST Club Platform discounts (numerous well-known brands in hospitality, retail, free time...)Gym Access discounts (choose the nearest to your home or office!)
If you would like to know more, don’t hesitate to apply and we’ll get in touch to fill you in detail.
We are waiting for you!

title: Data Developer
description:
To give people the power to build community on our platforms, we need to make sure they have the best and most secure experiences possible. People in Central Analytics empower Facebook’s Global Operations organization to be self-sufficient in tactical decision-making and drive operations strategy through analytics, data infra, and reporting. Our key partners are embedded data teams, core functions on the business side, and Data Engineering/Data Science on the product side. We are responsible for providing accurate, reliable and accessible business metrics as well as contextualizing them in operational performance with research and advanced analysis. We are looking for a Data Developer who shares our passion for helping make Facebook a safe place for people and businesses to connect across the world. The right candidate will be comfortable in a fast-moving organization, excited to collaborate and focused on positively impacting the experience of a large scale global workforce and the entire Facebook Community. They possess strong data management and manipulation skills, data visualization skills, and the ability to build strong partnerships to drive impact across the organization.

Data Developer Responsibilities:

Build/maintain data infrastructure (data pipelines, aggregated data sets, reports, dashboards) to monitor the performance of our operations and drive business understandingPartner with Operations, Data Science, Data Engineering, Product and Engineering teams to solve problems and identify trends and opportunitiesApply quantitative skills to and incorporate qualitative insights to inform and influence strategy for Global OperationsBuild best practices to support the growing data development function within the team and mentor junior colleagues on application of data development gold standards

Minimum Qualifications:

B.A. or B.S. degree with a quantitative focus in Economics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Math, Statistics, Operations Research, or equivalent training4+ years of experience extracting and manipulating data to drive projectsProficiency in querying and manipulating complex raw datasets for analysis using SQL and at least one scripting language (PHP, Python, Perl, etc.)Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker)Professional experience with reporting systems, data pipeline architecture and data modelingExperience explaining technical concepts and analysis implications clearly to varied audiences and experience translating business objectives into actionable analyses

Preferred Qualifications:

Advanced degree with a quantitative focus (Economics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Math, Statistics)Experience thinking strategically, structurally solving product problems, and driving executionExperience with distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop)Experience developing data pipelines via SQL and Python-based ETL frameworkExperience releasing code into production

title: Azure Data Engineer
description:
¿Te apasiona la tecnología y te gustaría formar parte de una empresa referente en el sector energético? En Grupo DISA buscamos a una persona que se incorpore a nuestro equipo de Transformación Digital, repartido entre nuestras sedes de Tenerife, Gran Canaria y Madrid. Este departamento se encarga de integrar la tecnología en las distintas áreas y actividades del Grupo, con el objetivo de establecer un modelo de relación digital que sitúe al cliente en el centro de nuestra estrategia y nos ayude a optimizar nuestros modelos de negocio.Dentro de este equipo, tu misión principal sería la gestión de diferentes proyectos relacionados con Data Science, Business Intelligence, Machine Learning, Inteligencia Artificial, enfocados a extraer todo el potencial que ofrecen los datos para mejorar nuestros procesos y resultados.
¿Cuáles serían tus principales responsabilidades?-Proyectos de Big Data y Business Intelligence, siendo la persona encargada de poner a disposición los datos necesarios para los Data Scientist de estos proyectos.-Diseñar y construir los pipelines (flujos) de datos de los diferentes orígenes hasta el Data Lake y el Data Warehouse del grupo, en tiempo real y batch-Crear los flujos de datos con las diferentes soluciones y servicios disponibles o en desarrollo en el Grupo DISA-Monitorizar, diagnosticar posibles incidencias y optimizar el rendimiento de todos los pipelines -Establecer sinergias con otras áreas de la empresa y con otras empresas del grupo en búsqueda de bien común.-Implementar y documentar políticas de gobierno, estandarización e integridad de los datos a medida que se van desarrollando los pipelines
Requisitos mínimos:- Mínimo 2-3 años de experiencia usando componentes DATA de Azure (ADFv2, Azure SQL DB, Azure SQL, Datawarehouse, Azure Data Lake, Azure Databricks)- Mínimo 2-3 años de experiencia Experiencia en ingestas streaming de datos usando plataforma azure (Azure Functions, Event Hub, Blob storage)- Mínimo 2-3 años de experiencia en programación con Python- Licenciatura/Grado en Matemáticas, Estadística, Informática, Física o similar- Experiencia en Azure Databricks y ADFv2- Buen conocimiento en Ecosistema Apache Spark- Experiencia con el framework de PySpark- Experiencia usando las API`s de Spark, RDD, Dataset, Dataframe- Idiomas: inglés, nivel medio/alto
Se valora:- experiencia en CI/CD, Azure DevOps- experiencia en SSIS- experiencia en C#- Formación en gestión de proyectos- Formación en sistema de gestión y auditorias
¿Qué ofrecemos?- Incorporación inmediata-Contratación indefinida-Formación continua y desarrollo profesional-Incorporación en las Políticas de sistema de teletrabajo, flexibilidad horaria y medidas de conciliación. 
Las personas que concurran a los procesos de selección y evaluación serán valoradas en base a los requisitos del puesto de trabajo con objetividad, transparencia y respetando el principio de igualdad de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres.

title: Large Format Marketing Data Science & Business Analyst Lead
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
description:
As part of a tight and agile LFP marketing team in EMEA, the Marketing Business Analyst & DMT/Automation Lead will be responsible for driving marketing excellence and performance management efforts at Global Levell

Reporting directly to the Head of marketing LF EMEA/APJ/AMS, you will partner with a multicultural central team and remotely collaborate with other 8 professional abroad based in country.

Typical responsibilities include developing reporting mechanisms to measure marketing contribution productivity & effectiveness of programs and campaigns, creating executive dashboards and other measurement tools to drive behavior and discipline and close loop marketing reporting.

Analytics
Delivers key insights in excellent presentations and prepares analytical documents that are meaningful for the business stakeholdersIdentifies data requirements to be able to conduct future analytic studies in a timely and efficient mannerConduct data-driven analysis based on syndicated, primary and secondary customer data.Provides operational expertise to drive adoption in the marketing team of data-based strategic and tactical planningTakes initiative and delivers on special marketing projects (i.e. acceleration online sales to HP Store) to increase the marketing impact.
