Support the deployment of new Digital Marketing Transformation releases in in the marketsRepresent the regional requirements in the DMT discussions; make sure the proposed structures of the DMT fit with the local structure and way of workingKeep up to date with new online targeting functionalities and deploy them to the region; e.g. LinkedIn integration with Adobe Audience builder etc. Investigate new and innovative ways to continue driving brand and demand for our HP products options beyond paid social media (paid social is not a long-term growth strategy)
Automation & Nurturing 
Redesign & automate the customer journey for our volume PLsEnsure campaign attribution is done correctly between all marketing activities (paid, programmatic, content syndication, online events, etc.)Define overarching nurturing strategy and content for existing contactsDefine and set up Eloqua integration within all the campaigns in the regionEnsure good insights and reporting is in place to continue optimizing our marketing initiatives
Who You Are
You have a Bachelor’s degree in business administration, economics, digital marketing, statistics, computer science, information technology, or equivalent.You have a highly analytical mind and have experience in understanding, processing and analyzing processes, systems and data.Advanced PPT, Power BI, Microsoft Dynamics, Excel and Power Point UserExperience managing other tools Google Analytics and Eloqua will be a plusDesirable Knowledge in DB management/administration.Results orientedStrong verbal and written communication skills.You are responsible and methodic, with analytical capabilities, willingness to learn and dynamic.Ability to work well under pressure and manage their own time to deliver the Task / Projects
Entity 70

LI-POST

About HP

You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion - it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

title: Data Engineer (Open to remote)
description:
SAVANA (www.savanamed.com) is an award-winning, international medical company aiming to accelerate health science by putting into the hands of healthcare providers the power to unlock all of the clinical value embedded within existing Electronic Health Records (EHRs) with Artificial Intelligence and Natural Language Processing. Always ensuring maximum privacy and security.
Founded in 2014, Savana is an international medical company that has developed a scientific methodology that applies Artificial Intelligence (AI) to unlock all the clinical value embedded within Electronic Health Records' free-text (EHRs). With the largest AI-enabled, multi-language, multi-center research network in the world, Savana generates customized descriptive and predictive, High-quality Deep Real World Evidence research studies. Engineered by doctors for doctors, the company is built following the highest privacy-by-design standards.
Savana operantes in more than 160 hospitals, 5 languages, 15 countries and has already improved more than 6 clinical practices with more than 120 employees from 16 nationalities. It constitutes a clinical research ecosystem that aims to advance personalized and precision medicine worldwide.

Data Engineer at Savana
Major Accountabilities where this role is involved:
Facilitate operations of Data Architects, Data QAs and Software Engineers.Remain up-to-date with data engineering trends in distributed data architectures (like Apache Spark, Apache Beam, Apache Avro, etc) to support data management initiatives.Conceptualizing and generating infrastructure that allows big data to be accessed and analyzed.Monitor and anticipate data related issues, it’s management and governance.Suggesting and implementing architecture improvements including process improvements.End to end evaluation of new technology options and vendor products. Operate according to Security Policies, Procedures and Manuals.Report any suspect of incident or improvement proposals.
Skills, Experience and Qualifications required:
Proficient with ETL tools such as Airflow and Analytics Engines for large-scale data processing such as Spark and its ecosystem.Expert proficiency in Software Engineering skills along with a deep understanding of Python, code review best practices and industry standard methodologies.Cloud: 3+ years’ experience with using a broad range of Cloud technologies (e.g. AWS ECS, AWS EC2, AWS EMR or equivalents) to prototype AWS based solutions, with a emphasis on best practices regarding cloud security and performance.Experience with data-related monitoring tools (performance and data governance).Knowledge of IaaC (eg: Terraform) tools is a BIG plus.English B2+.
 We offer:
Work with a multidisciplinary team of clinicians, computer engineers, computational linguists, mathematicians, designers, medical Natural Language Processing expert programmers, and other disciplines. We are a team of professionals with a common goal: to blend the knowledge of all of us to seek excellence in our purpose. Coming from very different disciplines, we want everyone to learn from everyone, creating a unique entity that moves towards the transformation of health through Artificial Intelligence.An opportunity to provoke a positive impact. We seek to improve health on the planet through technology and to help people and health institutions. Our employees and collaborators strive to provide our users with the necessary tools and support to achieve a more accessible and egalitarian global health. We care about our environment and we are willing to improve it.An environment to express yourself as you are and enjoy what you know. We defend individuality to form a richer and more plural "ecosystem". Be yourself and tell us what you have learned and how could we use it together to help us achieve our purpose. If you like what you do, we like to work with you.Competitive salary conditions, flexible culture and a development framework to grow your career. People are our main asset, so we invest in training and development and recognize and compensate for achievements and valuable work. We trust in the talent and commitment of people and focus on objectives and results, so we are flexible in our way of working, providing a framework to reconcile our personal and professional lives.

Details from this job description are not to be used for marketing purposes. Savana does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Savana via e-mail, the Internet or directly without a valid written search agreement will be deemed the sole property of Savana, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Savana.
Medsavana S.L. (“Medsavana”), with registered office at Calle Gran Vía 30, planta 10, 28013 Madrid will process the personal data you provide to us during the selection process (the “Candidate’s Personal Data”) in order to manage your curriculum data and the selection process you are applying to. You can exercise the rights of access, rectification or erasure, restriction of processing, objection, portability, and to object automated individual decisions at the registered office of the company indicated or in the email dpo@savanamed.com. For more information, please refer to the privacy policy section on our webpage: https://www.savanamed.com/es/curriculum/

title: Data Platform Engineer
description:
Passionate about precision medicine and advancing the healthcare industry?

Recent advancements in underlying technology have finally made it possible for AI to impact clinical care in a meaningful way. Tempus' proprietary platform connects an entire ecosystem of real-world evidence to deliver real-time, actionable insights to physicians, providing critical information about the right treatments for the right patients, at the right time.

Passionate about building great software products?

At Tempus, software products are owned and developed by small, autonomous teams composed of developers, designers, scientists, and product managers. You and your team set the goals, build the software, deploy the code, and contribute to a growing software platform that will make a lasting impact in the field of cancer research and treatment

Tempus builds software as nimble as our teams. Our modern tech stack - containerized applications running on GCP managed services - allows our teams to iterate rapidly and lead our industry in innovation. Emphasis on automation coupled with our decentralized, microservice architecture allows us to deliver advanced solutions with confidence at scale.

Why We’re Looking For You
You know what it takes to build and run resilient data pipelines in production and have experience implementing ETL/ELT to load a multi-terabyte enterprise data warehouse.You have implemented analytics applications using database technologies such as relational or multidimensional (OLAP).You value the importance of defining and enforcing data contracts with experience in writing specifications.You write code to transform data between data models and formats, preferably in Python.You've worked in agile environments and are comfortable iterating quickly.
Bonus Points For
Experience with one of the many infrastructure-as-code tools such as Terraform (our favorite), Kubernetes, CloudFormation, Docker, Ansible, Salt, Packer, Puppet, Chef, or similarExpert knowledge of relational database modeling concepts, SQL skills, proficiency in query performance tuning, and desire to share knowledge with others.Experience building cloud-native applications and supporting technologies / patterns / practices including: Google Dataflow, Google BigQuery, Google Cloud Composer, Google Pub/Sub, Google Cloud Storage, Docker, and CI/CD
Responsibilities For The Position
Works as an embedded member of an engineering teamReviews application requirements and recommends solutions and common design patternsBe a hands-on contributor to the implementation of our data lake and data pipelinesWork with data producers and data scientists to understand our data processing needs.Use your experience, technical knowledge, and creativity to simplify development and infrastructure provisioning workflowsConfigures and deploys cloud infrastructure using Terraform and CI tools like ConcourseProactively and continuously learn about new and relevant technologiesUse your knowledge to influence other developers and advocate for best practicesImplements dashboards, monitoring, and alerting for team servicesSupport your users either in-person or via Slack Document usage and query patterns for our data platform

title: Cloud Data Engineer
description:

Our client is currently engaged within driving digital changes by leveraging state of the art technologies within Data and A.I products at scale, inspiring cutting-edge developments within Data strategies to the markets.
You will be joining a team of high-performing data engineering professionals who are developing Cloud-based efforts in transforming businesses across multiple industries.Working within the Data & Analytics teams, you will participate in the development of data applications on cloud architectures, delivering digital transformation to industries. 
This opportunity will present professional exposure in cutting-edge, innovative, and technologically complex projects for clients from different sectors, acquiring knowledge in the most advanced technologies.

At Quotacom, we take the security and privacy of your personal data seriously; any data we hold will be in accordance with data protection legislation. Full details of our privacy notice can be found at www.quotacom.com/privacy-notice

title: Elasticsearch - Tech Lead - Datastore
description:
Elastic is a search company built on a free and open heritage. Anyone can use Elastic products and solutions to get started quickly and frictionlessly. Elastic offers three solutions for enterprise search, observability, and security, built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe and is publicly traded on the NYSE under the symbol ESTC. Learn more at elastic.co.

Elasticsearch is the distributed search and analytics engine that sits at the core of the Elastic Stack and powers our Cloud and our three Solutions: Elastic Enterprise Search, Elastic Observability, and Elastic Security. The teams in our datastore group work together to provide the scalable and secure foundation of an Elasticsearch cluster that other teams build on. As technical lead, you'll help transform Elasticsearch into the cloud-native foundation we'll build our SaaS platform on while continuing to improve scale, security, and user experience.

What You Will Be Doing
Work closely with a globally distributed team of 25+ technical leaders and engineers to evolve the architecture of Elasticsearch and Elastic CloudProvide mentoring to our contributors and tech leadsKeep the work in your area on-track by communicating challenges, unblocking technical hurdles, and ensuring decisions are madeUnderstand what other teams are doing with Elasticsearch - how our changes may affect them and how we could change Elasticsearch to better support their usesFoster a culture of mutual respect, collaborative decision making, and open feedbackWe value an empathetic, diverse, and motivated team with healthy personal lives. You'll encourage and promote these values, and frequently participate in interviews to hire technically strong contributors who share these values.
What You Bring Along
Excellent written and verbal communicationExperience providing technical leadership across multiple engineering teams and delivering multi-team projectsStrong technical foundation in building reliable, scalable, and supportable systems.Strong understanding of the Java ecosystem and modern Cloud environmentsOutstanding interpersonal skills; you regularly build relationships across teams to get things done
What Would Be Great
Experience building applications for deployment in KubernetesExperience building distributed systems, designing security models, or deep JDK knowledge
Additional Information - We Take Care Of Our People

As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.
Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary Health coverage for you and your family in many locationsAbility to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many rolesGenerous number of vacation days each yearDouble your charitable giving - We match up to $1500 (or local currency equivalent)Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you loveEmbracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave

title: Python Data Engineer (Remote)
description:
Veeva is a mission-driven organization that aspires to help our customers in Life Sciences and Regulated industries bring their products to market, faster. We are shaped by our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. Our teams develop transformative cloud software, services, consulting, and data to make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do. Veeva is a work anywhere company. You can work at home, at a customer site, or in an office on any given day. As a Public Benefit Corporation , you will also work for a company focused on making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.

The Role

Veeva Link seeks a mid to senior Python Data Engineer that will participate in all aspects of architecting and developing new and innovative data pipelines and data handling. You will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology and new product development in an established company that is rapidly growing. This is a great opportunity for an engineer looking to expand their well-established career, who is excited about search, solving complex problems, ownership, and who enjoys working with technologies like Python, ElasticSearch, and AWS.

What You'll Do
Participate in architecting and extending our data pipelines to accommodate the rising data amountsCollect data e.g., publications from doctors, meant for our production systems from several internal sources into a stable data setMake the data consumable for other teams using the right databases (e.g., ElasticSearch or Postgres) and APIs
Requirements
5+ years of working as a software or data engineerVery good Python knowledge with one widely used framework like Django, FastAPI, or FlaskVery good knowledge of one widely used RDS like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MSSQL, or OracleGood ElasticSearch and Git knowledgeExcellent verbal and written communication in English
Nice to Have
Knowledge in data streaming, AWS, REST APIs and GraphQL
#RemoteSpain Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world. Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams.

title: Online Marketing Data Engineer
description:
Python Developer

We are building a world-class Online Marketing Technology organization and we are seeking a highly motivated and driven back end Python developer to design, implement and maintain data pipelines along with building the backend of applications and services to automate, simplify and de-risk processes currently manually executed. This will help marketers to spend less time on repetitive tasks and to better measure the impact of marketing spend.

Data and automating processes is at the core of our online marketing campaigns and in this role, you'll work with key marketing leaders to understand their business domain (search engine marketing, app marketing, display advertising, retargeting) and how data and technology can empower them.

You will work along with other Analysts, Data Scientists and SW developers and will drive automation and insights for the eDreams Odigeo internal marketing teams, which are among the top Google, Microsoft Bing, Facebook and Criteo customers by spending in Europe.

The Online Marketing Technology team members are passionate about data, automation, statistical models, technology and innovation and love to work in a collaborative and agile environment. Team members are eager to learn and grow, to deep dive into things, to share constructive feedback and they welcome feedback from other team members. They also love challenging the status quo and are constantly thinking of new ways of doing things. You will be spending most of the time on data manipulation (pulling and merging data from external data sources through API’s or internal cloud) with the end goal to build software and algorithms for intelligent task automation. This position will report directly to the Marketing Measurement and Technology lead. Join us and help us reach our ambitious goal of becoming the global leader in online travel!

Job Responsibilities
 Collect, process, and clean data from different sources using SQL, Python, or other scripting languages;  Build applications that help analysts and marketers to work more efficiently;  Automate Online Marketing tasks, processes and best practices (also through browser automation) by building Python algorithms;  Help the team to create a best in class data & automation vision and strategy;  Assist in designing the architecture of the applications in order to minimize the development time and ensure we don’t build what can be already found in the market;  Investigate and diagnose problems, carry outcode and deployment fixes, and keep documents up to date;  Collaborate in a fast-paced, agile environment that focuses on delivering value to our customers early and often;  Help the broader team to improve the way of working and make suggestions to improve it;  Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team. 

Required Qualifications
 Degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, etc.), a PhD is a plus;  Strong working knowledge of Python - ideally at least 4 years of experience. Having worked in the online marketing domain is a plus;  Experience using SQL or other database languages;  Some experience in designing the architecture of an application from start to finish;  Experience with cloud technologies (ideally Google Cloud);  Good communication & collaboration skills, able to give and receiving constructive feedback;  Good written and verbal communication skills in English;  Positive reviews as a team player with strong positive attitude;  Ability to research using internal knowledge bases and public facing documentation (Google Cloud Platform documentation, StackOverflow, etc). 

 What can make you stand out: 
 Experience working with Agile Methodology (Kanban highly valued);  Experience with Google Analytics / website analytics platforms is a plus;  Experience with Google, and/or Microsoft Bing and/or Facebook API a plus;  Familiarity with modern API technologies (OAuth, RESTful APIs)  Good analytical skills;  Knowledge of digital marketing & advertising technology ecosystem;  Knowledge of any other programming language is a plus. 

 What do we offer? 
 We support a phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance with our flexible hours and flexible remote work policy.  Fun at work: At eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand!  Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: you will have access to internal soft skills and technical skills training as well as language lessons  A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels  We support a phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance (e.g. half-day Fridays, team building activities, flexible hours)  Flexible benefits scheme: Ticket Restaurant, transport, private health insurance, etc.  Free subscription to Safari Online Learning  We like our eDOers happy and healthy! Free fresh fruit and coffee for all and a significant GymForLess discount!  Special discounts in other local venues, such as gyms, restaurants, shops, etc.  Amazing offices in the heart of Barcelona with a beautiful terrace to have a break and enjoy the views. 

… And the opportunity to work on a dynamic, dedicated, fun, and passionate team of professionals.   We journey together! 

Come fly with us and join us now.

eDreams ODIGEO under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo –is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

title: AI/ML - Data Curation Engineer (Hebrew), Siri Languages and Technologies
description:
Summary
 
Apple's Machine Learning and AI team transform every Apple product and because we fully integrate hardware and software, we can collaborate to deliver amazing experiences while protecting user data. 


The Siri and Languages Technologies team build high quality solutions for all of Apple’s international customers, and deliver them to their favorite Apple devices, in over 40 languages and dialects. 


Join us and drive data quality to help our language engineers bring Siri to more users than ever before.


Key Qualifications
 
Native speaker fluency and cultural awareness of Hebrew


Knowledge of text processing, scripting (e.g python)and automation

Highly organized with attention to detail and a commitment to quality.

Awareness of ML, NLP, TTS, or speech recognition technologies

Outstanding communication skills.

Project management skills, with cross-functional experience and ability to understand and prioritize tasks and issues.

Technical engineering, data science or machine learning background.


Description
 
The Global Siri team brings innovative solutions to complex engineering challenges, with focus on improving the end to end engineering and quality of Siri's experiences for our international users. From Speech Recognition to Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, Big Data consumption, all the way to Speech Synthesis. Be ready to develop robust scalable systems for Siri's international languages, in partnership with a wide range of colleagues.


As a Data Curation Lead in Global Siri, you will drive and supervise several of the data curation efforts that fuel the pieces in Siri’s technology pipeline. This will include defining data curation specifications for your language, reviewing and ensuring data quality, reporting accuracy metrics, and documenting conventions and processes. You will also lead failure analysis exercises aimed at improving the quality of the end-to-end experience for Siri users in your market. This will include delivering hands-on data analysis tasks across the product’s stack, and triaging technical issues.


We are looking for demonstrated ability to be creative, take ownership of a project, and a knack for solving problems that stump most accuracy improvement projects. If you have a desire to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams with design, product, data science, and research partners we'd love to hear from you!


Education & Experience
 
B.A. or B.S. degree preferred, or experience in related fields


Additional Requirements
 
Apple’s most important resource, our soul, is our people. Apple benefits help further the well-being of our employees and their families in meaningful ways. No matter where you work at Apple, you can take advantage of our health and wellness resources and time-away programs. We’re proud to provide stock grants to employees at all levels of the company, and we also give employees the option to buy Apple stock at a discount — both offer everyone at Apple the chance to share in the company’s success. You’ll discover many more benefits of working at Apple, such as programs that match your charitable contributions, reimburse you for continuing your education and give you special employee pricing on Apple products. 


Apple benefits programs vary by country and are subject to eligibility requirements.


Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Apple is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Apple is a drug-free workplace.


Role Number: 200316036

title: CRM Data Developer
description: Reby is a fast-growing European Urban Mobility Service that provides on-demand light electric vehicles (e-kick scooters, e-bikes, e-motorbikes, etc). We are mission-driven to reduce emissions and traffic congestion making urban areas more habitable, clean and sustainable. At Reby, we are a team. We work as a team, we think as a team, and we also have a lot of fun as a team. We believe in cities where mobility is sustainable, safe, practical and affordable. Our team works very hard, every minute, to transform our communities into healthy, and clean eco-systems, while providing our riders with a practical, safe, and easy to use, method of transportation. We build for the long-term, and with a zero-waste mindset. We are coming to stay, and we know that our community will stand behind us. To be successful for this role at Reby, we’re looking for someone that has experience working with data (building dashboards, broad understanding of ETL, working with BI tools) and has some experience with code, preferably in python. This person will be the reference and owner of all-things data related that impact CRM and Customer Service. Your area of impact: At Reby you will be part of a team where you willProvide analytical support to the Customer Support and Marketing teamsBuild analytical models and dashboards to support the implementation of the initiatives across the markets and compile accurate reports for the department or upper managementBuild and own the data pipelines (extraction, transformation and modeling) that both extract data from our tools into our data warehouse and reverse ETL enriched profiles into these same tools.Implement all the Workflows and Campaigns in our CRM system (Iterable), track their progress and understand its impact in the customer journey.Ensure we get the most out of our ticketing tool (Kustomer) by means of its event-driven capabilities (webhooks + workflows)  You are a great candidate if you have:- Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field or experience working in areas of data analysis / data science- Experience with SQL is mandatory - Python/R is highly desired- Has some experience with BI tools (Datastudio, Redash, Metabase, etc.)- Is intrigued by Deep Learning in its application to NLP.- Proactive and with multi-tasking skills- Positive and patient - Get your hands dirty. Work directly with your staff on the ground What we offer:- A good and friendly team.- Competitive salary.- Real ownership and autonomy to thrive.- Be part of a company that has ambitious goals- Free coffee in the office.- Free snacks and fruit- Free rides to drive our cool & sustainable vehicles.- Cozy office in Barcelona city center. - A rapidly changing environment with lots of challenges ahead, perfect for professional growth.- A close-knit multicultural team working towards the same goal.

title: Tech Lead - Big Data (Full Remote)
description:
En Stratio llevamos más de 8 años desarrollando nuestro producto Big Data, y tenemos como objetivo conquistar el mundo digital con un único producto que revolucionará todo lo que conocemos hasta ahora.
Buscamos personas apasionadas por su trabajo que estén constantemente preguntándose si la solución que implementan/diseñan es la mejor y buscando maneras de optimizarla. 
Gente que conozca como nosotros el estado del arte, que sea capaz de detectar qué nuevas tecnologías emergentes son aplicables a nuestro producto.
Capaz de trabajar en equipo, escuchar las ideas de otras personas y abrir esos debates técnicos que tanto nos gustan. 
Creyente en la cultura agile, donde todos tenemos una voz y nos organizamos de tal manera que nuestro proyecto es sostenible y entregable. 
Entendedor de nuestro valores, aquí prima la libertad y la responsabilidad, cada uno es dueño de su tiempo pero también único responsable de su trabajo. 
Técnicamente capaz de diseñar soluciones y arquitecturas complejas que encajen en el marco del producto.
A nivel técnico necesitamos que tengas experiencia diseñando soluciones escalables en un entorno Big DataBackground en desarrollo, principalmente Java y Scala.Experiencia trabajando con BBDD no relacionales.Conocimiento de Microservicios Experiencia trabajando bajo paradigmas CI/CDValoramos muy positivamente experiencia/conocimientos de Hadoop, Spark, Spark SQL, Spark Streaming, Hive, Sistemas distribuidos: Kafka y Akka, Kubernetes, Docker, Ansible 
Si todo esto suena interesante y quieres conocer más, estaremos encontados de conocerte, aplica en la oferta y ponemos en marcha el proceso. 



The personal data you provide in this offer will be processed by STRATIO to manage yourapplication. You may exercise your rights of access, rectification, deletion, opposition,limitation, portability or revoke your consent by mail to Vía de las Dos Castillas, 33 - 28224Pozuelo de Alarcón (Madrid), providing DNI or equivalent document, identifying yourself as acandidate in this offer and completing your request.For more information about the treatment of your data, see Privacy Policy.By submitting your request, you consent to the processing of your personal data.

title: Data Analyst Intern (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you’ll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives… all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo (glovoapp.com) is looking for a passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on professional to be a hybrid supporter to our Live Operations Controlling and Data team in our headquarters in Barcelona. You will help to provide an excellent and efficient service.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Assist on the creation, enhance and maintenance of financial dashboards and analyses to give visibility to the top-management of the LiveOperations performance; Support in the design of dashboards and data visualizations; Help the company’s decision makers with any ad-hoc requests; Be part of the automation of LiveOperations cost structure and KPIs tracking, ensuring they are properly implemented and accurate; Ensure financial reporting compliance; Assist in the analytical/financial models and perform analysis that will bring insights to solve challenges of LiveOps cost and operations; Give life to your craziest ideas and have an immediate impact; Report to the LiveOps Controller Actively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a difference 
You Have
Bachelor in Business, Economics, Engineering, Maths Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills Analytical and coding skills: Excel proficiency and SQL (plus) Comfortable working in a high growth and high performance start-up with a fast pace Itchy feet and continuous thrive on learning through different projects Strong Business mindset Professional English Our core values are very important to us: Gas, Good vibes, Be humble, Glownership and Care An empathetic, inclusive and curious attitude 
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!

Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders! Flexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time) Online therapy and wellbeing benefit Discounted gym memberships Paid internship 
What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openly Stay Humble: Self-aware and open to learning Care: Uplift people and the planet Glownership: Act as proud owners High Bar: Focus on Top Performance 
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

title: Data Pipeline Engineer (Java/Golang/C#) (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know Our Team 

The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.

The Opportunity 

As data engineer, you will work on distributed systems spanning multiple data centers, thousands of servers and hundreds of billions of messages a day. Ensuring data quality, data integrity and data accuracy is a core part of our identity. Design for new scalable system which data is increasing day by day, including auditing and monitoring systems. You will be eager to solve problems that come from managing and making sense of large amounts of data. Some of the things you’ll get to work on include schema registry, real-time data-ingestion, cross data center replication, enrichment, storage and analytics of the data flow.

We are a small passionate team and we are looking for exceptional individuals to be a part of designing, building, deploying (and probably debugging) our Data Pipeline.

In This Role, You’ll Get to 

You will build, administer and scale data pipelines that process hundreds of billions of messages a day spanning over multiple data centersYou will develop and expand upon existing frameworks that is used by Teams throughout Agoda to produce messages to the data pipelineYou will build and manage data ingestion into multiple systems (Hadoop, ElasticSearch, other Distributed Systems)You will build tools that monitor high data accuracy SLAs for the data pipelineYou will explore available new technologies that improve upon our quality of data, processes and data flowYou will develop quality software through design review, code reviews and test driven development

What You’ll Need To Succeed

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science / Information Systems / Computer Engineering or related field2 plus years of industry experience, preferred at a tech companyAn experienced Java DeveloperGood knowledge of data architecture principlesHave operational experience debugging production issuesAn experienced coder, who can stand your ground with experience building systems with purpose that are flexible, well-tested, maintainable and scaleYou’re detail oriented considering every outcome of a particular decisionYou can communicate in technical English with fluidity, both verbal and writtenAbility to work under pressure

It’s Great If You Have 

More than one programming language (Golang, Java, Scala, Python, C#, etc.)Good understanding of how Kafka worksKafka Administrator ExperienceUnderstands Concepts relating to Schema Registry and Schema EvolutionExperience working with Serialization Formats either with ProtocolBuffers, Avro or ThriftExperience with data ingestion from Kafka into Hadoop, ElasticSearch, other Distributed SystemsStrong systems administration skills in LinuxWorked on or contributed to Open Source Project 

Equal Opportunity Employer 

Agoda prides ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

title: Employee Success (HR) Data Analyst (Remote)
description:
Veeva is a mission-driven organization that aspires to help our customers in Life Sciences and Regulated industries bring their products to market, faster. We are shaped by our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. Our teams develop transformative cloud software, services, consulting, and data to make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do. Veeva is a work anywhere company. You can work at home, at a customer site, or in an office on any given day. As a Public Benefit Corporation , you will also work for a company focused on making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.

The Role

Today, Veeva is one of the fastest companies to hit one billion in revenue and we have our sights to reach 10,000 employees worldwide by 2025. To help with this rapid scaling, we are expanding our Employee Success (HR) team in Europe.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our growth across Europe. You will act as the subject-matter expert on our HRIS, ATS and other systems, integrations, data, and reporting. The work you do will help leaders make smarter, more data-driven decisions throughout the organization.

You are comfortable diving into databases, systems, working across various teams, and interacting with internal customers daily. You can identify inefficiencies and proactively bring solutions to light. Analytics and data accuracy go hand-in-hand with this role. Partnering with the team to support the delivery of timely, accurate data that is actionable for different audiences is crucial.

This opportunity is available across Spain as this is a Work Anywhere role. You must be legally authorized to be employed in the European Union as Veeva does not provide sponsorship for employment visas for this position.

What You'll Do
Own our databases, mapping, and systems integrations. Troubleshoot and resolve issues in a timely mannerOptimize, simplify, and automate reporting and dashboard configuration as neededDeliver high-quality weekly reporting to the business. You’re not just pulling data, you’re interpreting it, uncovering trends, and providing actionable insightsBecome a super user of our HRIS and ATSUnderstand the business and its priorities - deliver proactive and informed insights that can create a net positive impactEnsure data integrity and accuracy through focus and attention to detail 
Requirements
2+ years of quantitative analysis experience; ideally in HR, recruitment, or Sales/Marketing Advanced Excel (macros, queries, etc.) and Google Sheets skillsUnderstanding of SQL Experience working with Domo or a similar BI/analytics tool (e.g. Tableau, Google Analytics)Comfortable with system integrations, connectors, APIs, or data migrationsExperience with data visualization and data-driven storytelling Strong interpersonal and communication skills – ability to collaborate, partner, and solutionAbility to handle multiple tasks concurrently while maintaining strong attention to detailFluency in English
Nice to Have
University degree in a relevant fieldHands-on experience with Domo Experience with Bamboo or Lever
#RemoteSpain Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world. Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams.

title: CX Strategy Data Analyst Intern (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you’ll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives… all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

Reporting to Sr. CX Project Manager, you will be part of a small multicultural A-team of super-achievers with a huge impact in the company, aiming to deconstruct, synthesize, and deploy initiatives to drive best-in-class customer experience. Ownership and Responsibilities will be given to you from Day one.

You will be thrown at different tasks and problems that are identified as key areas for improvement that affect customer happiness. The learning curve will be steep as this role entails understanding all the touchpoints (and pain points) of the whole customer journey and being able to identify root causes and solutions to improve them.

The team is by nature cross-functional, so most of the time and energy is spent collaborating with multiple departments from Operations and Customer Service to Finance, Strategy, Growth and Tech.

Are you looking for a challenging experience in one of the fastest-growing Startups in Europe? Do you want to contribute to building a world-class Customer Experience?

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will

Be a key asset for CX strategic decision making:
Support CX team on internal consulting projects with the goal of gaining insights, identifying root causes and coming up with brand new ideas for strategies and solutions to deliver a world-class experience to Glovo customersSupport senior management and leadership team in strategic decision making by providing key intelligenceTrack and report customer experience KPIs & performance
Master Glovo Data
Provide support on all data related queries by conducting exploratory analysis via SQL (occasionally python), including verifying data quality, analyzing data, isolating and diagnosing the problem and resolving the issueTranslate data insights into quantifiable business opportunities and actionable proposalsDesign, publish and maintain dashboards and visualization tools to facilitate reporting
Collaborate & Foster CX Mindset
Actively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a differenceDrive Customer focused actions and a CX mindset within all teams of Glovo (extremely cross-functional role)Proactively contribute with experience blindspots, constantly have an eye open for the real experience and continuously drive Glovo end to end Customer Journey to the next levelActively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a difference 
You Have
Availability for 6 months full-time internshipStudying or just graduated from a bachelor or master degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Business Management, Economics, Statistics, or other disciplines with demonstrated technical exposurePrevious internship/trainee experience in business analyst, engineering or other technical positions, start-ups, consulting, investment banking, VC, PE are highly preferredStrong SQL skills - able to extract, manipulate, transform and analyze large volumes of data by building complex queries with a high level of accuracy; Looker, PowerBI, Tableau and Python skills are highly preferredA strong grasp of statistical concepts, especially those related to experiment design and analysisStrong analytical mindset to deliver effective & pragmatic solutionsExcellent attention to detail - you are methodical and thorough in your analyses (problem statement, data discovery to result in communication)Excellent communication, visualization & storytelling with data skills to both scientific and business audiencesFluent in English, any additional language is a plusGlobal mentality and international experiencesProblem solver and a structured and sharp mindTeam player and proactive can-do attitudeResponsible and able to prepare quality reliable outputsWilling to take responsibility from day 1An empathetic, inclusive and curious attitude
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!

Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders! Flexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time) Online therapy and wellbeing benefit Discounted gym memberships Paid internship 
What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learningCare: Uplift people and the planetGlownership: Act as proud ownersHigh Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

title: Data Product Analyst
description:
Wallbox is a global company, dedicated to changing the way the world uses energy. We do this by creating smart charging systems that combine innovative technology with outstanding design and manage the communication between vehicle, grid, building, and charger.

Founded in 2015, with headquarters in Barcelona and selling already in over 80+ countries, our mission is to facilitate the adoption of electric vehicles today to make more sustainable use of energy tomorrow. Our talent has no borders - we welcome over 900 Wallboxers from over 45 nationalities in Europe, Asia, and the Americas!

We’re now the first Spanish unicorn listed on the NYSE (WBX) and have been recently named amongst LinkedIn’s top 3 Spanish startups.

In day-to-day life, you will see our core values shining through our Wallboxers. The passion and dedication towards our mission will hit you the moment you walk through our doors - and there’s no feeling like it.

Our journey is not plain sailing - it requires proactive, flexible and top performing individuals who are committed to the world of sustainable mobility. But one thing is for sure - it's going to be a fun ride!

The question is: are you ready to change the world with us?

You Will
Be responsible for improving the in-App experience of our usersEngage with internal stakeholders to gain an understanding of the problems that need to be solved and gather requirements for analytical tasksModel and evaluate user and device behaviour in order to identify potential value of planned projectsDevelop and evaluate A/B test experiments or other analyses to measure and report the performance of released featuresEnable data driven product development through analysis of device, in-app, and external dataExtract, load and reconcile large data sets from multiple system platforms and sources.Utilize SQL or other advanced analytic tools to perform data extract and query functions..Build post-measure dashboards that will serve as a feature monitoring tool for diverse stakeholdersBe involved throughout the complete product lifecycle in order to guarantee a data-driven process

Requirements

Must have:
Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering or other fields with a strong mathematical-statistical background2+ years experience in working in a data driven analytics environment including an understanding of how to engage and influence decision makersExceptional analytical skills, lateral thinking and experience in solving highly challenging problemsBe fluent with one or more common data-related programming languages (Python or R)Very good knowledge of SQL and experience in working with large data sets Fluent in business English 

Nice to have
Experience in working with predictive modelsExperience in working with Data Visualisation tools (e.g.Tableau, Qlikview)Experience in working with Product Analytics tool (e.g. Mixpanel) Experience in Energy, Mobility or Automotive industry will be good to have

Benefits
Half-day Fridays! First class private health insurance after your first month at Wallbox Online group training sessions twice a week & other out of office activitiesUse one of our EVs for a weekend and/or a week (car sharing) and test our products in your home (beta testing) to become a valuable source of feedbackFree online language classes (Spanish & English) twice a weekFlexible compensation valid for restaurants & food delivery apps, transportation, childcare, and learning & development. Hundreds of discounts in different brands & services with our Wallbox Circle benefits platformCar discounts & special advantages if you choose an EV!Smartpoint for all your online orders & services at our officesFree coffee & soft drinks to fuel those tough Monday morningsVariety of breakfast and lunch dishes, everyday, at a discounted price at our canteenLearn and grow in a company of over 45 nationalities and counting! No suits! Unless it's Carnival or Halloween 

Please submit your CV in English
At Wallbox, we’re committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We strive to be a more equal opportunity workplace.

title: Urgente!!!Engineer Big Data & DevOps. Proyecto Oil & Gas. TEMPORAL/Remoto!
description:
En Decskill, buscamos Big Data Engineer con conocimientos de DevOps para un importante proyecto del sector Oil & Gas. 
Condiciones: Contrato de freelance/ Cuenta propiaPosibilidad de continuidadTrabajar mano a mano con importante empresa del sector teecomunicaciones y Oil&GasAl menos 5 años de experiencia en las funciones descritas.Incorporación inmediataRequisitos: Fuertes habilidades de desarrollo de Python Amplia experiencia trabajando con Rest, frameworks (Flask, FastAPI, Falcon, etc.), arquitectura de microservicios y protocolos de comunicación. Experiencia con funciones de Azure, securitización, diseño de API sin servidor. Experiencia con Integración Continua / Entrega Continua en AZURE Ser capaz de configurar, ejecutar, ajustar y solucionar problemas de servicios en Azure, registro de diagnóstico, servicio de aplicacionesServidor SQL, Postgres o similarConstruir una base sólida de ingeniería dentro del equipo de ciencia de datos.Crear y mantener servicios escalables y de alto rendimiento para ser utilizados por millones de clientes todos los días. Desarrollar herramientas para habilitar a los equipos de ciencia de datos y mejorar su productividad en toda la organización.Profundo conocimiento de Python y su ecosistema, especialmente orientado a ciencia de datos y Machine Learning.Buenas prácticas de testing con TDD o similar y conocimientos sobre cómo configurar entornos de testing automatizados.Tener pasión por la buena calidad y mantenibilidad del código. Experiencia con Spark o tecnologías de procesamiento de datos distribuidos comparablesExperiencia con Docker, Kubernetes y Helm

title: Head of Data Analytics (They /She/ He)
description:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you’ll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives… all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (for example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

Data and Product Analysts at Glovo form the biggest part of the Data community, with over 100 individuals and growing. We aim to use Data to drive each and every decision we make, and to support those analytical needs our Data teams are decentralized and integrated within each business unit. To continue building our Data Culture and drive fast iterations with Data, we are looking for a solid Analytics leader who can accelerate our time to insight and help develop our advanced analytics capabilities.

As the Head of Data Analytics, you will be the main point of reference for the data analytics craft, setting its vision and foundational processes (career progression, working ways, prioritization…). You will have the opportunity to influence and rally teams across the company to evolve the analytics function and deliver incremental value to the organisation through Data. You will be identifying mechanisms, processes, tools and technologies to make analysts' jobs more efficient and engaging. You will interact with other Data leaders and VPs.

You will build and grow central teams to help you in your ambitious mission, so you can efficiently support the rest of the organization.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Actively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a differenceCreate strategic plans to define the evolution of Data Analytics, in which areas to invest, and where not to invest.Guide and develop the senior team within the area and help build solid teams across the company.Define data standards, processes and best practises and evangelise on them throughout the organisationAct as an ambassador and harmonise a common toolset, identifying the right tools and services and finding support for teams across the company to adopt it.Upskill, enable and incubate talent within the company, to elevate the capabilities within certain areas of the companyBuild and develop the analytics community
You Have
An empathetic, inclusive and curious attitudeExtensive experience in the analytics field, both as a product or data analyst and leading analytics teamsLeadership and people management skills (team development, coaching, strategic planning, business acumen, influencing, making change happen).Project management skills (familiarity with Agile and OKRs) and knowledge in productising data solutions.Be familiar with technical concepts & tools in most disciplines of data & product analytics. You can pick the right approach & tool, and help others do so.Excellent written and spoken communication skills (English).
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!

Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing equity planTop-notch private health insuranceMonthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders!Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and foodDiscounted gym membershipsFlexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time)Enhanced parental leave including nursery support!Online therapy and wellbeing benefitExternal learning budget
What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quicklyCare: Uplift people and the planetGood Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learningGlownership: Act as proud ownersHigh Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

title: Data Analyst Internship
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
description:
What We Offer
Curricular Internship agreement between university, company, studentFlexible schedule for part time (4h/day) or full time (8h/day) for a 3 to12 months agreementA Young employee Network (YEN) which host fun events on a regular basis; such as “beer bust” Fridays at different venues including the beach in the summertime.We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy and general healthFree daily printing Happy hour – from photographs, to large posters. And Hands-on workshops to print with the latest technology – from wall covers to 3D printed models
The HP Personalization & Industrial Business (PIB) offers an integrated portfolio of Services that enables predictable printing operations and optimized cost structure. It allows our customers to maximize press uptime, increase productivity, and grow their business.

The EMEA Competency Center is part of this organization, and our focus is to give support to our customers and help them to grow.

Our team actually giving support to the local service teams that are delivering onsite support to the HP Indigo customers. As part of our responsibilities we need to ensure that the knowledge is transferred from GBU to the local service teams. From our team we develop and deliver programs to help customer growth and improve current processes in the organization.

Knowledge And Skills
Good presentation skillsUnderstanding of the printing industryOffice 365 expertiseCustomer orientedExcellent verbal and written communication skills in language to be supported.Experience in troubleshooting in a technical environment.Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.Software and hardware knowledge of computing, storage and peripheral devices.Advanced proficiency with case management databases and tools.Superior customer service skills.LEAN knowledge (preferred)
Responsibilities
Usage of differents platforms to manage Data.Creation of automatic reports to extract data that supports the organization in their operations and decisionsCreation of Dashboard in different platforms (Power BI, Tableu, Service Now) to cover the needs of the organization.Office 365 expertiseAnalytical thinking and problem solving skills.Software and hardware knowledge of computing, storage and peripheral devices.
Education And Experience Required

Last year of Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science and Engineering

Fluent english.

About HP

You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion - it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

title: Big Data Developer Cloud-Remoto
description:
¡Hola! Somos Indizen By Scalian, una empresa española que forma parte del Grupo Scalian, especializada en soluciones para empresas que buscan realizar su transformación digital implementando proyectos de Big Data, Cloud, Cyberseguridad o Inteligencia Artificial. Nacimos en 2001 y desde entonces nos hemos desarrollado en el sector bancario, salud, transporte, retail…
En Indizen by Scalian llevamos largos años de recorrido, desde el 2019 formamos parte de la multinacional francesa Scalian Group, presente en diferentes países de Europa, especializada en estrategia, transformación, sistemas y desempeño de operaciones. Juntos hemos alcanzado nuevos proyectos y sectores a nivel internacional donde se combinan nuestros conocimientos y talentos.
Nuestros equipos están orgullosos de trabajar en este sector sabiendo que nuestro trabajo contribuye a mejorar la vida de las personas, y que cada día aportamos un poco más en hacer del mundo un lugar mejor (entre todos). Sentimos pasión y curiosidad por lo que hacemos. ¿Y a ti que te apasiona?
Actualmente somos más de 400 indizer@s y seguimos creciendo… ¿te interesaría unirte a nuestro equipo? 
¿Qué buscamos? 
Un/a Desarrollador/a Big Data Developer para incorporarse en proyectos del sector Banca
Te incorporarás a un proyecto de ámbito internacional cuyo objetivo es redefinir los cálculos de reportes financieros, trabajando en Cloud con Azure
Requisitos mínimos: 
Experiencia mínima de 2-3 años con lenguaje de programación ScalaExperiencia con diferentes tecnologías de Big Data: Spark, Hive, Kafka...Experiencia con Azure Event Hubs, Azure Functions y Azure Data Lake Storage
¿Qué ofrecemos? 

Contrato indefinido 100% Teletrabajo Formación continua y planos de desarrollo profesional Retribución flexible (seguro médico, cheque restaurante, cheque guardería, transporte público ...) 
¿Quieres saber más? 
Si hemos despertado tu curiosidad, inscríbete o envía tu CV a joinus@indizen.com con el asunto "Big Data Cloud". 
(Ref:2364)

title: Intern Data Analyst
description:
Do you want to live the experience of a Multinational company with the Dynamism of a

Startup?

If you are looking for an internship that test your skills and boost your career, our

Schneider trainee program is for you.

Be part of an inclusive environment for the 6 months where you can co-create solutions

for the key challenges of the industry by learning from our experts. Take your creativity

and innovation to another level while enjoying paid internship with flexible hours and

interactive workshops.

Join our #SEGreatPeople

https://youtu.be/VbldHPFltQQ

What will you learn?
 Supporting AI / BI Projects in the business gathering, data sourcing and quality assurance in
various AI/BI Platforms including Tableau, Tableau CRM, Einstein discovery, MS Azure.. etc.
 Participating during the initial stages and run mode of AI/BI projects supporting Product
Owners using Agile principles and following Scrum rituals.
 Helping to implement methods to monitor and improve data reliability and quality. Participating in the ideation of the AI initiatives using Python, R Studio and other Data
Platforms.
 In constant touch with community and deployment managers within the AI/BI Projects scope.

What do we ask from your side?
 Be able to do the internship between 4 and 6 hours per day (Monday to Friday) and have
availability in the morning, the schedule is flexible and you can start between 8:00 and 10:00
 Be able to sign an internship agreement with your school for at least 6 months.

What do we offer?
 Paid internship based on the hours you are able to do (maximum 30 hours per week) Flexible schedule. One day off per month Duration: 6 months with the possibility of extending Possibilities of career opportunities within the company Tracking of your evolution and learning.We seek out and reward people for putting the customer first, being disruptive to the status
quo, embracing different perspectives, continuously learning, and acting like owners. We want

our employees to reflect the diversity of the communities in which we operate. We welcome

people as they are, creating an inclusive culture where all forms of diversity are seen as a real

value for the company. We’re looking for people with a passion for success — on the job and

beyond.

Why us?

Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.

€25.7bn global revenue

137 000+ employees in 100+ countries

45% of revenue from IoT

5% of revenue devoted for R&D

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled

It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

title: Data Analysis Internship
description:
Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek ---- so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com

Are you highly motivated, results-oriented, and currently studying in the field of data analysis? Partner with us, put theory into practice, and accomplish an internship within an international company and market leader!

This Is An Exciting Opportunity To Join Us As a Data Analysis Intern, Become Part Of a Dynamic Team Of Highly Experienced Professionals, And Learn And Apply The Knowledge Acquired During Your Degree Program In a Professional Environment To
Understand the main responsibility and activities of the teamWork with internal and external tools focused on data analysis and trends that help defining the group’s activitiesExtract and evaluate trends, workflows and possible areas of growth potential for the markets served by Agilent
This internship opportunity will be based in Madrid (Spain), should ideally be in full-time dedication, and for a duration of 12 months. The start date could be as soon as possible (Summer 2022).

At Agilent, we value a passion for science, a focus on results and a commitment to a greater good. Drive, talent and experiences can vary from individual to individual, but together we have a common thread we call One Agilent. Learn more about Diversity and Inclusion here: https://careers.agilent.com/diversity-inclusion/

See what’s it like to work at Agilent Technologies Spain here: https://youtu.be/H4ZS5Ba0vnA

Who Are We Looking For

A current student with a strong work ethic, studying towards an academic degree in a relevant field, including (but not limited to) Data Analysis, Data Science or Business studies. Ideally, you are in your last 1-2 years of studies.

To be successful in your internship, you would also ideally need to be/ have:
Organized, self-motivated, able to balance priorities & to work independentlyGood understanding of the principles of Marketing, Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.Proficient in English - other European languages are an advantageFirst practical data analysis experience (previous internships, etc.) would be helpful
Agilent is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

Interested?

We are looking forward your application!

Please, complete the application process online.

The position will remain open for applications until a suitable candidate has been identified.

title: Data Solutions Developer
description: Desde Sandav Consultores nos encontramos en la necesidad de incorporar perfiles con experiencia como Data Engineer para colaborar en un importante proyecto que gestionamos 100% en remoto. ¿QUÉ HARÁS EN TU TRABAJO?
