title: Senior/Principal Data Scientist
description:
About UsWe are Aily Labs, a start-up based in Munich and in Barcelona. Aily Labs was founded in Spring 2020 and now we are already a team of +50 super motivated ML Engineers, data scientists and developers.
Our mission is to build beautiful Artificial Intelligence products. We’re curious, passionate, and relentless in our drive to develop a truly end-to-end product, pushing the boundaries of innovation as far as we can.
Our data science and ML hub is based in Barcelona, we are currently a team of 15 DS & ML engineers both working from our office or remotely. We are looking for passionate data scientists to join our mission at all the levels of seniority (this post is for Seniors, but if you have more or less seniority and you are interested we would also love to hear from you).
In the data science team, we encourage a fun and agile environment. We contribute to the development of the brain of our products. We work in scrum, and we develop our products in our own Python packages powered by open-source ML libraries.
RoleIf you have a passion for data and technology and want to join a crew of sharp analytical minds, then this is the right opportunity for you. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will get a chance to take part in leading the development of features of our AI products and perform the following tasks:Understand and own a business requirement and design an ML approach to solve the challenge effectivelyDefine which is the technology to use in each part of the pipeline (SQL, Python, EC2, AWS Lambda, crontab, …)Lead a small team of data scientists towards the development of a feature for the application.Ensure coding best practices in the development and mentor junior data scientists in coding standardsValidate and approve Pull RequestsInteract with other functions and agree data exchange protocols (DevOps, Front End, Database, backend, …)Define strategies for the use of data and how data use interact with data designLead an AI laboratory performing discovery tasks and developing AI products

Qualifications / Experience4 to 6 years of experience in data science for Senior, 6+ years for Principal>4 years experience with data programming/ scripting languages (Python, R, SQL). Including package building, object-oriented programming. Bonus: APIs, AWS Lambda, Step functions, …>4 years experience in machine-learning methodologies (supervised /unsupervised, deep learning)Experience using cloud technologiesExperience working with multi disciplinary teamsExperience working with Agile Methodology (Jira, stand ups, sprint planning, …)Experience in project planningExperience in communicating technically, at a level appropriate for the audienceAbility to work in a fast pace and learn quickly(Bonus) Master in Data Science /Machine Learning(Bonus) AWS Cloud experience/ exposureEnglish C1 required

What sets us apart?We are an internationally diverse team that supports one anotherWe develop high-quality software and thus create sustainable added value for our customersWe live a feedback culture so that we can constantly reflect and improveWe offer flexible remote work with free time management within the projectsWe enjoy new technologies and love to learn new things and grow with themWe give freedom for further training because lifelong learning is important to us

title: Senior Data Scientist Search (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo is looking for world-class Senior Data Scientists to work in our Barcelona office.

Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on? Do you want to evolve into one of the fastest growing startups of Barcelona, building a product that will change people's day-to-day lives and disrupt the on-demand market?

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Contribute to the development of Glovo’s Search engine by a cross functional team (Product Management,Software Engineering, Data) and being responsible for the implementation of the Machine Learning part of the solutionDevelop, test and productionize predictive algorithms by using state of the art machine learning algorithms and statistical modelsEvaluate algorithms through controlled offline (e.g. cross validation with holdouts strategy) and online experiments (e.g. cross validation, A/B testing) Help shape the future of the team by designing and carrying out experiments that provide actionable insightsCreate dashboards and reports to regularly communicate results and monitor key metricsOpportunity to grow the DS Glovo community through mentoring and recruiting Disseminate outcomes through talks as well as papers and posters in conferences
You Have
At least 2+ years of experience in the development of Machine Learning solutions applied to search engines, and knowledge of the relevant technologies and concepts (Elastic Search, Semantic Search, etc) Deep theoretical and applied knowledge in at-least one of the following areas: supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, game theory, statistical inference, bayesian statistics, causal inference, time series analysis, decision theory, mathematical optimisation Demonstrable experience at productionising ideas; from conception to deployment Python and/or R experience; can independently prototype solutions to problems Experience with big data (e.g. PySpark or equivalent) and cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) Excellent English communication skills and ability to tailor for different audiences 
Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan Attractive Relocation package (if applicable ;)) Comprehensive Private Health Insurance Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!) Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months! Discounted Gym memberships Flexible working environment 
What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
GAS: Driven to deliver quality results quicklyGood Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learningCare: Uplift people and the planetGlownership: Act as proud ownersHigh Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we’re currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://glovoapp.com/ | Twitter: @Glovo_ES | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/glovoappES/ | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/glovo-app/

title: Senior Data Scientist, Global Procurement Technology
description:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

*Role can be based out of one of the following EU locations: Berlin, Madrid, Barcelona, Luxembourg, London, Milan, etc.*

Are you a talented and inventive scientist with a strong passion about modern data technologies and interested to improve business processes, extracting value from the data? Would you like to be a part of an organization that is aiming to use self-learning technology to process data in order to support the management of the procurement function?

The Global Procurement Technology, as a part of Global Procurement Operations, is seeking a skilled Data Scientist to help build its future data intelligence in business ecosystem, working with large distributed systems of data and providing Machine Learning (ML) and Predictive Modeling expertise. You will be a member of the Data Engineering and ML Team, joining a fast-growing global organization, with a great vision to transform the Procurement field, and become the role model in the market. This team plays a strategic role supporting the core Procurement business domains as well as it is the cornerstone of any transformation and innovation initiative. Our mission is to provide a high-quality data environment to facilitate process optimization and business digitalization, on a global scale. We are supporting business initiatives, including but not limited to, strategic supplier sourcing (e.g. contracting, negotiation, spend analysis, market research, etc.), order management, supplier performance, etc.

We are seeking an individual who can thrive in a fast-paced work environment, be collaborative and share knowledge and experience with his colleagues. You are expected to deliver results, but at the same time have fun with your teammates and enjoy working in the company. In Amazon, you will find all the resources required to learn new skills, grow your career, and become a better professional. You will connect with world leaders in your field and you will be tackling Data Science challenges to ensure business continuity, by taking the right decisions for your customers.

Key job responsibilities

As a Senior Data Scientist in the team, you will:
 be the subject matter expert to support team strategies that will take Global Procurement Operations towards world-class predictive maintenance practices and processes, driving more effective procurement functions, e.g. supplier segmentation, negotiations, shipping supplies volume forecast, spend management, etc. have strong analytical skills and excel in the design, creation, management, and enterprise use of large data sets, combining raw data from different sources provide technical expertise to support the development of ML models to facilitate intelligent digital services, such as AI-powered Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) platform cooperate closely with different groups of stakeholders, e.g. data/software engineers, product/program managers, analysts, senior leadership, etc. to evaluate business needs and objectives to set up the best data management environment create and share with audiences of varying levels technical papers and presentations deal with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment

Basic Qualifications
 Master’s Degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Informatics, Mathematics, or a related technical discipline 6+ years of industry experience in data engineering/science, business intelligence or related field 4+ year experience in algorithm design, engineering and implementation for very-large scale applications to solve real problems Very good knowledge of data modeling and evaluation Deep understanding of regression modeling, forecasting techniques, time series analysis, machine-learning concepts such as supervised and unsupervised learning, classification, random forest, etc. Track record of developing and applying ML models to business problems (Procurement, Transportation, Finance, etc.) Experience architecting Big Data and ML solutions with AWS products (Redshift, DynamoDB, Lambda, S3, EMR, SageMaker, Lex, Kendra, Forecast etc.) Advanced SQL level and query performance tuning skills 4+ years of proficiency in using R, Python, Scala, Java or any modern language for data processing and statistical analysis
Preferred Qualifications
 PhD in ML & Data Science, Applied Data Science, Web Science, Statistics, Analytics, or a related discipline Experienced in applying theoretical models in an applied environment Experience with various RDBMS, such as PostgreSQL, MS SQL Server, MySQL, etc. Experience mentoring other scientists on best model design and development practices Experience articulating business questions and using quantitative techniques to arrive at a solution using available data Experience with agile/scrum methodologies and its benefits of managing projects efficiently and delivering results iteratively Excellent written and verbal communication skills including data visualization, especially in regards to quantitative topics discussed with non-technical colleagues
Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.


Company - Amazon EU SARL (Spain Branch)

title: (Junior) Data Scientist
description:
XING is the social network for business professionals with millions of members all over the world. Help us shape the future – for a better working life! 
You will be part of an international team of Data Scientists and Data Engineers that is responsible for turning data into services and products for XING's jobs market which is used by Millions of users. We work closely together in an agile setting and focus on improving our existing job recommender and job search and developing new data-driven services that benefit the users of XING's jobs market place. For example, we work on features that help job seekers to better understand who their future colleagues may be, models that help forecasting salaries, etc. As a (Junior) Data Scientist your job includes analysis, feature engineering and the development of machine learning models. And it does not stop there: you also bring your models to production and conduct A/B tests to understand to what extent your models helped people to find a job. 
Your Role as Data Scientist:Design and implement new algorithms and Machine learning models for search and recommender services Contribute to the development of services, batch processes and stream processing components (using programming languages such as Scala, Python or SQL and technologies like Spark, Kafka, etc.) to ship algorithms to our end usersProactively analyze data assets (e.g. tracking data, profiles, job ads, etc.) and experiment to enhance existing services and create new servicesDesign and implement components in a sustainable fashion (e.g. automating training of ML models; balance between complexity of models, computational costs, ease of use)Contribute to our Data Platform by developing reusable data sets, data processing components, utility functions, etc.
You're the right candidate if you come with...MSc or higher degree in Computer Science, Math or similar disciplinefirst Hands-on experience in analyzing large datasets (e.g. with Python, SQL or similar) and developing Machine learning modelsGood theoretical and practical knowledge about machine learning and problem domains related to information retrieval (e.g. recommender systems, search)Good programming skills (preferably in Scala or Python) Proficient English language skills (German is not required)
An inspiring environmentCheck our Twitter account! https://twitter.com/NewWork_esGood isn't enough? Tell us what we can change, we're willing to take risks.Flexible remote work from Spain.Varied tasks, uncomplicated interactions with your colleagues as well as many opportunities to bring in your own ideas.Training, conferences and many opportunities to learn, experiment and grow.Innovation weeks (Hackweeks)Restaurant tickets, coffee and snacks.Spanish / English/ Portuguese / German lessons.A mobile device of your choice (iPhone, iPad, Android…).A great, multicultural and diverse environment.A sunny office located in the centre of Barcelona, with a large terrace.Flexible Compensation Plan: Health insurance/ Transport/ Nursery TicketsExtended holidays 26+4+2Competitive salary and a Permanent contractA referral bonus for recommending talent to our companyBicycle park and package reception We're looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Data Scientist - Insurance / Financial Services Background
description:
Our opportunity 

Group Audit is responsible for performing audits over the whole of Zurich's operations globally. We are looking for a Data Scientist in EMEA to join our audit hub in Barcelona being part of our global Internal Audit organization. You will contribute to the Group Audit global team in terms of professional skills, technical knowledge, energy and motivation.

Our mandate is to provide independent and objective assurance to the Zurich Boards of Directors and Audit Committees as well as to the Group CEO and Senior Management. To deliver this mandate, Group Audit works as a fully virtually integrated team, with a one-global-team mindset across the 19 countries where our teams are located.

You will play a key role in implementing our data science and analytics strategy and embed our data science function in our Group Internal Audit lifecycle. You will implement tools and strategies to translate raw data into valuable business insights to help Group Audit to enhance the focus of the Group Audit Annual Audit Plan and shape the individual audits around the identified risks, as well support data analytics approach on individual audits in various countries.

As part of your work you will participate in global audits and Group Audit wide initiatives and interact with leaders and team members from other countries. In Zurich Group audit you will be part of a professional Internal Audit department rated as one of the top 10% in our peer group.

 Your role 

 As a Data Scientist, your main responsibilities will involve: 

 Deliver data analytics and science strategy and projects on data ingestion, validation, mining, engineering work streams, modeling, visualization, and communication of deliverables  Manage resources and deliverables to meet agreed outcomes and timeliness on the Global Themed audits and the Global Maturity Assessments and any defined global tasks  Support synthesizing distinctive analytical and risk insights into compelling ideas and messages communicated to both internal and external stakeholders, in collaboration with Audit Teams and Audit Functional Leads  Test and validate hypotheses to generate distinctive analytical and risk insights that can deliver improved Annual Audit Plan and actionable business insights and audit exceptions across the Audit lifecycle  Guide and support auditors to perform analytics works on multiple key business processes  Assess, capture, and translate complex business and data requirements from a broad range of sources and functions into a structured analytics use case and testing audit hypothesis  Scan a broad spectrum of internal/external, structured/unstructured data sources to define the optimal data set for testing the hypotheses  Partner and collaborate across the organization to connect data sources to build the data set, including assurance functions  Support preparation of internal/external, structured/unstructured data sets to troubleshoot data-related problems and authorize maintenance or modifications of data in RADAR to discover ways of enhancing them (new technologies, new techniques, upgrades etc.)  Utilize a hypothesis-driven problem-solving approach to design, construct, and rapidly test/iterate exploratory analyses that will reveal insight and opportunities for Group Audit  Create robust documentation of solutions and underlying design decisions and operating procedures  Fostering the daily use of data systems and implement efficient and secure procedures for data handling in adherence to legal and company standards  Support in design of Group Audit data architecture and demand side governance model, alignment of data dictionary across Group Audit systems, advance digitalisation of Group Audit  Formulate techniques for quality data collection to ensure adequacy, accuracy and legitimacy of data, and where possible automation  Provide training support as directed by the Data Scientist Lead for the Data Science Specialists and Group Audit Community and actively contribute to the Global Competency network for data science. 

Your Skills And Experience

 As a Data Scientist your skills and qualifications will ideally include: 

 BSc/BA in Math, Statistics, Data Management, Econometric, Computer Science, Actuarial or related quantitative field from an accredited college or university  Job holder should have 3+ years’ experience in digital analytics/statistics, econometrics, decision science projects, or related activities  Knowledge of Internal Audit processes and Insurance industry experience is a plus  Organization, analytical mindset and problem solving skills  Exhibits high professional and ethical behavior  Good communications skills, with good verbal and written English with ability to explain technical concepts and analytics-driven findings to business stakeholders  Ability to work customer focused, collaborative, flexible, persistent and results-oriented  Ability to work without close supervision and to take decisions autonomously, subject to verification  Cope with varying workloads, pressures, and priorities.  Proficiency with sophisticated analytics tools and programming languages (e.g., SAS, SPSS, R, Python, SQL) and visualization platforms such as Tableau, Qlikview, PowerBI, IDEA, ACL, SPOTFIRE etc. 

Additional Information

 As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes: 

 Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 80% - you choose  Flexible working hours  Wide range of internal and external trainings  Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on the needs  Ticket restaurant  Life Insurance  Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company  Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you  Special banking and insurance conditions  Exclusive Employees discounts 

 Primary work location is Barcelona  . Please apply with your CV in English.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Are you ready to shape the future of travel by working at one of the world's largest online travel companies? At eDreams ODIGEO you can make travel experiences better for people across the world, combining more than 600 airlines and 100.000 flights worldwide every day into billions of potential combinations and helping our users find the very best travel deals.

Our passion is travel, our business is technology.

Our dynamic team of young, talented professionals from over 60 different nationalities and varied academic backgrounds is driven by one clear mission: making travel easier, more accessible, and creating better value for our customers worldwide. Within the Data Science team, we are focussed on researching and building cutting-edge solutions to evolve better travel experiences for our customers, all by leveraging the information from over 30 million searches that we receive everyday! Due to this scale, we are able to have a wider and better selection of travel plans that are tailored to suit the traveller’s needs which is probably more than any other travel site. We have dozens of machine learning models in production making hundreds of thousands of predictions which help improve customer experience, optimise processes and adapt to changing market conditions. The team is constantly analysing the past to understand it, and predicting the future to guide the business on making decisions that drive the most value both for our customers and our business.

We set the path with data and intelligence. Shape with us the way people travel.

We are looking for a passionate, highly analytical Data Scientist to join our talented team in the sunny and vibrant Barcelona office. You will have the opportunity to crunch massive datasets using the latest Big Data technologies as well as solve problems using state of the art algorithms. You will have the chance to debate and explore new ideas, approaches and technologies with your compatriots to design and implement the best solutions. We follow the philosophy of using the right tool for the right job and are not afraid to explore the greenfield. You will be a key player in the organization; designing and implementing advanced analytics and using machine learning to build AI powered solutions for almost every area in the business like online fraud detection, recommendation engines, user experience personalization, optimizing the flight combinations we offer or the marketing campaigns we launch, and virtually every possible area subject to optimization in the business. Join us and help us reach our ambitious goal of becoming the global leader in online travel!

As a Senior Data Scientist, apart from gathering and analysing data, generating insights and building models, you will also be responsible for:
 As a first step, take a business challenge, understand it, and translate it to a data science or machine learning problem  Successfully discuss and negotiate plans and initiatives with stakeholders, leading necessary meetings  Organise, create, communicate and present effectively to large audiences of different backgrounds  Coordinate with stakeholders and organize tasks for yourself and peers involved, guiding projects to ensure its alignment with company's strategy  Train and execute models following best practices in DS, designing and implementing any end-to-end ML solution necessary in collaboration with IT and Data Engineering stakeholders  Write quality code following good practices and standards (we love PEP-8, testing and documentation), and coach and mentor your peers to do so  Address potential pitfalls due to technical constraints before they arise by working around them  Take advantage of cloud solutions to improve the time to market  Mentor and lead other data scientists, and keep yourself updated on advancements in the field of ML and share it with your peers  Capitalize the opportunities for testing and implementing cutting edge algorithms, prioritizing delivery and impact on business  Create or adapt algorithms to fit non-standard problems 

About you:
 Degree in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or other quantitative fields).  5+ years of related experience as a Data Scientist, Machine Learning engineer or similar.  Previous experience in problem solving, strong analytical and technical skills.  A solid understanding of appropriate statistical, data mining and machine learning methods for various analysis situations.  Experience using programming languages like Python, Scala, Java, Spark etc.  Experience in Big Data technologies; such as NoSQL/graph databases and/or distributed computing would be a plus.  Written and oral communication skills (in English). 

What do we offer?
 Safe environment during COVID times: Onboarding and daily work can be done 100% remote.  A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.  Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.  Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills training, language lessons, external events and industry conferences.  Free subscription to O'Reilly Online Learning.  Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.  We also have for you a Ticket Restaurant benefit & unlimited beverages and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) because we like our eDOers happy and healthy!  A phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance.  New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.  Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements.  Fun at work: at eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand! 

… And the opportunity to work on a dynamic, dedicated, fun, and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!

Come dream with us and join us now.

eDreams ODIGEO under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo –is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

title: Data Scientist in Planning & Fullfillment - Applied Intelligence Team
description:
About Accenture

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners, and communities.

The company has been operating in Greater China for over 30 years. Today, it has more than 17,000 people servicing clients across the region with offices in the cities including Beijing, Shanghai, Dalian, Chengdu, Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Hong Kong and Taipei. As a trusted Partner of Choice for digital transformation, Accenture is bringing more innovation to the business and technology ecosystems and helping Chinese enterprises and the government to embrace digitization and enhance global competitiveness to succeed in the new era.

For more information about Accenture, please visit its corporate homepage www.accenture.com and its Greater China homepage www.accenture.cn .

Supply Chain & Operations

Supply Chain Management professional’s help clients develop strategies and operating models that integrate planning, procurement, manufacturing, and fulfillment functions within an organization, as well as connect suppliers and customers across the extended supply chain. The key areas of focus/consideration for the Supply Chain and Operations practice in Fulfillment and Logistics areas are:

Design and implement efficient and effective supply chain networks that support client business strategies 

Balancing the tradeoffs of customer service levels, inventory deployment, network options, transportation, and distribution costs 

Help companies implement processes, applications, and enablement strategies to support the transaction flow from customer inquiry through to financial settlement, order to cash process 

Key Responsibilities

Work independently in client facing situations as well as part of larger project teams in the design, development and implementation of new and improved business processes and enabling technology in Fulfillment and Logistics related projects 

Supervising business diagnosis in Fulfillment and logistics activities 

Management of daily operative communication with the client 

Deliver expertise for the implementation and continuous improvement of Logistics strategy, organization, network, processes, operations, and technology. Typical Fulfillment and Logistics projects include: 

Strategy: Supply Chain strategy, Logistics and Supply Chain assessment, fulfillment model, customer service policy 

Organization: functional (re)structure, role sort, job description, job competency 

Network: supply network node design, inventory policy 

Process: standard operation procedures, KPI setup, benchmarking

Operation: transportation planning, route planning, warehouse layout design, equipment, and automations, 3PL service evaluation, logistics trainings 

Technology: ERP, TMS, WMS, OMS and BMS system implementation and business process management

Deliver cost saving initiatives including productivity and utilization of logistics resources and facilities covering transportation, warehouse, and customer delivery to meet project deliverables 

Setup and evaluate logistics performance measurement KPIs and benchmarking process. Periodical interviews with the client for measurements/KPIs presentation 

Leverage best practices and existing operation standards to create client-specific business solutions for Logistics and Supply Chain improvements 

Conceptualize, design, and build re-usable components around the Logistics practices to help accelerate the development of Capability Network. 

Act as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for making client proposals and setting up project objectives for the prospective projects 

Ability to meet travel requirements, up to 100% 

Technical skills:

Bachelor in mathematics, statistics, physics, Industrial or other Engineering is required

6+ years of experience developing or running advanced analytics capabilities, preferably with consulting experience

Demonstrate strong understanding of business, technology and process implications as related to supply chain planning

solving skills, with expertise in quantitative/qualitative process analysis techniques, process metrics and performance measurement

Exhibit effective oral and written communication, leadership, project management, and teamwork skills with an ability to interact effectively with different levels of management. Should be diplomatic, flexible, and have a good team approach.

Experience in a similar role, managing a data science teams and projects. Preferably in supply chain space

Excellent spoken and written communication skills (English).

Demonstrable experience at productizing models; from inception to deployment.

Professional Skill Requirements

Having supply chain strategy and operation consulting experienced is preferred.

Advanced algorithm modeling skills: Python, R

Deep theoretical and applied knowledge in one or more of the following areas: forecast modelling, inventory optimization, network optimization, supply simulation or digital twin modelling

Cloud architectures know how: Azure, AWS, GCP

Working knowledge of agile development, including DevOps and DataOps concepts.

Experience with Azure Data Factory, Databricks, etc…is a plus.

Experience with Statistical/Machine Learning techniques is a plus.

Familiarity with business solutions tools (such as o9, BlueYonder, etc…).

Skills in business diagnostics, value assessment and opportunity identification, and application design of Supply chain

We offer a competitive salary, an extensive benefits package which includes extra vacations days per year, medical and life insurance, learning opportunities and much more!

#BarcelonaInnovationCenter

title: Tech Lead Data Scientist- ES
description:
At ManoMano, we bet on passionate and innovative people! Are you looking for a great environment to grow professionally and personally ?

Join us in this tremendous adventure ! 

About

Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners, 10 million products, 7M active customers and 50M unique visitors per month, ManoMano is a disruptor of online home improvement, DIY and gardening across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

ManoMano was valued at $2.6 billion and reached Unicorn status in July 2021 after $725 million raised 8 years after its creation.

ManoMano also works for the pros with ManoManoPro, a unique platform designed to make life easier and free building craftsmen from their daily constraints. Currently in France, Spain and Italy, the BtoB activity saves craftsmen time by revolutionizing their purchasing processes.

We currently are more than 900 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona).

Our vision, as a responsible European B2C and B2B industry leader online, is to offer a unique value proposition on our HI markets, beyond product to services, to be an A Brand. Our ManoMano way of life, within business hypergrowth, is to always keep the human dimension at its right place. Empowering people to responsibly make their own kind of world is our mission.

Our Company Culture 💙

People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Be challenged at ManoMano. The Machine Learning team is an applied ML team with a focus on delivery. We’re outcome-oriented: we solve high-impact business problems and deliver value to our users in production.

We are seeking a Staff Machine Learning (ML) Engineer to be part of a team of best-in-class ML practitioners focused on personalization (search and recommender systems) and the quality of our catalog (e.g., product categorization or product attribute extraction).

You’ll be joining a team of top-tier Data Scientists with probably some of the strongest modeling skills in the French Tech Next40. The ML team was instrumental in the growth of ManoMano from the very beginning and is now fully committed to building ML data products on our marketplace in this hypergrowth stage. This is the opportunity to contribute to one of Europe’s highest-valued unicorn companies and tap into one of the largest e-commerce data sets in the world to build the algorithms that power our internal and external products.

We have several roles open across different levels of seniority. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background and experience solving tough problems with large datasets.

SCOPE & CHALLENGES
The Machine Learning team is an applied ML team with a focus on delivery. We’re outcome-oriented: we solve high-impact business problems and deliver value to our users in production.We are seeking a Staff Data Scientist to be part of a team of best-in-class ML practitioners focused on personalization (search and recommender systems) and the quality of our catalog (e.g., product categorization or product attribute extraction).The Staff Data Scientist is a technical lead for the team.You’ll be joining a team of top-tier Data Scientists with probably some of the strongest modeling skills in the French Tech Next40. The ML team was instrumental in the growth of ManoMano from the very beginning and is now fully committed to building ML data products on our marketplace in this hypergrowth stage. This is the opportunity to contribute to one of Europe’s highest-valued unicorn companies and tap into one of the largest e-commerce data sets in the world to build the algorithms that power our internal and external products.We have several roles open across different levels of seniority. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background and experience solving tough problems with large datasets.We're actively seeking applications from candidates of all backgrounds. 
Your Day To Day Responsibilities
Identify and develop relevant data science modeling methodologies/frameworks to tackle open ended problems and deliver business valueProvide technical and thought leadership to the team, sharing data science best practices and mentoring junior team membersOwn the ML lifecycle, from experimentation and prototyping to deployment into production pipelines.Write production model code and implement algorithms in production.Perform exploratory data analysis to gain a deeper understanding of the problem.Investigate and fix a production issue from a data product your team owns.Partner with software engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to frame problems, both mathematically and within the business context.
MUST HAVE
User-focused5+ years of industry experience applying Machine Learning to business problems and building ML models for productionA Bachelor or Master’s Degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Operations Research, Bioinformatics, Economics, Computational Biology, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering) or equivalent practical experienceSolid knowledge of Machine Learning theory, statistics, and probabilitiesStrong coding experience in Python and proficiency in SQL. You care about code simplicity and performanceStrong communicator (oral and written, in English). We’re a remote-first team, so good writing is key. French is not requiredExperience coordinating multiple team members to deliver on complex initiativesGrowth mindset: love learning and seek challenges
NICE TO HAVE
Built large-scale production ML models and systemsExpertise in search, ranking, recommendation systems, information retrieval, natural language processing (NLP), visual recognition, or reinforcement learning (RL)Ph.D. degree in a quantitative fieldYou are a Kaggle Competitions ExpertProfessional experience in a technology company setting involving a product, an e-commerce platform, or a consumer-facing marketplaceExperience using data processing (e.g., Apache Spark, Apache Flink, or Apache Beam) or deep learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch or Tensorflow)Strong core computer science fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, architecting systems)
Benefits & Perks
A FLEXIBLE WORKING CULTURE 🏡 Full remote option30 working days vacationFlexible working hours Disconnection charterFriday afternoon… it’s off!Intensive working day in AugustPrivate medical insurance with AxaCrafternoons : every Thursday afternoon (share your knowledge, learn from others)Ticket restaurantTicket transportationExternal conferences - organisation of internal and external MeetupsMM employee discountTake care of yourself with our dedicated program with moka.care Gym membership with Andjoy
At ManoMano we are dedicated to building an inclusive and diverse workforce where each individual can grow. 

We respect and value the richness of varied cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our teams which is why we are looking for talented people from all backgrounds.

The information collected on this form is recorded in a file used by ManoMano - Colibri SAS so that we can process your application. 

The data is kept for 2 years from the date of your application. You can access your data, rectify it, request its deletion or exercise your right to limit the processing of your data. You can also exercise your right to the portability of your data. Consult the cnil.fr website for more information on your rights. 

To exercise these rights or if you have any questions about the processing of your data under this scheme, you can contact our data protection officer by writing to dpo@manomano.com. 

If, after having contacted us, you feel that your "Data Protection" rights have not been respected, you may submit a complaint to the CNIL.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Kraz es una consultora analítica que forma parte del Grupo VIKO. El Grupo VIKO se dedica a prestar servicios de marketing digital desde 1999 y está formado por un equipo de más de 180 profesionales en España y México. Desde Kraz nos dedicamos a combinar datos, tecnología y ciencia para construir soluciones creativas a problemas de información complejos.
Y también...Ayudamos a las empresas a ser más competitivas a partir de la explotación inteligente de sus fuentes primarias de datos.Combinamos un alto nivel de expertise técnico con una profunda comprensión de las necesidades del cliente.Revelamos el valor oculto tras los datos disponibles en las organizaciones.
Si quieres formar parte del equipo, ¡sigue leyendo!
Estamos buscando a una persona que ocupe el rol de Data Scientist para ampliar nuestro equipo.
¿Buscas formar parte de un proyecto en expansión, participar en la definición de los procedimientos de trabajo del equipo de data, trabajar en proyectos retadores de diversos ámbitos funcionales (marketing, manufacturing, etc…) y de distintas industrias (fabricantes, distribuidores, etc…)? ¿Te apasiona la idea de participar en la construcción de la empresa? ¿Tienes muchas ganas de aprender y de rodearte de un entorno dinámico, donde se fomenta el respeto y la transparencia? ¿Disfrutas haciendo tu trabajo y crees en el trabajo en equipo?
Si has contestado “sí” a todas estas preguntas, ¡nos busques más! ¡Este es tu sitio!
¿Cómo será tu día a día?Los Data Scientists son el corazón de la actividad de Kraz. Alrededor de las DS se definen los proyectos a implementar y la metodología más adecuada en cada caso.
¿Qué buscamos en ti?Que tengas formación universitaria superior en Matemáticas, Estadística, Física, Ingeniería o similar.Que domines lenguajes de programación como R y/o PythonQue tengas conocimientos en bases de datos relacionales (SQL)Que conozcas herramientas de Visualización de datos (Shinny, Tableau, QlikView…)Que domines herramientas de control de versiones (Git)Que tengas experiencia trabajando con entornos Cloud (GCP, AWS, Azure, etc)Que tengas un nivel alto de inglésQue vengas con muchas ganas de aprender nuevas herramientas y tecnologías.
Además, valoraremos...Expertise en alguna de las siguientes áreas de foco: Reinforcement Learning, Evolutionary Algorithms, Computer Vision, NLP, distributed machine learning.Experiencia en MLOpsExperiencia en BBDD NoSQLY que compartas nuestros valores: Empower talent, Truly together, Good vibes, We love change y Own it & Make it happen!
¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?Incorporación a Kraz, empresa del grupo VIKO, con más de 180 personas enfocadas en proyectos de marketing digitalFormar parte de un equipo altamente especializado en un entorno joven, dinámico y flexible.Un proceso de selección transparenteSalario fijo + variable en función de objetivosBeneficios fiscales en restaurantes, transporte, seguro de salud, formación y guarderías.Ayuda económica para estudiar inglés: ¡nos hacemos cargo del 50% de tu cuota mensual!Cursos online de M4CAcademy sin coste23 días de vacaciones (+ 2: el 24 y el 31 de diciembre, ¡te los regalamos!)Horario flexibleJornada intensiva todos los viernes y los meses de julio y agostoHome office (asistencia a la oficina 2 días a la semana entre martes y jueves; aunque estarán abiertas toda la semana para poder ser utilizadas)
Si has llegado hasta aquí, eres la persona que buscamos... ¿dónde te habías escondido? ;-)

title: Data Scientist
description:
Let’s Talk About You

Your profile 

You are a highly collaborative individual and enjoy solving problems that focus on adding business value. You have a sense of ownership and enjoy hands-on technical work. Our values resonate with yoursDegree educated in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or equivalent experience, with strong physics backgroundAbility to write clean, maintainable, and robust code in Python Hands-on experience with ML libraries e.g Scikit-learn, XGBoost, keras and least one data query language / database technologyWorking expierence and deep understanding in methods for non-uniformly sampled time-series analysis, deep learning, computer vision or (non)linear optimization (at least two fields)Preferable: familiarity with ML cloud technologies, preferably with AWS SageMakerFluency in English is essential (C2 Level), knowledge of German and other languages is a plus

Your Responsibilities

Design and build digital twin models of Siemens-Energy assets components for anomaly and faults detectionsDefine failures root causes and produce risk analysis with explainable probabilistic modelsCombine data from various and diverse sources into global optimization modelsTake advantage of Siemens Energy cloud environment to scale your modelsContribute to cross-functional problem-solving sessions with your team and deliver presentations to colleagues and clients Your opportunities for personal growth

You will have the opportunity to work in a start-up like environment, with highly motivated team within a leading market company, and in an international environmentYou will be part of an international team, working alongside Project Managers, Data Engineers, Machine Learning Engineers, Software Engineers and 3D DesignersDuring your first project you will also work closely with collaborators from two of the biggest companies in data services and deep learning techYou will directly contribute on the establishment of the energy systems of tomorrow

Let’s Talk About Us

"Let’s make tomorrow different today" is our genuine commitment at Siemens Energy to all customers and employees on the way to a sustainable future.

As Siemens Energy we are the only company with a leading portfolio along the entire energy value chain – in both conventional and renewable energy – we are uniquely able to help both public- and private-sector customers benefit from these developments.

Your role will be inside one of our DigiHubs and based in Barcelona.

#DigiHubBarcelona leads all Siemens Energy DigiHubs worldwide from the showcasing and customer experience perspective in Digitalization and Energy Transition. We work with consultative sales methodologies and enable our sales colleagues in selling Digital Transformation and Energy Transition related solutions from a holistic customer centric approach.

#DigiHubBarcelona is one of the main Data Hubs for Siemens Energy, become part of our dynamic digitization team as a Data Scientist and join us in the world of digitalization and decarbonization. A new dimension of the service of our machines awaits you - the dimension of data. For us, digitization means increasing the value for our customers by development of innovative business models as well as digital products.

Check out this video to see what we do here!

MORE INSIGHTS

Be Energized. Be you.

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity we generate power. We run on inclusion and compassion. Our combined creative energy is fueled by at least 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society. All of society.

Jobs & Careers: https://www.siemens-energy.com/global/en/company/jobs.html

Organization: Gas and Power

Company: Siemens Energy S.A.

Experience Level: Experienced Professional

Job Type: Full-time

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Spain based position : in Barcelona or Remote !!

Who are we?🚀

PayFit simplifies payroll management and HR processes for SMBs. PayFit is an automated SaaS solution to help business owners and HR professionals save time and money allowing them to refocus on what really matters: their employees.

Since 2015, we have set ourselves a mission to support the digital transformation of HR management through our ever growing range of product features and services. We have a strong presence in France and have been quickly growing in Germany, Spain and the UK. With 6,000 customers in 4 countries, we are one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in Europe.

Today, we are more than 650 employees at PayFit and we all share four core values:
 Care for each other Always stay humble Strive for excellence Live and work with passion
We are committed to a culture of inclusion and an environment that enables fulfillment in freedom & responsibility.

You want to join us? This video is better than a long description…

What will be your role?⭐
Develop and apply data science and statistical methods to respond to business questions.Produce high-quality code, that is easy to reuse and maintain.Accompany the industrialisation of algorithms.Determine the best data sources, evaluate their quality and relevance.Communicate results and influence key business leaders.This job has been tailored for you if...🦄
You have 4+ years of experience in a data science role (predictive modelling, clustering, NLP, etc.)You have a strong logic & business sense.You are autonomous, self-starter and detail-oriented individual.You have a vision on how to make data science work and you are able to communicate this in a simple, clear and convincing way.You have 3+ years working experience with Python (pandas, scikit learn…)You are proficient in SQLYou are fluent in English
We would be even more impressed if you have :
- Experience with dbt.- Ability to provide on-the-job coaching to our juniors.What we offer❤️
An amazing work environment, designed for kindness and blossoming.An international and dynamic team with the opportunity to visit our different offices (Paris, Berlin, Barcelona and London).A Company Bonus that is paid to all PayFit employees when predefined MRR targets are achieved.25 days of vacations.Private insurance with Sanitas 100% covered by PayFit and extendable to partner and children (optional).Tickets restaurant: € 6 / day worked.Transport / Bicing Ticket (optional).Gym (Andjoy) (optional).Flexible remuneration: Nursery (Part kindergarten for baby) and training ticket.Language courses (English) 1.30h per week.Work from Anywhere policy: full flexibility to work wherever you prefer with some face-to-face moments to maintain our culture.
Hiring process ⚙️

1️⃣ Applicant initial validation: added value, key achievements, motivations, job match. (make sure your CV is in English).

2️⃣ Visio interview with Aida, our Head of Data.

3️⃣ Visio interviews & SQL test with a Data Analyst.

4️⃣ Data Science assignment to present to the Head of Data.

5️⃣ Background check to verify your identity, diploma and past professional experience in the context of your ISO27001 certification.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
About Toptal

Toptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world’s largest fully remote company.

We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.

Position Description

Here at Toptal, we always rely on data to guide all of our initiatives. This data helps to mold both our long-term strategy and our day-to-day operations. As a Data Scientist, you will be working with our cross-functional team to model complex problems, use SotA approaches and identify high-impact opportunities. You will be part of a high-energy, fast-paced team responsible for supporting initiatives and operations across the company.

Our full-stack Data Science Team uses Python for research and development and leverages Google Cloud Platform for production implementation. Our wide range of experience includes NLP, graph theory, recommendations systems, supervised and unsupervised problems. As part of the team you are free to use the approach you see fit while relying on your colleague’s previous experience and expertise.

The ultimate goal is to solve real business problems. Our team works on problems that profoundly affect the operation of our business. We address these problems by using predictive models, automating decision-making, and other very open-ended questions. For example, our stake-holders may ask if it is feasible to predict the outcome of a particular process in order to improve our approach or to help them leverage the massive amount of feedback our users provide.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.

Responsibilities
Build advanced and explainable models to classify objects, predict outcomes or make recommendations.Deploy the models that you build to production by building APIs or leveraging our ETL pipelines.Use statistical, algorithmic, data mining, and visualization techniques to model complex problems, find opportunities, discover solutions, and deliver actionable business insights.Own your projects and use this autonomy to find creative and innovative ways of solving problems and delivering solutions.Handle both parts of the Research & Development process, including clean, rigorous implementations of devised models inside our production environment.Be persistent, focused, and well-adapted when it comes to finishing your work. At Toptal, we always drive research from start to finish - we don’t get distracted; we don’t leave anything unfinished.Communicate data-driven insights and recommendations to key stakeholders.Be in constant communication with team members and other meaningful parties and convey results efficiently and clearly via Slack.
In The First Week, Expect To
Meet the entire Data Science team.Get familiar with our best practices guidelines.Get access to all our services.
In The First Month, Expect To
Set up your working environment.Learn our data sources and get familiar with our data warehouse.Meet our friends from the Data Engineering team.
In The First Three Months, Expect To
Start reviewing your colleagues’ work.Meet our stakeholders and start your first ad-hoc research.Get familiar with our Machine Learning implementations.Be included in our brainstorming sessions in different areas of Data Science.
In The First Six Months, Expect To
Deliver first ah-hoc analysis to our stakeholders.Start your first Machine Learning initiative.Start contributing to our live ML models.
In The First Year, Expect To
Meet the team in person during our onsite meeting.Deliver your first Machine Learning model to production.
Requirements
A strong background in advanced mathematics, in particular in probability theory and statistics, data mining, and machine learning.You must be able to think critically, to look at the big picture and spot what is missing, taking advantage of it to propose improvements and deliver business insights.4+ years of professional experience in data science, doing exploratory data analysis, testing hypotheses, and building predictive models. Ability to quickly and accurately understand complex new concepts.Proficiency in Python and proven experience using popular ML packages (sklearn, keras, word2vec, etc), and previous experience efficiently conducting research and creating ad hoc reports.Deliver your work to production as a stand-alone microservice.Be enthusiastic about DS and stay up to date with SotA Machine Learning algorithms and developments.Be passionate about collaborating daily with your team and other groups while working via a distributed model.Be eager to help your teammates, share your knowledge with them, and learn from them.Be open to receiving constructive feedback.You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.
For Toptal Use Only: #individualcontributorEurope #europe #southamerica

title: Data Scientist
description:
Our opportunity 

At Zurich, one of our key areas of focus is preparing for the Future of Work. Changes in customer behaviours and needs, as well as the integration of new technologies are changing the workforce of the future. In order to be ready for the future of work we are proactively driving key transformation programs across the business.

Join us on our global Future of Work journey, working in a forward-thinking organizational design and analytics team, bringing data science and digitalization to life. Be part of shaping the organization of the future leveraging data to inform better decision making about people and teams. Act as a thought leader and partner to drive better decisions based on data.

 Your role 

 As an organizational data scientist your main responsibilities will involve: 

 Be the thought leader in the team when it comes to data science  Aggregation of large amounts of data, building statistical models and performing statistical analysis (e.g., segmentation, correlation, multiple regression, trend analysis, behavioral analysis, predictive modeling, etc.)  Perform organizational network analysis to support Org. Design initiatives  Analysis of all text data (survey comments, system data): cluster analysis, sentiment analysis, etc.  Presenting, explaining and discussing results of analysis and trends concisely and effectively  Supporting high-priority projects for executives and/or the leadership team  Providing thought leadership and capability building to the global HR community  Combining data science with technology to provide tailored insights at scale  Leading workforce planning and informing organizational effectiveness initiatives 

Your Skills And Experience

 As a organizational data scientist your skills and qualifications will ideally include: 

 General skills: 

 Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in Mathematics / Statistics, preferably with HR background  Knowledge of HR data and Workforce Analytics  Strong knowledge of statistical theory and calculations and analytic methods (e.g., correlation, multiple regression, moderator analysis, etc.)  Preferred skills: R, Python, Microsoft PowerBI, SQL (optional)  Good command of English (C1) 

 Data Modelling and Machine Learning: 

 Linear Modelling: Regression and Classification, Linear Mixed Models, Survival Analysis  Natural Language Processing: Text Classification, Cluster Analysis, Unsupervised/Supervised Topic Modelling, NER, Semantic Similarity Modelling  Recommendation Modelling: Collaborative / Content / Deep Learning Based Recommendations 

 Social Network Analysis: 

 Analysis of basic properties of a network (Density, Node centrality, Component analysis and etc.)  Node similarity, node classification, cluster / community analysis 

Additional Information

 As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes: 

 Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 100% - you choose  Flexible working hours  Wide range of internal and external trainings  Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on the needs  Ticket restaurant  Life Insurance  Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company  Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you  Special banking and insurance conditions  Exclusive Employees discounts 

Primary work location is Barcelona, Spain. Option to telework from any location within Spain territory is also feasible.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

 So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

 At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

title: Data Scientist, Product
description:
As a Data Scientist at Facebook, you will shape the future of people-facing and business-facing products we build across our entire family of applications (Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp, Oculus). By applying your technical skills, analytical mindset, and product intuition to one of the richest data sets in the world, you will help define the experiences we build for billions of people and hundreds of millions of businesses around the world. You will collaborate on a wide array of product and business problems with a diverse set of cross-functional partners across Product, Engineering, Research, Data Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Finance and others. You will use data and analysis to identify and solve product development’s biggest challenges. You will influence product strategy and investment decisions with data, be focused on impact, and collaborate with other teams. By joining Facebook, you will become part of a world-class analytics community dedicated to skill development and career growth in analytics and beyond.

Product leadership: You will use data to shape product development, quantify new opportunities, identify upcoming challenges, and ensure the products we build bring value to people, businesses, and Facebook. You will help your partner teams prioritize what to build, set goals, and understand their product’s ecosystem.

Analytics: You will guide teams using data and insights. You will focus on developing hypotheses and employ a diverse toolkit of rigorous analytical approaches, different methodologies, frameworks, and technical approaches to test them.

Communication and influence: You won’t simply present data, but tell data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your partners using clear insights and recommendations. You will build credibility through structure and clarity, and be a trusted strategic partner.

Data Scientist, Product Responsibilities:

Work with large and complex data sets to solve a wide array of challenging problems using different analytical and statistical https://www.linkedin.com/redir/general-malware-page?url=approaches%2eWork with large and complex data sets to solve a wide array of challenging problems using different analytical and statistical approaches.Identify and measure success of product efforts through goal setting, forecasting, and monitoring of key product metrics to understand trends.Define, understand, and test opportunities and levers to improve the product, and drive roadmaps through your insights and recommendations.Partner with Product, Engineering, and cross-functional teams to inform, influence, support, and execute product strategy and investment decisions.

Minimum Qualifications:

A Bachelor’s degree (BA or BS)A minimum of 2 years of work experience in analytics (minimum of 1 year with a Ph.D.)Experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), and/or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R)

Preferred Qualifications:

Masters or Ph.D. Degree in a quantitative field.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Craft

Data, Analytics & Strategy

Job Description

Do you want to help Candy Crush Soda Saga players enjoy their game even more? What about having a direct impact in what millions of people are playing?

We are looking for a talented and creative Senior Data Scientist to join the Candy Crush Saga team. You will be working with varied stakeholders in a fun, dynamic and fast- paced environment. You’ll help us to further understand, model, predict, segment, and retain our players and be part of a community of 100+ business intelligence & analytics experts.

This role can be based from Barcelona, London, or Stockholm

Your role within the Kingdom

As a Senior Data Scientist in the Candy Crush Soda Saga team, you will be working with varied stakeholders in a fun, dynamic and fast- paced environment. You’ll help us to further understand, model, predict, segment and retain our players and be part of a community of 100+ business intelligence & analytics experts.
Translate business needs to technical requirements and AB- tests, and work with development teams to ensure correct implementation, taking care to correctly track the right information to allow easy, precise analysis of the impactProactively develop new analyses, experiments and data- driven tools to better understand our players’ behaviour and the performance of our gamesProvide insights to support decision making for the gameWork closely with other Data Scientists across the business to leverage insights from one game across multiple gamesHelp evolve the methodology and tools available to King’s data science communityCarefully check, debug, and problem solve issues to ensure you deliver accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools, even when confronted by subtle data complications
Skills to create thrills

There is plenty of scope at King for you to learn from your colleagues in the areas where you have less experience, and to share your own skills where you are stronger.

Specific factors that are helpful to excel in this role include:
Business Insight: The ability to understand the problems and issues our games and business wants to solve, and then defining the most appropriate data, analysis or interpretation to lead to the right recommendations and decisionsCommunication: Designing good ways of communicating, visualising or reporting your results/analysis so they are clear and unambiguousSQL: The ability to write complex SQL queries to analyse our databases with 300+ million players and work with relational database systems.Analytical coding: Using tools such as R, Python or Excel for analytical purposesStats: Understanding the basics of appropriate statistical or machine learning techniques.Work in the games industry or similarly customer- facing digital businessesFamiliarity with massive data sets and tools to deal with them (BigQuery/AWS/Hadoop etc)Experience in behavioural psychology/economics and experimental designExperience in predictive analytics, segmentation, and related areasSoftware engineering skills in Java and other languages (beyond R and Python which we use most frequently)Skills with standard reporting tools such as Looker/QlikView/Tableau/etc.
About King

King is the game developer behind the world- famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top- grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King’s games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta.

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.

Making the World Playful

Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players - and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!

Applications need to be in English.

Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Game Data Analyst/Scientist
description:
An important technological enterprise focused on the entertainment sector is looking to incorporate a new member for in their Analytics team. Once they join the team their main function will be using their analyst, statistical and programing skills to develop a real value business insight.

 

Your profile

- Curious, Meticulous and Creative profile will be great.

 

Your benefits

- Continous training

- Flexible 

-  Much more! 

 

Are you a passionate gamer!? APPLY NOW!

 


Montreal Associates is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

title: Principal / Senior Data & Applied Scientist
description:
Microsoft's mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more and we believe that artificial intelligence will play a critical role in accomplishing that mission.

The Web Experiences (WebXT) org at Microsoft is working on large scale search, browse and content technologies across Bing, Microsoft News, Advertising Platform, Edge browser, and Maps.

We are the Bing Local Search team responsible for delivering various local search and recommendation experiences to over 500M+ global users of Microsoft’s search engine (Bing) and Web Experiences (WebXT). We are responsible for mining comprehensive, fresh, rich, and clean content from internet, partners, and business owners for millions for businesses around the world.

We are looking for a self-motivated and experienced data scientist that share our passion for understanding and processing information to make the real world easier to explore. This is a fun and fast paced environment, where teams are empowered to drive innovation in product and technology. This position offers great opportunities to demonstrate technical leadership, collaborate across teams and to develop a successful career path.

Responsibilities
End to end delivery of various search and recommendation experiences covering wide range of areas including index selection, relevance, information retrieval, entity extraction, recommendation and classification.Deeply analyze existing user & customer data to understand gaps and opportunities to improve our ML solutions. Provide technical leadership to Software Engineers, Data and Applied Scientists to successfully execute on our roadmap and achieve your strategic objectives.Drive collaboration and partnership with a global team of world-class researchers, scientists & engineers to solve very challenging problems. 
Qualifications

Required Qualifications:
Significant years of industry experience in a Software Engineer, Data Scientist, or related roleSignifiant years expertise and hands-on experience on one or more of machine learning, text analysis, statistics, information retrieval, natural language processing, computer vision, recommendations, with a strong understanding of both practical and theoretical aspectsRelevant years of experience with large scale data processing infrastructure such as SQL, Spark, Cosmos, Scope (or similar)Ability to own Machine Learning systems end-to-end - from data pipelines and training to realtime prediction engines.Ability to independently drive cross team collaborations and ship production features in a fast-paced startup environment.
Preferred Qualifications
MS/PhD Degree in CS/CE/EE/Data Science or related areas is preferred.Experiences in Python/R/C++/C# and general software development skillsExcellent communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

#Backend# #BigData# #MachineLearning# #Search# #WebXT#

title: Game Data Scientist
description:
Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps. With 6 billions downloads and over 300 million monthly active users, Voodoo is the #1 mobile publisher worldwide.

The company is one of the most impressive examples of hypergrowth in the ecosystem, backed by Goldman Sachs, Tencent, and GBL. Deciding to expand its portfolio of products further, Voodoo has more recently announced its investment in blockchain technology to bring blockchain games to mobile users. Voodoo is now a team of over 600 employees worldwide, we’re looking for talented individuals from across the globe to come and entertain the world with us.

What will be your main challenges?

You will be joining the new and growing Casual Games Business Unit at Voodoo. You will play a key role in the growth of this unit and in setting standard methodologies to support a growing number of studios and partners. You will work in an ambitious and fast-paced environment with stakeholders from multiple horizons: management, game design, marketing and tech.

You will be the link between our data organization and multiple teams working on games in development or live. You will assist them through the different stages of the game development cycle: implementation of events tracking, analyses of the performance of early prototypes, performance assessment of games to launch, optimization of live games and content. You will also need to adapt to a fast-moving environment and be pragmatic when it comes to defining priorities and choosing the most efficient solutions.

We expect you to match the high standards of rigor needed to carefully assess the potential of a game and identify areas of improvement to clearly communicate your results with the game teams. You will become an undisputed expert in game analytics, earning the trust of your collaborators through rigorous and efficient work.

What do we expect?
At least 2 years of analytical work experience in the gaming, tech or data-driven industry.Proficient with SQL and either R or Python, with a proven experience working with large and complex data sets.
