title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
description:
Job description:

We are looking for a new colleague in the Global Commercial Excellence department of ZF Aftermarket at our location in Barcelona.


Your tasks as Data Scientist (m/f/d):

 Prototyping of advanced analytics data products (models for business recommendations, segmentations, optimizations & statistical forecasts) across marketing, sales, pricing & logistics, and creation of relevant algorithms which can improve how the business operates  Business Understanding: acquire understanding of the business problem with the help of business analyst Data Understanding: lead the exploration of the data Modelling: create hypothesis of which models could fit the data, test the different hypothesis, find optimal parameters Results: share the prototype results and get feedback to have its model improved  

Your profile as Data Scientist (m/f/d):

 Strong Background in both Computing and Statistics (academical and/or by experience) Unsupervised and Supervised models including tree-based models and linear models in Python, R & Pyspark. Experience with (Deep) Neural Networks and Bayesian modelling is desirable. Databases (ex. Oracle, AWS S3). Big Data platforms (ex. Databricks, GCP, Cloudera) Knowledge of Visualization tools is highly desirable (ex. such as Tableau, PowerBi, Qlikview). Team player, ability to deal with uncertainty and ambiguity, business acumen, communication skills (mostly data storytelling)

title: Data Scientist
description:
EL PUESTO

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics team. You will be part of the team that shapes Mango’s data intelligence, strategy, and architecture. The Advanced Analytics team develops Artificial Intelligence algorithms targeting to optimize the most challenging processes and decisions within the retail industry.

Mango Advanced Analytics team consists of Data Scientist, Big Data Engineers and Software Engineers who work together in cross-functional squads to develop state-of-the-art quality machine learning algorithms leveraging the latest technology in Big Data platforms and distributed computing.

Each Of The Advanced Analytics Squads Targets To Develop And Evolve Machine Learning Algorithms To Face Some Of Mango Key Technical And Business Challenges
Personalization Squad: Develop Artificial Intelligence algorithms to provide a personalized experience to Mango Clients including both product, fit and size recommendations.Pricing and Markdown Squad: Develop machine learning algorithms which determine the optimal promotions and discounts to optimize the company margin during the sales period.Forecasting: Develop time-series forecasting algorithms to predict the evolution of sales and returns both short-term and long-term.Purchasing/Production: Develop data-science algorithm for early best sellers detection and to determine how many units of each product and size should Mango manufacture during the season planning.
Due to the relevance of Mango Advance Analytics projects, each squad has board-level visibility and presentations.

At Mango we are inspired and united by our passion for style and culture. We are present in 118 countries and our online presence extends to over 80 countries. Our team is made up of people of 112 nationalities, 80% of whom are female.

We are a very dynamic team, motivated by new technologies, with a passion of what we do and will to take on major challenges that will allow us to continue to grow and contribute value through data.

WHAT DOES A DATA SCIENTIST DO AT MANGO?

As a Data Scientist you will be part of the team that shapes Mango’s data intelligence, strategy, and architecture. You will work developing Artificial Intelligence solutions developed with state-of-the-art data models and algorithms. These data products enable use cases that are very innovative in the retail space, such as geoanalytics, robotization, omnichannel personalization, the connected store, computer vision, consumer 360º and real-time decisions.

In you day-to-day work…
Develop the development advanced machine learning algorithms to improve our core business processes and decisions.Work with a solid engineering approach (e.g., continuous integration, testing automation, etc) in a strong team of data engineers and data scientists.Use Spark to scale up your models and leverage MLOps tools to deploy them to production.Interact with business stakeholders to ensure proper alignment and adoption; and participate the delivery of the project end-to-end.Be passionate to work with a fast, iterative approach in new ideas and proofs of concepts.Stay connected to the latest developments in Big Data and MLOps and invest time in bringing new technologies and best practices to Mango.
WHAT MAKES US SPECIAL?
Immediate incorporation with an indefinite contractWe offer flexible hours (you can enter from 08:00 to 09:30 and leave from 17:00 to 18:30) with an intensive day every Friday (you can enter from 08:00 to 09:00 and leave from 14:00 to 15:00) and most eves of public holidays.Possibility of teleworking 50%25% discount on all our linesYou will be able to train at a technical level on platforms such as O'Reilly, among others, as well as in languages, and in skills for your personal development. We mentor you in order for you to continue to develop professionally and personally!Referral policy, you can participate in the incorporation of talent to our teams, and we will reward you for it!Free company transport from Barcelona and Vallès to our headquartersPhysiotherapy service in our headquarters, as well as a fitness room and changing rooms in case you wish to do sports in your free timeWorkshops, meetups, practise communities, team building and company meetingsFlexible remuneration package with tax advantages: medical insurance, training, canteen discount, nurseries, etc.Canteen and kitchen service in our headquarters. The company subsidises part of the daily menu as well as cafeteria items.Company medical service in our headquarters.You will be part of a leading company in the fashion sector that is dynamic, in full innovation, with great awareness and which takes action towards sustainabilityFriendly, inspiring and ambitious work environment. You will work with a great team moving in the same direction to achieve optimal results.Constant development opportunities with extremely varied challenges that generate learning in the workplace.
You got it?

We like you!

TU PERFIL

WHAT DO WE EXPECT OF YOU?
Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or other quantitative fieldsExperience developing mathematical models and predictive algorithms (supervised & unsupervised models, clustering, neural networks…)Experience developing production level machine learning solutions in a cloud environment with distributed computing.Experience with deep learning is a plusExperience working in cloud environment (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)Ability to own the delivery of a project, including communication with business stakeholders and to deliver board-level presentationsAt least 3 years of programming experience, expertise in Python is a plusExperience implementing ETL, using BigData platform is a plus

title: Principal Data & Applied Scientist
description:
Microsoft's mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more and we believe that artificial intelligence will play a critical role in accomplishing that mission. The Core Search and AI team is the leading applied machine learning team at Microsoft responsible for delivering the highest-quality search experience to over 500M+ monthly active users around the world in Microsoft’s search engine, Bing and other dependent search engines such as Yahoo, DuckDuckGo, and new startups like Neeva.

We have seen little innovation in search in the last decade and we are looking for people who want to build the next generation of search using advanced AI technologies at scale. We are responsible for the largest machine learning models at Microsoft by volume and take pride in being the first in the world to solve many practical AI at Scale challenges. Our work spans a very large scope of scenarios including delivering high quality search results from a massive document corpus, extractive and abstractive summarization to generate document snippets, personalization, machine reading comprehension, and document recommendations.

As a team, we leverage the diverse backgrounds and experiences of passionate engineers, scientists, and program managers to help us realize our goal of making the world smarter and more productive. We believe great products are built by inclusive teams of customer-obsessed individuals who trust each other and work together closely. We collaborate regularly across the company both to find the technology breakthroughs from groups like Microsoft Research to infusing AI into the rest of Microsoft products like Office and Azure.

Some Examples Of Our Work Include
Building the world’s most comprehensive spelling correction system through zero shot learning (covered by NextWeb, Venture Beat, and ZDNet)Using transformer networks for search (covered in Search Engine Land and in State of AI 2020 report)Deep learning based question answering and captions (covered in VentureBeat, Search Engine Land)Launching our technology as a cloud service on Azure (a summary of the technologies we used)Co-developing our large scale training library called DeepSpeed (covered in SiliconAngle, The Batch)Building and open sourcing blazing fast transformer network inferencing (covered in ZDNet and Forbes) including developing our own accelerated chips for inferencingOpen sourcing our vector search algorithm (covered by Ars Technica and TechCrunch)
If you are passionate about working on the latest and hottest areas that will help you develop skills in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, data science and high scale systems, this is the team you’re looking for!

#semanticsearch#

Responsibilities

We need a strong technical lead to direct a team of engineers and scientists in discovering and building the next wave of innovations in search.
Work closely with Program Management to deliver a roadmap towards solving the needs of our users by building the most relevant, freshest, and authoritative results while being strategically differentiated from our biggest competitors.Lead a team to define, design, and deliver product quality improvements from ideation stage to shipping to the customer.Focus on the whole team's productivity and strive to increase the impact of the team's work product.Define and build systems and strategies to ensure high quality, stable, performant code and state-of-the-art algorithms being shipped in production.Make independent decisions for the team and handle difficult tradeoffs.Translate strategy into plans that are clear and measurable, with progress shared out monthly to stakeholders.
Qualifications

Required Qualifications
Bachelors, Masters or advanced degree in Computer Science or related field (including Mathematics and Physics)Significant years of industry experience applying Machine Learning techniquesSignificant years of experience coding in Python, C++, C#, C or Java
Preferred Qualifications
MS or PhD computer science or related field.Experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorchExperience building large scale cloud-based solutions.Customer focused, strategic, drives for results, is self-motivated, and has a propensity for action.Fantastic problem solver: ability to solve problems that the world has not solved before.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Data Scientist
description:
As Data Scientist you will have following key accountabilities: Design, develop and implement solutions based on data science, stats and machine learning models throughout the full life cycle (ideation, design, implementation, productization and maintenance) Create and improve methods and tools, contribute to communities of practice in the area of Data Science Communicate regularly with non-data scientists in Tech, Operations, Commercial, Product to understand the domain and the requirements, as well as explain data science principles, concepts, algorithms, and approaches Make data your best friends, understand their strengths and leverage them - be aware of their weaknesses and tackle them in your solutions Screen the market for potential new / innovative Data Science approaches Foster knowledge exchange within the company and present GfK’s Data Sciences expertise at conferences and workshops 
Now you know what a Data Scientist does. What skills, qualifications & experience do you need for this job? You can think creatively in addressing analytical objectives You have expert statistical / machine learning modeling skills (e.g. statistical tests, classification, predictive modelling, handling of missing data, sampling, weighting) You are skilled regarding performance optimization and scalability (e.g. parallelization and code optimization) You have experience with an analytical programming language (Python, R) and the respective ecosystem You have solid skills regarding database handling as SQL Knowledge of the constantly evolving Data Science ecosystem and its frameworks (e.g. Spark MLlib, TensorFlow, MLflow) is a plus Knowledge of cloud computing environments and tooling (especially AWS) is a plus Advanced software development skills (unit testing, CI/CD, Git) is a plus Your English is fluent in a business environment, fluent Spanish is a plus You typically have a master’s degree or PhD that reflects strong modeling and statistics skills You typically have 3+ years of work experience Admittedly, this is a long list and we do not expect you to be able to tick off every single point on it. Learning on the job and formal trainings will help you to close potential knowledge gaps and quickly bring you up to speed. 
We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions. Can there be a better place to take center stage in the digital revolution? We are excited to getting to know you!

title: Data Scientist
description:
DESCRIPTION
As a Data Scientist, you will be able to witness the beginnings of building a data-driven culture and implementing predictive models into our products at MENU, as well as get the opportunity to take a leading role in making it happen.
The Data Scientist is responsible for providing insights to the product team to help them understand our business, product and customers better. The insights provided by the Data Scientist will help the team take better and more informed decisions that result in improved business outcomes for our customers and us.Additionally, the Data Scientist is responsible for taking the lead to implement machine learning models into our products to power features such as personalized recommendations, engagement optimization and predictive reports.
We are just starting to take a data-driven approach to build a commerce platform that allows restaurants to create a better experience for their guests and grow their business, and are looking for someone that is willing to pull their sleeves up and get their hands dirty to lay the groundwork for a new and growing expertise within the organization.

Type of contract: Permanent
The key functions of the Data Scientist include:
Collaborate with your product team to understand business problems and areas of insights that would be valuable to product developmentPerform exploratory data analysis to deliver insights to your teamContinuously monitor KPIs and metrics as product changes are implemented to determine successDesign and execute product experimentsDevelop machine learning technology strategy and implementation planDesign and implement data pipelines and infrastructureWork with designers, developers, QA engineers and product managers to integrate your models into customer-facing productsGrow the Data Science expertise within the organization, including recruiting, defining standards and developing best practices
REQUIREMENTS:
Minimum 5 years of experience in a data analysis roleMinimum 3 years of experience developing production machine learning and predictive analytics modelsPrevious experience working in an agile and cross-functional product teamStrong SQL skills and experienceExperience with business intelligence tools (Tableau, Power BI, Mode or similar) and data warehousesExperience with Python and Python-based data science and machine learning librariesExperience building large-scale modelsStrong written and verbal communication skills to interact with a wide audience: customers, development, product management and senior management teamsDemonstrated ability to successfully manage multiple projects under limited Willingness to do what it takes to ensure the team accomplishes its goalsCritical thinker with strong analytical and problem-solving skills and “can-do” attitudeAttention to detailAbility to dive deep into technical details, while maintaining an understanding of the big pictureStrong English language skills
Nice to Have
Experience deploying ML models on AWSExperience with deep learning frameworks and modelsExperience working for a B2B SaaS company
OUR OFFER:
Opportunity to participate in creating a global industry-changing productGreat international team and informal start-up atmosphereStrong company culture and team spiritOpportunity to learn and improve technical and soft skillsPossibilities for career development as the company grows25 vacation daysCompetitive salaryEquity incentivesHome office

title: Global Analytics, Data and Automation Scientist
description:
Alcon is the global leader in eye care, dedicated to helping people see brilliantly. With our 70-plus-year heritage, we are the largest eye care device company in the world – with complementary businesses in Surgical and Vision Care. Being a truly global company, we work in over 70 countries and serve patients in more than 140 countries. We have a long history of industry firsts, and each year we commit a substantial amount in Research and Development to meet customer needs and patient demands.

Join us now as our new Global Analytics, Data and Automation Scientist.

The main purpose of this role is to create data mining architectures/models, statistical reporting, and data analysis methodologies to identify trends in large data sets.

You will build and maintain business analytics that support the Global Commercial Excellence team in driving excellence in sales execution, marketing execution, automation, competency management, forecasting, sales re-porting and customer satisfaction in all regions across both Vision Care and Surgical franchises. Moreover, you will ensure maximum automation of data processing and reporting for all commercial activities internationally.

The Main Accountabilities Will Include
Creating and maintaining predictive models to help making decision and/or predict future trends or events.Creating and maintaining best-in-class ad-hoc reporting and analytics systems and capabilities.Creating and maintaining the databases used by the analytics.Collaborating with key stakeholders (e.g. Region Franchise leadership, Commercial Excellence, Marketing, IT and Finance) to ensure focus on the most value adding analytics to drive business growth.Driving and/ or supporting ad hoc analysis for core Commercial, Sales, Marketing and Training projects (e.g. Sales Incentive Plans, Launch Campaigns, Strategic Plan, Forecasting, etc).Supporting key processes such as incentive compensation automation, sales data loads into CRM, President’s Club reporting, etc, at least for Global Emerging markets.
To be considered in this role we are looking for an individual with:
Bachelors (Masters Preferred) in data or computer sciences, economics, or other related quantitative fieldStrong English communication capability as well as relevant local language skills to drive the team and drive change. Experience working in multiple countries with multiple languages and currencies is a plus2-3 years’ experience in building databases and SQL queries2-3 years’ experience in Python Scripting and R2 years’ experience in developing and managing analytics system (Tableau CRM - Einstein Analytics, Tableau, Spotfire, PowerBI, Qlik)1 years’ experience with data processing automation tools/ ETLs (Alteryx preferred)Strong quantitative aptitudeUnderstanding of Healthcare Market Environment is a plus
Why join Alcon?

We aspire to lead the world in innovating life-changing vision products because when people see brilliantly, they live brilliantly.

We are the world’s leading Eye Care products and Devices Company. You will join our 20,000 associates at Alcon, making a real difference to the lives of others. At Alcon, we create meaningful opportunities for associates to grow their careers. Learn more at www.alcon.com . .

title: Senior Data Scientist (Digital Operations)
description:
Job DescriptionAt IFF, the heart of our company is fueled by a sense of discovery, constantly asking “what if?” That passion for exploration drives us to co-create unique scents and tastes in fine fragrances and beauty, detergents and household goods, as well as beloved foods and beverages. 
IFF is very excited to welcome a new Senior Data Scientist to our team, and we hope it’s you!
Role Scope: As Data Scientist in Digital Manufacturing you are part of our digital team that engages and improves decisions at our manufacturing site. You will be in an agile development environment with high expectations for rapid delivery of prototypes, we execute fast with a time to value less than 4 months. You will routinely meet changing requirements as well as will get direct feedback from our global business customers. You will engage closely with subject matter experts, where you are a strong team player that understands, digests and qualifies the input you receive during the project execution. You will have end-to-end responsibility from qualifying data to establishing the required facts and trust. Both are needed to take operational decisions in real time following your model’s recommendation. You are comfortable impacting our business directly by the work you do. 

Key responsibilities:Provide mentorship and guidance to other Data Scientist in the team.Qualifying data as made available by our digital team by our strong data infrastructureAnalyzing data Develop models Embed modelling results in real time User Interfaces Refine the modelling and user interface in view of the requirements of the usersDocument the work done and facts established
Job Requirements The successful candidate will possess:Experience in working professionally with industrial data of manufacturing sites in either planning, chemical engineering or machine learningPhD, Master’s degree, or Bachelors’ Degree within Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Technology or related fieldSolid background in statistical modelling (statistical hypothesis testing, regression, classification, optimization) as well as advanced statistics and machine learning (Time Series Analysis, clustering, dimension reduction, anomaly detection)Experience programming for User Interfaces in Plotly Dash Tableau improving performance of units and systems (such as chemical reactors, boilers, compressors, chillers, cooling towers & steam/condensate), PowerBI and related Visualizations PlatformsKnowledge of Kubernetes is desirableExperience with databases (Ocrale, SQL, & Historians)Has written Scientific PublicationsHas made Experimental designs and Process optimization 
In order to work with our manufacturing sites some travel is required– around 30% of the time (lifted currently due to COVID restrictions), remaining 70% can be split between working from home or from the office location. 
IFF is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
At IFF, we believe that your uniqueness unleashes our potential. We value the diverse mosaic of the ethnicity, national origin, race, age, sex or veteran status. We strive for inclusive workplace that allows each of our colleagues to bring their authentic self to work regardless of their religion, gender identity & expression, sexual orientation, or disability. Visit IFF.com/careers/workplace-diversity-and-inclusion to learn more

description:

title: DATA SCIENTIST
description:
Desde CaixaBank Tech nos encontramos en búsqueda un perfil Data Scientist para el área de ADVANCED ANALYTICS. 
¿Qué proyectos desarrollamos? Estamos embarcados en el camino hacia el Cloud que llevará el entorno de datos corporativo y el desarrollo de los casos de uso analíticos a nuevas plataformas y paradigmas. Con nosotros podrás realizar proyectos con las tecnologías más punteras en el ámbito de la Analítica Avanzada y del Dato en general. Realizamos proyectos variados que van desde el diseño e implementación de plataformas para el desarrollo e industrialización de modelos de Machine Learning e Inteligencia Artificial, hasta la implementación de dichos modelos para los diferentes casos de uso a los que damos solución para el resto de las empresas del grupo.
Funciones y responsabilidades 
Identificar y proponer soluciones basadas en analítica avanzada para la resolución de problemas de Negocio. Realizar experimentos a gran escala y construir modelos data-driven para responder preguntas de negocio. Analizar información, riesgos y oportunidades de manera autónoma sobre un ámbito concreto. Aplicar análisis de datos y técnicas de generación de modelos analíticos para la generación de valor añadido en el end-to-end del ciclo de vida del dato. 
Requisitos y competencias clave
Conocimientos avanzados de Machine Learning y modelos matemáticos (ej Regresión logística, Regresión Lineal, K-Means, Random Forest, etc.) Experiencia en programación orientada a ciencia de datos (R o Phython, nivel medio/alto) Conocimientos en story telling. Analizar, interpretar y presentar los resultados. Conocimientos en estructuras de almacenamientos de datos (json, avro, xml, etc.) Ciclo de Testing de software y modelos. Monitorización funcional de modelos. Inglés alto 
Propuesta de valor
Incorporación en plantilla con contrato indefinido en nomina de CaixaBank TechPodrías trabajar desde Madrid o BarcelonaPosibilidad de días de teleworking Horario intensivo los viernes y en verano (julio y agosto)Plan de carrera y crecimiento en empresa on top en EspañaRetribución flexible y compensaciones salariales Seguro medico y de vida. Banda salarial competitiva Plataforma de formación interna Planes de formación con posibilidad de certificación Formar parte del https://www.peoplexperiencehub.com/ Hub puntero en España

title: Online Data scientist
location: El Prat de Llobregat, Catalonia, Spain
description:
Descrépción del trabajo:

En MediaMarkt somos especialistas en acercar la tecnología a nuestr@s clientes y líderes en el sector de la electrónica de consumo. En España y Portugal, nuestro equipo está formado por más de 6.500 personas que, desde nuestras 107 tiendas, la web, y nuestro Headquarter, trabajamos para ofrecer el mejor servicio y los mejores productos día a día. Nos adaptamos rápidamente a los cambios estando a la última en las tendencias del retail. Y no, no todos somos Geeks, pero sí que tenemos una cosa en común: pasión por lo que hacemos.

 

Estamos buscando un Online Data scientist cuya misión será dar las herramientas y la información, así como sugerencias, al equipo Online para mejorar la experiencia de usuario, las ventas y convertir más visitantes en clientes.

En este sentido elaborará y análizará reportes sobre el Performance del negocio con relación a KPIs operativos y financieros y aportará información para la creación de Forecast, con el objetivo de aportar información y análisis al negocio de cara a la correcta toma de decisiones. El rol de Web Analyst incluye tareas adicionales como implementar y establecer tracking de métricas, creación de dashboards para visualizar datos relacionados con el e-commerce y el posterior análisis de éstos

Esta posición forma parte del departamento de online ubicado en nuestras oficinas del Prat de Llobregat.

 

LO QUE HARÁS / ASÍ SERÁ TU DÍA A DÍA

 

Trabajo cross functional con los distintos departamentos de Business Operations, Service & Solutions, Digital y BI Analitycs (IT & Organization)

Elaborar informes sobre los principales KPIs de negocio y operativos de cara a presentarlo a diferentes stakeholders (Board, comités operativos y de marketing, equipo online):

  Análisis de la información para identificar, entender, y reportar desviaciones.

   Análisis de los diferentes KPIs de manera conjunta para plantear escenarios futuros (forward thinking) para dar soporte en la toma de decisiones.

   Seguimiento de Targets.

  Realizar el Monthly Planification online, ventas, stock, compras, pedidos, tráfico, CR,…

Desarrollar y gestionar el sistema de reporting estandarizado para online a través de las herramientas existentes en cada momento (Excel / PowerBI / DataStudio/Tableau)

Atender las necesidades de análisis y reporting de online

Resolver dudas en relación al reporting

 

LO QUE ESPERAMOS DE TI

 

  Licenciatura en Administración y Dirección de Empresas, Económicas o Empresariales, y valorable formación en Business Intelligence/Business Analytics.

   Google Analytics avanzado.

   Experiencia en herramientas de visualización de datos (PowerBI / DataStudio).

   Office avanzado (especialmente Excel).

   Inglés nivel alto escrito y oral.

   Valorable experiencia Hotjar, Contentsquare, Crazy Egg, etc.

   Valorable experiencia en el sector retail.

   Extras: Programación VBA, DAX, y SQL.

   Experiencia mínima de 3 años como Web Analyst y Business Controller, y/o Controller operacional.

   Valorable experiencia en mantenimiento de bases de datos.

   Valorable experiencia en el sector retail.

   



We offer:

 

LO QUE PODEMOS OFRECERTE

El bienestar de nuestro equipo es clave para que las cosas salgan bien.

MediaMarkt benefits:

 Flexibilidad horaria Jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano Formación online disponible 24/7 Oficinas open-space y ambiente joven Descuentos en nuestros productos Menú subvencionado en la cantina con opciones saludables y vegetarianas Fruta gratuita una vez por semana Café, té y leche para todos los gustos Gimnasio particular y planes mensuales para otros gimnasios Sesiones de nutricionista Eventos y celebración de días especiales Clases de inglés subvencionadas (después de 6 meses en la compañía) ¡Y mucho más!  

 

¡Conócenos y contágiate de #LaFuerzaDelRojo!

title: Game Data Scientist
description:
Our client are a world-renowned social gaming developer and publisher, specialised in the mobile gaming industry. With an active 2+ million daily users, they are looking to expand their team members by recruiting another Game Data Scientist to join their Analytics team.
As Game Data Scientist you will work to understand our gamers’ behaviour, and work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion. You will do this by:Using predictive and quantitative analysis, statistics & programming to help predict how users will react to changes in the Games and turn this data into actionable insights.Making an impact in a fast-paced, agile environment, where you will be continuing to learn and develop yourself while collaborating closely with other game analysts and data scientists to lead projects on machine learning, behavioural segmentation and monetization.Visualising and presenting analyses and results to senior stakeholders and liaising between different departments to ensure our data is precisely specified, understood and consistent.
 Requirements:3+ years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value.A Masters degree in a quantitative field, including hard and social sciences.Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis.Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python and/or R for data exploratory analysis and has experience in creating dashboards and visualising findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau or Looker.Experienced with A/B Testing.Excellent written and oral communication skills, experience presenting to business stakeholders.Passion for games, or high interest in the mobile gaming industry.Curiosity about everything, ability to innovate & work both in a team and independently.
Nice-to-haves:Experience in a mobile B2C business.Experience designing and analysing randomized experiments.A fast learner, highly meticulous, a consummate professional. You bring value into any conversation you have.
Some additional Benefits:Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you’re not already there).25 days annual leave, not including public holidays.Free language lessons (English, Spanish & Catalan).An amazing training budget just for you and your internal mobility programme offers real growth opportunities!Plus many, many more....
Intrigued? We’d love to hear from you. Please click “apply” to level up and submit your application in English.

Take specifications from productDesign and develop a solution to solve a given business problem.Modeling, model testing and assess models performanceTest the solution in a control environment + document the solution.Efficient communication with the operations team to assess all needs are covered in the designed solution.Identify areas of improvement in DS code/logic/algorithmsExisting models maintenance.Production deploymentWork on automation of processesResearch on new DS techniques of direct application to solve our business problems.Efficient communication with back end and front end development team to provide insightful information and help in optimizing data storage

title: Data & Applied Scientist II - WebXT
description:
The newly formed WebXT organization encompasses Bing, Edge Browser and Microsoft Content services used by nearly a billion users across the Globe. Data is staple to how we run the business in WebXT and there’s immense thirst from engineering, data science, business development and partners across Microsoft to have their data insight questions answered in a fast, accurate and easily digestible fashion. If you seek the opportunity to make direct business impact in major AI driven products in Microsoft, come and join the Bing Metrics and Insights team as a Data Scientist to drive user and engagement growth strategies with data.

We combine our data science expertise with business and engineering knowledge to provide insights to build better products for our customers.

So if you want to work on key growth initiatives for Bing and drive future growth, if analyzing petabytes of data to generate insights excites you and if you want to build great products and make business impact using statistical analysis, machine learning, experiments, data mining, data visualization, and more, then this role is for you!

As Bing is evolving and getting integrated across multiple Microsoft owned products like Windows, Edge, Office, Teams etc., there is a critical need for identifying actionable insights to drive product growth by analyzing cross product data across all Microsoft owned products.

We are looking for a strong data scientist who is hands-on, self-driven and able to work in a fast-paced and constantly evolving environment with direct product focus. This role also requires solid technical, leadership and communication skills. You will extract actionable insights from petabytes of data through data analysis and tell a story through data visualization that will drive enhancement and development of Bing.

Responsibilities
Hands on analysis on large volumes of telemetry data using various algorithms and tools including your ownDrive data driven ideation for Bing user and volume growth initiativesDrive impact analysis for features critical to agile course correction and business investmentsDefine and track key org level success metrics for impact and drive reliable process to track contribution from individual feature initiatives across the product lifecycle against set goalsArticulate insights, storyboard with data and visualization to communicate and influence leadership and other key decision makersHelp build data platform for the Bing org to support their metrics and analytical needs
Qualifications

Required Qualifications:
 Bachelor's or master’s degree in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, Statistics, or another quant-focused fieldRelevant years of professional experience working in Data Science and analyticsRelevant years of experience with metric design, exploratory data analysis, predictive analytics, machine learning for data mining, clustering, A/B testing and other areas of data science and statisticsRelevant years of experience working with large data sets or doing large scale quantitative analysisProficiency in SQL scripting requiredProficiency in using one or more programming or scripting language like Python, R, C# to work with data requiredStrong communication skills to articulate insights to senior management and feature teams to drive actions
Preferred Qualifications
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Kibana etc.,Familiarity with search engines and online servicesA willingness to learn, share, and improve
#WebXT #nextplay #data #datascience #analysis #datamodel #machinelearning

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

title: Data Scientist Madrid/Barcelona/Gijón
description:
Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services at scale in Strategy & Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations, with digital capabilities across all off these services. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions – underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network – Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With approximately 373,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

Applied Intelligence helps our clients grow their business in entirely new ways. Artificial Intelligence and

Analytics enables our clients to achieve high performance through insights from data - insights that

inform better decisions and strengthen customer relationships.

Come and work at the heart of change

We are looking for a Data Scientist. A talented, fun, collaborative person willing to bring added knowledge to our Data Analytics Group. If you thrive working with top clients in the evolution of their data & AI journey… then, we’d like to meet you!

Your work:

Iberia market unit – working for our top clients in the evolution of their core systems and the implementation of new digital architectures. Our clients are belonging to a wide variety of industries (such as Financial Services, Resources, Health & Public Services, Products or Comms & Media) and our services/projects can be transformational for all the company or focused on a particular area (Marketing, HR, Sales or Supply Chain & Operations)

Supply Chain & Operations Innovation Center – located between Barcelona and Madrid, has been at the forefront in helping clients from around the globe and across industries under the umbrella of intelligent operations for the last 15 years – we develop cutting-edge assets and solutions to reduce costs and improve supply chain processes, such as optimization of stock levels, demand planning and forecasting, automated warranty solutions, and predictive asset maintenance.

Your role:

Data scientists drives new data insights to uncover business opportunities & revenue streams. The role has a firm understanding of statistics and data visualization for communication, as well as an understanding business growth areas & how to utilize important data. The role is also responsible for identifying new analytic trends/data needs and repeatable analytic solutions. Works with key stakeholders to generate hypotheses and create analytic models that answer impactful business questions.

Key Responsibilities

Designs and implements processes and layouts for complex, large-scale data sets used for modeling, data mining, and research purposes.

Defines strategy for use of data and how data use interacts with data design.

Works with Data Engineer to design and implement statistical data quality procedures around data sources. 

Performs data studies and data discovery around new data sources or new uses for existing data sources.

Implements and hands-off data checking and updating procedures to other teams as needed (e.g. Data Engineering team)

Performs statistical analyses with existing data sets in statistical packages.

Visualizes and reports data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that appropriately provides insights to the organization.

Develops end-to-end data science applications, including complex distributed data processing, creating an analysis framework (e.g. models, algorithms, etc.), developing custom complex visualization tools, and deploying web applications.

Key Skills

Data-Driven Decision Making

Statistical modeling with focus in any of the following: Natural Language Processing, Classification/predictive modeling, Econometrics modeling, Computer vision/image modeling, Etc.

Data Visualization

Statistical Analysis and Measurement

Background in statistics, econometrics or quantitative analysis

Preferred Qualifications

Amazon Web Services/GCP/Azure

Data Analytics with Python or R

Data Preparation with Python or R

Hadoop

Spark (pySpark/Scala) 

What’s in it for you:

Join the Data Analytics Group for a challenging and rewarding career where the variety of opportunities and projects allows you to develop your potential and grow professionally every day. The only place where you can learn from our unrivalled experience, working alongside over 100 data scientists and Data Engineers, 20% of which are PhD’s in the areas of Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or Statistics.

We offer a competitive salary, an extensive benefits package which includes extra vacations days per year, medical and life insurance, learning opportunities and much more

#BarcelonaInnovationCenter

title: Sr. Data scientist
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
description:
Applies advanced subject matter knowledge to solve complex business issues and is regarded as a subject matter expert. Frequently contributes to the development of new ideas and methods. Works on complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of multiple factors. Leads and/or provides expertise to functional project teams and may participate in cross-functional initiatives. Acts as an expert providing direction and guidance to process improvements and establishing policies. Frequently represents the organization to external customers/clients. Exercises significant independent judgment within broadly defined policies and practices to determine best method for accomplishing work and achieving objectives. May provide mentoring and guidance to lower level employees.

Responsibilities
Mines data using modern tools and programming languages.Defines and implements models to uncover patterns and predictions creating business value and innovation.Manages relationships with stakeholders to evaluate and foster data driven innovation, provide domain-specific expertise in cross-organization projects/initiatives.Ties insights into effective visualizations communicating business value and innovation potential.Maintains proficiency within the data science domain by keeping up with technology and trend shifts. Contributes to industry data science domain initiatives.Leads project team(s) of data science professionals, assuring insights are communicated regularly and effectively, reviewing designs, models and accuracy and data compliance.Collaborates and communicates with project team regarding project progress and issue resolution.Communicates and drives data insights/innovation into the business.Represents the data science team for all phases of larger and more-complex development projects.Provides guidance, training and mentoring to less experienced staff members.
Knowledge & Skills
Extensive experience using statistics, mathematics, algorithms and programming languages to solve big data challenges.Advanced knowledge in Python and/or RFluent in structured and unstructured data, its management, and modern data transformation methodologies.Ability to define and create complex models to pull valuable insights, predictions and innovation from data.Effectively and creatively tell stories and create visualizations to describe and communicate data insights.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Excellent written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English and local language.Ability to effectively communicate data insights and negotiate options at senior management levels.

Collaborates with peers, junior engineers, data scientists and project team.Typically interacts with high- level Individual Contributors, Managers, Directors and Program Core Teams.Leads multiple projects requiring data engineering solutions development.Drives design innovation.

About HP

You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion - it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

title: Data Scientist - Eternal Games
description:
Craft

Job Description:

Do you want to be part of our exciting Eternal Games family? In Eternal Games, we run 5 amazing King games with a very clear picture in mind: making our games Eternal, challenging the standard assumed mobile games’ lifecycle. We have 3 million people playing our games every single day and the value we deliver is counted in millions of dollars. Are you ready to join us and to have a great impact?

Your role within our Kingdom

You will be working with varied stakeholders in a fun, dynamic and fast- paced environment. You’ll help us to further understand, model, predict, segment, retain and monetise our players and be part of a community of 100+ business intelligence & analytics experts.

Specifically, You’ll
Proactively develop new analyses, experiments and data- driven tools to better understand our players’ behaviour and the performance of our gamesProvide insights to support decision making for the portfolio of games in the StudioTranslate business needs to technical requirements and AB- tests, and work with development teams to ensure correct implementation, taking care to correctly track the right information to allow easy and precise analysis of the impactWork closely with other Data Scientists across the business to leverage insights from one game across multiple gamesCarefully check, debug, and problem solve issues to ensure you deliver accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools, even when confronted by subtle data complications. 
Skills to create thrills

There is plenty of scope at King for you to learn from your colleagues in the areas where you have less experience, and to share your own skills where you are stronger.

Specific factors that are helpful to excel in this role include:
Business Insight: The ability to understand the problems and issues our games and business wants to solve, and then defining the right data, analysis or interpretation to lead to the right recommendations and decisionsCommunication: Designing good ways of communicating, visualising or reporting your results/analysis so they are clear and unambiguousSQL: The ability to write complex SQL queries to analyse our databases with 300+ million players and work with relational database systems.Analytical coding: Using tools such as R, Python or Excel for analytical purposesStats: Understanding the basics of appropriate statistical or machine learning techniques.
Other experience that might be helpful, but is not required, includes:
 Work in the games industry or similarly customer- facing digital businesses Familiarity with massive data sets and tools to deal with them (BigQuery/AWS/Hadoop etc) Experience in behavioural psychology/economics and experimental design Experience in predictive analytics, segmentation, and related areas Software engineering skills in Java and other languages (beyond R and Python which we use most frequently) Skills with standard reporting tools such as Looker/QlikView/Tableau/etc.
About King

King is the game developer behind the world- famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top- grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King’s games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta.

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.

Making the World Playful

Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players - and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!

Applications needs to be in English.

Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Data Scientist AI
description:
Position Snapshot

Location: Global IT HUB Barcelona (Esplugues de Llobregat)

Company: Nestle

Full-time position

Grade: H

About IT At Nestlé

We are a multicultural and diverse team of IT professionals driving the biggest IT operations landscape of the FMCG industry, and a Digital Transformation at scale. We work with leading technologies and top external partners to provide solutions to enable Nestlé to engage with millions of consumers and customers worldwide. We look for people who are curious, courageous , innovative, collaborative and passionate about new technologies. We want to hear from candidates who have the courage to challenge ; who believe the only way of moving forward is by doing and who look for solutions to improve the lives of our consumers through responsible use of technology.

Our Global IT Innovation Team is in a mission to unlock tech-powered innovation enabling new business models and continuously future-ready IT products. We focus on solving problems that matter, in a different way. In other words, we help tackle challenges and opportunities that, if solved with a drastic different approach, have a drastic increase in the generated outcome. We are at the forefront of new transversal emerging technologies such as Next AI, Blockchain Implications (Web3, NFT..), Next VR/Metaverse, Distributed Data lakes, Quantum Computing. We help innovate with impact and we never settle!

To strengthen our IS/IT Innovation group, we are looking for a Data Scientist AI, position that will be called “IT Technology Specialist – AI” internally, to complete our Transversal Emerging Technologies team.

Position Summary

If you are an expert in applying advanced analytics to solve real problems. You are hands on in your ability to build models, but you are also comfortable coaching less experienced team members in how to solve problems or managing agencies to deliver where needed. If you know that having a great model isn’t enough, you love to derive the “so what” from you models and tell compelling stories which inspire action and drive growth. If you can research in the frontier of the advanced analytics area and you love to try-by-yourself if needed. Then, you need to apply for working on Transversal Emerging Technologies in the Global IT Innovation team!

Your mission will be to support the exploration, understanding, validation and recommendation of the emerging IT Technologies (AI, Blockchain, Metaverse, …) that will impact to Nestlé during the next years. In your case, mainly the Next AI techniques (Reinforcement Learning, Edge AI, Responsible AI, Causal Inference). This will give you a unique opportunity to gain a global perspective on this adoption process in IT that will help you to educate, coach and share knowledge on how to apply this technology across Nestlé.

A day in the life of...

You’ll be responsible for using advanced analytics to solve real problems but using nonstandard techniquesYou will research in the current state-of-the-art techniques, libraries and platforms that could impact to Nestlé during the next yearsAs a member of the IT Innovation team, you will coach other people and stakeholders in the adoption of this emerging technologiesYou will lease with technological partners to understand where they are working (and why)You will test new platforms, libraries, languages, or devices to be sure that they fit the requirements to solve the problem

What Will Make You Successful

↵
Be educated to MSc level (or equivalent) in Math, Statistics, Physics or Data Science.+3 years of experience in similar positions.Have proven experience on MLOps and deploy ML models in productionExperience with Machine Learning modeling, mainly in Computer Vision and Natural Language Processing, Deep Learning mastering is a must.Have the ability to network and influence at senior levels both internally and externally.Be able to interpret data and explain business performance in an easy-to-understand way that tells a story to key stakeholders.Have proven experience of working in a matrix environment; achieving results through effective influencing and collaboration.Have advanced Python, PyTorch (or similar) experience. Nice to have a good understanding of PySpark, Reinforcement Learning libraries (rllib on ray) and/or Causal Inference.Experience in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, Watson and/or GCP)

Benefits
An attractive and dynamic international working environment with the most talented and engaged IT professionals in their field and working with best-in class technologiesBe yourself @Nestlé, everyone else is taken! Our values are rooted in respect, we champion diversity and inclusion, and believe on the power of diversity to build winning teams where everyone can be the best version of themselves Personal and professional growth through ongoing training and constant career opportunities reflecting our conviction that people are our most important assetGreat benefits including competitive salary and a comprehensive social benefits packageHybrid working environment with flexible working scheme, allowing everyone to meet their needs enjoying the advantages of remote work and combining with the amazing Nestlé facilities (dog friendly!) and culture
If you want to work in an international multi-discipline team, believe you have the right profile and you are looking for a development opportunity apply now in English on our career website www.nestle.com/jobs

title: Data Scientist - Customer Intelligence with Python
description:
What are we looking for? 

As part of the Data & Analytics team, the Customer Intelligence Analyst will use complex data to analyse customer data and optimize marketing campaigns. This person will provide customer analysis and segmentation for targeted campaigns, will evaluate campaigns, and analyse campaign results to improve campaigns in the future.

The Data & Analytics team at Zurich is formed of Data Enthusiasts (Business Analysts and Data Scientists) that use data to accelerate innovation and bring value across the business verticals.

 Identifying, gathering, and integrating the necessary data from different data sources.  Customer analysis and segmentation into distinct customer groups.  Development of targeted marketing campaigns by using the results of the available propensity models to select the right customers.  Campaign evaluation using test and control groups.  Analysis of campaign results to improve the campaign for the next round in terms of targeting, time, offer, product, communication, etc.  Improve and champion current process and analyses to drive segmentation, product recommendations and targeted strategy.  Build and share tools e.g. customer dashboard, to provide self-serve access to customer data throughout the business.  Influencing key cross-functional business stakeholders by delivering analyses and recommendations.  Challenge the status quo and consistently identify areas for improvement, diagnose issues and working to resolve them. 

 What do we need? 

 BS/BA in a quantitative discipline Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research, Computer Science, preferred.  3+ years of demonstrated experience in customer analytics and business intelligence.  Working experience in campaign management or CRM preferred.  Insurance experience is considered a plus.  Proven ability and experience analyzing customer data for actionable business insight.  Advanced SQL and Python programming proficiency.  Experience building dashboards using Microsoft PowerBI, Tableau or similar  Ability to prioritize and work on multiple projects in a deadline-driven environment.  Experience in AWS Cloud would be considered a plus.  Skilled at turning complex analysis into simple conclusions and recommendations for senior leadership.  Proactive.  Strong drive for excellence.  Fluent in Spanish and English. 

 For being from Zurich 

At Zurich we want to take care of you and these are some of your benefits:

 Flexible compensation. Restaurant card. Home office voucher. Hybrid Working model Pension plan - Life insurance. Bank and insurance offer. Discount in gyms. Zurich Wellness, sports activities. Zurich Sports Club, free registration for marathons and popular races. Free English classes.

About Us

Our nearly 55,000 employees in more than 215 countries and territories are the foundation of our success. They are the ones who enable companies and communities to confront a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You would give them confidence and peace of mind by protecting what they love the most. It is a great challenge, but you will have the support of a great international team that is ready to help you so that you can reach your full potential and thus fulfill our promises.

 We have already started and we are changing the way of making insurance. For this we need talented people, the desire to learn and passion! Will you join us? 

 "Zurich, 14 consecutive years as Top Employer"

title: Data Scientist at the Proteomics Unit
description:
The Institute
The Centre for Genomic Regulation (CRG) is an international biomedical research institute of excellence, based in Barcelona, Spain, with more than 400 scientists from 44 countries. The CRG is composed by an interdisciplinary, motivated and creative scientific team which is supported both by a flexible and efficient administration and by high-end and innovative technologies.
In April 2021, the Centre for Genomic Regulation (CRG) received the renewal of the 'HR Excellence in Research' (https://www.crg.eu/en/content/careers/hr-excellence-research) Award from the European Commission. This is a recognition of the Institute's commitment to developing an HR Strategy for Researchers, designed to bring the practices and procedures in line with the principles of the European Charter for Researchers (https://euraxess.ec.europa.eu/jobs/charter/european-charter) and the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers (Charter and Code) (https://euraxess.ec.europa.eu/jobs/charter/code).
Please, check out our Recruitment Policy:https://www.crg.eu/sites/default/files/crg/crg_recruitment_policy.pdf
The role  A new position is open for a Data Scientist at the CRG/UPF Proteomics Unit in Barcelona. The successful applicant will become a part of an international team of scientists, which is working closely with scientists at the Parc de Recerca Biomèdica de Barcelona. The available position is in a laboratory that focuses on the analysis of proteomes using mass spectrometry. The person recruited will lead the analysis of proteome longitudinal variability, assessment of proteome information content, generation of prediction models, and the analysis of plasma proteomes from selected cohorts in the context of personalized medicine. We are looking for highly motivated and organized candidates with a strong background in data science, statistics, and proteomics and/or other type of omics data. Candidates must have good communication skills, capable of working in a group, and with a high degree of work autonomy. About the team The Proteomics Unit is a joint effort of the Universitat Pompeu Fabra and the Center of Genomic Regulation to create an innovative research infrastructure with a high-level of excellence and sustainability to support scientists in the biomedical field. The activities of the Proteomics Unit are focused onto the provision of high-quality proteomics services with strong added-value to the research community by offering state-of-the-art methods, advise and expertise to support basic and translational researchers, developing new methods and techniques that keep the unit up to date and at the forefront of the proteomics field and training the community and actively disseminating proteomics science and methods. Professional experience Must Have · You have experience in biomedicine with educational background in data science · You have experience in data science and statistics with educational background in biomedicine· You have advanced programming skills in machine learning and statistical models· You have previous experience in proteomics or other omics data analysis· You are familiar with mass spectrometry· You have good skills with office automation and data analysis software Education and training · You hold a PhD or Master degree in fields related to biomedicine, data science or statistics Languages · You have good communication skills and fluency in English Competences  You have highly developed organization skillsYou have analytical skills and critical thinkingYou are capable of working independently and in a team The Offer – Working Conditions · Contract duration: aprox.1 year· Estimated annual gross salary: Salary is commensurate with qualifications and consistent with our pay scales· Target start date: April 2022We provide a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructures, and unique professional career development opportunities. To check out our training and development portfolio, please visit our website in the training section.(https://www.crg.eu/en/content/training).
We offer and promote a diverse and inclusive environment and welcomes applicants regardless of age, disability, gender, nationality, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation or gender identity.
The CRG is committed to reconcile a work and family life of its employees and are offering extended vacation period and the possibility to benefit from flexible working hours.
Application ProcedureAll applications must include:A motivation letter addressed to Dr. Eduard Sabidó.A complete CV including contact details.Contact details of two referees.
All applications must be addressed to Dr. Eduard Sabidó and be submitted online on the CRG Career site - http://www.crg.eu/en/content/careers/job-opportunities 
Selection Process ₋ Pre-selection: The pre-selection process will be based on qualifications and expertise reflected on the candidates CVS. It will be merit-based. ₋ Interview: Preselected candidates will be interviewed by the Hiring Manager of the position and a selection panel if required. ₋ Offer Letter: Once the successful candidate is identified the Human Resources department will send a Job Offer, specifying the start day, salary, working conditions, among other important details.  Deadline: Please submit your application by March 20th, 2022
Suggestions: The CRG believes in ongoing improvement and promotes a culture of feedback. This is one of the reasons we have in place, at your disposal as a candidate, a mechanism to gather your suggestions/complaints concerning your candidate experience in our recruitment processes. Your feedback really matters to us in our aim at creating a positive candidate journey. You can make a difference and help us improve by letting us know your suggestions through the following form.https://recruitment.crg.eu/webforms/recruitment-contact-form-suggestionscomplaints.

title: Senior Data Scientist - Pricing analytics
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
description:
About The Position

As Data Scientist in the Pricing Analytics team, you will shape HP’s future of how we set prices. We are a very dynamic, highly skilled and diverse global team consisting of data scientists, economists, statisticians, computer scientists and engineers, who are pushing the innovation frontier in the way HP sets prices for its products. Working with us you will combine your modelling skills, economic/business thinking, experimentation and optimization methods to build complex pricing algorithms for most popular Printers and PCs in the market.

About You
You have deep interests in customer and market behaviour and methods to measure and anticipate itYou are passionate about unveiling answers to most difficult questions using data and modelsYou feel accomplished seeing your pricing recommendations being implemented while shopping for yourself You can’t stop thinking about learning something new every day and enjoy being surrounded by highly talented people 
Key Responsibilities
Develop and apply data science and statistical methods and experimentation to analyse the effect of pricing and sales decisions on business performanceCollaborate with internal stakeholders to design and deploy pricing initiatives based upon analytical findingsPresent results and recommendations to relevant stakeholders, including senior leadership
Must-haves

Requirements
Proven track record of experience in data scienceTheoretical and applied skills in Machine Learning and Statistics/EconometricAbility to think creatively and invent original solutions to business and modelling challengesProficiency with Python or RAdvanced degree in Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or related disciplines
Bonus Points For
Interest in pricing, economics, and consumer behaviourExperience in designing, deploying, and analysing in-market experiments and/or AB testsExperience in deploying ML and data science solutions Knowledge of price optimization approaches, price discrimination models and a general knowledge of main concepts from the industrial organization literatureBasic understanding of finance and product economics
What We Offer
Opportunity to work in an international organization with colleagues coming from all over the world.Diverse, continued internal growth and career opportunities. Including HP’s own learning platform and LinkedIn Learning.Health & Life insuranceTicket restaurant vouchersHP product discountFlex optimization program: Kindergarten tickets, public transportation ticketsPension planWork life balance /flexible working hoursWomen, Pride, Young employees, Multicultural and DisAbility! Just a few of our fantastic global business networks you can get involved with locally.
About HP

You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion - it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
“Ocado Technology, powering the future of retail through sustained disruptive technology innovation...”

Ocado Technology is putting the world’s retailers online using the cloud, robotics, AI, and IoT. We develop the innovative software and systems that power Ocado.com, the world’s largest online-only grocery retailer as well as the global ‘Ocado Smart Platform’. With everything from websites to fully autonomous warehouse that we design in-house, our employees need to be specialists in a wide range of technologies to help drive our business.

We champion a value-led culture to get our teams working at their very best and to help create a collaborative working environment that our people love. Core values of Trust, Autonomy, Craftsmanship, Collaboration and Learn Fast help drive our innovative culture.

Data Science is responsible for designing cutting-edge machine learning and optimisation techniques to convert data into important business insights and efficient operations.

We focus on machine learning and optimisation problems across Ocado’s E-commerce - from recommending products to customers, to search optimisation and intelligent substitutions. Our data is stored in Google BigQuery, we work primarily in Python for machine learning and use frameworks such as Spark and TensorFlow. We are looking for someone with experience in developing and optimising search engines as we seek to improve the personalisation and performance of our existing engine for our OSP platform.

Role & Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist you will work closely with the team lead, management, other data scientists and software engineering teams to identify, scope, plan and manage projects, and effectively communicate complex technical issues and findings to a range of technical and non-technical internal audiences.

You will work on projects in all the areas touched by data science, dealing with complex problems and having a real impact on the operational performance of the company. You will be given autonomy in how you approach these problems and will be encouraged to research and seek out innovative solutions.

Communication is key; you will be in constant contact with business stakeholders and will need to work with developers both within the team and in other technology teams to ensure that your solutions are properly productionised and can be supported.

You may be asked to perform tasks as required by management deemed as a reasonable request. This job description is a summary of the typical functions of the role, not an exhaustive or comprehensive list of possible role responsibilities, tasks and duties and is subject to review. The responsibilities, tasks and duties of the job holder might differ from those outlined in the job description and other duties, as assigned, might form part of the job.

Knowledge, Skills And Experience
A strong academic record including a postgraduate degree in mathematics, statistics, or related fields.Demonstrated computer programming ability including fluency in two or more of Python, Java (or equivalent), and SQL.Experience conducting analysis on large data sets and providing rigorous interpretations of the results.The ability to model complex problems mathematically and/or computationally, and appropriately apply results obtained using those models.A solid understanding of key statistical concepts.Machine learning or applied operations research experience.
DESIRABLE COMPETENCIES
Successfully conducted research of significant scope – an M.Phil. or Ph.D. will be looked on favourably.Knowledge of common machine learning toolkits (e.g. scikit-learn).Knowledge of deep learning frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, Theano, Torch..).
BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES
Craftsmanship – demonstrates breadth and depth of knowledge and skill; upholds quality and continuous improvement; can adapt the ideas of others; displays high levels of initiative.Trust – demonstrates high levels of trust between individuals and teams; espouses respect, openness, honesty and knowledge sharing.Collaboration – works well with others and actively contributes towards team/department/division objectives to enable high performance of own and fellow teams; displays the generosity to help others succeed at own expense.Autonomy – accepts ownership of what they do; relishes empowerment to drive innovation; take accountability and responsibility of own actions.Learn Fast – ability to learn fast through experimentation; understands that failing is acceptable; recognises the importance of learning from failure quickly, without attributing blame.Leadership – proven ability to inspire, motivate and empower others; able to make tough decisions and handle difficult situations and face major challenges with positivity, confidence and pragmatism; adept communicator.
What We Offer You

What we can offer you

A relaxed, international, talented, creative and friendly environment, where we invest in our employees, ensuring we provide them with the best in-house and external training programs available.
Flexible working hours with short FridaysReduced hours in AugustPrivate Health InsuranceLife InsuranceTicket RestaurantTicket TransportTicket KindergartenFlexible WFH policyShare-saving scheme Gym membership discounts Fresh fruit, snacks, tea and coffeeMonthly social eventsTable football, board games and Nintendo SwitchTech Talks and internal trainingsEnglish, Spanish and Catalan language courses
We are growing rapidly, making it a very exciting time to join, as we are currently at a brand new office in the 22@ district - the thrilling tech area of Barcelona.

Anything else?

There’s a lot going on at Ocado Technology! Click to find out more about Ocado Technology and our recruitment process.

Ocado is an equal opportunities employer and as such makes every effort to ensure that all potential employees are treated fairly and equally, regardless of their sex, sexual orientation, marital status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion, age, disability or union membership status.

title: Game Data Scientist
description:
We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Game Data Scientist into our Analytics team, where you will work to understand our gamers’ behaviour, and work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion.

Applying quantitative analysis, statistics & programming, you’ll draw business insights that add real value to Socialpoint. To truly make an impact you’ll need to learn quickly & work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with analytics & game teams.

What will you do in Socialpoint?
 Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour and answer key business questions.  Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis.  Visualize and present analyses and results to senior stakeholders, including: Analytics Leads, VPs of Product, the CEOs and other C-level executives.  Acting as the liaison between product leads, game developers, data engineers and data scientists to ensure our data is precisely specified, understood and consistent.  Team up with other data scientists to lead projects on machine learning, behavioural segmentation and monetization.  Using predictive analytics to predict how users will react to changes in the Games.  Requirements
