Our vision, as a responsible European B2C and B2B industry leader online, is to offer a unique value proposition on our HI markets, beyond product to services, to be an A Brand. Our ManoMano way of life, within business hypergrowth, is to always keep the human dimension at its right place. Empowering people to responsibly make their own kind of world is our mission.

Our Company Culture 💙

People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Be challenged at ManoMano. The Machine Learning team is an applied ML team with a focus on delivery. We’re outcome-oriented: we solve high-impact business problems and deliver value to our users in production.

We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist to be part of a team of best-in-class ML practitioners focused on personalization (search and recommender systems) and the quality of our catalog (e.g., product categorization or product attribute extraction).

You’ll be joining a team of top-tier Data Scientists with probably some of the strongest modeling skills in the French Tech Next40. The ML team was instrumental in the growth of ManoMano from the very beginning and is now fully committed to building ML data products on our marketplace in this hypergrowth stage.

This is the opportunity to contribute to one of Europe’s highest-valued unicorn companies and tap into one of the largest e-commerce data sets in the world to build the algorithms that power our internal and external products.

We have several roles open across different levels of seniority. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background and experience solving tough problems with large datasets.

Responsibilities
Apply machine learning algorithms and statistical techniques to build new ML. product features, creating new and improving internal and external-facing data products. Own the ML lifecycle, from experimentation and prototyping to deployment into production pipelines. Write production model code and implement algorithms in production. Perform exploratory data analysis to gain a deeper understanding of the problem. Investigate and fix a production issue from a data product your team owns.Partner with software engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to frame problems, both mathematically and within the business context.Share your knowledge and expertise with the rest of the team.
Requirements
User-focused.3+ years of industry experience applying Machine Learning to business problems and building ML models for production.A Bachelor or Master’s Degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Operations Research, Bioinformatics, Economics, Computational Biology, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering) or equivalent practical experience.Solid knowledge of Machine Learning theory, statistics, and probabilities.Strong coding experience in Python and proficiency in SQL. You care about code simplicity and performance.Proficient oral and written communication skills in English. We’re a remote-first team, so good writing is key. French is not required.Growth mindset: love learning and seek challenges.
Nice To Have
Built large-scale production ML models and systems.Expertise in search, ranking, recommendation systems, information retrieval, natural language processing (NLP), visual recognition, or reinforcement learning (RL).Ph.D. degree in a quantitative field.You are a Kaggle Competitions Expert.Professional experience in a technology company setting involving a product, an e-commerce platform, or a consumer-facing marketplace.Experience using data processing (e.g., Apache Spark, Apache Flink, or Apache Beam) or deep learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch or Tensorflow).Strong core computer science fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, architecting systems).
Benefits & Perks
A FLEXIBLE WORKING CULTURE 🏡 Full remote option30 working days vacationFlexible working hours Disconnection charterFriday afternoon… it’s off!Intensive working day in AugustPrivate medical insurance with AxaCrafternoons : every Thursday afternoon (share your knowledge, learn from others)Ticket restaurantTicket transportationExternal conferences - organisation of internal and external MeetupsMM employee discountTake care of yourself with our dedicated program with moka.care Gym membership with Andjoy
At ManoMano we are dedicated to building an inclusive and diverse workforce where each individual can grow. 

We respect and value the richness of varied cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our teams which is why we are looking for talented people from all backgrounds.

The information collected on this form is recorded in a file used by ManoMano - Colibri SAS so that we can process your application. 

The data is kept for 2 years from the date of your application. You can access your data, rectify it, request its deletion or exercise your right to limit the processing of your data. You can also exercise your right to the portability of your data. Consult the cnil.fr website for more information on your rights. 

To exercise these rights or if you have any questions about the processing of your data under this scheme, you can contact our data protection officer by writing to dpo@manomano.com. 

If, after having contacted us, you feel that your "Data Protection" rights have not been respected, you may submit a complaint to the CNIL.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Our opportunity 

At Zurich, one of our key areas of focus is preparing for the Future of Work. Changes in customer behaviours and needs, as well as the integration of new technologies are changing the workforce of the future. In order to be ready for the future of work we are proactively driving key transformation programs across the business.

Join us on our global Future of Work journey, working in a forward-thinking organizational design and analytics team, bringing data science and digitalization to life. Be part of shaping the organization of the future leveraging data to inform better decision making about people and teams. Act as a thought leader and partner to drive better decisions based on data.

 Your role 

 As an organizational data scientist your main responsibilities will involve: 

 Be the thought leader in the team when it comes to data science  Aggregation of large amounts of data, building statistical models and performing statistical analysis (e.g., segmentation, correlation, multiple regression, trend analysis, behavioral analysis, predictive modeling, etc.)  Perform organizational network analysis to support Org. Design initiatives  Analysis of all text data (survey comments, system data): cluster analysis, sentiment analysis, etc.  Presenting, explaining and discussing results of analysis and trends concisely and effectively  Supporting high-priority projects for executives and/or the leadership team  Providing thought leadership and capability building to the global HR community  Combining data science with technology to provide tailored insights at scale  Leading workforce planning and informing organizational effectiveness initiatives 

Your Skills And Experience

 As a organizational data scientist your skills and qualifications will ideally include: 

 General skills: 

 Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in Mathematics / Statistics, preferably with HR background  Knowledge of HR data and Workforce Analytics  Strong knowledge of statistical theory and calculations and analytic methods (e.g., correlation, multiple regression, moderator analysis, etc.)  Preferred skills: R, Python, Microsoft PowerBI, SQL (optional)  Good command of English (C1) 

 Data Modelling and Machine Learning: 

 Linear Modelling: Regression and Classification, Linear Mixed Models, Survival Analysis  Natural Language Processing: Text Classification, Cluster Analysis, Unsupervised/Supervised Topic Modelling, NER, Semantic Similarity Modelling  Recommendation Modelling: Collaborative / Content / Deep Learning Based Recommendations 

 Social Network Analysis: 

 Analysis of basic properties of a network (Density, Node centrality, Component analysis and etc.)  Node similarity, node classification, cluster / community analysis 

Additional Information

 As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes: 

 Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 100% - you choose  Flexible working hours  Wide range of internal and external trainings  Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on the needs  Ticket restaurant  Life Insurance  Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company  Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you  Special banking and insurance conditions  Exclusive Employees discounts 

Primary work location is Barcelona, Spain. Option to telework from any location within Spain territory is also feasible.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

 So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

 At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

title: Data Scientist in Sourcing & Procurement - Applied Intelligence team
description:
We are looking for passionate, curious, and driven team players who are ready to ignite ideas, push boundaries and drive innovation. At Accenture you’ll work on innovative projects and develop your career, collaborating with the best teams in the world.

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services at scale in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations.

Part of Accenture Strategy and Consulting, the Barcelona Center of Excellence (see it in action in this video!) has been at the forefront in helping clients from around the globe under the umbrella of intelligent operations for the last 15 years. With a team of over 100 consultants, data scientists and engineers, and leveraging Artificial Intelligence, Analytics, Machine Learning, Simulation & Optimization, among others, we develop cutting-edge assets and solutions to reduce costs and improve supply chain processes.

Zooming into the Sourcing & Procurement Analytics Team, we develop & implement intelligent algorithms solving procurement challenges to help global leading companies maximize value and move towards automation. As part of this group you will grow your skills and capabilities around both, Data Science and Procurement functional knowledge, areas in continuous growth and huge demand for talent in todays’ global economy.

Manager/Consultant Procurement Analytics Role

As part of the Procurement Analytics team, you will have to:

Understand and describe issues and challenges around any Sourcing & Procurement processes.

Interact with business leads to define implementation strategies, business requirements and solution design related to procurement processes.

Outline project tasks and best approach from the client’s problem statement.

Develops simple and easy to understand frameworks and formats to present information & ideas.

Help develop Procurement Analytics offerings and software solutions demonstrations.

Designing Procurement Analytics algorithms and software solutions.

As a data scientist, you also will have to:

Do the extraction, wrangling and enrichment of data from one or multiple sources.

Manipulate data sets, including variables definition, calculations and summarizations.

Develop predictive models and generate data-driven insights to solve industrial challenges.

Develop, train and validate data models, and results visualization through dynamic dashboards.

Develop and maintain analytical models.

Work effectively with offshore development team and provide guidance to ensure quality.

Additionally, you will have to:

Mentor and train junior developers and modelers.

Support Management team on client proposals and other sales activities.

Resolves problems quickly and effectively using creativity and innovation.

Adopt methods and tools that improve personal and team productivity.

Skills you will need:


Engineer / mathematics / physics / economics / science master’s degree or equivalent.

3 to 6 years of relevant experience proving Data Science skills:

process data visualization, statistics/statistical testing, machine learning, data mining, and database structure and management.

Statistical analysis/programming (in tools like R, SAS, PYTHON, SCADA, Spark, MATLAB, Tensor Flow, Torch, Caffe, Excel, CNTK).

Knowledge in visualization tools (like Shiny, Spotfire, Qlikview, Tableau, PowerBI).

Knowledge of full life cycle development methodologies.

3 to 6 years of relevant experience proving Procurement area skills:

Procure-to-Pay Process, Supplier Relationship Mgnt., Contract Mgnt. or Spend Mgnt.

Interaction with business leads to define requirements and solution design related to procurement processes.

Experience with Ariba or Coupa P2P solutions, or equivalent platforms are a plus.

Passion in statistical analysis.

Critical thinking and attention to detail.

Interest in consulting career.

Excel advanced level.

What’s in it for you:

Join the Data Analytics Group for a challenging and rewarding career where the variety of opportunities and projects allows you to develop your potential and grow professionally every day. The only place where you can learn from our unrivaled experience, working alongside over 100 data scientists and Data Engineers, 20% of which are PhD’s in the areas of Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or Statistics.

We offer a competitive salary, an extensive benefits package which includes extra vacations days per year, medical and life insurance, learning opportunities and much more!

Make your move – Apply now!

#BarcelonaInnovationCenter

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo is looking for world-class Senior Data Scientists to work in our Barcelona office. Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on? Do you want to evolve in one of the fastest growing startups of Barcelona, building a product that will change people's day-to-day lives and disrupt the on-demand market?

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Develop, test and productionize predictive algorithms by using state of the art machine learning algorithms and statistical modelsEvaluate algorithms through controlled offline (e.g. cross validation with holdouts strategy) and online experiments (e.g. cross validation, A/B testing)Contribute to one or more of the following areas: time series analysis & forecasting, A/B testing, customer analytics, personalisation & recommender design as well as operational research & optimisationDesign experiments and interpret the results to draw detailed and actionable conclusionsGenerate and execute on ideas for exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide recommendations for actionsCreate dashboards and reports to regularly communicate results and monitor key metricsCollaborate with cross-functional teams across disciplines such as product, engineering, operations, marketing amongst others; identify use cases for data science applicationMentor one or more data scientists; lead a small teamContribute to the recruitment and onboarding of data scientistsDisseminate outcomes through talks as well as papers and posters in conferences
You Have
At least 5+ years research and development experience in industry or academia. Holds at least an MSc, and preferably a PhD in a scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science or MathematicsDeep theoretical and applied knowledge in at-least one of the following areas: supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, game theory, statistical inference, bayesian statistics, causal inference, time series analysis, decision theory, mathematical optimisationExperience working with large data setsDemonstrable experience at productionising ideas; from conception to deploymentPython and/or R experience; can independently prototype solutions to problemsExperience with big data (e.g. Scala and Spark) and cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)Command line skillsExperience a start-up and/or R&D environmentsAbility to manage a team is desirableStrong presentation skills in communicating with experts and novicesFluent spoken and written English
Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan Attractive Relocation package (if applicable ;)) Comprehensive Private Health Insurance Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!) Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months! Discounted Gym memberships Flexible working environment 
What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
GAS: Driven to deliver quality results quicklyGood Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learningCare: Uplift people and the planetGlownership: Act as proud ownersHigh Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we’re currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://glovoapp.com/ | Twitter: @Glovo_ES | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/glovoappES/ | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/glovo-app/

title: Data Scientist
description:
eDreams ODIGEO is one of the world's largest online travel companies and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. Under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo – it serves more than 18 million customers per year across 46 markets. Listed on the Spanish Stock Market, eDreams ODIGEO works with over 665 airlines and has partnerships with 130. The brand offers the best deals in regular flights, low-cost airlines, hotels, cruises, car rental, dynamic packages, holiday packages and travel insurance to make travel easier, more accessible, and better value for consumers across the globe.

Our dynamic team of young, talented professionals from over 60 different nationalities is driven by one clear mission: making travel easier, more accessible, and create better value for our 18 million customers worldwide. Inside our Data Science team, we research and build cutting-edge solutions to be able to offer more and better combinations of tailored travel plans than any other site. We have dozens of machine learning models in production doing hundreds of thousands of predictions that optimize our processes, improve the content for our customers and help us adapt to changes in the market. The team is constantly analyzing the past to understand it, and predicting the future to guide business on making the decisions that drive the most value both for our customers and our business.

We set the path with data and intelligence. Shape with us the way people travel.

We are looking for a passionate, highly analytical Data Scientist to join our talented team in sunny and vibrant Barcelona. You will have the opportunity to either crunch massive datasets using the latest Big Data technologies or solve a quick problem with an already classic algorithm. We always promote using the best tool for each task. You will be a key player in the organization by designing and implementing advanced analytics and using machine learning to build AI-powered solutions for almost every area in the business like online fraud detection, recommendation engines, user experience personalization, optimizing the flight combinations we offer or the marketing campaigns we launch, and virtually every possible area subject to optimization in the business etc. Join us and help us reach our ambitious goal of becoming the global leader in online travel!

What you will do:
 Conduct predictive analytics to better understand how our customers interact with our products and help us anticipate their needs.  Collaborate with Product and Business teams in order to embed Machine Learning into our apps, services and products and create predictive models and generate insights from our data.  Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.  Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.  Effectively communicate results and insights with other stakeholders throughout the organization. 

About you:
 Degree in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or other quantitative fields).  2+ years of related experience as a Data Scientist, Machine Learning engineer or similar.  Previous experience in problem-solving, strong analytical and technical skills.  You have a solid understanding of appropriate statistical, data mining and machine learning methods for various analysis situations.  Strong experience coding in Python. Other programming languages like Scala, R, or Java are also valued.  Experience using frameworks like, Spark, Tensorflow and the already classic libraries like scikit-learn, pandas, etc.  Solid knowledge and use of SQL is important. Experience in Big Data technologies; such as distributed computing, NoSQL/graph databases or architectures based on kubernetes, airflow or kafka would be a plus.  You are committed to follow good practices and conventions, from code versioning to QA processes and monitorization.  Written and oral communication skills (in English). 

What do we offer?
 Safe environment during COVID times: Onboarding and daily work can be done 100% remote.  A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.  Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.  Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills training, language lessons, external events and industry conferences.  Free subscription to O'Reilly Online Learning.  Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.  We also have for you a Ticket Restaurant benefit & unlimited beverages and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) because we like our eDOers happy and healthy!  A phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance.  New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.  Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements.  Fun at work: at eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand! 

… And the opportunity to work in a dynamic, dedicated, fun and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!

Come fly with us and join us now.

eDreams ODIGEO under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo –is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

title: Data Scientist AI
description:
Desde CaixaBank Tech nos encontramos en búsqueda un perfil Data Scientist con conocimiento avanzado de Python, Machine Learning, modelos matemáticos y estadísticos.  ¿Qué proyectos desarrollamos? Desarrollamos soluciones basadas en inteligencia artificial (IA) para impulsar la adopción de la IA en el grupo CaixaBank. Para ello, definimos la estrategia de IA en el grupo CaixaBank, ofrecemos servicios y aplicaciones escalables y robustas en IA, centralizamos y divulgamos el conocimiento y buenas prácticas en IA, y exploramos nuevas tecnologías y tendencias manteniéndonos a la vanguardia del estado del arte.El Centro de Excelencia de Inteligencia Artificial es un equipo multidisciplinar que conceptualiza y desarrolla proyectos con una visión user centric entre los que destacan las aplicaciones cognitivas (nueva generación de asistentes virtuales), soluciones basadas en tecnologías de voz y análisis de texto, recomendadores, clasificadores de lenguaje natural o gestión documental.Las responsabilidades que asumirás en la posición son: Desarrollo de modelos de machine learning/deep learning para dar respuesta a los diferentes problemas que se planteen.Transformar los datos en información relevante, obteniendo ‘insights’ y transfiriendo este conocimiento a las áreas de negocio, proponiendo soluciones cuando se requiera.Desarrollo de prototipado ágil, para demostrar la viabilidad de la solución/modelo propuesta.Implementar soluciones de ingeniería inversa para entender el problema del cliente y resolver sus retos de negocio identificando oportunidades de machine learning.Definición, implantación y seguimiento de indicadores.Diseñar las actividades necesarias para completar proyectos de manera exitosa fomentando el uso de metodologías Agile.Analizar información, riesgos y oportunidades de manera autónoma sobre un ámbito.Aplicar las últimas tecnologías de mercado y estado del arte en las soluciones propuestas.Aplicar análisis de datos y técnicas de diseño, modelado y QA en base a un entendimiento detallado de los procesos de negocio, para establecer, modificar o mantener una estructura de datos y sus componentes.Documentar trabajo técnico, utilizando estándares, métodos y herramientas adecuados.

Requisitos y competencias clave: Título universitario en Informática, Ingeniería, Matemáticas o Físicas. Se valorará tener un doctorado.Conocimiento avanzado de machine learning y modelos matemáticos y estadísticos como autoencoders, Transformers, RNNs, análisis de series temporales, Gradient Boosting, Multi-armed Bandits, etc.Experiencia de mínimo 3 años en programación orientada a ciencia de datos: Python con conocimientos de paquetes como TensorFlow, Pytorch, Sklearn, Scipy, Keras, etc.Experiencia en la visualización y exploración de datos con herramientas como Seaborn, Matplotlib y se valorará experiencia en librerías de javascript para la visualización interactiva como 3D.jsConocimientos de metodologías de desarrollo de modelos (MLOps, DataOps, etc.).Conocimientos de transformación y limpieza de datos (ETL., data wrangling).Conocimiento en entorno Cloud (IaaS, PaaS, CaaS, SaaS).Experiencia práctica en el uso de técnicas, metodologías para el control de versiones y A/B Testing.Experiencia en implementación de proyectos de machine learning en industria con grandes volúmenes de datos.Capacidad para valorar y seleccionar los procedimientos y enfoques de trabajo adecuados para superar los retos técnicos.Versatilidad y visión transversal de proyectos IA.Habilidad gestionando expectativas de equipos técnicos y de clientes.Comunicación e influencia.Capacidad de trabajo en equipoAlta motivación para afrontar retos y diseñar aplicaciones innovadoras y transformadoras.Capacidad para desempeñar sus funciones con autonomía, gestionando tiempos e imprevistos.Necesario nivel alto de inglés (escrito y conversacional)

title: Data Scientist
description:
Let’s Talk About You

Your profile 

You are a highly collaborative individual and enjoy solving problems that focus on adding business value. You have a sense of ownership and enjoy hands-on technical work. Our values resonate with yoursDegree educated in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or equivalent experience, with strong physics background or experience in physics-based Deep Learning preferably with Tensorflow or PytorchAbility to write clean, maintainable, and robust code in Python as well as working experience with CUDA and familiarity with at least some container, query, and database technologiesAnalysis of discrete or continuous, non-uniformly sampled time-series as well as knowledge in distributed computing and deep learning Preferable: familiarity with ML learning in the cloud, preferably with AWS SageMaker, as well as familiarity with the RAPIDs family specially cuMLFluency in English is essential (C2 Level), fluency in Spanish is strongly recommended (B2/C1 Level), knowledge of German and other languages is a plus

Your Responsibilities

Design and build digital twin models of Siemens-Energy assets components for anomaly and faults detectionsDefine failures root causes and produce risk analysis with explainable probabilistic modelsCombine data from various and diverse sources into global optimization modelsTake advantage of Siemens Energy cloud environment to scale your modelsContribute to cross-functional problem-solving sessions with your team and deliver presentations to colleagues and clients Your opportunities for personal growth

You will have the opportunity to work in a start-up like environment, with highly motivated team within a leading market company, and in an international environmentWhile we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, SQL, R, AWS Step Functions, AWS lambda and a lot of container technologies (Docker) with multiple runtimes for these (AWS SageMaker, EKS or AWS Batch). We are also using RStudio Teams as a centralized development environment to launch VScode, RStudio and JupyterLab sessionsYou will be part of an international team, working alongside Project Managers, Data Engineers, Machine Learning Engineers, Software Engineers and 3D DesignersDuring your first project you will also work closely with collaborators from two of the biggest companies in data services and deep learning techYou will directly contribute on the establishment of the energy systems of tomorrow

Let’s Talk About Us

"Let’s make tomorrow different today" is our genuine commitment at Siemens Energy to all customers and employees on the way to a sustainable future.

As Siemens Energy we are the only company with a leading portfolio along the entire energy value chain – in both conventional and renewable energy – we are uniquely able to help both public- and private-sector customers benefit from these developments.

Your role will be inside one of our DigiHubs and based in Barcelona.

#DigiHubBarcelona leads all Siemens Energy DigiHubs worldwide from the showcasing and customer experience perspective in Digitalization and Energy Transition. We work with consultative sales methodologies and enable our sales colleagues in selling Digital Transformation and Energy Transition related solutions from a holistic customer centric approach.

#DigiHubBarcelona is one of the main Data Hubs for Siemens Energy, become part of our dynamic digitization team as a Data Scientist and join us in the world of digitalization and decarnonization. A new dimension of the service of our machines awaits you - the dimension of data. For us, digitization means increasing the value for our customers by development of innovative business models as well as digital products.

MORE INSIGHTS

Be Energized. Be you.

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity we generate power. We run on inclusion and compassion. Our combined creative energy is fueled by at least 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society. All of society.

Jobs & Careers: https://www.siemens-energy.com/global/en/company/jobs.html

!

Organization: Enterprise Data & Advanced Analytics

Company: Siemens Energy S.A.

Experience Level: Experienced Professional

Job Type: Full-time

title: Game Data Scientist/Analyst - Barcelona Gaming Giant
description:
Game Data Scientist/Analyst (Barcelona):
Have you been looking for an exciting life-changing opportunity that is too good to miss? Are you keen to reap the rewards of your efforts with huge progression possibilities? If so, then please read on!
Our client is a worldwide mobile games leader that are in the top rankings of both iOS & Android, with games that are played by over 50 million fans all over the world. Their team of over 300 is full of keen gamers with a passion in this field. 
They are looking for creative and innovative Games Data Scientist/Analysts to join their vibrant Analytics team in Barcelona. You will work to understand their games behaviour and work with teams to continuously improve the product, drive retention and user conversion
This role offers the following benefits:
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you’re not already here). No sponsorship can be offered so you must have the right to work in the EU.Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).Spotify Premium for the first 6 months of your employment with us. Social events & parties to let off some steam. 
Required Experience:
Master’s degree in quantitative field3+ years’ experience applying analytics to answer business questions Strong exposure to A/B testing or A/B testing techniques Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python or R for data exploratory analysis Confidence in liaising with teams across the boards from pitching to stakeholders through to collaborating with the technical team
This truly is a unique, life-changing opportunity so if this sounds of interest and you are open to talking through more information, then please apply and if suitable, we will get back to you as soon as possible.

title: Principal Data & Applied Scientist
description:
Microsoft's mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more and we believe that artificial intelligence will play a critical role in accomplishing that mission. The Core Search and AI team is the leading applied machine learning team at Microsoft responsible for delivering the highest-quality search experience to over 500M+ monthly active users around the world in Microsoft’s search engine, Bing and other dependent search engines such as Yahoo, DuckDuckGo, and new startups like Neeva.

We have seen little innovation in search in the last decade and we are looking for people who want to build the next generation of search using advanced AI technologies at scale. We are responsible for the largest machine learning models at Microsoft by volume and take pride in being the first in the world to solve many practical AI at Scale challenges. Our work spans a very large scope of scenarios including delivering high quality search results from a massive document corpus, extractive and abstractive summarization to generate document snippets, personalization, machine reading comprehension, and document recommendations.

As a team, we leverage the diverse backgrounds and experiences of passionate engineers, scientists, and program managers to help us realize our goal of making the world smarter and more productive. We believe great products are built by inclusive teams of customer-obsessed individuals who trust each other and work together closely. We collaborate regularly across the company both to find the technology breakthroughs from groups like Microsoft Research to infusing AI into the rest of Microsoft products like Office and Azure.

Some Examples Of Our Work Include
Building the world’s most comprehensive spelling correction system through zero shot learning (covered by NextWeb, Venture Beat, and ZDNet)Using transformer networks for search (covered in Search Engine Land and in State of AI 2020 report)Deep learning based question answering and captions (covered in VentureBeat, Search Engine Land)Launching our technology as a cloud service on Azure (a summary of the technologies we used)Co-developing our large scale training library called DeepSpeed (covered in SiliconAngle, The Batch)Building and open sourcing blazing fast transformer network inferencing (covered in ZDNet and Forbes) including developing our own accelerated chips for inferencingOpen sourcing our vector search algorithm (covered by Ars Technica and TechCrunch)
If you are passionate about working on the latest and hottest areas that will help you develop skills in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, data science and high scale systems, this is the team you’re looking for!

#semanticsearch#

Responsibilities

We need a strong technical lead to direct a team of engineers and scientists in discovering and building the next wave of innovations in search.
Work closely with Program Management to deliver a roadmap towards solving the needs of our users by building the most relevant, freshest, and authoritative results while being strategically differentiated from our biggest competitors.Lead a team to define, design, and deliver product quality improvements from ideation stage to shipping to the customer.Focus on the whole team's productivity and strive to increase the impact of the team's work product.Define and build systems and strategies to ensure high quality, stable, performant code and state-of-the-art algorithms being shipped in production.Make independent decisions for the team and handle difficult tradeoffs.Translate strategy into plans that are clear and measurable, with progress shared out monthly to stakeholders.
Qualifications

Required Qualifications
Bachelors, Masters or advanced degree in Computer Science or related field (including Mathematics and Physics)Significant years of industry experience applying Machine Learning techniquesSignificant years of experience coding in Python, C++, C#, C or Java
Preferred Qualifications
MS or PhD computer science or related field.Experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorchExperience building large scale cloud-based solutions.Customer focused, strategic, drives for results, is self-motivated, and has a propensity for action.Fantastic problem solver: ability to solve problems that the world has not solved before.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Data Scientist (DS2) - Ecommerce
description:
“We are on a mission to transform the future of grocery retail through sustained technology innovation.”

Ocado Technology is putting the world’s retailers online using the cloud, robotics, AI, and IoT. We develop the innovative software and hardware systems that power Ocado.com, the world’s largest online-only grocery retailer as well as the global ‘Ocado Smart Platform’. With everything from websites to fully autonomous warehouse that we design in-house, our employees need to be specialists in a wide range of technologies to help drive our business.

Data Scientist - Ecommerce | Barcelona 

Purpose Of The Position

Data Science is responsible for designing cutting-edge machine learning and optimisation techniques to convert data into important business insights and solutions.

We focus on machine learning and optimisation problems across Ocado’s ecommerce - from recommending products to customers, to search optimisation and intelligent substitutions. Our data is stored in Google BigQuery, we work primarily in Python for machine learning and use frameworks such as Spark and TensorFlow. We are looking for someone with experience in developing and optimising data science products as we seek to improve the personalisation capabilities and their performance for our OSP platform.

Role & Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist you will work closely with the team lead, management, other data scientists and software engineering teams to identify, scope, plan and manage projects, and effectively communicate complex technical issues and findings to a range of technical and non-technical internal audiences.

You will work on projects in all the areas touched by data science, dealing with complex problems and having a real impact on the operational performance of the company. You will be given autonomy in how you approach these problems and will be encouraged to research and seek out innovative solutions.

Communication is key; you will be in constant contact with business stakeholders and will need to work with developers both within the team and in other technology teams to ensure that your solutions are properly productionised and can be supported.

Essential Skills & Experiences Required
Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, or other quantitative sciences.Experience building productionised machine learning models at scale with a preference for MVP and iteration.Demonstrated computer programming ability including fluency in two or more of Python, Java (or equivalent), and SQL.Experience conducting research and analysis on large data sets and providing rigorous interpretations of the results.The ability to model complex problems mathematically and/or computationallyA solid understanding of key statistical concepts.
Desirable Competencies
Portfolio of past work (applications, analysis, visualisations, blog posts, presentations etc.)Successfully conducted research of significant scope – a Master degree or Ph.D. will be looked on favourably.Experience working on recommendation systems or search algorithms.Experience with Google Cloud Platform.Knowledge of common machine learning toolkits (e.g. scikit-learn).Knowledge of deep learning frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, Theano, Torch..).
Behavioral Competencies
Craftsmanship – demonstrates breadth and depth of knowledge and skill; upholds quality and continuous improvement; can adapt the ideas of others; displays high levels of initiative.Trust – demonstrates high levels of trust between individuals and teams; espouses respect, openness, honesty and knowledge sharing.Collaboration – works well with others and actively contributes towards team/department/division objectives to enable high performance of own and fellow teams; displays the generosity to help others succeed at own expense.Autonomy – accepts ownership of what they do; relishes empowerment to drive innovation; takes accountability and responsibility for their own actions.Learn Fast – ability to learn fast through experimentation; understands that failing is acceptable; recognises the importance of learning from failure quickly, without attributing blame.Leadership – proven ability to inspire, motivate and empower others; able to make tough decisions and handle difficult situations and face major challenges with positivity, confidence and pragmatism; adept communicator.
What We Can Offer You

Our employee benefits are designed for you, we care about people and we’ve ensured we have a wealth of benefits that focus on your well-being. We can offer technically stretching work, a competitive salary and;
Flexible working patterns and options for remote working (depending on your role/team)Wellbeing support through Apps such as Unmind and an Employee Assistance Programme25 days annual leave, rising to 27 days after 5 years service (plus optional holiday purchase)Pension scheme (various options available including employer contribution matching up to 7%)Private Medical Insurance22 weeks paid maternity leave and 6 weeks paid paternity leave (once relevant service requirements complete) Train Ticket loan (interest-free)Cycle to Work SchemeShare OptionsOpportunity to participate in Sharesave and Buy as You Earn share schemes15% discount on Ocado.com and free delivery for all employeesIncome Protection (can be up to 50% of salary for 3 years) and Life Assurance (3 x annual salary)
We also have regular divisional socials, sports clubs not to mention the Ocado Technology Academy for a packed schedule of courses, conferences and events. If you think you have what it takes to make a difference, please submit your application below.

We are thrilled to welcome applicants from across the world. Whilst we are able to offer visa sponsorship, please note that we are only able to cover the company-specific costs. For all employment offers made for UK roles, it is expected that you will be based in the UK in commutable distance, ready for your first day of work, so please keep this in mind. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask.

Due to the energising nature of Ocado's business, vacancy close dates, when stated, are indicative and may be subject to change so please apply as soon as possible to avoid disappointment. If you have applied and been rejected for this role in the last 6 months, or applied and been rejected for a role with a similar skill set, we will not re-evaluate you for this position. After 6 months, we will treat your application as a new one. All benefits information is subject to change and the terms of the individual arrangements.

Be bold, be unique, be brilliant, be you. We are looking for individuality and we value diversity above gender, sexual orientation, race, nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, disability or union participation. We are an equal opportunities employer and we are committed to treating all applicants and employees fairly and equally. 

We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a positive barrier-free recruitment process and supportive work environment. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application.

title: Data Scientist
description:
As Data Scientist you will have following key accountabilities: Design, develop and implement solutions based on data science, stats and machine learning models throughout the full life cycle (ideation, design, implementation, productization and maintenance) Create and improve methods and tools, contribute to communities of practice in the area of Data Science Communicate regularly with non-data scientists in Tech, Operations, Commercial, Product to understand the domain and the requirements, as well as explain data science principles, concepts, algorithms, and approaches Make data your best friends, understand their strengths and leverage them - be aware of their weaknesses and tackle them in your solutions Screen the market for potential new / innovative Data Science approaches Foster knowledge exchange within the company and present GfK’s Data Sciences expertise at conferences and workshops 
Now you know what a Data Scientist does. What skills, qualifications & experience do you need for this job? You can think creatively in addressing analytical objectives You have expert statistical / machine learning modeling skills (e.g. statistical tests, classification, predictive modelling, handling of missing data, sampling, weighting) You are skilled regarding performance optimization and scalability (e.g. parallelization and code optimization) You have experience with an analytical programming language (Python, R) and the respective ecosystem You have solid skills regarding database handling as SQL Knowledge of the constantly evolving Data Science ecosystem and its frameworks (e.g. Spark MLlib, TensorFlow, MLflow) is a plus Knowledge of cloud computing environments and tooling (especially AWS) is a plus Advanced software development skills (unit testing, CI/CD, Git) is a plus Your English is fluent in a business environment, fluent Spanish is a plus You typically have a master’s degree or PhD that reflects strong modeling and statistics skills You typically have 3+ years of work experience Admittedly, this is a long list and we do not expect you to be able to tick off every single point on it. Learning on the job and formal trainings will help you to close potential knowledge gaps and quickly bring you up to speed. 
We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions. Can there be a better place to take center stage in the digital revolution? We are excited to getting to know you!

title: Data Scientist
description:
Our opportunity 

This is an opportunity to join Zurich’s Advanced Analytics and Product Lab team , to help develop innovative analytics and data products/ services which will drive Zurich’s business forward.

As a Data Scientist in the Advance Analytics and Product Lab you will:

 Undertake analysis, data mining, machine learning and visualisation tasks  Provide consultancy/ be a trusted advisor in regard to analytics and data science  Communication effectively and build relationships with business contacts  Engage with business units to understand business issues and develop analytical use cases  Develop use case based proposals, for ad hoc analytics and analytical products  Lead and ensure the delivery of analytical/ data science components of the products and projects to which you are assigned  Support and activity contribute to POCs run by the Advanced Analytics and Product Lab  work collaboratively with our on shore and near shore data science and data engineering teams  Quality review of work performed by others in the team 

Your Skills And Experience

 Qualified to at least degree level  2 years (minimum) experience in an analytical / Data Science role  2 years experience in programming languages such as SAS/ Python/ R  Experience of the application of Statistics, Predictive Modelling, Data Mining, Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing to business problems  Experience and familiarity with customer segmentation techniques  Experience with dash boarding, reporting and data visualisation tools/ techniques  Experience of analytics/ data science in the cloud or in a big data environment is an advantage.  Experience working with non-technical business users 

Additional Information

 As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes: 

 Wide range of internal and external trainings  Ticket restaurant  Option to work remotely up to 50% of time weekly  Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company  Life Insurance  Exclusive Employees discounts  Free English and Spanish classes depends on the needs 

Primary work location is Barcelona. This position requires approximately 3 days of travel per month. You can apply by clicking on the button “Apply online”

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

title: Data Scientist – Marketing & Network Analytics
description:
Craft

Data, Analytics & Strategy

Job Description

We are looking for a talented and creative Data Scientist interested in pushing the boundaries of in- game and marketing analytics. You will help network team to push the boundaries of online gaming analytics both on the marketing side (getting more players into the game) and in partnership with game teams (increasing player engagement)

Your role within our Kingdom

If you want to improve the experience of King’s 300 million+ players across our network of games, and help us to further understand, model, predict, segment, monetise and retain those customers, then this may be the right opportunity for you. You will be part of the community of 80+ business intelligence & analytics experts at King, while working on a daily basis in smaller teams of 6- 8 people, including other data scientists, focused on particular games, our network or specific business areas.

You Will
Identify potential business opportunities within your area and scope/design approaches to capture those opportunitiesTranslate business needs to technical requirements and AB- tests, and work with development teams to ensure correct implementation, specifically including correctly tracking the right information to allow easy, precise analysis of the impactDevelop an analysis strategy and perform analysis of complex scenarios and AB- tests, both systematically and on a one- off basis.Carefully check, debug, and problem solve issues to ensure you deliver accurate and clear analysis and reports, quickly, even when confronted by subtle data complicationsProvide an analytics perspective to discussions and prioritisation within your team, so that the overall team selects the right ideas to work onBe the pro- active owner of the entire data chain for your game(s)
Skills To Create Thrills

You have a passion for quantitative analysis and the ability to draw business insights that will add real value to King. You will need to demonstrate the ability to learn quickly and work in a fast paced and collaborative environment whilst communicating effectively with teams and individuals across King - such as Game Developers, Business Performance Managers and Marketeers.

Skills

While we certainly don’t expect you to have all of these skills from day one, we do expect you to learn and develop in each of the following five areas
Business Insight: The ability to deeply understand the problems and issues our games and business wants to solve and therefore define for yourself the right data or analysis or interpretation to lead to the right recommendations and decisionsSQL: The ability to write complex SQL queries to analyse our databases with 300+ million players, and work effectively with both Hive and relational database systems.Analytical coding: Using tools such as R, Python (and also Excel) for analytical purposesStats: Understanding the appropriate statistical or machine learning techniques to use in different circumstances.Communication: Designing good ways of communicating, visualising or reporting your results/analysis so they are clear and unambiguous
There is plenty of scope at King for you to learn from your colleagues in those areas where you have less experience, and to share your own skills where you are stronger.

Specific experience that might be helpful, but is not required, include: experience in the games industry or similarly sophisticated customer- facing digital businesses; experience in “big data” systems such as Hadoop, Hive; experience in behavioural psychology/economics; robust understanding of more advanced statistical techniques suitable for analysis of highly skewed populations; experience in predictive analytics, segmentation, and related areas; experience in experimental design; software engineering skills in Java and other languages (beyond R, Python which we use most frequently); skills with standard reporting tools such as QlikView/Tableau/etc.

Personal Attributes
High integrityLow egoPragmatic problem- solver
Our Kingdom

King Digital Entertainment is a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world. King is an independent unit of Activision Blizzard Inc. (Nasdaq: ATVI), which acquired the company in February 2016. We make games for millions of players worldwide, which can be played on our king.com and royalgames.com websites, Facebook, and mobile platforms such as the Apple App Store, the Google Play Store and the Amazon Appstore. King has game studios in Barcelona, Berlin, London, Malmö and Stockholm along with offices in New York and San Francisco.

Want to join our Kingdom?

Apply now! Join us in the thrill of making fun and delightful games for everyone.

The brilliant experience we give our players comes from the diversity and experience of our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes. That’s why we hire all sorts of talent.

About King

King is the game developer behind the world- famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top- grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King’s games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta.

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.

Making the World Playful

Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players - and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!

Applications need to be in English.

Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Data Scientist
description:
EL PUESTO

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics team. You will be part of the team that shapes Mango’s data intelligence, strategy, and architecture. The Advanced Analytics team develops Artificial Intelligence algorithms targeting to optimize the most challenging processes and decisions within the retail industry.

Mango Advanced Analytics team consists of Data Scientist, Big Data Engineers and Software Engineers who work together in cross-functional squads to develop state-of-the-art quality machine learning algorithms leveraging the latest technology in Big Data platforms and distributed computing.

Each Of The Advanced Analytics Squads Targets To Develop And Evolve Machine Learning Algorithms To Face Some Of Mango Key Technical And Business Challenges
Personalization Squad: Develop Artificial Intelligence algorithms to provide a personalized experience to Mango Clients including both product, fit and size recommendations.Pricing and Markdown Squad: Develop machine learning algorithms which determine the optimal promotions and discounts to optimize the company margin during the sales period.Forecasting: Develop time-series forecasting algorithms to predict the evolution of sales and returns both short-term and long-term.Purchasing/Production: Develop data-science algorithm for early best sellers detection and to determine how many units of each product and size should Mango manufacture during the season planning.
Due to the relevance of Mango Advance Analytics projects, each squad has board-level visibility and presentations.

At Mango we are inspired and united by our passion for style and culture. We are present in 118 countries and our online presence extends to over 80 countries. Our team is made up of people of 112 nationalities, 80% of whom are female.

We are a very dynamic team, motivated by new technologies, with a passion of what we do and will to take on major challenges that will allow us to continue to grow and contribute value through data.

WHAT DOES A DATA SCIENTIST DO AT MANGO?

As a Data Scientist you will be part of the team that shapes Mango’s data intelligence, strategy, and architecture. You will work developing Artificial Intelligence solutions developed with state-of-the-art data models and algorithms. These data products enable use cases that are very innovative in the retail space, such as geoanalytics, robotization, omnichannel personalization, the connected store, computer vision, consumer 360º and real-time decisions.

In you day-to-day work…
Develop the development advanced machine learning algorithms to improve our core business processes and decisions.Work with a solid engineering approach (e.g., continuous integration, testing automation, etc) in a strong team of data engineers and data scientists.Use Spark to scale up your models and leverage MLOps tools to deploy them to production.Interact with business stakeholders to ensure proper alignment and adoption; and participate the delivery of the project end-to-end.Be passionate to work with a fast, iterative approach in new ideas and proofs of concepts.Stay connected to the latest developments in Big Data and MLOps and invest time in bringing new technologies and best practices to Mango.
WHAT MAKES US SPECIAL?
Immediate incorporation with an indefinite contractWe offer flexible hours (you can enter from 08:00 to 09:30 and leave from 17:00 to 18:30) with an intensive day every Friday (you can enter from 08:00 to 09:00 and leave from 14:00 to 15:00) and most eves of public holidays.Possibility of teleworking 50%25% discount on all our linesYou will be able to train at a technical level on platforms such as O'Reilly, among others, as well as in languages, and in skills for your personal development. We mentor you in order for you to continue to develop professionally and personally!Referral policy, you can participate in the incorporation of talent to our teams, and we will reward you for it!Free company transport from Barcelona and Vallès to our headquartersPhysiotherapy service in our headquarters, as well as a fitness room and changing rooms in case you wish to do sports in your free timeWorkshops, meetups, practise communities, team building and company meetingsFlexible remuneration package with tax advantages: medical insurance, training, canteen discount, nurseries, etc.Canteen and kitchen service in our headquarters. The company subsidises part of the daily menu as well as cafeteria items.Company medical service in our headquarters.You will be part of a leading company in the fashion sector that is dynamic, in full innovation, with great awareness and which takes action towards sustainabilityFriendly, inspiring and ambitious work environment. You will work with a great team moving in the same direction to achieve optimal results.Constant development opportunities with extremely varied challenges that generate learning in the workplace.
You got it?

We like you!

TU PERFIL

WHAT DO WE EXPECT OF YOU?
Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or other quantitative fieldsExperience developing mathematical models and predictive algorithms (supervised & unsupervised models, clustering, neural networks…)Experience developing production level machine learning solutions in a cloud environment with distributed computing.Experience with deep learning is a plusExperience working in cloud environment (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)Ability to own the delivery of a project, including communication with business stakeholders and to deliver board-level presentationsAt least 3 years of programming experience, expertise in Python is a plusExperience implementing ETL, using BigData platform is a plus

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Join us on our exciting journey!

IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.

Data Science & Advanced Analytics

Data Science & Advanced Analytics - with departments in Frankfurt, Philadelphia, Beijing and Warsaw as well as a network of over 150 team members worldwide - is the global competence center for data science at IQVIA. Complex analysis at the highest level are conceptualized and implemented to support international customers in the pharmaceutical industry - often within multinational projects. As a member of our team you can expect exciting international projects with interesting development perspectives.

Data Scientist, Data Science & Advanced Analytics – the role
Collaboration in projects of the European Data Science & Advanced Analytics TeamSupport in concept design and development of innovative sampling approaches.Ongoing development and improvement of quality control methodologies (e.g., anomaly detection, isolation trees), ML based imputation approaches and various projection methodologies (e.g., geo-spatial, cloning, ML based, etc) specifically for large data sets.Support in development and automation of machine learning solutions and technologies and high scale deployment for Healthcare Big Data (Pharmacy, Hospital, Physician, Patient).Support in development and deployment of new offerings.Selection and application of machine learning techniques, in connection with Healthcare Big Data to identify complex patterns.Working with technology teams to support machine-learning algorithms in big data platforms.
Our ideal candidate will have:
Master degree in Mathematics/Statistics, Economics/Econometrics, Computer Science or related field.At least 3 years of professional experience in quantitative data analysis or PhD with at least 1 year of relevant professional experience with research in machine learning algorithms.Good knowledge and understanding of Machine Learning methods.Experience applying Machine Learning methods to business questions.Good knowledge of the higher statistical and econometric methods in theory and practice.Experience with handling Big Data.Skilled in Python/R and SQL.Fluent in English.Strong analytic mindset and logical thinking capability, strong QC mindset.Demonstrates consulting, creativity, critical thinking, project planning, and attention to detail capabilities.Knowledge of pharmaceutical market and experience with pharmaceutical data (medical, hospital, pharmacy, claims data) would be a plus, but not a must.
We know that meaningful results require not only the right approach but also the right people. Regardless of your role, we invite you to reimagine healthcare with us. You will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and

Whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there!

We invite you to join IQVIA™.

IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

title: Online Data scientist
location: El Prat de Llobregat, Catalonia, Spain
description:
Descrépción del trabajo:

En MediaMarkt somos especialistas en acercar la tecnología a nuestr@s clientes y líderes en el sector de la electrónica de consumo. En España y Portugal, nuestro equipo está formado por más de 6.500 personas que, desde nuestras 107 tiendas, la web, y nuestro Headquarter, trabajamos para ofrecer el mejor servicio y los mejores productos día a día. Nos adaptamos rápidamente a los cambios estando a la última en las tendencias del retail. Y no, no todos somos Geeks, pero sí que tenemos una cosa en común: pasión por lo que hacemos.

 

Estamos buscando un Online Data scientist cuya misión será dar las herramientas y la información, así como sugerencias, al equipo Online para mejorar la experiencia de usuario, las ventas y convertir más visitantes en clientes.

En este sentido elaborará y análizará reportes sobre el Performance del negocio con relación a KPIs operativos y financieros y aportará información para la creación de Forecast, con el objetivo de aportar información y análisis al negocio de cara a la correcta toma de decisiones. El rol de Web Analyst incluye tareas adicionales como implementar y establecer tracking de métricas, creación de dashboards para visualizar datos relacionados con el e-commerce y el posterior análisis de éstos

Esta posición forma parte del departamento de online ubicado en nuestras oficinas del Prat de Llobregat.

 

LO QUE HARÁS / ASÍ SERÁ TU DÍA A DÍA

 

Trabajo cross functional con los distintos departamentos de Business Operations, Service & Solutions, Digital y BI Analitycs (IT & Organization)

Elaborar informes sobre los principales KPIs de negocio y operativos de cara a presentarlo a diferentes stakeholders (Board, comités operativos y de marketing, equipo online):

  Análisis de la información para identificar, entender, y reportar desviaciones.

   Análisis de los diferentes KPIs de manera conjunta para plantear escenarios futuros (forward thinking) para dar soporte en la toma de decisiones.

   Seguimiento de Targets.

  Realizar el Monthly Planification online, ventas, stock, compras, pedidos, tráfico, CR,…

Desarrollar y gestionar el sistema de reporting estandarizado para online a través de las herramientas existentes en cada momento (Excel / PowerBI / DataStudio/Tableau)

Atender las necesidades de análisis y reporting de online

Resolver dudas en relación al reporting

 

LO QUE ESPERAMOS DE TI

 

  Licenciatura en Administración y Dirección de Empresas, Económicas o Empresariales, y valorable formación en Business Intelligence/Business Analytics.

   Google Analytics avanzado.

   Experiencia en herramientas de visualización de datos (PowerBI / DataStudio).

   Office avanzado (especialmente Excel).

   Inglés nivel alto escrito y oral.

   Valorable experiencia Hotjar, Contentsquare, Crazy Egg, etc.

   Valorable experiencia en el sector retail.

   Extras: Programación VBA, DAX, y SQL.

   Experiencia mínima de 3 años como Web Analyst y Business Controller, y/o Controller operacional.

   Valorable experiencia en mantenimiento de bases de datos.

   Valorable experiencia en el sector retail.

   



We offer:

 

LO QUE PODEMOS OFRECERTE

El bienestar de nuestro equipo es clave para que las cosas salgan bien.

MediaMarkt benefits:

 Flexibilidad horaria Jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano Formación online disponible 24/7 Oficinas open-space y ambiente joven Descuentos en nuestros productos Menú subvencionado en la cantina con opciones saludables y vegetarianas Fruta gratuita una vez por semana Café, té y leche para todos los gustos Gimnasio particular y planes mensuales para otros gimnasios Sesiones de nutricionista Eventos y celebración de días especiales Clases de inglés subvencionadas (después de 6 meses en la compañía) ¡Y mucho más!  

 

¡Conócenos y contágiate de #LaFuerzaDelRojo!

title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
description:
Job description:

We are looking for a new colleague in the Global Commercial Excellence department of ZF Aftermarket at our location in Barcelona.


Your tasks as Data Scientist (m/f/d):

 Prototyping of advanced analytics data products (models for business recommendations, segmentations, optimizations & statistical forecasts) across marketing, sales, pricing & logistics, and creation of relevant algorithms which can improve how the business operates  Business Understanding: acquire understanding of the business problem with the help of business analyst Data Understanding: lead the exploration of the data Modelling: create hypothesis of which models could fit the data, test the different hypothesis, find optimal parameters Results: share the prototype results and get feedback to have its model improved  

Your profile as Data Scientist (m/f/d):

 Strong Background in both Computing and Statistics (academical and/or by experience) Unsupervised and Supervised models including tree-based models and linear models in Python, R & Pyspark. Experience with (Deep) Neural Networks and Bayesian modelling is desirable. Databases (ex. Oracle, AWS S3). Big Data platforms (ex. Databricks, GCP, Cloudera) Knowledge of Visualization tools is highly desirable (ex. such as Tableau, PowerBi, Qlikview). Team player, ability to deal with uncertainty and ambiguity, business acumen, communication skills (mostly data storytelling)

title: Data Scientist
description:
Background:
Our clients provides first-class, highly customisable, fintech risk solutions. Their customers include alternative investment funds, banks, and ManCo’s. Their core solution is an award-winning institutional risk aggregation and reporting application which provides an independent appraisal of investment risk compliance and financial risk exposures.
The international and innovative team has a passion for technology and problem solving. They are looking for a driven Consultant to join the team. In this role, you will be involved in both research and production environments.
