title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
“Ocado Technology, powering the future of retail through sustained disruptive technology innovation...”

Ocado Technology is putting the world’s retailers online using the cloud, robotics, AI, and IoT. We develop the innovative software and systems that power Ocado.com, the world’s largest online-only grocery retailer as well as the global ‘Ocado Smart Platform’. With everything from websites to fully autonomous warehouse that we design in-house, our employees need to be specialists in a wide range of technologies to help drive our business.

We champion a value-led culture to get our teams working at their very best and to help create a collaborative working environment that our people love. Core values of Trust, Autonomy, Craftsmanship, Collaboration and Learn Fast help drive our innovative culture.

Data Science is responsible for designing cutting-edge machine learning and optimisation techniques to convert data into important business insights and efficient operations.

We focus on machine learning and optimisation problems across Ocado’s E-commerce - from recommending products to customers, to search optimisation and intelligent substitutions. Our data is stored in Google BigQuery, we work primarily in Python for machine learning and use frameworks such as Spark and TensorFlow. We are looking for someone with experience in developing and optimising search engines as we seek to improve the personalisation and performance of our existing engine for our OSP platform.

Role & Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist you will work closely with the team lead, management, other data scientists and software engineering teams to identify, scope, plan and manage projects, and effectively communicate complex technical issues and findings to a range of technical and non-technical internal audiences.

You will work on projects in all the areas touched by data science, dealing with complex problems and having a real impact on the operational performance of the company. You will be given autonomy in how you approach these problems and will be encouraged to research and seek out innovative solutions.

Communication is key; you will be in constant contact with business stakeholders and will need to work with developers both within the team and in other technology teams to ensure that your solutions are properly productionised and can be supported.

You may be asked to perform tasks as required by management deemed as a reasonable request. This job description is a summary of the typical functions of the role, not an exhaustive or comprehensive list of possible role responsibilities, tasks and duties and is subject to review. The responsibilities, tasks and duties of the job holder might differ from those outlined in the job description and other duties, as assigned, might form part of the job.

Knowledge, Skills And Experience
A strong academic record including a postgraduate degree in mathematics, statistics, or related fields.Demonstrated computer programming ability including fluency in two or more of Python, Java (or equivalent), and SQL.Experience conducting analysis on large data sets and providing rigorous interpretations of the results.The ability to model complex problems mathematically and/or computationally, and appropriately apply results obtained using those models.A solid understanding of key statistical concepts.Machine learning or applied operations research experience.
DESIRABLE COMPETENCIES
Successfully conducted research of significant scope – an M.Phil. or Ph.D. will be looked on favourably.Knowledge of common machine learning toolkits (e.g. scikit-learn).Knowledge of deep learning frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, Theano, Torch..).
BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES
Craftsmanship – demonstrates breadth and depth of knowledge and skill; upholds quality and continuous improvement; can adapt the ideas of others; displays high levels of initiative.Trust – demonstrates high levels of trust between individuals and teams; espouses respect, openness, honesty and knowledge sharing.Collaboration – works well with others and actively contributes towards team/department/division objectives to enable high performance of own and fellow teams; displays the generosity to help others succeed at own expense.Autonomy – accepts ownership of what they do; relishes empowerment to drive innovation; take accountability and responsibility of own actions.Learn Fast – ability to learn fast through experimentation; understands that failing is acceptable; recognises the importance of learning from failure quickly, without attributing blame.Leadership – proven ability to inspire, motivate and empower others; able to make tough decisions and handle difficult situations and face major challenges with positivity, confidence and pragmatism; adept communicator.
What We Offer You

What we can offer you

A relaxed, international, talented, creative and friendly environment, where we invest in our employees, ensuring we provide them with the best in-house and external training programs available.
Flexible working hours with short FridaysReduced hours in AugustPrivate Health InsuranceLife InsuranceTicket RestaurantTicket TransportTicket KindergartenFlexible WFH policyShare-saving scheme Gym membership discounts Fresh fruit, snacks, tea and coffeeMonthly social eventsTable football, board games and Nintendo SwitchTech Talks and internal trainingsEnglish, Spanish and Catalan language courses
We are growing rapidly, making it a very exciting time to join, as we are currently at a brand new office in the 22@ district - the thrilling tech area of Barcelona.

Anything else?

There’s a lot going on at Ocado Technology! Click to find out more about Ocado Technology and our recruitment process.

Ocado is an equal opportunities employer and as such makes every effort to ensure that all potential employees are treated fairly and equally, regardless of their sex, sexual orientation, marital status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion, age, disability or union membership status.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Buscamos Data Scientist!🚀
TMC es una empresa internacional de consultoría de alta tecnología que aporta su experiencia a sus clientes para apoyarles en la realización de sus retos tecnológicos. Como tal, TMC opera como un centro de expertos a disposición de sus clientes y les ayudamos a ser más competitivos en un mundo tecnológico cada vez más global y cambiante.🌎
En TMC creemos que las personas son el motor de la innovación tecnológica. Por eso queremos crear las mejores condiciones posibles para que los talentos tecnológicos prosperen. Te ofrecemos un entorno de trabajo desafiante y estimulante en el que puedes ser el director de tu propia carrera.💫
Como Employeneur, formas parte de nuestra familia TMC. Junto a nuestra excelente experiencia técnica, la diversión y el compromiso son partes significativas de nuestra cultura.🤝
| TUS RETOS?
Dependiendo de tu experiencia y afinidad, las áreas de aplicación pueden incluir Sistemas Distribuidos, Fabricación, Movilidad y Sanidad. El trabajo se llevará a cabo principalmente en equipos de proyectos de diversas disciplinas (técnicas). Es crucial que tengas una buena visión de las posibles aplicaciones de tu experiencia y que seas capaz de motivar a los demás.🤓
Como científico de datos en nuestro equipo tendrás el reto de
Aprender de conjuntos de datos grandes y complejos para extraer ideas pragmáticas y procesables.Aprovechar los datos para identificar, cuantificar y obtener beneficios empresariales tangibles.Tu capacidad para ver más allá de los números, ser la voz de los datos cuando te comuniques con los responsables de la toma de decisiones, los propietarios de los productos y los líderes del equipo.Tener la capacidad de prosperar en nuestro entorno de ritmo rápido, adaptándose rápidamente y asumiendo la propiedad de su trabajo.Manejar ideas y métodos innovadores al tiempo que se trabaja con miembros del equipo con talento y altamente cualificados.

| ¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?
Que domines perfectamente el español, que tengas estudios en ingeniería de software, informática, física (teórica), econometría, estadística, informática científica, bioinformática o una formación comparable.
Durante tus estudios o a través de la experiencia profesional (se requiere un mínimo de 2 años de experiencia relevante) has adquirido experiencia en uno o más de los siguientes temas:
Sólidos conocimientos prácticos de C, C++, C#, Matlab, Python, R, Java, Hadoop, Spark, SQL y/o noSQL.Sólidos conocimientos prácticos de conjuntos de herramientas de BI comunes, como Tableau, Qlikview, Spotfire, Splunk, SAP, SAS u otros.Experiencia probada y afinidad con el modelado de problemas físico-técnicos, modelado de riesgos, desarrollo de algoritmos, procesamiento de imágenes y/o análisis de datos.La experiencia con el procesamiento de grandes conjuntos de datos (> 1 TB) se considera una ventaja.Se considera un plus el conocimiento de los métodos ágiles;Además de estas habilidades técnicas desarrolladas a través de su experiencia en la industria, has desarrollado fuertes habilidades blandas como buenas habilidades comunicativas orales y escritas, resistencia al estrés y una actitud de jugador de equipo.También se requiere una seria motivación por el modelo de empleabilidad de TMC.
| ¿POR QUÉ ELEGIRNOS?
Somos realmente únicos gracias a nuestro modelo de Employeneurship que es una verdadera innovación para el negocio de la consultoría de alta tecnología. Es la relación comercial del siglo XXI para los profesionales técnicos altamente cualificados. Se basa en 5 pilares principales:Tendrás un contrato laboral indefinido, que te ofrece estabilidad y seguridad.Conocerás tu valor en el mercado y tendrás una participación en los beneficios que genere tu trabajo gracias al reparto de beneficios individuales.Te apoyaremos con un coaching individual y formaciones diseñadas para ayudarte a desarrollar tus habilidades empresariales.La estructura de las células de competencia, que te proporciona una red sólida, significativa y relevante.Laboratorios de emprendimiento: un patio de recreo para nuevas ideas y un posible lanzamiento de nuevas empresas
¿Te interesa? ¡Hablemos!✌🏼

title: Data Scientist
description:
Mediktor is looking for a Data Scientist to join our prediction models team. You’ll work side by side with our Python developers to take the most of our extensive data sets, creating models for real time prediction of health inquiries and improving healthcare worldwide.
About us: Mediktor has developed an artificial intelligence based medical assistant capable of simulating a conversation with a real doctor. This can lead to enormous cost savings, process optimization and waiting time reduction in many healthcare use cases, for example in triage for emergency departments or medical call centers.Our technology uses natural language recognition, multiple types of prediction models, and can be integrated into almost any type of solution thanks to our UI libraries and our wide range of API methods and capabilities.The software has been clinically validated with a success rate of up to 91.3% in trials with real patients.You can try our showcase application by yourself, and we will surely appreciate your feedback: Mediktor in the Apple App StoreMediktor in the Google Play StoreMediktor B2C web portal
We invite you to be part of the team of one of the most important technology startups in the ehealth sector. We are a Barcelona-based startup and we are growing! We are looking for motivated individuals that want to help us improve access to healthcare all over the world.
About the team:You will be integrated in a team that is moving towards Agility. As a startup company, we are fast-learners but still adapting some of the processes so you can help us in the shaping of our Scrum framework; improving our working flows & CICD. If you want to be part of a team that is constantly improving where we value transparency, commitment, energy and good vibes, do not hesitate to join us. In our constantly growing environment, we are improving and we need you to help us! What you will be doing:During your first day…You will be introduced to our prediction models and data teams and you will be sitting a lot with our backend team to deep-dive into our data structure and prediction methodologies. You will also receive a Mediktor welcome pack to start feeling the vibes. After your two weeks…You will have a better knowledge of the team and our rituals (if you are lucky, you will experience our after-work activities); we are an open team that value different opinions to improve! The knowledge of our data structure and prediction models will still be far from ideal but you will already know the challenge we face and the potential it has to impact society. And after three months, you will be able to:
 Develop, maintain & monitor prediction models using the latest AI Python technologies & frameworks.Understand and improve our prediction techniques and methodologiesConstantly monitor existing and new AI technologies that could help improve our accuracyCo-Deploy server side dockerized prediction modelsLeverage API communications for automated incremental model trainingReport & discuss performance with doctorsImpact the strategic technology roadmap planningCommunicate effectively of new technology trends with your team  What you need to have: Extensive knowledge and experience using TensorFlow or Keras.Some experience and knowledge of all the data science trending prediction technologies (TensorFlow, Keras, pytorch, sklearn…)Python programming skillsData analytics skills, deep understanding of statistics and probabilisticsGood communication skills (English & Spanish) What will make you shine:Proven professional experience creating real time predictive modelsExperience with Natural Language ProcessingExperience in Health domain Experience in Agile methodologiesExperience working in team-oriented, collaborative environmentExperience in startup environmentHighly self-motivated, independent and with a challenging mindsetPositive attitude, team-player
What you will find working with Mediktor:An exciting startup with always good vibesOpportunity to grow and develop together with us. Flexible hours and hybrid model of work. Excellent and multicultural environment. TeamworkAmazing offices in an important historic centre of the city located in the Modernist Campus of Hospital Sant Pau. Our rooftop views are one of the best in the city and we have a “futbolin”!Access to cheap meals in our canteenCompetitive salary conditions.A Mediktor welcome packParking discounts around the officeGym discounts around the office
Mediktor is an equal opportunity employer and we encourage diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

title: Remote Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer - eCommerce - Python stack - Remote
description:
Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer

eCommerce sector

Exceptional Salary And Benefits

The YourCode Group are proud to be partnered with an expanding e-Commerce provider, expanding rapidly Worldwide through acquisitions and new product development. In the last three years, the company has expanded significantly throughout Europe and become a leading tech business within the sector.

Due to continued expansion, our client is looking to hire a Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer to join their company and develop a market leading eCommerce platform that can be used across the world with B2B and B2B2C customers.

Joining the Data Science team, you will be working closely with the business to identify issues presented and use data to propose solutions for effective decision making. You'll be involved in building new and supporting existing applications which are used throughout the company, meaning these are very much business critical and time sensitive.

Duties & Responsibilities
Interpret large amounts of unorganised, raw dataUtilise machine learning so that we can convert data into various forms and develop algorithms to solve problemsUse a modern Python tech stack to enhance the engineering of the platformsCapable of conducting statistical analysisTaking part in complex technical projects and delivering iterative solutions that provide value at each step of the way.Work in a fast-paced environment and contribute to optimal flow in a rapidly changing design/technology environment.Work closely with partners across the business and within your team to solve problems.Discover and deliver solutions facilitating meaningful discussions and building consensus.
Skills & Experience Needed
Experience and exposure to API developmentProficiency in mathematical computingExcellent verbal and written communication skillsProficiency in various programming languages such as Python, or Java, C, R along with strong coding skillsExperience in design and usage of relational databases (SQL, PostgreSQL) and no SQL databasesExperience using a variety of data analysis, data mining methods and data toolsExperience using and developing algorithms, developing, and implementing models and creating and running simulations.
Flexibility With Working

This opportunity is open to flexible working arrangements, such as working from home. At all times, you will be working with the core development teams to bridge the gap between the data and the front end translating that to a story for the end user, taking an active role in defining how the application looks, as well as how it works, so must be available for video calls.

Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer

eCommerce sector

Desired Skills and Experience
            Python, Remote, Data Science, PyTorch

title: Game Data Scientist
description:
We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Game Data Scientist into our Analytics team, where you will work to understand our gamers’ behaviour, and work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion.

Applying quantitative analysis, statistics & programming, you’ll draw business insights that add real value to Socialpoint. To truly make an impact you’ll need to learn quickly & work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with analytics & game teams.

What will you do in Socialpoint?
 Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour and answer key business questions.  Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis.  Visualize and present analyses and results to senior stakeholders, including: Analytics Leads, VPs of Product, the CEOs and other C-level executives.  Acting as the liaison between product leads, game developers, data engineers and data scientists to ensure our data is precisely specified, understood and consistent.  Team up with other data scientists to lead projects on machine learning, behavioural segmentation and monetization.  Using predictive analytics to predict how users will react to changes in the Games.  Requirements
 3+ years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value  A Masters degree in a quantitative field, including hard sciences (e.g Physics, Stats, Maths, Engineering) & social sciences (Economics, Psychology, Sociology…)  Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis.  Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python or R for data exploratory analysis.  Creating dashboards and visualising findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau or Looker.  Excellent written and oral communication skills, experience presenting to business stakeholders.  Passion for games, or high interest in the mobile gaming industry  Curiosity about everything & ability to innovate & work independently  Nice-to-haves
 Experience in a mobile B2C business.  Experience implementing data science models with Python or R.  Creative and innovative, always looking for better ways to achieve our goals.  Experience designing and analysing randomized experiments  A fast learner, highly meticulous, a consummate professional. You bring value into any conversation you have.  Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.  A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.  What's in it for you

Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we have employed a hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean?  All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office in Barcelona  so you are able to come into the office for important meetings/events.

We Also Offer
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you’re not already here).  An impressive 25 days annual leave , not including public holidays. Private medical insurance for you and your family, just in case.  Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).  Free language lessons (English, Spanish & Catalan). Spotify Premium for the first 6 months of your employment with us.  Legendary social events & parties to let off some steam.  People development is key for us: an amazing training budget just for you and real growth opportunities ! 
Check Out Some Of Our Onsite Benefits

And when you work in the office, don’t worry - we have you covered.
 State of the art gym facilities so you can level up your fitness game.  Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist .  Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet). 
Intrigued? We’d love to hear from you. Please click “apply” to level up and submit your application in English.

Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You’re welcome on the team no matter where you’re from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It’s a trick question – mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Locaria is a pioneering multilingual marketing and language services agency that sits within The Stagwell Group and MDC Partners. We maximise the effectiveness and performance of global content seamlessly across territory, platform and media for brands with international ambition.

We combine engagement metrics with content creation processes by harnessing data from all stages of the customer journey including awareness, consideration and engagement. We do this in any language combination, across more than 90 markets.

Our global clients include the world’s top brands across luxury, retail, travel, hospitality, finance, market research and tech.

About The Role

We are currently looking for a new Data Scientist to help solve client business challenges using mathematical and computer science techniques.

Day to day you will work with other Data Scientists, Web Analytics Consultants and the Head of Department to execute projects across our client set of well known luxury, travel and retail brands. This will include technical data analysis using R, Python, and PrestoSQL as well as liaising with clients on a regular basis to implement findings.

Requirements

Key Responsibilities:

Project managing Data Science & Advanced Analytics work
Analysis of large datasets, drawing insight and value from multiple complex big data sources.Completion of data analysis pieces against briefs and business requirements.Ownership of client relationships and development of bespoke solutions to their business challenges.Defining project plans and timelines and communicating these to the client on a regular basis.Translating findings to marketing actions and communicating these directly to the client.Working with our Development team to maintain and optimise our existing codebase.Working alongside Senior Data Scientists to develop our data science product set and grow the department within the agency.

Essential Skills And Experience
A strong working knowledge of SQL, and hands on experience with large relational databasesHands-on experience with data gathering/management/manipulation, in either a professional or personal capacityStrong experience and understanding of R or Python in an analytical and technical capacityAwareness of how to approach data modelling problems, from data ingestion to deploying models in productionUnderstanding and application of traditional statistical techniques to business problems (ANOVA, Bayesian, etc.)Awareness of modern machine learning techniques, with ability to write models suitable for production environments (Gradient boosting, Clustering)Accustomed to Time Series forecasting, Causal Inference, and Regression analysisComfortable working with data from an array of sources, with ability to adapt to and minimise data issues with easeStrong project management skillsExperience of managing client communications and presentationsBachelor’s degree in a numerical (Economics, Mathematics, Statistics) or technical discipline, or equivalent experienceMinimum 2 years experience with analytical methods, preferably in marketing, market research and/or financial concentrationsStrong listening, presentation, communication and influencing skillsExperience supporting key management decisions with clear and concise data analysis

Preferred Skills And Experience
Practical understanding of how digital marketing works, and common challenges facing MarketersPrevious professional or academic projects using cloud computing, especially AWS or GCP Experience with PrestoSQL or BigQueryWritten documented projects utilising version control, such as Git

You will be:
Friendly, approachable and able to collaborate with both technical and non-technical colleagues.Highly motivated to succeed, and a regular user of Stack OverflowCurious, adaptive, and proactive - continually looking for new opportunities for the Data team to work with clients and Locaria as well as its sister agencies in the Stagwell network.Highly organised in order to keep on top of multiple projects at once

Successful candidates will have a strong mathematical and technical background. Excellent communication and team skills are vital as the role interfaces across the agency and with clients.

You’ll also live up to the Locarian Values:
Always Learning, Always TeachingWe Grow TogetherEquality in ContentCelebrating Language with DataDoing Some Good Along the Way

Locaria is Winner of the 'Best Language Service Provider for Training and Personal Development Award' at BELA 2022 (Best Employers in Localization Awards, Adaptive Globalization)

Benefits

We are always looking for rising stars to join our team and employ the best and the brightest in our industry. We’re also proud to offer progressing and flexible working practices designed to give you the work-life balance you need.

In return for your enthusiasm and expertise, we’ll reward you with a competitive salary and an enviable range of benefits that includes: a 7€ daily lunch allowance, 22 day holiday allowance plus Birthday leave, full access to our Employee assistance programme and a referral scheme. You may also have the opportunity to visit our head office in London for our yearly social events.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Our Story

After 4 years of intense research and product development on breakthrough digital mental health solutions; we launched as Koa Health in October 2020. Having secured a successful and oversubscribed Series A funding totaling €30m (ca.$36M), we are continuing to grow our global team. To read more about our funding to date and a little about our CEO and vision, visit our blog.

As a digital mental health company, we are dedicated to bringing high-quality mental healthcare to people around the world. Against the backdrop of decades of rising demand, mental health has never been more important. The Covid pandemic has led to a 4x increase in mental disorders around the world. With no increase in the supply of clinicians, tens of millions of people are stranded today without access to care. So widespread are these challenges across society that stigma has all but disappeared - for good. There has never been a more critical moment for the work that we're leading at Koa Health.

Our mission is to bring mental wellbeing to everyone, and we have built the technology to deliver this mission around the world. You can find out more about our products via our company page.

In your New Role

You will work with Koa Health's Personalization Team on building Machine Learning solutions for personalizing Koa Health's products. You will also participate in the entire process of delivering ML products. That includes:
Collaborate with the product team in order to optimize existing features and build new onesProviding Data Analysis on performance of existing productsBuild ML modelsBuild ETLs pipelinesProductionize ML solutions

Other functions in this role will be:

Performing and analyzing AB Tests

Performing Data Analysis that explains user behavior

Leading and taking the responsibility of the internal experiments

Helping with design and maintaining tracking events

Minimum Qualifications
Experience as a Data Scientist in building ML productsSolid statistical background in Machine LearningCoding skills, preferably advanced Python. Experience with Scala or/and Spark is a strong plusExperiences with deep learning libraries such as Tensorflow or Pytorch.Strong communication skills (both written and verbal). Ability to explain difficult concepts to non-technical audiencesAbility to organize your work efficiently and prioritize tasks. Experience with Agile methodologies desired.

Preferred Qualifications
MLOps skills related to CI/CD and cloud computing (preferably AWS)Experience with Recommender Systems and user modelingExperience with RCT and Causal InferencePublications in peer reviewed journals or conferencesDegree in Quantitative fields like Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, NeurosciencePrevious experience in the health area. 

Why Koa Health?

We are at the forefront of innovation in the MedTech arena, working on one of the hottest topics

of today – behavioral health. By working with us, in whatever role, you get to make a true

impact on the lives of others.

Aside from this, we provide all the necessary support and perks to make your life at work and

outside of work fun and comfortable all year round, such as:
Flexibility – we're hiring your skills and experience, so ask you to use these in the most

effective way you can.
A democratic team culture that encourages everybody to contribute ideas and acquire new

skills, we have regular catch ups as a global team and have the opportunity to work cross

functionally as needed.
A fantastic salary package that includes Generous Healthcare Benefits, Food Stipend,

Pension, Life Assurance.
Finally, as a business we are focused on supporting your wellbeing, we provide you with a

Wellbeing Allowance and Wellbeing Leave to help manage both your mental and physical health

as you see fit.

An Inclusive Workplace

Koa Health is committed to workplace diversity and to cultivating, fostering and preserving a culture of inclusion. We believe that bringing our diverse backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives together is the way to solve today's complex health problems in a booming digital era.

Our goal is to create a culture and environment where our people feel empowered to do their best work while being their authentic selves. We commit to creating an inclusive environment where we recognize the rights of all individuals to mutual respect and where there is an unbiased acceptance of others.

If you're as excited as us by the future we can create, then do get in touch.

title: Senior Data Scientist - Sales
description:
Since 2015, Revolut has introduced over 20 million customers to a new way to handle their money. From instant spending notifications and built-in budgeting controls, to global currency exchange and stock trading, customers simply get more with Revolut.

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. From onboarding flows to new feature presentations, our goal is to both inform and delight.

Put simply, we build things we want to use ourselves, that we’re proud to show to our friends and families.

About The Role

Our mission is leveraging the power of data and algorithms along with creativity and logic.

We analyse our existing and prospective customers in both a qualitative and quantitative manner, ask questions, form hypotheses, and build controls powered by machine learning, algorithms and heuristic to achieve our goal.

We’re looking for talented Data Scientists to join the Sales department and start building models to improve our lead sourcing. You will work closely with Data, Software Engineering and Operations to help the department improve its Data Science capabilities.

What You'll Be Doing
Producing machine learning and statistical models to identify trends in our existing customer base and drive lead sourcing focusProduce predictive models to identify and score high potential sales leadsTesting and improvingConducting deep-dive analysis to really understand complex problems

What You'll Need
Previous experience in a Data Science or Machine Learning based rolePrevious experience owning a machine learning project end-to-end, from design to implementation and iterationGreat skills with Python, SQL or other programming languagesHands on experience with Deep Learning related libs (e.g. TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch)Knowledge of version control, model deployment, developer environmentsEvidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledgeStrong background / education in a quantitative discipline

NICE TO HAVE
Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Masters or PhD)Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++…)Previous experience of lead scoringWorked at a large tech company worth >$15BSchool/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or ProgrammingExperience in system design and distributed computing

The Benefits
 Competitive salary Annual discretionary performance bonus (equity) All the latest tech you need Roll with a free Revolut Metal subscription

title: Data Scientist, Analytics
description:
As a Data Scientist at Facebook, you will shape the future of people-facing and business-facing products we build across our entire family of applications (Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp, Oculus). By applying your technical skills, analytical mindset, and product intuition to one of the richest data sets in the world, you will help define the experiences we build for billions of people and hundreds of millions of businesses around the world. You will collaborate on a wide array of product and business problems with a diverse set of cross-functional partners across Product, Engineering, Research, Data Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Finance and others. You will use data and analysis to identify and solve product development’s biggest challenges. You will influence product strategy and investment decisions with data, be focused on impact, and collaborate with other teams. By joining Facebook, you will become part of a world-class analytics community dedicated to skill development and career growth in analytics and beyond.Product leadership: You will use data to shape product development, quantify new opportunities, identify upcoming challenges, and ensure the products we build bring value to people, businesses, and Facebook. You will help your partner teams prioritize what to build, set goals, and understand their product’s ecosystem.Analytics: You will guide teams using data and insights. You will focus on developing hypotheses and employ a diverse toolkit of rigorous analytical approaches, different methodologies, frameworks, and technical approaches to test them.Communication and influence: You won’t simply present data, but tell data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your partners using clear insights and recommendations. You will build credibility through structure and clarity, and be a trusted strategic partner.

Data Scientist, Analytics Responsibilities:

Work with large and complex data sets to solve a wide array of challenging problems using different analytical and statistical approaches.Apply technical expertise with quantitative analysis, experimentation, data mining, and the presentation of data to develop strategies for our products that serve billions of people and hundreds of millions of businesses.Identify and measure success of product efforts through goal setting, forecasting, and monitoring of key product metrics to understand trends.Define, understand, and test opportunities and levers to improve the product, and drive roadmaps through your insights and recommendations.Partner with Product, Engineering, and cross-functional teams to inform, influence, support, and execute product strategy and investment decisions.

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelors/Masters Degree with 7+ years (or Ph.D. with 5+ years) of experience working within an analytical roleLeadership skills in driving large complex efforts with many stakeholders to successful outcomesCommunication skills and experience influencing key stakeholders and building cross-functional partnershipsExperience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), and/or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R)

Preferred Qualifications:

Masters or Ph.D. Degree in a quantitative field.

title: Skilled and Dynamic Data Scientist - Barcelona
description: Your work will be to develop algorithms and improve them for on-demand shared transportation. Work with the present tools and develop and improve new algorithms. Apply data to discover and deliver better products.

title: (Junior) Data Scientist
description:
XING is the social network for business professionals with millions of members all over the world. Help us shape the future – for a better working life! 
You will be part of an international team of Data Scientists and Data Engineers that is responsible for turning data into services and products for XING's jobs market which is used by Millions of users. We work closely together in an agile setting and focus on improving our existing job recommender and job search and developing new data-driven services that benefit the users of XING's jobs market place. For example, we work on features that help job seekers to better understand who their future colleagues may be, models that help forecasting salaries, etc. As a (Junior) Data Scientist your job includes analysis, feature engineering and the development of machine learning models. And it does not stop there: you also bring your models to production and conduct A/B tests to understand to what extent your models helped people to find a job. 
Your Role as Data Scientist:Design and implement new algorithms and Machine learning models for search and recommender services Contribute to the development of services, batch processes and stream processing components (using programming languages such as Scala, Python or SQL and technologies like Spark, Kafka, etc.) to ship algorithms to our end usersProactively analyze data assets (e.g. tracking data, profiles, job ads, etc.) and experiment to enhance existing services and create new servicesDesign and implement components in a sustainable fashion (e.g. automating training of ML models; balance between complexity of models, computational costs, ease of use)Contribute to our Data Platform by developing reusable data sets, data processing components, utility functions, etc.
You're the right candidate if you come with...MSc or higher degree in Computer Science, Math or similar disciplinefirst Hands-on experience in analyzing large datasets (e.g. with Python, SQL or similar) and developing Machine learning modelsGood theoretical and practical knowledge about machine learning and problem domains related to information retrieval (e.g. recommender systems, search)Good programming skills (preferably in Scala or Python) Proficient English language skills (German is not required)
An inspiring environmentCheck our Twitter account! https://twitter.com/NewWork_esGood isn't enough? Tell us what we can change, we're willing to take risks.Flexible remote work from Spain.Varied tasks, uncomplicated interactions with your colleagues as well as many opportunities to bring in your own ideas.Training, conferences and many opportunities to learn, experiment and grow.Innovation weeks (Hackweeks)Restaurant tickets, coffee and snacks.Spanish / English/ Portuguese / German lessons.A mobile device of your choice (iPhone, iPad, Android…).A great, multicultural and diverse environment.A sunny office located in the centre of Barcelona, with a large terrace.Flexible Compensation Plan: Health insurance/ Transport/ Nursery TicketsExtended holidays 26+4+2Competitive salary and a Permanent contractA referral bonus for recommending talent to our companyBicycle park and package reception We're looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Senior Data Scientist - Personalisation
description:
About The Team

Data sits at the heart of Revolut and plays a uniquely crucial role in what we do. With data we build intelligent real-time systems to personalise our product, tackle financial crime, automate reporting, track team performances and enhance customer experiences.

Fundamentally, data underpins all operations at Revolut and being part of the team gives you the chance to have a major impact across the company – apply today to join our world class data department. Since 2015, Revolut has introduced over 20 million customers to a new way to handle their money. From instant spending notifications and built-in budgeting controls, to global currency exchange and stock trading, customers simply get more with Revolut.

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. From onboarding flows to new feature presentations, our goal is to both inform and delight. Put simply, we build things we want to use ourselves, that we’re proud to show to our friends and families.

About The Role

At Revolut we are building a financial super app to manage all things money and personalisation is one of the core principles on which our app is based. We firmly believe that the best way to serve our customers is to provide them with a truly personalised experience from the moment they decide to join.

We start with deep data analysis to understand our customers, their objectives and any issues they might have. We then use various data points and advanced machine learning algorithms, to come up with the best possible option for each client. We experiment, iterate and build fully automated solutions, based on algorithms which self-improve with time.

We are looking for talented Data Scientists to join our personalisation team and help us create the future of financial services apps. You will be working together with the strongest professionals in Product, Design, Data Science and Engineering on the projects which have direct customer impact and drive our company forward.

What You'll Be Doing
Producing machine learning and statistical models to provide personalised experience to our customersPerforming experiments and iteratingReviewing literature to identify and test modern approaches to personalisationConducting deep-dive analysis to really understand complex problems

What You'll Need
Previous experience in a Data Science or Machine Learning based roleStrong background / education in a quantitative disciplineGreat skills with Python, SQL or other programming languagesKnowledge of version control, model deployment, developer environmentsEvidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge

NICE TO HAVE
Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Masters or PhD)Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++…)Previous experience in personalisation, recommender systems and reinforcement learningWorked at a large tech company worth >$15BSchool/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming

The Benefits
 Competitive salary Annual discretionary performance bonus (equity) All the latest tech you need Roll with a free Revolut Metal subscription

By applying for the above role, you confirm that you have reviewed our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

title: Junior Data Scientist (Open to remote)
description:
SAVANA (www.savanamed.com) is an award-winning, international medical company aiming to accelerate health science by putting into the hands of healthcare providers the power to unlock all of the clinical value embedded within existing Electronic Health Records (EHRs) with Artificial Intelligence and Natural Language Processing. Always ensuring maximum privacy and security.
Founded in 2014, Savana is an international medical company that has developed a scientific methodology that applies Artificial Intelligence (AI) to unlock all the clinical value embedded within Electronic Health Records' free-text (EHRs). With the largest AI-enabled, multi-language, multi-center research network in the world, Savana generates customized descriptive and predictive, High-quality Deep Real World Evidence research studies. Engineered by doctors for doctors, the company is built following the highest privacy-by-design standards.
Savana operantes in more than 160 hospitals, 5 languages, 15 countries and has already improved more than 6 clinical practices with more than 120 employees from 16 nationalities. It constitutes a clinical research ecosystem that aims to advance personalized and precision medicine worldwide.

Junior Data Scientist at Savana
Major Accountabilities where this role is involved:
Design of quality checks queries to verify the study databases structure and data.Check output and usability of ML models.Exploration of important variables of the studies to find abnormal patterns.Technical support for other med-4-tech members.Statistical and modeling support for ML modelsData cleansing, wrangling/munging from raw data to data formats ready to be analysed or presented to different audiences (internal staff, reports to clients, etc).Programming the training and validation of predictive models decided by the Data Team.Elaboration and review of technical documents related with statistical analysis and interpretation of results of observational studies using data from Savana’s databases.Operate according to Security Policies, Procedures and Manuals.Report any suspect of incident or improvement proposals.
Skills, Experience and Qualifications required:
University degree in a strong quantitative field (mathematics, engineering, statistics, computer science) or university degree in biomedical field (Bioinformatics,medicine, biology, pharmacy) with a master’s degree or PhD with strong quantitative component (bioinformatics, epidemiology, etc).Postgraduate degree in the field of Data Analytics/Machine Learning will be a plus.Programming skills in at least two of the following languages: python, R, Stata, SQL.English: professional working proficiency.1-2 years of previous desirable experience on similar role.
 We offer:
Work with a multidisciplinary team of clinicians, computer engineers, computational linguists, mathematicians, designers, medical Natural Language Processing expert programmers, and other disciplines. We are a team of professionals with a common goal: to blend the knowledge of all of us to seek excellence in our purpose. Coming from very different disciplines, we want everyone to learn from everyone, creating a unique entity that moves towards the transformation of health through Artificial Intelligence.An opportunity to provoke a positive impact. We seek to improve health on the planet through technology and to help people and health institutions. Our employees and collaborators strive to provide our users with the necessary tools and support to achieve a more accessible and egalitarian global health. We care about our environment and we are willing to improve it.An environment to express yourself as you are and enjoy what you know. We defend individuality to form a richer and more plural "ecosystem". Be yourself and tell us what you have learned and how could we use it together to help us achieve our purpose. If you like what you do, we like to work with you.Competitive salary conditions, flexible culture and a development framework to grow your career. People are our main asset, so we invest in training and development and recognize and compensate for achievements and valuable work. We trust in the talent and commitment of people and focus on objectives and results, so we are flexible in our way of working, providing a framework to reconcile our personal and professional lives.

Details from this job description are not to be used for marketing purposes. Savana does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Savana via e-mail, the Internet or directly without a valid written search agreement will be deemed the sole property of Savana, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Savana.
Medsavana S.L. (“Medsavana”), with registered office at Calle Gran Vía 30, planta 10, 28013 Madrid will process the personal data you provide to us during the selection process (the “Candidate’s Personal Data”) in order to manage your curriculum data and the selection process you are applying to. You can exercise the rights of access, rectification or erasure, restriction of processing, objection, portability, and to object automated individual decisions at the registered office of the company indicated or in the email dpo@savanamed.com. For more information, please refer to the privacy policy section on our webpage: https://www.savanamed.com/es/curriculum/

title: Data Scientist, Performance & Availability
description:
Primary Responsibilities:
You’ll help create systems and metrics to monitor how well our products and platform are performing, and where key opportunities for improvement are. You'll apply your knowledge of machine learning to this problem, and you will also be responsible for providing key stakeholders across the business with insights and self-service dashboards and reports that will provide a real time views of the metrics you have created and problems that you have discovered.Carry out performance research using data collected by our systemsWork collaboratively with engineering teams to evolve data collection and instrumentationManipulate data to discover insightsUse ML techniques to streamline issue and anomaly detectionGenerate and deliver reports based on your analysisOffer suggestions and direction from your analysis to help guide product teams and organization decision makersCollaborate with different teams and departments to provide expertise and insightExpand audience and usage of your reports

title: Data Scientist (Forecasting Expertise)
description:
DATA SCIENTIST - specialized in ForecastingAt QUANT AI LAB, we work with our clients to help them solve their problems, from defining strategy to implementing robust and sustainable solutions. We build on our operational approach that links advice and tools.We have a project to support our clients in the long term with our convictions, our approaches and our QUANT platform. Joining QUANT AI LAB means joining a business adventure where every employee is an important part of this project.Therefore, our search is aimed at hiring several specialized profiles, including a Data Scientist specialized in Time Series Forecasting.Location of position: Spain Your missions:Data Analysis: writing queries, scripts, and producing figures which provide insights into campaign performance by campaign, or by metric across campaigns.Data validation: verifying the data we obtain from ad exchange and the third party mobile app tracking solutions so that our campaign models get trained with accurate data.Campaign optimization: engaging in the life cycle of campaigns from building the initial lookalike model, monitoring daily performance, and advancing machine learning models.Interact cross-functionally with a wide variety of leaders and teamsWork closely with Engineers and Product Managers to identify opportunities for design and to assess improvements for our products.Create business modelled datasets and analyse the data to generate insightsWork cross functionally to embed and automate data science driven decision makingExploring and bounding business decisioning problems, identifying signal from our data, developing data science and statistical models and building them into full data products.Work closely with our Product and Technology teams to deploy machine learning products and systems at scale.Also, since you will be focused on the Computer Vision branch you will have toBenchmarking analysis: Study, design and compare different computer vision algorithms, selecting the most adequate option to meet the project's needs.Interact with the clients to understand their needs and propose the most adequate technical solution.Interact and collaborate with the development team to define computational and performance requirements of the solution, helping them to guarantee the requirements and levels of performance demandedDevelop high-quality, reusable, and efficient computer vision algorithms.Code these algorithms for their integration and exploitation into the final solution.Define, design and run code tests to guarantee the stability, robustness and performance of the modules in a productive environment.Collaborate with the development team to integrate the modules into the final solution.Research, design, implement, and style transfer, among others).Develop and implement state-of-the-art computer vision algorithms for object detection, classification, segmentation, etc., including advanced medical diagnostic use cases.Translate business requirements into quick prototypes and work with clients directly to uncover operational objectives and advance data collection.Design, create, and present high-quality presentations of your work, the state-of-the-art in computer vision, and project progress.
Specific requeriments:

Requirements:2 or more years of experience with a master's / doctorate degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or another quantitative field.Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development.Experience in the use of statistical computer languages (R, Python, C++, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and extract information from large data sets
Knowledge of various machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their advantages / disadvantages in the real world.Knowledge of statistical and data mining techniques: GLM / Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc. And experience with their applications.Valuable experience with distributed computing / data tools: Map / Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Gurobi, MySQL, etc.Valuable experience in data visualization / presentation for stakeholders using: Tableau, Power BI, Periscope, Business Objects, D3, ggplot, etc.Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordination between teams.The desire to learn and master new technologies and techniques.Certifications in the field of data science and / or in the main clouds (Azure, AWS and Google Cloud).For the Computer Vision branch it is also required:Experience with Digital image processingApplication experience of artificial intelligence techniques in images (traditional classifiers, extraction of classical descriptors, etc.)It is essential to have worked and managed very comfortably with Deep neural networks, Convolutional networksNotions, hands on experience with Autoencoders is desirableFamiliar with Agile Methodology
QUANT AI LAB, what we offer you:- Contribute to the development of a growing international company integrating their ideas- Integrate a multidisciplinary team with high-level professional and academic training.- The opportunity to take on innovative challenges with consultants who are passionate about providing concrete value to their clients.- A collaborative, entrepreneurial and supportive work environment, and a young and dynamic team:A fun and friendly atmosphere and festive events (after works, seminars ...)Permanent contract and an attractive salary, which will be determined based on profile and experienceRemote work
If you want to participate in our selection process and join our teams, apply for this offer or send an email to careers@quant.global . If your profile fits with the opportunities we have, we will contact you from Human Resources to get to know you better and tell you the next steps in the process.

title: Data Scientist (Experimentation)
description:
Company Description

We’re Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including marktplaats in the Netherlands, Mobile.de in Germany and Leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We’re all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

Job Description

Reporting to the Product Lead for Experimentation & Analytics Effectiveness, you’ will join a team of engineering and product managers and work to bring experimentation algorithms and causal inference methods into production at scale for use by decision-makers across Adevinta.

We are committed to using cutting-edge technology to build tools that help Analysts inform their decision-making and work more efficiently.

What You Will Do

Short-term
Help us improve the analytic capabilities of our Experimentation platformReview and challenge the AB testing methodology in useWork with our Product Manager and UX expert to evolve our platformTrain and educate teams across Adevinta
Long term
Drive automation on tasks that are time-consuming for our analysts Apply statistics to reduce time to get significant resultsApply techniques to support the most challenging cases (if.e. testing with small samples)
Qualifications
BA/BS degree in (or comparable experience) in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Physics.Solid industry experience in AB testing, Big Datastream, and batch processingGreat coding skills in Python, Scala is a plusTeam player with strong driver capabilitiesStrong communication skills and stakeholder management skills with any level of the organiszation
Additional Information

What you’ll get from us
Competitive compensation packageA unique position in an international and dynamic environmentOpportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisationThe chance to be a key player in a growing, highly skilled teamGreat colleagues and a healthy working environmentBenefits including private health insurance, stock purchase plan and bonusFlexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, choose your phone and computerCareer development, including individual training budget and language classesFlexible benefits programme (transport, restaurants, child-care, etc)Free daily breakfast 26 days of holiday
Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Flexibility: We believe that work is what you do, not where you do it. So we provide flexible hours and remote working options that give you the autonomy and scope to set your own agenda and working patterns. We empower our teams to decide which key moments they want to spend face to face, instead of mandating a fixed number of office days.

Covid-19: We’re reviewing the situation on a regular basis to ensure that we follow all local government guidelines and put the health of our people first. All interviews are currently taking place virtually.

If anything you’ve read above ticks your boxes, then why not apply now to find out more!

title: Data Scientist
description:
¿Te apasiona la tecnología y te gustaría formar parte de una empresa referente en el sector energético? En Grupo DISA buscamos a una persona que se incorpore a nuestro equipo de Transformación Digital, repartido entre nuestras sedes de Tenerife, Gran Canaria y Madrid. Este departamento se encarga de integrar la tecnología en las distintas áreas y actividades del Grupo, con el objetivo de establecer un modelo de relación digital que sitúe al cliente en el centro de nuestra estrategia y nos ayude a optimizar nuestros modelos de negocio.Dentro de este equipo, tu misión principal sería la gestión de diferentes proyectos relacionados con Data Science, Business Intelligence, Machine Learning, Inteligencia Artificial, enfocados a extraer todo el potencial que ofrecen los datos para mejorar nuestros procesos y resultados.
¿Cuáles serían tus principales responsabilidades?-Desarrollar modelos de Inteligencia Artificial, Aprendizaje Automático, Series Temporales, Clasificación, etc. para llegar a nuevos escenarios de explotación de datos, en los que se puedan optimizar procesos internos y redefinir la experiencia del cliente.-Reutilizar activos de datos existentes en los negocios del grupo e identificar activos de datos y modelos analíticos que puedan mejorar el negocio mediante la aplicación de análisis avanzados.-Comunicarse con los usuarios de negocio para comprender los desafíos a los que se enfrentan y dotarles de soluciones automáticas basadas en la analítica de sus datos.-Desarrollar visualizaciones para que sus análisis complejos sean accesibles a la audiencia de los usuarios de negocio (Retail, Gas, Electricidad, Renovables, Logística, Suministros, etc.)
Requisitos mínimos:- Mínimo de 2 años de experiencia en frameworks de Machine Learning (Scikit-learn, Xgboost, Pytorch, Tensorflow etc.)- Mínimo de 2 años de experiencia en estadísticas, algoritmos, análisis de datos y tecnologías relacionadas, como base de datos, almacenamiento de datos, extracción de datos e integración de datos.- Mínimo de 2 años de experiencia en analítica avanzada y aprendizaje automático utilizando tecnologías Big Data- Conocimiento en ecosistemas y lenguajes propios del BI y el Big Data: BBDD SQL, Databricks, Python, PySpark, etc. - Conocimientos en herramientas de visualización (PowerBI, Qlik, Tableau, etc.)-Idiomas: inglés, nivel medio/alto-Licenciatura/Grado en Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas, Estadísticas, Física o similar
Se valora:- experiencia en entornos Cloud. Azure preferentemente - Formación en gestión de proyectos- Formación en sistema de gestión y auditorias- Conocimientos en materia de protección de datos
¿Qué ofrecemos?-Incorporación inmediata-Contratación indefinida-Formación continua y desarrollo profesional-Incorporación en las Políticas de sistema de teletrabajo, flexibilidad horaria y medidas de conciliación. 
Las personas que concurran a los procesos de selección y evaluación serán valoradas en base a los requisitos del puesto de trabajo con objetividad, transparencia y respetando el principio de igualdad de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres.

title: Data Scientist
description:

Requirements:
-AWS-React-Python (Juniper Notebooks)-SQL (Background)-Excel-Power BI
Min 4 years of hands on experience 
Data Scientist:
Role Context:
- Data scientists typically build scalable, re-usable data science products, usually containing statistical or machine learning algorithms, in collaboration with data engineers and software engineers.- Compared to data analysts, data scientists have more stringent requirements around coding capabilities and require Machine Learning skills.- Compared to performance analysts, data scientists have much stronger coding and statistics capabilities.
